original: agniṃ naro dīdhitibhiraraṇyorhastacyutī janayanta praśastam
analyzed: agnim naraḥ dīdhitibhiḥ araṇyoḥ hasta cyutī janayanta praśastam
translated: Men with their thoughts, in the wood, with hands that move, beget the praised Agni,

original: dūredṛśaṃ gṛhapatimatharyum
analyzed: dūredṛśam gṛhapatim atharyum
translated: The far-seeing, the householder, the youthful.

original: tamagnimaste vasavo ny ṛṇvan supraticakṣamavase kutaścit
analyzed: tam agnim aste vasavaḥ ni ṛṇvan supraticakṣam avase kutaścid
translated: That Agni have the Vasus set in motion, well-looking, for help from somewhere,

original: dakṣāyyo yo dama āsa nityaḥ
analyzed: dakṣāyyaḥ yaḥ dame āsa nityaḥ
translated: Who is most fit for the house, who is ever present.

original: preddho agne dīdihi puro no 'jasrayā sūrmyā yaviṣṭha
analyzed: preddhaḥ agne dīdihi puras naḥ jasrayā sūrmyā yaviṣṭha
translated: Be kindled, O Agni, shine in front of us with unceasing light, O youngest,

original: tvāṃ śaśvanta upa yanti vājāḥ
analyzed: tvām śaśvantaḥ upa yanti vājāḥ
translated: To thee come all the powers.

original: pra te agnayo 'gnibhyo varaṃ niḥ suvīrāsaḥ śośucanta dyumantaḥ
analyzed: pra te agnayaḥ gnibhyaḥ varam niḥ su vīrāsaḥ śośucanta dyumantaḥ
translated: Thy flames, O Agni, more heroic, shining, most excellent, go forth from the fires for a boon,

original: yatrā naraḥ samāsate sujātāḥ
analyzed: yatrā naraḥ samāsate sujātāḥ
translated: Where the well-born men sit together.

original: dā no agne dhiyā rayiṃ suvīraṃ svapatyaṃ sahasya praśastam
analyzed: dāḥ naḥ agne dhiyā rayim su vīram su apatyam sahasya praśastam
translated: Give us, O Agni, wealth with good heroes, self-dependent, to be praised by the mighty,

original: na yaṃ yāvā tarati yātumāvān
analyzed: na yam yāvā tarati yātumāvān
translated: Which the ever-wandering one does not overcome.

original: upa yameti yuvatiḥ sudakṣaṃ doṣā vastorhaviṣmatī ghṛtācī
analyzed: upa yam iti yuvatiḥ su dakṣam doṣā vastoḥ haviṣmatī ghṛtācī
translated: The young woman, bringing oblations, the ladle full of ghee, approaches the very skilful one, in the evening and in the morning.

original: upa svainamaramatirvasūyuḥ
analyzed: upa svā enam aramatiḥ vasūyuḥ
translated: To him comes the thought, seeking wealth.

original: viśvā agne 'pa dahārātīryebhistapobhiradaho jarūtham
analyzed: viśvāḥ agne daha arātīryebhiḥ tapobhiḥ adahaḥ jarūtham
translated: Burn up, O Agni, all the evil spirits with those flames of thine, burn up the wicked one.

original: pra nisvaraṃ cātayasvāmīvām
analyzed: pra nisvaram cātayasva amīvām
translated: Drive away the noise, as if it were an enemy.

original: ā yaste agna idhate anīkaṃ vasiṣṭha śukra dīdivaḥ pāvaka
analyzed: ā yaḥ te agne idhate anīkam vasiṣṭha śukra dīdivas pāvaka
translated: He who kindles thy face, O Agni, O Vasishṭha, O pure, shining, purifying one,

original: uto na ebhi stavathairiha syāḥ
analyzed: uta u naḥ ebhiḥ stavathaiḥ iha syāḥ
translated: And with these praises of ours thou shouldst be here.

original: vi ye te agne bhejire anīkaṃ martā naraḥ pitryāsaḥ purutrā
analyzed: vi ye te agne bhejire anīkam martāḥ naraḥ pitryāsaḥ purutrā
translated: Those mortal men, O Agni, who have spread out thy face in many places, the sons of Manu,

original: uto na ebhiḥ sumanā iha syāḥ
analyzed: uta u naḥ ebhiḥ sumanāḥ iha syāḥ
translated: Be thou also well-disposed towards them here.

original: ime naro vṛtrahatyeṣu śūrā viśvā adevīrabhi santu māyāḥ
analyzed: ime naraḥ vṛtra hatyeṣu śūrāḥ viśvāḥ adevīḥ abhi santu māyāḥ
translated: Let these heroes, in the slaying of Vrtra, overcome all the godless enchantments.

original: ye me dhiyaṃ panayanta praśastām
analyzed: ye me dhiyam panayanta praśastām
translated: Those who promote my hymn that is praised,

original: mā śūne agne ni ṣadāma nṛṇāṃ māśeṣaso 'vīratā paritvā
analyzed: mā śūne agne ni sadāma nṛṇām mā a śeṣasaḥ vīra tā paritvā
translated: Sit not empty, O Agni, among men, nor be thou far from us, O hero.

original: prajāvatīṣu duryāsu durya
analyzed: prajāvatīṣu duryāsu durya
translated: In the houses with offspring, in the houses,

original: yamaśvī nityamupayāti yajñaṃ prajāvantaṃ svapatyaṃ kṣayaṃ naḥ
analyzed: yam aśvī nityam upayāti yajñam prajāvantam su apatyam kṣayam naḥ
translated: The one who possesses horses always comes to the sacrifice, to our home with offspring and prosperity.

original: svajanmanā śeṣasā vāvṛdhānam
analyzed: sva janmanā śeṣasā vāvṛdhānam
translated: Having grown by his own birth and by the remnant,

original: pāhi no agne rakṣaso ajuṣṭāt pāhi dhūrterararuṣo aghāyoḥ
analyzed: pāhi naḥ agne rakṣasaḥ ajuṣṭāt pāhi dhūrteḥ a raruṣaḥ aghāyoḥ
translated: Protect us, O Agni, from the undesired Raksas, protect us from the deceitful, the red, the evil-doing one.

original: tvā yujā pṛtanāyūnrabhi ṣyām
analyzed: tvā yujā pṛtanāyūn abhi syām
translated: I will go forth with thee as ally against the bands of foes.

original: sedagniragnīnratyastvanyān yatra vājī tanayo vīḷupāṇiḥ
analyzed: sa id agniḥ agnīn ratyaḥ tu anyān yatra vājī tanayaḥ vīḍu pāṇiḥ
translated: Agni has sat down, other fires than he, where the strong son, with his hands smeared with fat,

original: sahasrapāthā akṣarā sameti
analyzed: sahasra pāthāḥ akṣarā sameti
translated: Comes together with a thousand paths, imperishable.

original: sedagniryo vanuṣyato nipāti sameddhāramaṃhasa uruṣyāt
analyzed: sa id agniḥ yaḥ vanuṣyataḥ nipāti sameddhāram aṃhasaḥ uruṣyāt
translated: Agni has sat down, who strikes down the one who would harm, protect the one who kindles the fire from great misfortune.

original: sujātāsaḥ pari caranti vīrāḥ
analyzed: sujātāsaḥ pari caranti vīrāḥ
translated: The well-born heroes move around.

original: ayaṃ so agnirāhutaḥ purutrā yamīśānaḥ samidindhehaviṣmān
analyzed: ayam saḥ agniḥ āhutaḥ purutrā yam īśānaḥ samidh indhe haviṣmān
translated: This is that Agni who is worshipped in many places, who is the lord, who kindles the fire with oblations.

original: pari yametyadhvareṣu hotā
analyzed: pari yamā iti adhvareṣu hotā
translated: He has come to the sacrifice, the priest.

original: tve agna āhavanāni bhūrīśānāsa ā juhuyāma nityā
analyzed: tve agne āhavanāni bhūrī īśānāsaḥ ā juhuyāma nityā
translated: In thee, O Agni, we would offer the many oblations, O lord, as constant

original: ubhā kṛṇvanto vahatū miyedhe
analyzed: ubhā kṛṇvantaḥ vahatū miyedhe
translated: ones, making both (kinds of oblations) carry the offering to the gods.

original: imo agne vītatamāni havyājasro vakṣi devatātimacha
analyzed: imā u agne vītatamāni havyā ajasraḥ vakṣi devatātimacha
translated: Carry these most pure oblations to the gods, O Agni, O you of constant stream, to the assembly of the gods.

original: pratina īṃ surabhīṇi vyantu
analyzed: pratinaḥ īm surabhīṇi vyantu
translated: Let them enjoy the fragrant (oblations) here.

original: mā no agne 'vīrate parā dā durvāsase 'mataye mā no asyai
analyzed: mā naḥ agne vīra te parā dāḥ durvāsase mataye mā naḥ asyai
translated: Do not give us to the childless, O Agni, to misfortune, to want of offspring, to this (evil).

original: mā naḥ kṣudhe mā rakṣasa ṛtāvo mā no dame mā vana ā juhūrthāḥ
analyzed: mā naḥ kṣudhe mā rakṣase ṛtāvaḥ mā naḥ dame mā vane ā juhūrthāḥ
translated: Do not give us to hunger, to the R̥ishis, to the Rakshas, to the house, to the forest.

original: nū me brahmāṇyagna ucchaśādhi tvaṃ deva maghavadbhyaḥ suṣūdaḥ
analyzed: nu me brahmāṇi agne ucchaśādhi tvam deva maghavadbhyaḥ suṣūdaḥ
translated: Now, O Agni, do thou further my prayers. Thou, O god, hast been well purified for the wealthy.

original: rātau syāmobhayāsa ā te yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
analyzed: rātau syāma ubhayāsaḥ ā te yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May we be in the favour of both of thee. Do ye protect us evermore with your blessings.

original: tvamagne suhavo raṇvasandṛk sudītī sūno sahaso didīhi
analyzed: tvam agne su havaḥ raṇva sandṛś su dītī sūno sahasaḥ didīhi
translated: Thou, O Agni, art easy to invoke, of kindly aspect, O son of strength, shine with good light.

original: mā tve sacā tanaye nitya ā dhaṃ mā vīro asman naryo vi dāsīt
analyzed: mā tve sacā tanaye nitye ā dham mā vīraḥ asmat naryaḥ vi dāsīt
translated: Do not be angry with us, as with a son, in the begetting (of us). Let not a hero, a man of ours, be lost.

original: mā no agne durbhṛtaye sacaiṣu deveddheṣvagniṣu pra vocaḥ
analyzed: mā naḥ agne durbhṛtaye sacā eṣu deva iddheṣu agniṣu pra vocaḥ
translated: Do not, O Agni, speak of us among these, O god-kindled fires, for our ill-keeping.

original: mā te asmān durmatayo bhṛmāccid devasya sūno sahaso naśanta
analyzed: mā te asmān durmatayaḥ bhṛmāt cit devasya sūno sahasaḥ naśanta
translated: Let not our evil thoughts, O son of strength, O god, harm us, nor thy anger.

original: sa marto agne svanīka revānamartye ya ājuhoti havyam
analyzed: sa martaḥ agne su anīka revān amartye yaḥ ājuhoti havyam
translated: That mortal, O Agni, O thou of fair face, the rich man, O immortal one, who offers thee the oblation,

original: sadevatā vasuvaniṃ dadhāti yaṃ sūrirarthī pṛchamāna eti
analyzed: sa devatāḥ vasu vanim dadhāti yam sūriḥ arthī pṛcchamānaḥ eti
translated: He bestows wealth together with the gods, whom the sun, as a suitor, approaches asking.

original: maho no agne suvitasya vidvān rayiṃ sūribhya ā vahā bṛhantam
analyzed: mahaḥ naḥ agne suvitasya vidvān rayim sūribhyaḥ ā vaha bṛhantam
translated: O Agni, knowing well our great prosperity, bring us wealth, O lord, that is vast.

original: yena vayaṃ sahasāvan mademāvikṣitāsa āyuṣā suvīrāḥ
analyzed: yena vayam sahasāvat madema a vikṣitāsaḥ āyuṣā su vīrāḥ
translated: By which, O victor, we may rejoice, unharmed by disease, with long life and brave sons.

original: nū me brahmāṇyagna / / /
analyzed: nu me brahmāṇi agne
translated: Now, my prayers to Agni...

original: juṣasva naḥ samidhamagne adya śocā bṛhad yajataṃ dhūmamṛṇvan
analyzed: juṣasva naḥ samidham agne adya śoca bṛhat yajatam dhūmam ṛṇvan
translated: Accept my prayers, O Agni, today, shining brightly, making the sacrifice fragrant with smoke.

original: upa spṛśa divyaṃ sānu stūpaiḥ saṃ raśmibhistatanaḥ sūryasya
analyzed: upa spṛśa divyam sānu stūpaiḥ sam raśmibhiḥ tatanaḥ sūryasya
translated: Touch the heavenly ridge with your flames, extend with your rays the light of the sun.

original: narāśaṃsasya mahimānameṣāmupa stoṣāma yajatasya yajñaiḥ
analyzed: narāśaṃsasya mahimānam eṣām upa stoṣāma yajatasya yajñaiḥ
translated: Let us praise the greatness of Narāśaṃsa, of the sacrificer, with sacrifices.

original: ye sukratavaḥ śucayo dhiyandhāḥ svadanti devā ubhayāni havyā
analyzed: ye su kratavaḥ śucayaḥ dhiyandhāḥ svadanti devāḥ ubhayāni havyā
translated: Those who are well-ordered, pure, and wise, the gods who enjoy both kinds of offerings.

original: īḷenyaṃ vo asuraṃ sudakṣamantardūtaṃ rodasī satyavācam🔽manuṣvadagniṃ manunā samiddhaṃ samadhvarāya sadamin mahema🔽saparyavo bharamāṇā abhijñu pra vṛñjate namasā barhiragnau
analyzed: īḍenyam vaḥ asuram su dakṣam antar dūtam rodasī satya vācam  manuṣvat agnim manunā samiddham sam adhvarāya sadamin mahema  saparyavaḥ bharamāṇāḥ abhijñu pra vṛñjate namasā barhiḥ agnau
translated: The adorable Asura, of good skill, the inner messenger, the truthful one between heaven and earth.🔽Like Manu, we will serve Agni, kindled by Manu, for the sake of the sacrifice, O you who are always present.🔽The attendants, carrying the oblations, spread out the sacred grass with reverence for Agni.

original: ājuhvānā ghṛtapṛṣṭhaṃ pṛṣadvadadhvaryavo haviṣā marjayadhvam
analyzed: ājuhvānāḥ ghṛta pṛṣṭham pṛṣadvat adhvaryavaḥ haviṣā marjayadhvam
translated: O Adhvaryus, anoint with oblation the swift one whose back is anointed with ghee.

original: svādhyo vi duro devayanto 'śiśrayū rathayurdevatātā🔽pūrvī śiśuṃ na mātarā rihāṇe samagruvo na samaneṣvañjan
analyzed: su ādhyaḥ vi duraḥ devayantaḥ śiśrayuḥ rathayuḥ devatātā  pūrvī śiśum na mātarā rihāṇe samagruvaḥ na samaneṣu añjan
translated: The divine ones, seeking the gods, have mounted the chariot-borne ones, the far-reaching ones🔽The two, like mothers, have embraced the child, like two swift mares in the races, well-anointed

original: uta yoṣaṇe divye mahī na uṣāsānaktā sudugheva dhenuḥ🔽barhiṣadā puruhūte maghonī ā yajñiye suvitāya śrayetām
analyzed: uta yoṣaṇe divye mahī naḥ uṣāsānaktā sudughā iva dhenuḥ  barhiṣadā puruhūte maghonī ā yajñiye suvitāya śrayetām
translated: And the two divine maidens, the great Dawn and Night, like a well-milking cow🔽Bestowing the sacrificial grass, much-invoked, rich in gifts, may the two worthy of sacrifice come to us for our welfare

original: viprā yajñeṣu mānuṣeṣu kārū manye vāṃ jātavedasā yajadhyai
analyzed: viprā yajñeṣu mānuṣeṣu kārū manye vām jātavedasā yajadhyai
translated: As priests at human sacrifices, I think of you, to worship with Jātavedas

original: ūrdhvaṃ no adhvaraṃ kṛtaṃ haveṣu tā deveṣu vanatho vāryāṇi
analyzed: ūrdhvam naḥ adhvaram kṛtam haveṣu tā deveṣu vanathaḥ vāryāṇi
translated: Make our sacrifice lofty in your offerings, and grant us boons among the gods

original: ā bhāratī bhāratībhiḥ / / /🔽tan nasturīpaṃ / / /
analyzed: ā bhāratī bhāratībhiḥ  tat nasturīpam
translated: May Bhāratī with the Bhāratīs...🔽That which is most extensive...

original: vanaspate 'va / / /🔽ā yāhyagne / / /
analyzed: vanaspate va  ā yāhi agne
translated: O lord of the forest, come down...🔽Come, O Agni...

original: agniṃ vo devamagnibhiḥ sajoṣā yajiṣṭhaṃ dūtamadhvarekṛṇudhvam
analyzed: agnim vaḥ devam agnibhiḥ sajoṣāḥ yajiṣṭham dūtam adhvarekṛṇudhvam
translated: Make ready Agni, the god, with the Agnis of one mind, the best messenger at the sacrifice

original: yo martyeṣu nidhruvirṛtāvā tapurmūrdhā ghṛtānnaḥ pāvakaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ martyeṣu nidhruviḥ ṛtāvā tapuḥ mūrdhā ghṛta annaḥ pāvakaḥ
translated: Who among mortals is firmly established in truth, the head of heat, the purifier who eats ghee

original: prothadaśvo na yavase 'viṣyan yadā mahaḥ saṃvaraṇād vyasthāt
analyzed: prothat aśvaḥ na yavase viṣyan yadā mahaḥ saṃvaraṇāt vyasthāt
translated: The horse neighs as if hungry for the barley when he is let loose from the great enclosure

original: ādasya vāto anu vāti śociradha sma te vrajanaṃ kṛṣṇamasti
analyzed: āt asya vātaḥ anu vāti śociḥ adha sma te vrajanam kṛṣṇam asti
translated: The wind blows after your glowing flame, and now your black path is seen

original: ud yasya te navajātasya vṛṣṇo 'gne carantyajarā idhānāḥ
analyzed: ud yasya te nava jātasya vṛṣṇaḥ gne caranti ajarāḥ idhānāḥ
translated: Of thee, O Agni, the young and mighty one, whose flames, when kindled, move without decay,

original: achā dyāmaruṣo dhūma eti saṃ dūto agna īyase hi devān
analyzed: achā dyām aruṣaḥ dhūmaḥ eti sam dūtaḥ agne īyase hi devān
translated: The ruddy smoke ascendeth to the sky, and thou, O Agni, goest as a messenger to the gods.

original: vi yasya te pṛthivyāṃ pājo aśret tṛṣu yadannā samavṛktajambhaiḥ🔽seneva sṛṣṭā prasitiṣ ṭa eti yavaṃ na dasma juhvā vivekṣi🔽tamid doṣā tamuṣasi yaviṣṭhamagnimatyaṃ na marjayanta naraḥ
analyzed: vi yasya te pṛthivyām pājaḥ aśret tṛṣu yat annā samavṛkta jambhaiḥ  senā iva sṛṣṭā prasitiḥ te eti yavam na dasma juhvā vivekṣi  tam id doṣā tam uṣasi yaviṣṭham agnimatyam na marjayanta naraḥ
translated: Thy splendour hath shone forth on the earth, when with the three-edged bolt thou hast crushed the food of the foe.🔽She goeth forth like an army with its weapons, to the barley, O wondrous one, to be winnowed with the winnowing-basket.🔽That same Agni, O ye men, most youthful, at eve and at dawn, do ye adorn like a steed.

original: niśiśānā atithimasya yonau dīdāya śocirāhutasya vṛṣṇaḥ🔽susandṛk te svanīka pratīkaṃ vi yad rukmo na rocasa upāke
analyzed: niśiśānā atithimasya yonau dīdāya śociḥ āhutasya vṛṣṇaḥ  su sandṛś te su anīka pratīkam vi yat rukmaḥ na rocase upāke
translated: Shining in his own abode, he hath shone forth, the ruddy one, when offered, with his flame.🔽Fair to behold is thy face, O thou of fair face, when thou shinest like a bright disk in thy place.

original: divo na te tanyatureti śuṣmaścitro na sūraḥ prati cakṣi bhānum
analyzed: divaḥ na te tanyatuḥ eti śuṣmaḥ citraḥ na sūraḥ prati cakṣi bhānum
translated: Thy might, O Agni, goeth like the thunder of the sky; the wondrous one looketh on thy light like the sun.

original: yathā vaḥ svāhāgnaye dāśema parīḷābhirghṛtavadbhiśca havyaiḥ
analyzed: yathā vaḥ svāhā agnaye dāśema parīḍābhiḥ ghṛtavadbhiḥ ca havyaiḥ
translated: As we may best offer unto Agni our oblations with ghee and with the Parilá ceremonies,

original: tebhirno agne amitairmahobhiḥ śataṃ pūrbhirāyasībhirni pāhi
analyzed: tebhiḥ naḥ agne amitaiḥ mahobhiḥ śatam pūrbhiḥ āyasībhiḥ ni pāhi
translated: With those, O Agni, with thy boundless boons, with a hundred iron fortresses, do thou guard us.

original: yā vā te santi dāśuṣe adhṛṣṭā giro vā yābhirnṛvatīruruṣyāḥ
analyzed: yāḥ vā te santi dāśuṣe adhṛṣṭāḥ giraḥ vā yābhiḥ nṛvatīḥ uruṣyāḥ
translated: Those which, O Agni, are irresistible to the worshipper, or those with which thou protectest the many-folk,

original: tābhirnaḥ sūno sahaso ni pāhi smat sūrīñ jaritṝñ jātavedaḥ
analyzed: tābhiḥ naḥ sūno sahasaḥ ni pāhi smat sūrīm jaritṝm jātavedaḥ
translated: With these, O son of strength, do thou protect us, O all-knower, our princes and our worshippers.

original: niryat pūteva svadhitiḥ śucirgāt svayā kṛpā tanvā rocamānaḥ
analyzed: niryat pūtā iva svadhitiḥ śuciḥ gāt svayā kṛpā tanvā rocamānaḥ
translated: When he hath gone forth, pure as a polished axe, shining with his own light,

original: ā yo mātroruśenyo janiṣṭa devayajyāya sukratuḥ pāvakaḥ
analyzed: ā yaḥ mātrā uru śenyaḥ janiṣṭa deva yajyāya su kratuḥ pāvakaḥ
translated: He who hath been born, well-disposed, between the two mothers, the pure one, of good resolve, for the worship of the gods.

original: etā no agne saubhagā didīhyapi kratuṃ sucetasaṃ vatema
analyzed: etā naḥ agne saubhagā didīhi api kratum su cetasam vatema
translated: These blessings, O Agni, do thou grant to us. May we attain to thy most intelligent will.

original: viśvā stotṛbhyo gṛṇate ca santu yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: viśvā stotṛbhyaḥ gṛṇate ca santu yūyam pāta
translated: Be all these to the praisers and singers. Do ye protect us.

original: pra vaḥ śukrāya bhānave bharadhvaṃ havyaṃ matiṃ cāgnaye supūtam
analyzed: pra vaḥ śukrāya bhānave bharadhvam havyam matim ca agnaye su pūtam
translated: Bear to your bright light, to Agni, your pure oblation and your thought,

original: yo daivyāni mānuṣā janūṃṣyantarviśvāni vidmanā jigāti
analyzed: yaḥ daivyāni mānuṣā janūṃṣi antar viśvāni vidmanā jigāti
translated: Who with his knowledge penetrates all the generations of gods and men.

original: sa gṛtso agnistaruṇaścidastu yato yaviṣṭho ajaniṣṭa mātuḥ
analyzed: sa gṛtsaḥ agniḥ taruṇaḥ cit astu yatas yaviṣṭhaḥ ajaniṣṭa mātuḥ
translated: May that Agni be strong, though young, from whom the youngest has been born of the mother.

original: saṃ yo vanā yuvate śucidan bhūri cidannā samidatti sadyaḥ
analyzed: sam yaḥ vanā yuvate śucidan bhūri cit annā samidh atti sadyas
translated: Who, with his pure teeth, chews the wood, and at once eats the abundant food.

original: asya devasya saṃsadyanīke yaṃ martāsaḥ śyetaṃ jagṛbhre
analyzed: asya devasya saṃsadi anīke yam martāsaḥ śyetam jagṛbhre
translated: In the assembly of this god, whom mortal men have seized as their white (treasure),

original: ni yo gṛbhaṃ pauruṣeyīmuvoca durokamagnirāyave śuśoca
analyzed: ni yaḥ gṛbham pauruṣeyīm uvoca durokam agniḥ āyave śuśoca
translated: He who hath spoken the seizure, the hard-to-bear one, Agni hath shone for Âyu.

original: ayaṃ kavirakaviṣu pracetā marteṣvagniramṛto ni dhāyi
analyzed: ayam kaviḥ akaviṣu pracetāḥ marteṣu agniḥ amṛtaḥ ni dhāyi
translated: This wise Agni, the immortal one, hath been placed among men, the unwise, the thoughtful one.

original: sa mā no atra juhuraḥ sahasvaḥ sadā tve sumanasaḥ syāma
analyzed: sa mā naḥ atra juhuraḥ sahasvas sadā tve sumanasaḥ syāma
translated: Do thou, O mighty one, accept our offerings here, and may we ever be dear to thee.

original: ā yo yoniṃ devakṛtaṃ sasāda kratvā hyagniramṛtānatārīt
analyzed: ā yaḥ yonim deva kṛtam sasāda kratvā hi agniḥ amṛtān atārīt
translated: He who hath sat down in the place prepared by the gods, by his wisdom hath Agni passed through the immortal.

original: tamoṣadhīśca vaninaśca garbhaṃ bhūmiśca viśvadhāyasaṃ bibharti
analyzed: tam oṣadhīḥ ca vaninaḥ ca garbham bhūmiḥ ca viśva dhāyasam bibharti
translated: The plants and the trees bear him as an embryo, and the earth as all-supporting.

original: īśe hyagniramṛtasya bhūrerīśe rāyaḥ suvīryasya dātoḥ
analyzed: īśe hi agniḥ amṛtasya bhūreḥ īśe rāyaḥ su vīryasya dātoḥ
translated: For Agni is the lord of the wide earth and of immortality, the lord of the bestowal of wealth and good heroism.

original: mā tvā vayaṃ sahasāvannavīrā māpsavaḥ pari ṣadāma māduvaḥ
analyzed: mā tvā vayam sahasāvan vīrāḥ mā apsavaḥ pari sadāma mā a duvaḥ
translated: O thou who art to be invoked, we, O Agni, who are without heroes, would not sit down around thee as men without boats (would not sit down) around the water.

original: pariṣadyaṃ hyaraṇasya rekṇo nityasya rāyaḥ patayaḥ syāma
analyzed: pariṣadyam hi araṇasya rekṇaḥ nityasya rāyaḥ patayaḥ syāma
translated: For we would be the lords of the wealth of the ever-present Agni, of the wealth of the unapproachable.

original: na śeṣo agne anyajātamastyacetānasya mā patho vi dukṣaḥ
analyzed: na śeṣaḥ agne anya jātam asti acetānasya mā pathaḥ vi dukṣaḥ
translated: There is no other birth for thee, O Agni, than from the wood; do not pour forth thy paths against the thoughtless one.

original: nahi grabhāyāraṇaḥ suśevo 'nyodaryo manasā mantavā u
analyzed: nahi grabhāya araṇaḥ su śevaḥ nyodaryaḥ manasā mantavai u
translated: For the wood is a good friend to the grasping one; one who has a different belly should be thought of with the mind.

original: adhā cidokaḥ punarit sa etyā no vājyabhīṣāḷ etu navyaḥ🔽tvamagne vanuṣyato / / /🔽etā no agne saubhagā / / /
analyzed: adhā cit okaḥ punar id saḥ etya ā naḥ vājī abhīṣāh etu navyaḥ  tvam agne vanuṣyataḥ  etā naḥ agne saubhagā
translated: Even now may the guest come back to us again, and may our hero come to us with terror.🔽You, O Agni, are the best of the two friends.🔽These blessings of thine, O Agni,

original: prāgnaye tavase bharadhvaṃ giraṃ divo arataye pṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: pra agnaye tavase bharadhvam giram divaḥ arataye pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Bring to Agni the strong, the song of praise, to him who delights in the sky and the earth,

original: yo viśveṣāmamṛtānāmupasthe vaiśvānaro vāvṛdhe jāgṛvadbhiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ viśveṣām amṛtānām upasthe vaiśvānaraḥ vāvṛdhe jāgṛvadbhiḥ
translated: He who in the lap of all the immortals, Vaiśvānara, has grown great with the watchful ones.

original: pṛṣṭo divi dhāyyagniḥ pṛthivyāṃ netā sindhūnāṃ vṛṣabha stiyānām
analyzed: pṛṣṭaḥ divi dhāyī agniḥ pṛthivyām netā sindhūnām vṛṣabhaḥ stiyānām
translated: Agni, when asked, is placed in heaven on earth, the leader of the streams, the bull of the strong

original: sa mānuṣīrabhi viśo vi bhāti vaiśvānaro vāvṛdhāno vareṇa
analyzed: sa mānuṣīḥ abhi viśaḥ vi bhāti vaiśvānaraḥ vāvṛdhānaḥ vareṇa
translated: He shines among the human people, Vaisvānara, grown great with a boon

original: tvad bhiyā viśa āyannasiknīrasamanā jahatīrbhojanāni🔽vaiśvānara pūrave śośucānaḥ puro yadagne darayannadīdeḥ
analyzed: tvat bhiyā viśaḥ āyan asiknīḥ asamanāḥ jahatīḥ bhojanāni  vaiśvānara pūrave śośucānaḥ puraḥ yat agne darayan adīdeḥ
translated: Through your fear the people came, the helpless ones, leaving their food without it🔽Vaisvānara, shining to Pūrava, when, O Agni, you opened the doors, breaking through

original: tava tridhātu pṛthivī uta dyaurvaiśvānara vratamagne sacanta
analyzed: tava tri dhātu pṛthivī uta dyauḥ vaiśvānara vratam agne sacanta
translated: Your three-fold abode, O Agni, the earth and the sky, follow the vow of Vaisvānara

original: tvaṃ bhāsā rodasī ā tatanthājasreṇa śociṣā śośucānaḥ
analyzed: tvam bhāsā rodasī ā tatantha ajasreṇa śociṣā śośucānaḥ
translated: You have spread out the two worlds with your radiance, shining with imperishable light

original: tvāmagne harito vāvaśānā giraḥ sacante dhunayo ghṛtācīḥ
analyzed: tvām agne haritaḥ vāvaśānāḥ giraḥ sacante dhunayaḥ ghṛtācīḥ
translated: Your bay steeds, O Agni, your songs that utter the cry of joy, your drops full of ghee attend you

original: patiṃ kṛṣṭīnāṃ rathyaṃ rayīṇāṃ vaiśvānaramuṣasāṃ ketumahnām
analyzed: patim kṛṣṭīnām rathyam rayīṇām vaiśvānaram uṣasām ketum ahnām
translated: The lord of the people, the charioteer of riches, the banner of the dawns, of the days, Vaisvānara

original: tve asuryaṃ vasavo ny ṛṇvan kratuṃ hi te mitramaho juṣanta
analyzed: tve asuryam vasavaḥ ni ṛṇvan kratum hi te mitra mahas juṣanta
translated: The Vasus have set the divine power in you, for they delight in your eternal law

original: tvaṃ dasyūnrokaso agna āja uru jyotirjanayannāryāya
analyzed: tvam dasyūn rokasaḥ agne ājaḥ uru jyotiḥ janayan āryāya
translated: You, O Agni, have shut out the Dasyus, producing great light for the Ārya

original: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyoman vāyurna pāthaḥ pari pāsi sadyaḥ
analyzed: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyoman vāyuḥ na pāthaḥ pari pāsi sadyas
translated: When born in the highest heaven, you guard the path like the wind in a moment

original: tvaṃ bhuvanā janayannabhi krannapatyāya jātavedo daśasyan
analyzed: tvam bhuvanā janayan abhi kran apatyāya jātavedaḥ daśasyan
translated: You, O all-knower, having generated the worlds, have prospered, bestowing offspring

original: tāmagne asme iṣamerayasva vaiśvānara dyumatīṃ jātavedaḥ
analyzed: tām agne asme iṣam erayasva vaiśvānara dyumatīm jātavedaḥ
translated: O Agni, bring us that booty, O Vaisvānara, O all-knower, the glorious one,

original: yayā rādhaḥ pinvasi viśvavāra pṛthu śravo dāśuṣe martyāya
analyzed: yayā rādhaḥ pinvasi viśva vāra pṛthu śravaḥ dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: With which, O bountiful one, you swell the gift for the mortal who offers, for wide fame,

original: taṃ no agne maghavadbhyaḥ purukṣuṃ rayiṃ ni vājaṃ śrutyaṃ yuvasva
analyzed: tam naḥ agne maghavadbhyaḥ purukṣum rayim ni vājam śrutyam yuvasva
translated: That, O Agni, for our wealthy ones, bestow on us, O you of great strength, wealth, and fame,

original: vaiśvānara mahi naḥ śarma yacha rudrebhiragne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ
analyzed: vaiśvānara mahi naḥ śarma yaccha rudrebhiḥ agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: O Vaisvānara, grant us great protection, O Agni, in accord with the Rudras and Vasus.

original: pra samrājo asurasya praśastiṃ puṃsaḥ kṛṣṭīnāmanumādyasya
analyzed: pra samrājaḥ asurasya praśastim puṃsaḥ kṛṣṭīnām anumādyasya
translated: I praise the praise of the great king, the Asura, of the man to be celebrated by the people,

original: indrasyeva pra tavasas kṛtāni vande dāruṃ vandamānovivakmi
analyzed: indrasya iva pra tavasaḥ kṛtāni vande dārum
translated: I praise the deeds of the powerful one, as of Indra, I praise the wood, I praise, I praise.

original: kaviṃ ketuṃ dhāsiṃ bhānumadrerhinvanti śaṃ rājyaṃ rodasyoḥ
analyzed: kavim ketum dhāsim bhānum adreḥ hinvanti śam rājyam rodasyoḥ
translated: The wise one, the banner, the spreading, the radiant one, they urge on the good rule of the two worlds.

original: purandarasya gīrbhirā vivāse 'gnervratāni pūrvyā mahāni
analyzed: purandarasya gīrbhiḥ ā vivāse gneḥ vratāni pūrvyā mahāni
translated: With the songs of Purandara I invoke the ancient great vows of Agni,

original: nyakratūn grathino mṛdhravācaḥ paṇīnraśraddhānavṛdhānayajñān
analyzed: nyakratūn grathinaḥ mṛdhravācaḥ paṇīn raśraddhān avṛdhān ayajñān
translated: The spiteful, deceitful, malicious-speaking Paṇis, who do not believe in the growing sacrifice.

original: prapra tān dasyūnragnirvivāya pūrvaścakārāparānayajyūn
analyzed: pra pra tān dasyūn ragniḥ vivāya pūrvaḥ cakāra aparān ayajyūn
translated: Agni has scattered those Dasyus away, and has made the others subject to the sacrificer,

original: yo apācīne tamasi madantīḥ prācīścakāra nṛtamaḥ śacībhiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ apācīne tamasi madantīḥ prācīḥ cakāra nṛtamaḥ śacībhiḥ
translated: The best of men, with his powers, who has made the lights shining in the western darkness shine towards the east.

original: tamīśānaṃ vasvo agniṃ gṛṇīṣe 'nānataṃ damayantaṃ pṛtanyūn
analyzed: tam īśānam vasvaḥ agnim gṛṇīṣe nānatam damayantam pṛtanyūn
translated: I praise that lord of the Vasus, Agni, the unbent one who subdues the enemies,

original: yo dehyo anamayad vadhasnairyo aryapatnīruṣasaścakāra
analyzed: yaḥ dehyaḥ anamayat vadhasnaiḥ yaḥ arya patnīḥ uṣasaḥ cakāra
translated: Who with his weapon bent the necks of the Dasyus, who made the wives of the Aryas and the dawns,

original: sa nirudhyā nahuṣo yajvo agnirviśaścakre balihṛtaḥ sahobhiḥ
analyzed: sa nirudhya nahuṣaḥ yajvaḥ agniḥ viśaḥ cakre bali hṛtaḥ sahobhiḥ
translated: That Agni, the sacrificer, the restrainer, the Nahusha, has made the people offer tribute with his powers.

original: yasya śarmannupa viśve janāsa evaistasthuḥ sumatiṃ bhikṣamāṇāḥ🔽vaiśvānaro varamā rodasyorāgniḥ sasāda pitrorupastham
analyzed: yasya śarman upa viśve janāsaḥ evaiḥ tasthuḥ sumatim bhikṣamāṇāḥ  vaiśvānaraḥ varamāḥ rodasyoḥ ā agniḥ sasāda pitroḥ upastham
translated: Under whose protection all people stand, seeking his favor with their songs,🔽Vaisvānara Agni has sat down as a boon between the two worlds,

original: ā devo dade budhnyā vasūni vaiśvānara uditā sūryasya
analyzed: ā devaḥ dade budhnyā vasūni vaiśvānaraḥ uditā sūryasya
translated: The god Vaisvānara has brought down treasures from the depths, from the rising of the sun,

original: ā samudrādavarādā parasmādāgnirdade diva ā pṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: ā samudrāt avarāt ā parasmāt ā agniḥ dade divaḥ ā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Agni has brought them from the ocean, from the lower and the higher, from heaven and earth.

original: pra vo devaṃ cit sahasānamagnimaśvaṃ na vājinaṃ hiṣe namobhiḥ🔽bhavā no dūto adhvarasya vidvān tmanā deveṣu vivide mitadruḥ
analyzed: pra vaḥ devam cit sahasānam agnim aśvam na vājinam hiṣe namobhiḥ  bhava naḥ dūtaḥ adhvarasya vidvān tmanā deveṣu vivide mitadruḥ
translated: I serve with homage that invincible Agni, the god, like a strong horse,🔽Be our wise messenger of the sacrifice, seeking among the gods, the one of measured speed.

original: ā yāhyagne pathyā anu svā mandro devānāṃ sakhyaṃ juṣāṇaḥ
analyzed: ā yāhi agne pathyāḥ anu svāḥ mandraḥ devānām sakhyam juṣāṇaḥ
translated: Come, O Agni, along the paths that are your own, rejoicing, delighting in the friendship of the gods,

original: ā sānu śuṣmairnadayan pṛthivyā jambhebhirviśvamuśadhag vanāni
analyzed: ā sānu śuṣmaiḥ nadayan pṛthivyāḥ jambhebhiḥ viśvam uśadhak vanāni
translated: Shaking the earth with your back and sides, burning all the woods with your jaws.

original: prācīno yajñaḥ sudhitaṃ hi barhiḥ prīṇīte agnirīḷito na hotā
analyzed: prācīnaḥ yajñaḥ sudhitam hi barhiḥ prīṇīte agniḥ īḍitaḥ na hotā
translated: The sacrifice is ancient, the sacred grass is well-spread; Agni, when praised, delights as a priest.

original: ā mātarā viśvavāre huvāno yato yaviṣṭha jajñiṣe suśevaḥ
analyzed: ā mātarā viśva vāre huvānaḥ yatas yaviṣṭha jajñiṣe su śevaḥ
translated: Calling the All-supporting Mothers, O most youthful one, from whom you are born most gracious,

original: sadyo adhvare rathiraṃ jananta mānuṣāso vicetaso ya eṣām🔽viśāmadhāyi viśpatirduroṇe 'gnirmandro madhuvacā ṛtāvā
analyzed: sadyas adhvare rathiram jananta mānuṣāsaḥ vicetasaḥ yaḥ eṣām  viśām adhāyi viśpatiḥ duroṇe gniḥ mandraḥ madhu vacāḥ ṛtāvā
translated: Immediately in the sacrifice they make Agni the charioteer, the human ones with their discerning minds, who are these [priests].🔽The lord of the people has been placed in the house, Agni the delightful one, true to his word, with sweet speech.

original: asādi vṛto vahnirājaganvānagnirbrahmā nṛṣadane vidhartā
analyzed: asādi vṛtaḥ vahniḥ ājaganvān agniḥ brahmā nṛṣadane vidhartā
translated: Surrounded, the bearer, Agni has come, the Brahman, the ordainer, in the abode of men.

original: dyauśca yaṃ pṛthivī vāvṛdhāte ā yaṃ hotā yajati viśvavāram🔽ete dyumnebhirviśvamātiranta mantraṃ ye vāraṃ naryā atakṣan
analyzed: dyauḥ ca yam pṛthivī vāvṛdhāte ā yam hotā yajati viśva vāram  ete dyumnebhiḥ viśvam ātiranta mantram ye vāram naryāḥ atakṣan
translated: Heaven and earth have increased him, whom the priest worships, the one who possesses all treasures.🔽They surpass all with their glories, those who have fashioned the hymn, the strainer, the men.

original: pra ye viśastiranta śroṣamāṇā ā ye me asya dīdhayannṛtasya
analyzed: pra ye śroṣamāṇāḥ ā ye me asya dīdhayan ṛtasya
translated: The people who listen to him, who have pondered this thought of his truth, have come to an end.

original: nū tvāmagna īmahe vasiṣṭhā īśānaṃ sūno sahaso vasūnām
analyzed: nu tvām agne īmahe vasiṣṭhāḥ īśānam sūno sahasaḥ vasūnām
translated: Now we invoke you, O Agni, O Vasishthas, the lord of treasures, O son of strength,

original: iṣaṃ stotṛbhyo maghavadbhya ānaḍ yūyaṃ pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
analyzed: iṣam stotṛbhyaḥ maghavadbhyaḥ ānaṭ yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Bring food to the generous praisers. Protect us always with your blessings.

original: indhe rājā samaryo namobhiryasya pratīkamāhutaṃ ghṛtena
analyzed: indhe rājā samaryaḥ namobhiḥ yasya pratīkam āhutam ghṛtena
translated: The king is kindled in the battle with offerings, whose form is called with ghee.

original: naro havyebhirīḷate sabādha āgniragra uṣasāmaśoci
analyzed: naraḥ havyebhiḥ īḍate sabādhaḥ ā agniḥ agre uṣasām aśoci
translated: Men delight him with oblations, the all-supporting one, Agni shines forth in the front of the dawns.

original: ayamu ṣya sumahānavedi hotā mandro manuṣo yajvo agniḥ
analyzed: ayam u sya su mahān avedi hotā mandraḥ manuṣaḥ yajvaḥ agniḥ
translated: This very great Agni is the altar, the delightful priest of men, the sacrificer.

original: vi bhā akaḥ sasṛjānaḥ pṛthivyāṃ kṛṣṇapaviroṣadhībhirvavakṣe
analyzed: vi bhās akaḥ sasṛjānaḥ pṛthivyām kṛṣṇa paviḥ oṣadhībhiḥ vavakṣe
translated: Thou, O Agni, hast been born, spreading abroad, with the dark-spotted (bull) and the plants on earth.

original: kayā no agne vi vasaḥ suvṛktiṃ kāmu svadhām ṛṇavaḥ śasyamānaḥ
analyzed: kayā naḥ agne vi vasaḥ suvṛktim kāmu svadhām ṛṇavaḥ śasyamānaḥ
translated: By what means, O Agni, wilt thou grant us a good dwelling, a desirable self-sustaining abode, when praised?

original: kadā bhavema patayah sudatra rāyo vantāro duṣṭarasya sādhoḥ
analyzed: kadā bhavema patayah su datra rāyaḥ vantāraḥ duṣṭarasya sādhoḥ
translated: When shall we become, O bountiful one, the lords of wealth, the bestowers of wealth hard to resist and good?

original: praprāyamagnirbharatasya śṛṇve vi yat sūryo na rocatebṛhad bhāḥ
analyzed: pra pra ayam agniḥ bharatasya śṛṇve vi yat sūryaḥ na rocate bṛhat bhās
translated: Agni is glorified, O Bharata, when his light shines forth like the sun's, his great light.

original: abhi yaḥ pūruṃ pṛtanāsu tasthau dyutāno daivyo atithiḥ śuśoca
analyzed: abhi yaḥ pūrum pṛtanāsu tasthau dyutānaḥ daivyaḥ atithiḥ śuśoca
translated: He who stands with Puru in battles, the divine guest, shining, has shone forth.

original: asannit tve āhavanāni bhūri bhuvo viśvebhiḥ sumanā anīkaiḥ
analyzed: asan id tve āhavanāni bhūri bhuvaḥ viśvebhiḥ sumanāḥ anīkaiḥ
translated: The abundant offerings are near thee, O existent one, with all thy well-disposed faces.

original: stutaścidagne śṛṇviṣe gṛṇānaḥ svayaṃ vardhasva tanvaṃ sujāta
analyzed: stutaḥ cit agne śṛṇviṣe gṛṇānaḥ svayam vardhasva tanvam su jāta
translated: Even when praised, O Agni, thou hearest, singing; increase thyself, O well-born one, thy body.

original: idaṃ vacaḥ śatasāḥ saṃsahasramudagnaye janiṣīṣṭa dvibarhāḥ
analyzed: idam vacaḥ śata sāḥ saṃsahasram udagnaye janiṣīṣṭa dvibarhāḥ
translated: Let this speech, a hundredfold, a thousandfold, be generated for Agni, with twofold strength.

original: śaṃ yat stotṛbhya āpaye bhavāti dyumadamīvacātanaṃ rakṣohā
analyzed: śam yat stotṛbhyaḥ āpaye bhavāti dyumat amīva cātanam rakṣaḥ hā
translated: When it becomes auspicious to the praisers, the supporter, driving away evil, the slayer of foes, shining.

original: nū tvāmagna īmahe / / /🔽abodhi jāra uṣasāmupasthād dhotā mandraḥ kavitamaḥ pāvakaḥ
analyzed: nu tvām agne īmahe  abodhi jāraḥ uṣasām upasthāt hotā mandraḥ kavitamaḥ pāvakaḥ
translated: Now we invoke thee, O Agni, to come to us...🔽The son of the dawns has awakened, the pleasant, most wise, purifying priest,

original: dadhāti ketumubhayasya jantorhavyā deveṣu draviṇaṃ sukṛtsu
analyzed: dadhāti ketum ubhayasya jantoḥ havyā deveṣu draviṇam sukṛtsu
translated: He sets up the banner of both peoples, the oblation, wealth among the well-doing gods.

original: sa sukraturyo vi duraḥ paṇīnāṃ punāno arkaṃ purubhojasaṃ naḥ🔽hotā mandro viśāṃ damūnāstirastamo dadṛśe rāmyāṇām
analyzed: sa su kratuḥ yaḥ vi duraḥ paṇīnām punānaḥ arkam puru bhojasam naḥ  hotā mandraḥ viśām damūnāḥ tirastamaḥ dadṛśe rāmyāṇām
translated: He is wise, who, purifying the path of the Paṇis, purifies the light for us, the all-nourishing one.🔽The delightful Hotar, the guest of the people, shines beyond the darkness of the lovely ones.

original: amūraḥ kaviraditirvivasvān susaṃsan mitro atithiḥ śivonaḥ
analyzed: amūraḥ kaviḥ aditiḥ vivasvān su saṃsad mitraḥ atithiḥ śiva ūnaḥ
translated: The unerring sage, the all-pervading Vivasvat, the well-ordered Mitra, the auspicious guest for us.

original: citrabhānuruṣasāṃ bhātyagre 'pāṃ garbhaḥ prasvaā viveśa
analyzed: citra bhānuḥ uṣasām bhāti agre pām garbhaḥ viveśa
translated: The wondrous light shines forth before the dawns, the embryo of the waters has entered the womb.

original: īḷenyo vo manuṣo yugeṣu samanagā aśucajjātavedāḥ
analyzed: īḍenyaḥ vaḥ manuṣaḥ yugeṣu samana gāḥ aśucat jātavedāḥ
translated: To be desired by men in the yokes, the all-purifying Jātavedas with united paths.

original: susandṛśā bhānunā yo vibhāti prati gāvaḥ samidhānaṃ budhanta
analyzed: su sandṛśā bhānunā yaḥ vibhāti prati gāvaḥ samidhānam budhanta
translated: He who shines with beautiful light, the cows respond to the kindled one.

original: agne yāhi dūtyaṃ mā riṣaṇyo devānachā brahmakṛtā gaṇena
analyzed: agne yāhi dūtyam mā riṣaṇyaḥ devān achā brahma kṛtā gaṇena
translated: O Agni, go as a messenger, do not be angry, lead the gods to the assembly of the Brahman-makers.

original: sarasvatīṃ maruto aśvināpo yakṣi devān ratnadheyāyaviśvān
analyzed: sarasvatīm marutaḥ aśvinā apaḥ yakṣi devān ratna dheyāya viśvān
translated: Worship the gods, Sarasvatī, the Maruts, the two Asvins, the waters, for the sake of bestowing treasures on all.

original: tvāmagne samidhāno vasiṣṭho jarūthaṃ han yakṣi rāye purandhim
analyzed: tvām agne samidhānaḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ jarūtham han yakṣi rāye purandhim
translated: O Agni, kindled, may Vasishtha worship the one who slays the wicked, worship Purandhi for the sake of wealth.

original: puruṇīthā jātavedo jarasva yūyaṃ pāta / / /🔽uṣo na jāraḥ pṛthu pājo aśred davidyutad dīdyacchośucānaḥ
analyzed: puruṇīthā jātavedaḥ jarasva yūyam pāta  uṣaḥ na jāraḥ pṛthu pājaḥ aśret davidyutat dīdyat śośucānaḥ
translated: Sing, O Jātavedas, give to many, you all protect...🔽The lover of dawn has sent forth his wide light, he has flashed forth, shining, glowing.

original: vṛṣā hariḥ śucirā bhāti bhāsā dhiyo hinvāna uśatīrajīgaḥ
analyzed: vṛṣā hariḥ śuciḥ ā bhāti bhāsā dhiyaḥ hinvānaḥ uśatīḥ ajīgaḥ
translated: The bull, the tawny one, shines with his radiance, urging the eager thoughts, he has attained.

original: svarṇa vastoruṣasāmaroci yajñaṃ tanvānā uśijo na manma
analyzed: svarṇa vastoḥ uṣasām aroci yajñam tanvānāḥ uśijaḥ na manma
translated: The golden-coloured dawns have shone forth, the eager ones fashioning the sacrifice like our thought

original: agnirjanmāni deva ā vi vidvān dravad dūto devayāvā vaniṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: agniḥ janmāni devaḥ ā vi vidvān dravat dūtaḥ deva yāvā vaniṣṭhaḥ
translated: Agni, the god, knowing the births, the swiftest messenger, most acceptable to the gods,

original: achā giro matayo devayantīragniṃ yanti draviṇaṃ bhikṣamāṇāḥ
analyzed: achā giraḥ matayaḥ devayantīḥ agnim yanti draviṇam bhikṣamāṇāḥ
translated: The hymns and thoughts that long for the gods go to Agni, seeking wealth

original: susandṛśaṃ supratīkaṃ svañcaṃ havyavāhamaratimmānuṣāṇām
analyzed: su sandṛśam su pratīkam svañcam havyavāham aratim mānuṣāṇām
translated: The well-seen, fair-formed, self-moving bearer of oblations, the messenger of men

original: indraṃ no agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣā rudraṃ rudrebhirā vahā bṛhantam
analyzed: indram naḥ agne vasubhiḥ sajoṣāḥ rudram rudrebhiḥ ā vaha bṛhantam
translated: Indra, O Agni, in accord with the Vasus, bring Rudra with the Rudras, the mighty one

original: ādityebhiraditiṃ viśvajanyāṃ bṛhaspatim ṛkvabhirviśvavāram🔽mandraṃ hotāramuśijo yaviṣṭhamagniṃ viśa īḷate adhvareṣu
analyzed: ādityebhiḥ aditim viśvajanyām bṛhaspatim ṛkvabhiḥ viśva vāram  mandram hotāram uśijaḥ yaviṣṭham agnim viśaḥ īḍate adhvareṣu
translated: Aditi, all-people-serving, with the Adityas, Brihaspati, all-conquering, with the singers🔽The joyful priest, the youngest, the Usija people invoke Agni at the sacrifices

original: sa hi kṣapāvānabhavad rayīṇāmatandro dūto yajathāya devān
analyzed: sa hi kṣapāvān abhavat rayīṇām atandraḥ dūtaḥ yajathāya devān
translated: For he has become the guardian of riches, the untiring messenger to worship the gods

original: mahānasyadhvarasya praketo na ṛte tvadamṛtā mādayante
analyzed: mahān asi adhvarasya praketaḥ na ṛte tvat amṛtāḥ mādayante
translated: He is the great foreteller of this great rite; without you the immortals do not rejoice

original: ā viśvebhiḥ sarathaṃ yāhi devairnyagne hotā prathamaḥ sadeha
analyzed: ā viśvebhiḥ sa ratham yāhi devaiḥ nyagne hotā prathamaḥ sadā iha
translated: Come, O Agni, with all the gods in your chariot; sit down as the first Hotar

original: tvāmīḷate ajiraṃ dūtyāya haviṣmantaḥ sadamin mānuṣāsaḥ
analyzed: tvām īḍate ajiram dūtyāya haviṣmantaḥ sadamidh mānuṣāsaḥ
translated: The men who offer oblations always invoke you, the swift one, as a messenger

original: yasya devairāsado barhiragne 'hānyasmai sudinā bhavanti
analyzed: yasya devaiḥ āsadaḥ barhiḥ agne ha anyasmai su dināḥ bhavanti
translated: Whose sacred grass, O Agni, is associated with the gods, for whom the days become good days for him

original: triścidaktoḥ pra cikiturvasūni tve antardāśuṣe martyāya
analyzed: tris cit aktoḥ pra cikituḥ vasūni tve antar dāśuṣe martyāya
translated: And thrice from the pressed (Soma) the treasures of the wise one are revealed to the mortal worshipper.

original: manuṣvadagna iha yakṣi devān bhavā no dūto adhiśastipāvā
analyzed: manuṣvat agne iha yakṣi devān bhava naḥ dūtaḥ adhiśasti pāvā
translated: O Agni, like Manu, worship the gods here, be our messenger, a protector from curses.

original: agnirīśe bṛhato adhvarasyāgnirviśvasya haviṣaḥ kṛtasya
analyzed: agniḥ īśe bṛhataḥ adhvarasya agniḥ viśvasya haviṣaḥ kṛtasya
translated: Agni is the lord of the great sacrifice, Agni of all the prepared oblation.

original: kratuṃ hyasya vasavo juṣantāthā devā dadhire havyavāham🔽āgne vaha haviradyāya devānindrajyeṣṭhāsa iha mādayantām🔽imaṃ yajñaṃ divi deveṣu dhehi yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: kratum hi asya vasavaḥ juṣanta athā devāḥ dadhire havyavāham  ā agne vaha haviḥ adyāya devān indra jyeṣṭhāsaḥ iha mādayantām  imam yajñam divi deveṣu dhehi yūyam pāta
translated: For his rite the Vasus accept, then the gods have made him the bearer of offerings.🔽O Agni, bring the gods to eat the oblation, may they rejoice here, headed by Indra.🔽Place this sacrifice among the gods in heaven. You, protect us, O Agni, with that deity to which you belong.

original: aganma mahā namasā yaviṣṭhaṃ yo dīdāya samiddhaḥ sve duroṇe
analyzed: aganma mahā namasā yaviṣṭham yaḥ dīdāya samiddhaḥ sve duroṇe
translated: We have come to the youngest with great reverence, who shines forth enkindled in his own abode.

original: citrabhānuṃ rodasī antarurvī svāhutaṃ viśvataḥ pratyañcam🔽sa mahnā viśvā duritāni sāhvānagniḥ ṣṭave dama ā jātavedāḥ
analyzed: citra bhānum rodasī antar urvī su āhutam viśvatas pratyañcam  sa mahnā viśvā duritāni sāhvān agniḥ tave dame ā jātavedāḥ
translated: The one with the wondrous light, between the two wide worlds, well-offered, from all sides, facing this way.🔽That Agni, who conquers all difficulties with his greatness, should be praised in the house, the all-knowing one.

original: sa no rakṣiṣad duritādavadyādasmān gṛṇata uta no maghonaḥ🔽tvaṃ varuṇa uta mitro agne tvāṃ vardhanti matibhirvasiṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ rakṣiṣat duritāt avadyāt asmān gṛṇataḥ uta naḥ maghonaḥ  tvam varuṇaḥ uta mitraḥ agne tvām vardhanti matibhiḥ vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: May he protect us from evil and sin, and us who sing his praises, and our wealthy patrons.🔽You are Varuna and Mitra, O Agni, you are exalted by the Vasishthas with hymns.

original: tve vasu suṣaṇanāni santu yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: tve vasu suṣaṇanāni santu yūyam pāta
translated: May all good things be in you, O Agni. You, protect us, O Agni, with that deity to which you belong.

original: prāgnaye viśvaśuce dhiyandhe 'suraghne manma dhītiṃ bharadhvam
analyzed: pra agnaye viśva śuce dhiyandhe sura ghne manma dhītim bharadhvam
translated: To Agni, the purifier of all, the slayer of demons, bring forth the hymn and thought.

original: bhare havirna barhiṣi prīṇāno vaiśvānarāya yataye matīnām
analyzed: bhare haviḥ na barhiṣi prīṇānaḥ vaiśvānarāya yataye matīnām
translated: I bring the oblation on the sacred grass, delighting Vaiśvānara, the impeller of thoughts.

original: tvamagne śociṣā śośucāna ā rodasī apṛṇā jāyamānaḥ
analyzed: tvam agne śociṣā śośucānaḥ ā rodasī apṛṇāḥ jāyamānaḥ
translated: You, O Agni, shining with your radiance, have filled the two worlds, being born.

original: tvaṃ devānabhiśasteramuñco vaisvānara jātavedo mahitvā
analyzed: tvam devān abhiśasteḥ amuñcaḥ vaisvānara jātavedaḥ mahitvā
translated: You, O Vaiśvānara Jātavedas, have freed the gods from the curse through your greatness.

original: jāto yadagne bhuvanā vyakhyaḥ paśūn na gopā iryaḥ parijmā
analyzed: jātaḥ yat agne bhuvanā vyakhyaḥ paśūn na gopāḥ iryaḥ parijmā
translated: When you, O Agni, were born, you have pervaded the worlds, like a guardian of cattle, moving around.

original: vaiśvānara brahmaṇe vinda gātuṃ yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: vaiśvānara brahmaṇe vinda gātum yūyam pāta
translated: O Vaiśvānara, find a way for the Brahman priest. You all protect.

original: samidhā jātavedase devāya devahūtibhiḥ🔽havirbhiḥ śukraśociṣe namasvino vayaṃ dāśemāgnaye
analyzed: samidhā jātavedase devāya deva hūtibhiḥ  havirbhiḥ śukra śociṣe namasvinaḥ vayam dāśema agnaye
translated: With fuel to Jātavedas, to the god with invocations to the god,🔽with oblations to the one with pure radiance, we humble ones should offer to Agni.

original: vayaṃ te agne samidhā vidhema vayaṃ dāśema suṣṭutī yajatra🔽vayaṃ ghṛtenādhvarasya hotarvayaṃ deva haviṣā bhadraśoce🔽ā no devebhirupa devahūtimagne yāhi vaṣaṭkṛtiṃ juṣāṇaḥ
analyzed: vayam te agne samidhā vidhema vayam dāśema suṣṭutī yajatra  vayam ghṛtena adhvarasya hotar vayam deva haviṣā bhadra śoce  ā naḥ devebhiḥ upa deva hūtim agne yāhi vaṣaṭkṛtim juṣāṇaḥ
translated: We, O Agni, should serve you with fuel, we should serve you with good praises, O worshipper.🔽We, O priest of the sacrifice with ghee, we, O god with radiant flames, with oblation.🔽Come to us with the gods to the invocation of the gods, O Agni, delighting in the exclamation Vashat.

original: tubhyaṃ devāya dāśataḥ syāma yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: tubhyam devāya dāśataḥ syāma yūyam pāta
translated: We should be servants of yours, O god, to the god who is to be served. You all protect.

original: upasadyāya mīḷhuṣa āsye juhutā haviḥ
analyzed: upasadyāya mīḍhuṣe āsye juhuta haviḥ
translated: To the one to be approached, to the one who is to be served, put the oblation in his mouth,

original: yo no nediṣṭhamāpyam
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ nediṣṭham āpyam
translated: who is our nearest kinsman,🔽who is to be served by us.

original: yaḥ pañca carṣaṇīrabhi niṣasāda damedame
analyzed: yaḥ pañca carṣaṇīḥ abhi niṣasāda damedame
translated: He who has sat down in every house over the five peoples

original: kavirgṛhapatiryuvā
analyzed: kaviḥ gṛhapatiḥ yuvā
translated: The young householder, the sage

original: sa no vedo amātyamagnī rakṣatu viśvataḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ vedaḥ amātyam agniḥ rakṣatu viśvatas
translated: May that Agni, our kinsman, protect us on every side

original: utāsmān pātvaṃhasaḥ
analyzed: uta asmān pātu aṃhasaḥ
translated: And may he deliver us from woe

original: navaṃ nu stomamagnaye divaḥ śyenāya jījanam
analyzed: navam nu stomam agnaye divaḥ śyenāya jījanam
translated: I have produced a new hymn for Agni, for the falcon of the sky

original: vasvaḥ kuvid vanāti naḥ
analyzed: vasvaḥ kuvid vanāti naḥ
translated: Will he not bestow wealth on us?

original: spārhā yasya śriyo dṛśe rayirvīravato yathā🔽agre yajñasya śocataḥ
analyzed: spārhāḥ yasya śriyaḥ dṛśe rayiḥ vīravataḥ yathā  agre yajñasya śocataḥ
translated: Whose glorious riches are to be seen, like wealth to the hero,🔽At the head of the shining sacrifice

original: semāṃ vetu vaṣaṭkṛtimagnirjuṣata no giraḥ
analyzed: sā imām vetu vaṣaṭkṛtim agniḥ juṣata naḥ giraḥ
translated: May he accept this Vasat cry, may Agni enjoy our songs,

original: yajiṣṭho havyavāhanaḥ
analyzed: yajiṣṭhaḥ havyavāhanaḥ
translated: Best offerer, bearer of oblations

original: ni tvā nakṣya viśpate dyumantaṃ deva dhīmahi
analyzed: ni tvā nakṣya viśpate dyumantam deva dhīmahi
translated: We will honour thee, O lord of the people, the glorious god,

original: suvīramagna āhuta
analyzed: su vīram agne āhuta
translated: O Agni, invoked with good heroes

original: kṣapa usraśca dīdihi svagnayastvayā vayam
analyzed: kṣapaḥ usraḥ ca dīdihi su agnayaḥ tvayā vayam
translated: Shine upon us, O Agni, and upon our own people,

original: suvīrastvamasmayuḥ
analyzed: su vīraḥ tvam asmayuḥ
translated: Thou art the good hero, thou art ours

original: upa tvā sātaye naro viprāso yanti dhītibhiḥ
analyzed: upa tvā sātaye naraḥ viprāsaḥ yanti dhītibhiḥ
translated: Men come to thee for help, O Agni, the sages with their thoughts

original: upākṣarāsahasriṇī
analyzed: upa akṣarā sahasriṇī
translated: With a thousand songs of praise

original: agnī rakṣāṃsi sedhati śukraśociramartyaḥ
analyzed: agniḥ rakṣāṃsi sedhati śukra śociḥ amartyaḥ
translated: Agni drives away the Raksases, the pure-flaming immortal,

original: śuciḥ pāvaka īḍyaḥ
analyzed: śuciḥ pāvakaḥ īḍyaḥ
translated: The pure purifier, to be praised

original: sa no rādhāṃsyā bhareśānaḥ sahaso yaho
analyzed: sa naḥ rādhāṃsyā bhara īśānaḥ sahasaḥ yaho
translated: Bring us, O lord of wealth, O son of strength, O messenger,

original: bhagaśca dātuvāryam
analyzed: bhagaḥ ca dātu vāryam
translated: And may Bhaga grant us good gifts

original: tvamagne vīravad yaśo devaśca savitā bhagaḥ
analyzed: tvam agne vīravat yaśaḥ devaḥ ca savitā bhagaḥ
translated: Thou, O Agni, the glorious fame of heroes, and the god Savitar, and Bhaga,

original: ditiścadāti vāryam
analyzed: ditiḥ cadāti vāryam
translated: And Diti grant good gifts

original: agne rakṣā ṇo aṃhasaḥ prati ṣma deva rīṣataḥ
analyzed: agne rakṣa naḥ aṃhasaḥ prati sma deva rīṣataḥ
translated: O Agni, protect us from distress, from the Raksases, O god, from behind

original: tapiṣṭhairajaro daha
analyzed: tapiṣṭhaiḥ ajaraḥ daha
translated: With your most burning (rays), O undecaying one, burn (them).

original: adhā mahī na āyasyanādhṛṣṭo nṛpītaye
analyzed: adhā mahī naḥ āyasī anādhṛṣṭaḥ nṛ pītaye
translated: Now be great for our support, unassailable, for the drinking of the men,

original: pūrbhavā śatabhujiḥ
analyzed: pūrbhavā śata bhujiḥ
translated: Be full of food, with a hundred supplies.

original: tvaṃ naḥ pāhyaṃhaso doṣāvastaraghāyataḥ
analyzed: tvam naḥ pāhi aṃhasaḥ doṣā vastara ghāyataḥ
translated: Protect us, O Agni, from distress, from behind, from in front, O you who are to be invoked

original: divā naktamadābhya
analyzed: divā
translated: By day and night, O you who are to be invoked

original: enā vo agniṃ namasorjo napātamā huve
analyzed: enā vaḥ agnim namasā ūrjaḥ napātam ā huve
translated: To you I offer this Agni, the son of strength, with homage,

original: priyaṃ cetiṣṭhamaratiṃ svadhvaraṃ viśvasya dūtamamṛtam
analyzed: priyam cetiṣṭham aratim su adhvaram viśvasya dūtam amṛtam
translated: The most beloved messenger, the pure one, the immortal one of all,

original: sa yojate aruṣā viśvabhojasā sa dudravat svāhutaḥ
analyzed: sa yojate aruṣā viśva bhojasā sa dudravat su āhutaḥ
translated: He yokes the red (horses) who enjoy everything, he has rushed forth, well-sacrificed.

original: subrahmā yajñaḥ suśamī vasūnāṃ devaṃ rādho janānām
analyzed: su brahmā yajñaḥ suśamī vasūnām devam rādhaḥ janānām
translated: The sacrifice is well-worshipped, the best of the bestowers of goods, the god's gift to the people.

original: udasya śocirasthādājuhvānasya mīḷhuṣaḥ
analyzed: udasya śociḥ asthāt ājuhvānasya mīḷhuṣaḥ
translated: His bright flame has risen from the one who is invoked, the bountiful one.

original: ud dhūmāsoaruṣāso divispṛśaḥ samagnimindhate naraḥ🔽taṃ tvā dūtaṃ kṛṇmahe yaśastamaṃ devānā vītaye vaha
analyzed: ud dhūmāsaḥ aruṣāsaḥ divispṛśaḥ sam agnim indhate naraḥ  tam tvā dūtam kṛṇmahe yaśastamam devānā vītaye vaha
translated: The red-hued smokes that touch the sky, the men kindle Agni together.🔽We make you that messenger who is most famous, carry the gods to the feast.

original: viśvā sūno sahaso martabhojanā rāsva tad yat tvemahe
analyzed: viśvā sūno sahasaḥ marta bhojanā rāsva tat yat tvā īmahe
translated: O son of strength, bestow on us all the food of mortals, give us what we desire from you.

original: tvamagne gṛhapatistvaṃ hotā no adhvare
analyzed: tvam agne gṛhapatiḥ tvam hotā naḥ adhvare
translated: You, O Agni, are the lord of the house, you are our Hotar in the sacrifice,

original: tvaṃ potā viśvavāra pracetā yakṣi veṣi ca vāryam
analyzed: tvam potā viśva vāra pracetāḥ yakṣi veṣi ca vāryam
translated: You are the protector, O you who possess all goods, the wise one, worship, and find the sacrificial food.

original: kṛdhi ratnaṃ yajamānāya sukrato tvaṃ hi ratnadhā asi
analyzed: kṛdhi ratnam yajamānāya su krato tvam hi ratna dhāḥ asi
translated: Make a treasure for the sacrificer, O very wise one, for you are the bestower of treasure.

original: āna ṛte śiśīhi viśvam ṛtvijaṃ suśaṃso yaśca dakṣate
analyzed: ānaḥ ṛte śiśīhi viśvam ṛtvijam su śaṃsaḥ yaḥ ca dakṣate
translated: Sharpen by truth all the priests, O well-praised one, and he who is skilled.

original: tve agne svāhuta priyāsaḥ santu sūrayaḥ
analyzed: tve agne su āhuta priyāsaḥ santu sūrayaḥ
translated: O Agni, well-worshipped, may the princes be dear to you,

original: yantāro ye maghavāno janānāmūrvān dayanta gonām
analyzed: yantāraḥ ye maghavānaḥ janānām ūrvān dayanta gonām
translated: The leaders who are rich in people, the supporters of the cattle's pastures.

original: yeṣāmiḷā ghṛtahastā duroṇa ānapi prātā niṣīdati
analyzed: yeṣām iḍā ghṛta hastā duroṇe ān api prātā niṣīdati
translated: To whom the ladle with ghee in its hands sits down in the house, even before dawn.

original: tāṃstrāyasva sahasya druho nido yachā naḥ śarma dīrghaśrut🔽sa mandrayā ca jihvayā vahnirāsā viduṣṭaraḥ
analyzed: tān trāyasva sahasya druhaḥ nidaḥ yaccha naḥ śarma dīrgha śrut  sa mandrayā ca jihvayā vahni rāsā viduṣṭaraḥ
translated: Protect them, O conqueror, from the enemy's snares. Grant us protection, O thou of far-reaching fame.🔽He, Agni, is to be invoked with his pleasant tongue, most wise.

original: agne rayiṃ maghavadbhyo na ā vaha havyadātiṃ ca sūdaya
analyzed: agne rayim maghavadbhyaḥ naḥ ā vaha havya dātim ca sūdaya
translated: O Agni, bring wealth to the rich, and make ready the offerer of oblations.

original: ye rādhāṃsi dadatyaśvyā maghā kāmena śravaso mahaḥ
analyzed: ye rādhāṃsi dadati aśvyā maghā kāmena śravasaḥ mahaḥ
translated: Those who bestow gifts, rich in horses, through desire for great glory,

original: tānaṃhasaḥ pipṛhi partṛbhiṣ ṭvaṃ śataṃ pūrbhiryaviṣṭhya🔽devo vo draviṇodāḥ pūrṇāṃ vivaṣṭyāsicam🔽ud vā siñcadhvamupa vā pṛṇadhvamādid vo deva ohate
analyzed: tān aṃhasaḥ pipṛhi partṛbhiḥ tvam śatam pūrbhiḥ yaviṣṭhya  devaḥ vaḥ draviṇaḥ dāḥ pūrṇām vivaṣṭi āsicam  ud vā siñcadhvam upa vā pṛṇadhvam āt id vaḥ devaḥ ohate
translated: From those dangers protect them, O thou who art to be invoked, with thy hundred aids, O most youthful.🔽May the god who bestows wealth fill your vessel to the brim and let it flow.🔽Either pour it out or fill it up. The god has given you a portion.

original: taṃ hotāramadhvarasya pracetasaṃ vahniṃ devā akṛṇvata
analyzed: tam hotāram adhvarasya pracetasam vahnim devāḥ akṛṇvata
translated: The gods have made Agni, the priest of the sacrifice, the all-knowing, the bearer.

original: dadhāti ratnaṃ vidhate suvīryamagnirjanāya dāśuṣe
analyzed: dadhāti ratnam vidhate su vīryam agniḥ janāya dāśuṣe
translated: He bestows treasure with good heroism on the one who has arranged it, Agni, to the people who offer.

original: agne bhava suṣamidhā samiddha uta barhirurviyā vi stṛṇītām
analyzed: agne bhava suṣamidhā samiddhaḥ uta barhiḥ urviyā vi stṛṇītām
translated: O Agni, be kindled with good fuel, and let the sacred grass be spread out in abundance.

original: uta dvāra uśatīrvi śrayantāmuta devānuśata ā vaheha🔽agne vīhi haviṣā vakṣi devān svadhvarā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ
analyzed: uta dvāraḥ uśatīḥ vi śrayantām uta devān uśataḥ ā vaha iha  agne vīhi haviṣā vakṣi devān su adhvarā kṛṇuhi jātavedaḥ
translated: Let the doors that are eager be opened, and bring the gods who are eager.🔽O Agni, come and carry the oblations to the gods, O all-knower, make the offerings.

original: svadhvarā karati jātavedā yakṣad devānamṛtān piprayacca
analyzed: su adhvarā karati jātavedāḥ yakṣat devān amṛtān piprayat ca
translated: The all-knower makes the offerings, serve the immortal gods and satisfy them.

original: vaṃsva viśvā vāryāṇi pracetaḥ satyā bhavantvāśiṣo noadya
analyzed: vaṃsva viśvā vāryāṇi pracetaḥ satyāḥ bhavantu āśiṣaḥ naḥ adya
translated: Enjoy all the good things, O wise one, let our prayers be fulfilled today.

original: tvāmu te dadhire havyavāhaṃ devāso agna ūrja ā napātam
analyzed: tvām u te dadhire havyavāham devāsaḥ agne ūrjaḥ ā napātam
translated: You, O Agni, the gods have made the carrier of oblations, the son of strength.

original: te te devāya dāśataḥ syāma maho no ratnā vi dadha iyānaḥ
analyzed: te te devāya dāśataḥ syāma mahaḥ naḥ ratnā vi dadhe iyānaḥ
translated: May we be the servants of that god of yours, bestow on us great treasures, O bountiful one.

original: tve ha yat pitaraścin na indra viśvā vāmā jaritāro asanvan
analyzed: tve ha yat pitaraḥ cit naḥ indra viśvā vāmā jaritāraḥ asanvan
translated: In you, O Indra, even our fathers, the singers, have placed all their hopes.

original: tve gāvaḥ sudughāstve hyaśvāstvaṃ vasu devayatevaniṣṭhaḥ🔽rājeva hi janibhiḥ kṣeṣyevāva dyubhirabhi viduṣ kaviḥ san
analyzed: tve gāvaḥ su dughāḥ tve hi aśvāḥ tvam vasu devayatevaniṣṭhaḥ  rājā iva hi janibhiḥ kṣeṣyā iva ava dyubhiḥ abhi viduṣ kaviḥ san
translated: In you are the well-milking cows, in you are the horses, you are the best bestower of wealth on the worshipper.🔽Like a king among his people, like a sage with his thoughts, I will go forth with my hymns, O wise one.

original: piśā giro maghavan gobhiraśvaistvāyataḥ śiśīhirāye asmān
analyzed: piśa giraḥ maghavan gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ tvāyataḥ śiśīhiḥ āye asmān
translated: Sharpen our songs, O bountiful one, with cattle and horses, and with wealth, O active one.

original: imā u tvā paspṛdhānāso atra mandrā giro devayantīrupa sthuḥ
analyzed: imāḥ u tvā paspṛdhānāsaḥ atra mandrāḥ giraḥ devayantīḥ upa sthuḥ
translated: Here, O Indra, these gladdening songs, desirous of the gods, have come to thee, contending for thy favour

original: arvācī te pathyā rāya etu syāma te sumatāvindra śarman
analyzed: arvācī te pathyā rāyaḥ etu syāma te sumatau indra śarman
translated: May thy path to riches come hitherward: may we be in thy most gracious favour, O Indra, for protection

original: dhenuṃ na tvā sūyavase dudukṣannupa brahmāṇi sasṛje vasiṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: dhenum na tvā sūyavase dudukṣan upa brahmāṇi sasṛje vasiṣṭhaḥ
translated: As one milks a cow for sweet milk, so have they milked thee, O lord of the people, for the Brahmans, O Vasishtha

original: tvāmin me gopatiṃ viśva āhā na indraḥ sumatiṃ gantvacha
analyzed: tvāmid me gopatim viśve āha ā naḥ indraḥ sumatim gantu acha
translated: All these have called thee the lord of the people: may Indra come to us for gracious favour

original: arṇāṃsi cit paprathānā sudāsa indro gādhānyakṛṇot supārā
analyzed: arṇāṃsi cit paprathānā sudāse indraḥ gādhāni akṛṇot su pārā
translated: Even the spreading waters, O Sudâs, Indra hath made easy to pass and safe to ford

original: śardhantaṃ śimyumucathasya navyaḥ śāpaṃ sindhūnāmakṛṇodaśastīḥ
analyzed: śardhantam śimyum ucathasya navyaḥ śāpam sindhūnām akṛṇot aśastīḥ
translated: The new (king) hath made the exulting Simyu, the son of Ucathya, and the curse of the rivers, easy to be overcome

original: puroḷā it turvaśo yakṣurāsīd rāye matsyāso niśitā apīva
analyzed: puroḷās id turvaśaḥ yakṣuḥ āsīt rāye matsyāsaḥ niśitāḥ api iva
translated: Turvaga, the son of Purukvas, was the lord of the people: the Matsyas, the sharp-pointed ones, were his wealth

original: śruṣṭiṃ cakrurbhṛgavo druhyavaśca sakhā sakhāyamatarad viṣūcoḥ
analyzed: śruṣṭim cakruḥ bhṛgavaḥ druhyavaḥ ca sakhā sakhāyam atarat viṣūcoḥ
translated: The Bhrigus and the Druhyus have made him famous: the friend hath delivered his friend from the two-edged (sword)

original: ā pakthāso bhalānaso bhanantālināso viṣāṇinaḥ śivāsaḥ
analyzed: ā pakthāsaḥ bhalānasaḥ viṣāṇinaḥ śivāsaḥ
translated: The Pakthas, the Bhalanasas, the Alinasas, the Visânayas, the Sivâsas, have roared

original: ā yo 'nayat sadhamā āryasya gavyā tṛtsubhyo ajagan yudhā nṛn
analyzed: ā yaḥ nayat sadhamāḥ āryasya gavyā tṛtsubhyaḥ ajagan yudhā nṛn
translated: He who hath brought the good assembly of the Ârya, hath overcome the men of the Tritsus in battle for the sake of the kine

original: durādhyo aditiṃ srevayanto 'cetaso vi jagṛbhre paruṣṇīm
analyzed: durādhyaḥ aditim srevayantaḥ cetasaḥ vi jagṛbhre paruṣṇīm
translated: The Durâdhyas, the Adityas, the Srevayas, the Achetâs, have seized Parushni

original: mahnāvivyak pṛthivīṃ patyamānaḥ paśuṣ kaviraśayaccāyamānaḥ
analyzed: mahnā avivyak pṛthivīm patyamānaḥ paśuḥ kaviḥ aśayat cāyamānaḥ
translated: Spreading out the earth with his greatness, the animal, the wise one, lay down, shining.

original: īyurarthaṃ na nyarthaṃ paruṣṇīmāśuścanedabhipitvaṃ jagāma🔽sudāsa indraḥ sutukānamitrānarandhayan mānuṣe vadhrivācaḥ🔽īyurgāvo na yavasādagopā yathākṛtamabhi mitraṃ citāsaḥ🔽pṛśnigāvaḥ pṛśninipreṣitāsaḥ śruṣṭiṃ cakrurniyuto rantayaśca🔽ekaṃ ca yo viṃśatiṃ ca śravasyā vaikarṇayorjanān rājā nyastaḥ
analyzed: īyuḥ artham na nyartham paruṣṇīm āśuḥ cana id abhipitvam jagāma  sudāse indraḥ sutukān amitrān arandhayat mānuṣe vadhri vācaḥ  īyuḥ gāvaḥ na yavasāda gopāḥ yathākṛtam abhi mitram citāsaḥ  pṛśni gāvaḥ pṛśni nipreṣitāsaḥ śruṣṭim cakruḥ niyutaḥ rantayaḥ ca  ekam ca yaḥ viṃśatim ca śravasyāḥ vaikarṇayoḥ janān rājā nyastaḥ
translated: They went to their goal, not to a worthless one. Parushni, and Ashu, quickly, went to his drinking place.

original: dasmo na sadman ni śiśāti barhiḥ śūraḥ sargamakṛṇodindra eṣām🔽adha śrutaṃ kavaṣaṃ vṛddhamapsvanu druhyuṃ ni vṛṇag vajrabāhuḥ🔽vṛṇānā atra sakhyāya sakhyaṃ tvāyanto ye amadannanu tvā🔽vi sadyo viśvā dṛṃhitānyeṣāmindraḥ puraḥ sahasā sapta dardaḥ🔽vyānavasya tṛtsave gayaṃ bhāg jeṣma pūruṃ vidathe mṛdhravācam
analyzed: dasmaḥ na sadman ni śiśāti barhiḥ śūraḥ sargam akṛṇot indraḥ eṣām 🔽adha śrutam kavaṣam vṛddham apsu anu druhyum ni vṛṇak vajra bāhuḥ 🔽vṛṇānāḥ atra sakhyāya sakhyam tvāyantaḥ ye amadan anu tvā 🔽vi sadyas viśvā dṛṃhitāni eṣām indraḥ puraḥ sahasā sapta dardar 🔽vyānavasya tṛtsave gayam bhāk jeṣma pūrum vidathe mṛdhra vācam
