original: ni gavyavo 'navo druhyavaśca ṣaṣṭiḥ śatā suṣupuḥ ṣaṭ sahasrā
analyzed: ni gavyavaḥ navaḥ druhyavaḥ ca ṣaṣṭiḥ śatā suṣupuḥ ṣaḍ sahasrā
translated: The Gavayas, the Anavas, and the Druhyus, sixty hundred and six thousand have slept well.

original: ṣaṣṭirvīrāso adhi ṣaḍ duvoyu viśvedindrasya vīryā kṛtāni
analyzed: ṣaṣṭiḥ vīrāsaḥ adhi ṣaḍ duvoyu viśvā id indrasya vīryā kṛtāni
translated: Sixty heroes and six are ready for service: all these are the deeds of Indra's power.

original: indreṇaite tṛtsavo veviṣāṇā āpo na sṛṣṭā adhavanta nīcīḥ
analyzed: indreṇa ete tṛtsavaḥ veviṣāṇāḥ āpaḥ na sṛṣṭāḥ adhavanta nīcīḥ
translated: These Tṛtsus, urged on by Indra, have flowed like waters sent forth, low-lying.

original: durmitrāsaḥ prakalavin mimānā jahurviśvāni bhojanā sudāse
analyzed: durmitrāsaḥ prakala vid mimānāḥ jahuḥ viśvāni bhojanā sudāse
translated: The evil-minded, measuring with a reed, have abandoned all enjoyments for Sudās.

original: ardhaṃ vīrasya śṛtapāmanindraṃ parā śardhantaṃ nunude abhi kṣām
analyzed: ardham vīrasya śṛta pāman indram parā śardhantam nunude abhi kṣām
translated: Half of the hero's food, O Indra, he drove away, the daring one, to the earth.

original: indro manyuṃ manyumyo mimāya bheje patho vartanimpatyamānaḥ
analyzed: indraḥ manyum manyumyaḥ mimāya bheje pathaḥ vartanimpatyamānaḥ
translated: Indra, the angry one, having measured out anger, has taken possession of the path, the way.

original: ādhreṇa cit tad vekaṃ cakāra siṃhyaṃ cit petvenā jaghāna🔽ava sraktīrveśyāvṛścadindraḥ prāyachad viśvā bhojanā sudāse🔽śaśvanto hi śatravo rāradhuṣ ṭe bhedasya cicchardhato vinda randhim
analyzed: ādhreṇa cit tat vekam cakāra siṃhyam cit petvena ā jaghāna  ava sraktīḥ veśyā avṛścat indraḥ prāyacchat viśvā bhojanā sudāse  śaśvantaḥ hi śatravaḥ rāradhuḥ ṭe bhedasya cit śardhataḥ vinda randhim
translated: He has done that difficult deed, he has killed even the lion-like one with a mere blow.🔽Indra has cut off the bonds, he has given all enjoyments to Sudās.🔽For your enemies, O Indra, who are always eager to fight, find delight in the breaking up of their army.

original: martānena stuvato yaḥ kṛṇoti tigmaṃ tasmin ni jahi vajramindra🔽āvadindraṃ yamunā tṛtsavaśca prātra bhedaṃ sarvatātāmuṣāyat
analyzed: martā anena stuvataḥ yaḥ kṛṇoti tigmam tasmin ni jahi vajram indra 🔽āvat indram yamunā tṛtsavaḥ ca pra atra bhedam sarvatātāmuṣāyat
translated: O Indra, hurl your sharp thunderbolt at the mortal who does harm to the one who praises you.

original: ajāsaśca śigravo yakṣavaśca baliṃ śīrṣāṇi jabhruraśvyāni
analyzed: ajāsaḥ ca śigravaḥ yakṣavaḥ ca balim śīrṣāṇi jabhruḥ aśvyāni
translated: The Ajās, the Sigrus, the Yakṣus have brought tribute, heads of horses,

original: na ta indra sumatayo na rāyaḥ saṃcakṣe pūrvā uṣaso na nūtnāḥ
analyzed: na te indra sumatayaḥ na rāyaḥ saṃcakṣe pūrvāḥ uṣasaḥ na nūtnāḥ
translated: Your good-will, O Indra, and your riches, the former dawns and the new ones do not deceive.

original: devakaṃ cin mānyamānaṃ jaghanthāva tmanā bṛhataḥ śambaraṃ bhet
analyzed: devakam cit mānyamānam jaghanthāva tmanā bṛhataḥ śambaram bhet
translated: You have slain even the god-worshipping Mānyamāna, and with your own strength you have shattered the great Śambara.

original: pra ye gṛhādamamadustvāyā parāśaraḥ śatayāturvasiṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: pra ye parāśaraḥ śatayātuḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ
translated: Those who have rejoiced in your house, for your sake, Parāśara, Śatayātu, and Vasiṣṭha,

original: na te bhojasya sakhyaṃ mṛṣantādhā sūribhyaḥ sudinā vyuchān
analyzed: na te bhojasya sakhyam mṛṣanta adhā sūribhyaḥ su dinā vyuchān
translated: They will not deceive your friendship, O Bhoja, and will bring good days to the princes.

original: dve napturdevavataḥ śate gordvā rathā vadhūmantā sudāsaḥ
analyzed: dve naptuḥ devavataḥ śate goḥ dvā rathā vadhūmantā sudāsaḥ
translated: Two hundred cows of Devavata's grandson, two chariots with brides, O Sudāsa,

original: arhannagne paijavanasya dānaṃ hoteva sadma paryemi rebhan
analyzed: arhan agne paijavanasya dānam hotā iva sadma paryemi rebhan
translated: The gift of Paijavana is worthy, O Agni, I go around his house singing like a Hotri priest.

original: catvāro mā paijavanasya dānāḥ smaddiṣṭayaḥ kṛśanino nireke
analyzed: catvāraḥ mā paijavanasya dānāḥ smad diṣṭayaḥ kṛśaninaḥ nireke
translated: Four gifts of Paijavana, directed by me, with dark horses, in the forefront,

original: ṛjrāso mā pṛthiviṣṭhāḥ sudāsastokaṃ tokāya śravase vahanti
analyzed: ṛjrāsaḥ mā pṛthiviṣṭhāḥ sudāsaḥ tokam tokāya śravase vahanti
translated: The red ones, the most extensive, Sudāsa, carry offspring for offspring's sake.

original: yasya śravo rodasī antarurvī śīrṣṇeśīrṣṇe vibabhājā vibhaktā
analyzed: yasya śravaḥ rodasī antar urvī śīrṣṇe śīrṣṇe vibabhājā vibhaktā
translated: Whose fame is divided, divided between the two vast worlds, between the head and the head,

original: saptedindraṃ na sravato gṛṇanti ni yudhyāmadhimaśiśādabhīke
analyzed: sapta id indram na sravataḥ gṛṇanti ni yudhyām adhim aśiśāt abhīke
translated: They praise Indra, the seven, the flowing ones, in the battle, in the near one, in the distant one.

original: imaṃ naro marutaḥ saścatānu divodāsaṃ na pitaraṃ sudāsaḥ
analyzed: imam naraḥ marutaḥ saścata anu divodāsam na pitaram sudāsaḥ
translated: O men, O Maruts, follow this Sudâs, as he follows his father Divodâsa.

original: aviṣṭanā paijavanasya ketaṃ dūṇāśaṃ kṣatramajaraṃ duvoyu
analyzed: aviṣṭanā paijavanasya ketam dūṇāśam kṣatram ajaram duvoyu
translated: He has obtained the banner of Paijavana, the hope of victory, the imperishable lordship, which is to be gained by devotion.

original: yastigmaśṛṅgo vṛṣabho na bhīma ekaḥ kṛṣṭīścyāvayati pra viśvāḥ
analyzed: yaḥ tigma śṛṅgaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ na bhīmaḥ ekaḥ kṛṣṭīḥ cyāvayati pra viśvāḥ
translated: He who is terrible as a bull with sharp horns, alone stirs up all the people.

original: yaḥ śaśvato adāśuṣo gayasya prayantāsisuṣvitarāya vedaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ śaśvataḥ a dāśuṣaḥ gayasya prayantā asi suṣvitarāya vedaḥ
translated: He who is the leader of the ever-unbelieving and niggardly Gayu, is to be known by the more faithful.

original: tvaṃ ha tyadindra kutsamāvaḥ śuśrūṣamāṇastanvā samarye
analyzed: tvam ha tyad indra kutsamāvaḥ śuśrūṣamāṇaḥ tanvā samarye
translated: You, O Indra, helped Kutsa, O you who are to be served, with your body in the battle,

original: dāsaṃ yacchuṣṇaṃ kuyavaṃ nyasmā arandhaya ārjuneyāya śikṣan
analyzed: dāsam yat śuṣṇam kuyavam ni asmai arandhayaḥ ārjuneyāya śikṣan
translated: You who led the Dâsa, the evil-living Kuya, to him who was to be led, to Ârjuneya, to instruct him.

original: tvaṃ dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā vītahavyaṃ prāvo viśvābhirūtibhiḥ sudāsam
analyzed: tvam dhṛṣṇo dhṛṣatā vītahavyam prāvaḥ viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ sudāsam
translated: You, O bold one, with your boldness, helped Vîtahavya, Sudâs, with all your aids.

original: pra paurukutsiṃ trasadasyumāvaḥ kṣetrasātā vṛtrahatyeṣu pūrum
analyzed: pra paurukutsim trasadasyum āvaḥ kṣetra sātā vṛtra hatyeṣu pūrum
translated: You helped Purukutsa, Trasadasyu, Pûru in the contests for land, in the slaying of Vr̥itra.

original: tvaṃ nṛbhirnṛmaṇo devavītau bhūrīṇi vṛtrā haryaśva haṃsi
analyzed: tvam nṛbhiḥ nṛmaṇaḥ deva vītau bhūrīṇi vṛtrā haryaśva haṃsi
translated: You, O man-desiring one, with men in the feast of the gods, O you with the bay steeds, slayest many Vr̥itras.

original: tvaṃ ni dasyuṃ cumuriṃ dhuniṃ cāsvāpayo dabhītaye suhantu
analyzed: tvam ni dasyum cumurim dhunim ca asvāpayaḥ dabhītaye su hantu
translated: You caused the Dasyu, Çumuri, and Dhuni to sleep, to be slain, for the sake of Dabhîti.

original: tava cyautnāni vajrahasta tāni nava yat puro navatiṃ ca sadyaḥ
analyzed: tava cyautnāni vajrahasta tāni nava yat puras navatim ca sadyas
translated: Yours are those mighty powers, O you with the thunderbolt in your hand, when you suddenly destroyed nine-and-ninety forts.

original: niveśane śatatamāviveṣīrahañca vṛtraṃ namucimutāhan
analyzed: niveśane śatatamā aviveṣīḥ aham ca vṛtram namucim uta ahan
translated: I entered the house of Satatamā, and I slew Vṛtra and Namuci.

original: sanā tā ta indra bhojanāni rātahavyāya dāśuṣe sudāse
analyzed: sanā tā te indra bhojanāni rāta havyāya dāśuṣe sudāse
translated: These are your ancient gifts, O Indra, to the worshipper who offers, to Sudās.

original: vṛṣṇe te harī vṛṣaṇā yunajmi vyantu brahmāṇi puruśāka vājam
analyzed: vṛṣṇe te harī vṛṣaṇā yunajmi vyantu brahmāṇi puruśāka vājam
translated: I yoke for you, O mighty one, your two mighty bay horses. Let the prayers go forth, O you of much strength, for booty.

original: mā te asyāṃ sahasāvan pariṣṭāvaghāya bhūma harivaḥ parādai
analyzed: mā te asyām sahasāvan bhūma harivas parādai
translated: Do not pass by this place, O victor, O you who delight in the ruddy one, come hither.

original: trāyasva no 'vṛkebhirvarūthaistava priyāsaḥ sūriṣu syāma
analyzed: trāyasva naḥ vṛkebhiḥ varūthaiḥ tava priyāsaḥ sūriṣu syāma
translated: Protect us with your safe protections. May we be dear to you, O lord, among the princes.

original: priyāsa it te maghavannabhiṣṭau naro madema śaraṇe sakhāyaḥ
analyzed: priyāsaḥ id te maghavan abhiṣṭau naraḥ madema śaraṇe sakhāyaḥ
translated: May we, O Maghavan, be dear to you in battle, O friend, may we men rejoice in your protection.

original: ni turvaśaṃ ni yādvaṃ śiśīhyatithigvāya śaṃsyaṃ kariṣyan
analyzed: ni turvaśam ni yādvam śiśīhi atithigvāya śaṃsyam kariṣyan
translated: Do thou, O Indra, crush Turvaṣa and Yadu, doing what is to be praised for Atithigva.

original: sadyaścin nu te maghavannabhiṣṭau naraḥ śaṃsantyukthaśāsa ukthā
analyzed: sadyaścit nu te maghavan abhiṣṭau naraḥ śaṃsanti uktha śāsaḥ ukthā
translated: Even now, O Maghavan, in thy praise, men who direct the hymns sing forth their hymns to thee.

original: ye te havebhirvi paṇīnradāśannasmān vṛṇīṣva yujyāya tasmai
analyzed: ye te havebhiḥ vi paṇīn radāśan asmān vṛṇīṣva yujyāya tasmai
translated: They who with their calls have given away the Paṇis, choose us for that union with thee.

original: ete stomā narāṃ nṛtama tubhyamasmadryañco dadato maghāni🔽teṣāmindra vṛtrahatye śivo bhūḥ sakhā ca śūro 'vitāca nṛṇām
analyzed: ete stomāḥ narām nṛtama tubhyam asmadryañcaḥ dadataḥ maghāni  teṣām indra vṛtra hatye śivaḥ bhūḥ sakhā ca śūraḥ vitāca nṛṇām
translated: These praises, O best of men, are for thee, O man, bestowing boons, granting riches.🔽Be gracious, O Indra, in the slaying of Vrtra, be a friend and a hero, a protector of men.

original: nū indra śūra stavamāna ūtī brahmajūtastanvā vāvṛdhasva
analyzed: nu indra śūra stavamānaḥ ūtī brahma jūtaḥ tanvā vāvṛdhasva
translated: Now, O Indra, the strong one, be thou exalted in strength by praise, urged on by prayer.

original: upa no vājān mimīhyupa stīn yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: upa naḥ vājān mimīhi upa stīn yūyam pāta
translated: Measure out for us the powers, measure out the strength; you, O Indra, protect us.

original: ugro jajñe vīryāya svadhāvāñcakrirapo naryo yat kariṣyan
analyzed: ugraḥ jajñe vīryāya svadhāvān cakriḥ apaḥ naryaḥ yat kariṣyan
translated: The fierce one is born for strength, the self-ruler, the hero, when he is about to do what he will do,

original: jagmiryuvā nṛṣadanamavobhistrātā na indra enaso mahaścit
analyzed: jagmiḥ yuvā nṛṣadanam avobhiḥ trātā naḥ indraḥ enasaḥ mahaḥ cit
translated: The young one who goes to the assembly of men, the protector, O Indra, from even a great sin.

original: hanta vṛtramindraḥ śūśuvānaḥ prāvīn nu vīro jaritāramūtī
analyzed: hanta vṛtram indraḥ śūśuvānaḥ prāvīt nu vīraḥ jaritāram ūtī
translated: Let Indra, the powerful one, slay Vṛtra; he has brought forth the hero, the supporter of the singer.

original: kartā sudāse aha vā u lokaṃ dātā vasu muhurā dāśuṣe bhūt
analyzed: kartā sudāse aha vai u lokam dātā vasu muhurā dāśuṣe bhūt
translated: He has made the world for Sudās, the giver of wealth, he has become the giver to the worshipper again and again.

original: yudhmo anarvā khajakṛt samadvā śūraḥ satrāṣāḍ januṣemaṣāḷhaḥ
analyzed: yudhmaḥ anarvā khaja kṛt samadvā śūraḥ satrāṣāh januṣemaṣāḷhaḥ
translated: The warrior who does not turn back, the destroyer of forts, the hero who is ready for battle, the impetuous one,

original: vyāsa indraḥ pṛtanāḥ svojā adhā viśvaṃśatrūyantaṃ jaghāna
analyzed: vyāsaḥ indraḥ pṛtanāḥ sva ojāḥ adhā viśvam śatrūyantam jaghāna
translated: Indra, the conqueror, has extended the battles, his own, and has slain all the enemies who have risen up.

original: ubhe cidindra rodasī mahitvā paprātha taviṣībhistuviṣmaḥ
analyzed: ubhe cit indra rodasī mahitvā paprātha taviṣībhiḥ tuviṣmas
translated: O Indra, with your greatness you have filled both the worlds, O mighty one, with your powers.

original: ni vajramindro harivān mimikṣan samandhasā madeṣu vāuvoca
analyzed: ni vajram indraḥ harivān mimikṣan sam andhasā madeṣu vā auvoca
translated: Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the tawny one, has mixed the juices, has spoken in the feasts.

original: vṛṣā jajāna vṛṣaṇaṃ raṇāya tamu cin nārī naryaṃ sasūva
analyzed: vṛṣā jajāna vṛṣaṇam raṇāya tamu cit nārī naryam sasūva
translated: The bull has generated the bull for battle; he has indeed been born by the woman, the hero, for the hero.

original: pra yaḥ senānīradha nṛbhyo astīnaḥ satvā gaveṣaṇaḥ sa dhṛṣṇuḥ
analyzed: pra yaḥ senā nīḥ adha nṛbhyaḥ astīnaḥ satvā gaveṣaṇaḥ sa dhṛṣṇuḥ
translated: He who is the general of the people, the leader, the brave one, the seeker of cattle, he is the bold one.

original: nū cit sa bhreṣate jano na reṣan mano yo asya ghoramāvivāsāt
analyzed: nu cit sa bhreṣate janaḥ na reṣat manaḥ yaḥ asya ghoram āvivāsāt
translated: Never is that people destroyed, never is it afflicted, whose mind has entered into his terrible (spirit).

original: yajñairya indre dadhate duvāṃsi kṣayat sa rāya ṛtapā ṛtejāḥ
analyzed: yajñaiḥ yaḥ indre dadhate duvāṃsi kṣayat sa rāyaḥ ṛta pāḥ ṛtejāḥ
translated: He who with sacrifices offers gifts to Indra, he, the wise, the powerful, shall increase in wealth.

original: yadindra pūrvo aparāya śikṣannayajjyāyān kanīyaso deṣṇam
analyzed: yat indra pūrvaḥ aparāya śikṣan ayat jyāyān kanīyasaḥ deṣṇam
translated: If, O Indra, the elder one instructs the younger, the greater one gives to the lesser one a gift.

original: amṛta it paryāsīta dūramā citra citryaṃ bharā rayiṃ naḥ
analyzed: amṛte id paryāsīta dūram ā citra citryam bhara rayim naḥ
translated: The immortal one should go far away, O wondrous one, bring us the wondrous wealth.

original: yasta indra priyo jano dadāśadasan nireke adrivaḥ sakhā te
analyzed: yaḥ te indra priyaḥ janaḥ dadāśat asat nireke adrivas sakhā te
translated: O Indra, the people who love you and give to you, O wielder of the thunderbolt, are your friends in the forefront.

original: vayaṃ te asyāṃ sumatau caniṣṭhāḥ syāma varūthe aghnato nṛpītau
analyzed: vayam te asyām sumatau caniṣṭhāḥ syāma varūthe a ghnataḥ nṛ pītau
translated: May we be the most devoted to this good will of yours, in the protection of the one who slays the foe.

original: eṣa stomo acikradad vṛṣā ta uta stāmurmaghavannakrapiṣṭa
analyzed: eṣa stomaḥ acikradat vṛṣā te uta stāmuḥ maghavan akrapiṣṭa
translated: This praise has resounded, O bull, and has been accepted, O magnanimous one.

original: rāyas kāmo jaritāraṃ ta āgan tvamaṅga śakra vasva āśako naḥ
analyzed: rāyaḥ kāmaḥ jaritāram te āgan tvam aṅga śakra vasvaḥ āśakaḥ naḥ
translated: The desire for wealth has come to the singer. You, O Shakra, are the bestower of wealth to us.

original: sa na indra tvayatāyā iṣe dhāstmanā ca ye maghavāno junanti
analyzed: sa naḥ indra tvayatāyai iṣe dhāḥ tmanā ca ye maghavānaḥ junanti
translated: O Indra, grant us food that is to be enjoyed by you and by those who are generous and who are inspired by you.

original: vasvī ṣu te jaritre astu śaktiryūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: vasvī su te jaritre astu śaktiḥ yūyam pāta
translated: May your power be beneficial to the singer. You, do protect us.

original: asāvi devaṃ goṛjīkamandho nyasminnindro januṣemuvoca🔽bodhāmasi tvā haryaśva yajñairbodhā na stomamandhaso madeṣu
analyzed: asāvi devam goṛjīkam andhaḥ ni asmin indraḥ januṣā īm uvoca  bodhāmasi tvā hari aśva yajñaiḥ bodha naḥ stomam andhasaḥ madeṣu
translated: The brown one has pressed the god who is rich in cattle. In him, Indra, he has spoken at birth.🔽We are awakening you, O you with bay horses, with sacrifices. Be awakened at the pressing of the soma juice and at the delights.

original: pra yanti yajñaṃ vipayanti barhiḥ somamādo vidathe dudhravācaḥ
analyzed: pra yanti yajñam vipayanti barhiḥ somamādaḥ vidathe dudhra vācaḥ
translated: They proceed to the sacrifice, they spread out the sacred grass. In the assembly, with their loud voices, they milk the soma juice.

original: nyu bhriyante yaśaso gṛbhādā dūra upabdo vṛṣaṇonṛṣācaḥ🔽tvamindra sravitavā apas kaḥ pariṣṭhitā ahinā śūra pūrvīḥ
analyzed: niḥ bhriyante yaśasaḥ gṛbhādāḥ dūre upabdaḥ vṛṣaṇā unṛṣācaḥ  tvam indra sravitavai apaḥ kaḥ pariṣṭhitāḥ ahinā śūra pūrvīḥ
translated: The greedy graspers of fame are driven away, the strong man's far-reaching voice is heard among men🔽You, O Indra, have released the waters that were held back by the dragon, O hero, the many

original: tvad vāvakre rathyo na dhenā rejante viśvā kṛtrimāṇi bhīṣā
analyzed: tvat vāvakre rathyaḥ na dhenāḥ rejante viśvā kṛtrimāṇi bhīṣā
translated: Even in your mouth, O Indra, the swift ones, like chariots, tremble, all the created things through fear

original: bhīmo viveṣāyudhebhireṣāmapāṃsi viśvā naryāṇi vidvān🔽indraḥ puro jarhṛṣāṇo vi dūdhod vi vajrahasto mahinājaghāna🔽na yātava indra jūjuvurno na vandanā śaviṣṭha vedyābhiḥ
analyzed: bhīmaḥ viveṣa āyudhebhiḥ eṣām apāṃsi viśvā naryāṇi vidvān  indraḥ puraḥ jarhṛṣāṇaḥ vi dūdhot vi vajra hastaḥ mahinā ājaghāna  na yātavaḥ indra jūjuvuḥ naḥ na vandanāḥ śaviṣṭha vedyābhiḥ
translated: The terrible one has entered with their weapons, knowing all manly deeds and all that is to be done🔽Indra, rejoicing, has split the forts asunder, the wielder of the thunderbolt has struck down with his might🔽Neither your enemies, O Indra, nor our praises, O most powerful one, have moved you by our offerings

original: sa śardhadaryo viṣuṇasya jantormā śiśnadevā api gurṛtaṃ naḥ🔽abhi kratvendra bhūradha jman na te vivyaṃ mahimānaṃ rajāṃsi
analyzed: sa śardha daryaḥ viṣuṇasya jantoḥ mā śiśna devāḥ api gurṛtam naḥ  abhi kratvā indra bhūradha jman na te vivyam mahimānam rajāṃsi
translated: You, O Indra, the destroyer of the strong one, the oppressor, do not accept our oblations, O godless one🔽In your own power, O Indra, you have filled the earth, your greatness, O Indra, the realms do not comprehend

original: svenā hi vṛtraṃ śavasā jaghantha na śatrurantaṃvividad yudhā te
analyzed: svena hi vṛtram śavasā jaghantha na śatruḥ antaṃvividat yudhā te
translated: For with your own power you have slain Vṛtra, your enemy has not found an end to you in battle

original: devāścit te asuryāya pūrve 'nu kṣatrāya mamire sahāṃsi
analyzed: devāḥ cit te asuryāya pūrve nu kṣatrāya mamire sahāṃsi
translated: Even the ancient gods have measured out great powers for your lordship, for your godhead

original: indro maghāni dayate viṣahyendraṃ vājasya johuvanta sātau
analyzed: indraḥ maghāni dayate viṣahya indram vājasya johuvanta sātau
translated: Indra bestows riches that are to be desired, in the battle for strength they call upon Indra

original: kīriścid dhi tvāmavase juhāveśānamindra saubhagasya bhūreḥ
analyzed: kīriḥ cit hi tvām avase juhāva īśānam indra saubhagasya bhūreḥ
translated: Even the Kīra has invoked you, O Indra, for help, for the abundant wealth of happiness

original: avo babhūtha śatamūte asme abhikṣattustvāvato varūtā
analyzed: avas babhūtha śatamūte asme abhikṣattuḥ tvāvataḥ varūtā
translated: Thou hast become our own, O thou of a hundred powers, for the protection of him who seeks thy favour

original: sakhāyasta indra viśvaha syāma namovṛdhāso mahinā tarutra
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ te indra viśvaha syāma namaḥ vṛdhāsaḥ mahinā tarutra
translated: May we all be thy friends, O Indra, who increase our homage, O thou who art mighty to save

original: vanvantu smā te 'vasā samīke 'bhītimaryo vanuṣāṃ śavāṃsi
analyzed: vanvantu smā te vasā samīke bhītimaryaḥ vanuṣām śavāṃsi
translated: Let them rejoice in thy help in the conflict, let the men who delight in thee rejoice in their strength

original: sa na indra tvayatāyā / / /
analyzed: sa naḥ indra tvayatāya
translated: Do thou, O Indra, with that (help) which is most near to us

original: pibā somamindra mandatu tvā yaṃ te suṣāva haryaśvādriḥ
analyzed: pibā somam indra mandatu tvā yam te suṣāva haryaśva adriḥ
translated: Drink the Soma, O Indra, let it delight thee, which the stone, O thou with bay steeds, hath pressed for thee

original: soturbāhubhyāṃ suyato nārvā
analyzed: sotuḥ bāhubhyām su yataḥ na arvā
translated: Well guided by the arms of the presser, as by reins

original: yaste mado yujyaścārurasti yena vṛtrāṇi haryaśva haṃsi
analyzed: yaḥ te madaḥ yujyaḥ cāruḥ asti yena vṛtrāṇi haryaśva haṃsi
translated: That gladdening juice of thine which is meet for the yoke, with which, O thou with bay steeds, thou smitest down the Vr̥itras

original: sa tvāmindra prabhūvaso mamattu
analyzed: sa tvām indra prabhūvaso mamattu
translated: Let that, O Indra, gladden thee, O Lord of ample wealth

original: bodhā su me maghavan vācamemāṃ yāṃ te vasiṣṭho arcatipraśastim
analyzed: bodha su me maghavan vācam ā imām yām te vasiṣṭhaḥ arcati praśastim
translated: Mark thou my words well, O bountiful one, this hymn which Vasistha sings to thee in praise

original: imā brahma sadhamāde juṣasva
analyzed: imā brahma sadhamāde juṣasva
translated: Accept these prayers in the assembly of the pious

original: śrudhī havaṃ vipipānasyādrerbodhā viprasyārcato manīṣām
analyzed: śrudhi havam vipipānasya adreḥ bodha viprasya arcataḥ manīṣām
translated: Hear the call of the thirsty Adrer, mark thou the thought of the singer who extols thee with his hymn

original: kṛṣvā duvāṃsyantamā sacemā
analyzed: kṛṣva duvāṃsi antamā sacā imā
translated: Make thou the songs of praise come nigh to thee

original: na te giro api mṛṣye turasya na suṣṭutimasuryasya vidvān🔽sadā te nāma svayaśo vivakmi
analyzed: na te giraḥ api mṛṣye turasya na suṣṭutim asuryasya vidvān  sadā te nāma sva yaśaḥ vivakmi
translated: I will not endure thy proud words, O thou who art rich in treasures, nor thy eulogy, O thou who art rich in treasures, knowing as I am

original: bhūri hi te savanā mānuṣeṣu bhūri manīṣī havate tvāmit
analyzed: bhūri hi te savanā mānuṣeṣu bhūri manīṣī havate tvām id
translated: I will proclaim thy name, O thou of fair glory, for many are the libations offered to thee among men, and many a time the thoughtful one invokes thee

original: māre asman maghavañ jyok kaḥ
analyzed: mā āre asmat maghavan jyok kaḥ
translated: O Maghavan, be thou our friend for a long time,

original: tubhyedimā savanā śūra viśvā tubhyaṃ brahmāṇi vardhanā kṛṇomi
analyzed: tubhya id imā savanā śūra viśvā tubhyam brahmāṇi vardhanā kṛṇomi
translated: To thee, O hero, are these libations, to thee all prayers I make for prosperity.

original: tvaṃ nṛbhirhavyo viśvadhāsi
analyzed: tvam nṛbhiḥ havyaḥ viśvadha asi
translated: On every side thou art to be invoked by men.

original: nū cin nu te manyamānasya dasmodaśnuvanti mahimānamugra
analyzed: nu cit nu te manyamānasya dasma udaśnuvanti mahimānam ugra
translated: Not even the swift one attains to thy greatness, O thou of wondrous power, O mighty one,

original: na vīryamindra te na rādhaḥ🔽ye ca pūrva ṛṣayo ye ca nūtnā indra brahmāṇi janayanta viprāḥ
analyzed: na vīryam indra te na rādhaḥ  ye ca pūrve ṛṣayaḥ ye ca nūtnāḥ indra brahmāṇi janayanta viprāḥ
translated: Nor thy strength, O Indra, nor thy bounty.🔽The ancient Rishis and the new, O Indra, the sages who have produced prayers for thee,

original: asme te santu sakhyā śivāni yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: asme te santu sakhyā śivāni yūyam pāta
translated: Let these be friendly to us, O Indra. Do thou, O Indra, be our nearest friend.🔽Do thou, O Indra, be our nearest friend.

original: udu brahmāṇyairata śravasyendraṃ samarye mahayā vasiṣṭha
analyzed: udu brahmāṇi airata śravasyā indram samarye mahaya vasiṣṭha
translated: Lift up your prayers, O Vasishṭha, to Indra, the glorious, to be magnified in the battle,

original: ā yo viśvāni śavasā tatānopaśrotā ma īvato vacāṃsi
analyzed: ā yaḥ viśvāni śavasā tatāna upaśrotā me īvataḥ vacāṃsi
translated: Who hath spread out all things by his might. May he listen to my words, the bountiful one.

original: ayāmi ghoṣa indra devajāmirirajyanta yacchurudho vivāci
analyzed: ayāmi ghoṣaḥ indra deva jāmiḥ irajyanta yat śurudhaḥ vivāci
translated: The cry of the people hath come to thee, O Indra, the son of the gods. Let thy two bay steeds be harnessed, that they may move in different directions.

original: nahi svamāyuścikite janeṣu tānīdaṃhāṃsyati parṣyasmān🔽yuje rathaṃ gaveṣaṇaṃ haribhyāmupa brahmāṇi jujuṣāṇamasthuḥ
analyzed: nahi svam āyuḥ cikite janeṣu tāni id aṃhāṃsi ati parṣi asmān  yuje ratham gaveṣaṇam haribhyām upa brahmāṇi jujuṣāṇam asthuḥ
translated: For men do not reckon their own life. Do thou carry us beyond these troubles.🔽Yoke the chariot which seeks the cow, the two bay steeds. They have come to the prayers, accepting them.

original: vi bādhiṣṭa sya rodasī mahitvendro vṛtrāṇyapratī jaghanvān
analyzed: vi bādhiṣṭa sya rodasī mahitvā indraḥ vṛtrāṇi apratī jaghanvān
translated: He hath filled the two worlds with his greatness. Indra hath laid low the Vr̥itras, unconquered.

original: āpaścit pipyu staryo na gāvo nakṣannṛtaṃ jaritārasta indra
analyzed: āpaḥ cit pipyuḥ staryaḥ na gāvaḥ nakṣan ṛtam jaritāraḥ te indra
translated: The waters have swollen like young cows, the oblations will fill the hymn, O Indra, for the praisers

original: yāhi vāyurna niyuto na achā tvaṃ hi dhībhirdayase vi vājān
analyzed: yāhi vāyuḥ na niyutaḥ na achā tvam hi dhībhiḥ dayase vi vājān
translated: Come, like Vayu with your teams, for you give out strength with your thoughts

original: te tvā madā indra mādayantu śuṣmiṇaṃ tuvirādhasaṃ jaritre
analyzed: te tvā madāḥ indra mādayantu śuṣmiṇam tuvi rādhasam jaritre
translated: Let these gladdening draughts, O Indra, gladden you, the mighty, the subduer of foes, for the praiser

original: eko devatrā dayase hi martānasmiñchūra savane mādayasva
analyzed: ekaḥ devatrā dayase hi martān asmin śūra savane mādayasva
translated: For you alone, O god, show favour to mortals. Delight yourself, O hero, at this libation

original: evedindraṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ vajrabāhuṃ vasiṣṭhāso abhyarcantyarkaiḥ🔽sa na stuto vīravat pātu gomad yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: eva id indram vṛṣaṇam vajra bāhum vasiṣṭhāsaḥ abhyarcanti arkaiḥ  sa naḥ stutaḥ vīravat pātu gomat yūyam pāta
translated: Thus the Vasishthas glorify Indra, the mighty one, with arms like thunderbolts, with hymns🔽May he, when praised, protect us with heroes and with cattle. You, O Indra, protect us with all kinds of protection.

original: yoniṣ ṭa indra sadane akāri tamā nṛbhiḥ puruhūta pra yāhi
analyzed: yoniḥ te indra sadane akāri tamā nṛbhiḥ puruhūta pra yāhi
translated: The birthplace has been made for you, O Indra, in the abode. Come, O much-invoked one, with men

original: aso yathā no 'vitā vṛdhe ca dado vasūni mamadaśca somaiḥ
analyzed: asaḥ yathā naḥ vitā vṛdhe ca dadaḥ vasūni mamadaḥ ca somaiḥ
translated: Be as our protector and promoter, and grant us treasures, and rejoice with the Soma libations

original: gṛbhītaṃ te mana indra dvibarhāḥ sutaḥ somaḥ pariṣiktā madhūni
analyzed: gṛbhītam te manaḥ indra dvibarhāḥ sutaḥ somaḥ pariṣiktā madhūni
translated: Your mind, O Indra, is grasped by the two-fold (people). The Soma is pressed. The sweet juices are sprinkled

original: visṛṣṭadhenā bharate suvṛktiriyamindraṃ johuvatī manīṣā
analyzed: visṛṣṭa dhenāḥ bharate suvṛktiḥ iyam indram johuvatī manīṣā
translated: The well-praised one, with his course released, brings (you). This thought of mine calls upon Indra

original: ā no diva ā pṛthivyā ṛjīṣinnidaṃ barhiḥ somapeyāya yāhi
analyzed: ā naḥ divaḥ ā pṛthivyāḥ ṛjīṣin idam barhiḥ soma peyāya yāhi
translated: From heaven and earth, O active one, come to this strew to drink the Soma

original: vahantu tvā harayo madryañcamāṅgūṣamachā tavasaṃ madāya
analyzed: vahantu tvā harayaḥ madryañcam āṅgūṣam achā tavasam madāya
translated: Let your bay steeds bring you hitherward, O rich one. I have sung praises to you for your delight

original: ā no viśvābhirūtibhiḥ sajoṣā brahma juṣāṇo haryaśvayāhi
analyzed: ā naḥ viśvābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ sajoṣāḥ brahma juṣāṇaḥ haryaśva yāhi
translated: Come to us, in accord with all your aids, delighting in prayer, O you whose horses are tawny, come

original: varīvṛjat sthavirebhiḥ suśiprāsme dadhad vṛṣaṇaṃ śuṣmamindra
analyzed: varīvṛjat sthavirebhiḥ su śiprā asme dadhat vṛṣaṇam śuṣmam indra
translated: With your most ancient and most wondrous powers, O Indra, bestowing upon us heroic strength

original: eṣa stomo maha ugrāya vāhe dhurīvātyo na vājayannadhāyi
analyzed: eṣa stomaḥ mahe ugrāya vāhe dhuri iva atyaḥ na vājayan adhāyi
translated: This praise is set up for the great and mighty draught, like a yoke-fellow, urging on to gain the prize

original: indra tvāyamarka īṭṭe vasūnāṃ divīva dyāmadhi naḥ śromataṃ dhāḥ
analyzed: indra tvā ayam arkaḥ īṭṭe vasūnām divi iva dyām adhi naḥ śromatam dhāḥ
translated: O Indra, this hymn is offered for the sake of wealth. Place in us, as in the sky, your glory and prosperity

original: evā na indra vāryasya pūrdhi pra te mahīṃ sumatiṃ vevidāma🔽iṣaṃ pinva maghavadbhyaḥ suvīrāṃ yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: eva naḥ indra vāryasya pūrdhi pra te mahīm sumatim vevidāma  iṣam pinva maghavadbhyaḥ su vīrām yūyam pāta
translated: Thus, O Indra, grant us choice boons. We will find your great favor🔽Increase food for the wealthy ones, with good heroes. Do you protect us...

original: ā te maha indro /
analyzed: ā te mahaḥ indraḥ
translated: Come to us, O Indra, with the most powerful

original: tyugra samanyavo yat samaranta senāḥ🔽patāti didyun naryasya bāhvormā te mano viṣvadryag vi cārīt
analyzed: ti ugra samanyavaḥ yat samaranta senāḥ  patāti didyut naryasya bāhvoḥ mā te manaḥ viṣvadryak vi cārīt
translated: When your armies clash, O fierce one, with equal rage🔽Let the thunderbolt fly from the arms of the hero. Let not your mind wander everywhere

original: ni durga indra śnathihyamitrānabhi ye no martāso amanti
analyzed: ni durge indra śnathihi amitrān abhi ye naḥ martāsaḥ amanti
translated: Destroy the forts, O Indra, and crush the enemies, those who among mortals hate us

original: āre taṃ śaṃsaṃ kṛṇuhi ninitsorā no bhara sambharaṇaṃ vasūnām
analyzed: āre tam śaṃsam kṛṇuhi ninitsoḥ ā naḥ bhara sambharaṇam vasūnām
translated: Turn away that reviler. Bring us the gathering of treasures

original: śataṃ te śiprinnūtayaḥ sudāse sahasraṃ śaṃsā uta rātirastu
analyzed: śatam te śiprin ūtayaḥ sudāse sahasram śaṃsāḥ uta rātiḥ astu
translated: A hundred, O you with the beautiful lips, are your aids for Sudās, a thousand your praises. Let your bounty be with us

original: jahi vadharvanuṣo martyasyāsme dyumnamadhi ratnaṃ ca dhehi
analyzed: jahi vadharvanuṣaḥ martyasya asme dyumnam adhi ratnam ca dhehi
translated: Slay the wicked man, O Indra, the mortal. Bestow upon us glory and treasure.

original: tvāvato hīndra kratve asmi tvāvato 'vituḥ śūra rātau
analyzed: tvāvataḥ hi indra kratve asmi tvāvataḥ vituḥ śūra rātau
translated: For you are the protector in our sacrifice, O Indra, you are the protector of the generous one, O hero, in the gift.

original: viśvedahāni taviṣīva ugranokaḥ kṛṇuṣva harivo na mardhīḥ
analyzed: viśvedahāni taviṣīvas ugra nokaḥ kṛṇuṣva harivas na mardhīḥ
translated: All the days, O mighty one, as a powerful one, make them easy for us, O you who have horses to draw, do not be angry with us.

original: kutsā ete haryaśvāya śūṣamindre saho devajūtamiyānāḥ
analyzed: kutsāḥ ete haryaśvāya śūṣam indre sahaḥ deva jūtam iyānāḥ
translated: These Kutsa people have brought strength to the one with bay horses, to Indra, longing for the devotion of the gods.

original: satrā kṛdhi suhanā śūra vṛtrā vayaṃ tarutrāḥ sanuyāma vājam
analyzed: satrā kṛdhi su hanā śūra vṛtrā vayam tarutrāḥ sanuyāma vājam
translated: Always make the battles easy to win, O hero, may we, with our enemies destroyed, win booty.

original: evā na indra vāryasya / / /
analyzed: eva naḥ indra vāryasya
translated: Thus, O Indra, for the sake of this good thing...

original: na soma indramasuto mamāda nābrahmāṇo maghavānaṃ sutāsaḥ
analyzed: na somaḥ indram a sutaḥ mamāda na abrahmāṇaḥ maghavānam sutāsaḥ
translated: The unsqueezed Soma did not delight Indra, the squeezed ones did not delight the bountiful one without prayers.

original: tasmā ukthaṃ janaye yajjujoṣan nṛvan navīyaḥ śṛṇavad yathā naḥ
analyzed: tasmai uktham janaye yat jujoṣat nṛvat navīyaḥ śṛṇavat yathā naḥ
translated: Therefore, I will produce a hymn that he approves of, the new one, like a man, may he listen to us.

original: ukthaukthe soma indraṃ mamāda nīthenīthe maghavānaṃ sutāsaḥ
analyzed: uktha aukthe somaḥ indram mamāda nīthenīthe maghavānam sutāsaḥ
translated: In every hymn the squeezed Soma delights Indra, in every prayer the squeezed ones delight the bountiful one.

original: yadīṃ sabādhaḥ pitaraṃ na putrāḥ samānadakṣā avase havante
analyzed: yadi īm sabādhaḥ pitaram na putrāḥ samāna dakṣāḥ avase havante
translated: When the sons call upon the father for help, with the same ability, with the same purpose, as if they were together.

original: cakāra tā kṛṇavan nūnamanyā yāni bruvanti vedhasaḥ suteṣu
analyzed: cakāra tā kṛṇavat nūnam anyā yāni bruvanti vedhasaḥ suteṣu
translated: He has done those things, he will do other new ones now, which the wise ones speak about in the Soma pressings.

original: janīriva patirekaḥ samāno ni māmṛje pura indraḥsu sarvāḥ
analyzed: janīḥ iva patiḥ ekaḥ samānaḥ ni māmṛje puraḥ indraḥsu sarvāḥ
translated: Like a single husband to many women, Indra has united all these cities together.

original: evā tamāhuruta śṛṇva indra eko vibhaktā taraṇirmaghānām
analyzed: eva tam āhuḥ uta śṛṇve indraḥ ekaḥ vibhaktā taraṇiḥ maghānām
translated: Thus they call him, and he listens, Indra, the one who divides the riches, the swift one.

original: mithastura ūtayo yasya pūrvīrasme bhadrāṇi saścatapriyāṇi
analyzed: mithasturaḥ ūtayaḥ yasya pūrvīḥ asme bhadrāṇi saścata priyāṇi
translated: Whose aids are mutually most powerful, may he be ready for us for all auspicious things that are to be desired.

original: evā vasiṣṭha indramūtaye nṝn kṛṣṭīnāṃ vṛṣabhaṃ sute gṛṇāti
analyzed: eva vasiṣṭhaḥ indram ūtaye nṝn kṛṣṭīnām vṛṣabham sute gṛṇāti
translated: Thus Vasistha praises Indra, the bull of men, for help, at the pressing, the one who wins a thousand prizes for us.

original: sahasriṇa upa no māhi vājān yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: sahasriṇaḥ upa naḥ māhi vājān yūyam pāta
translated: Protect us, you who are to be invoked.

original: indraṃ naro nemadhitā havante yat pāryā yunajate dhiyastāḥ
analyzed: indram naraḥ nemadhitā havante yat pāryā yunajate dhiyaḥ tāḥ
translated: Men who are skilled in worship call on Indra when they yoke their thoughts for the journey beyond.

original: śūro nṛṣātā śavasaścakāna ā gomati vraje bhajātvaṃ naḥ
analyzed: śūraḥ nṛṣātā śavasaḥ cakānaḥ ā gomati vraje bhajātvam naḥ
translated: The hero who delights in manly deeds, grant us a share in the pasture rich in cattle.

original: ya indra śuṣmo maghavan te asti śikṣā sakhibhyaḥ puruhūtanṛbhyaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ indra śuṣmaḥ maghavan te asti śikṣā sakhibhyaḥ puruhūta nṛbhyaḥ
translated: O Indra, O Maghavan, whatever strength thou hast, bestow it on thy friends, O thou who art much invoked by men.

original: tvaṃ hi dṛḷhā maghavan vicetā apā vṛdhi parivṛtaṃ na rādhaḥ
analyzed: tvam hi dṛḍhā maghavan vicetāḥ apa ā vṛdhi parivṛtam na rādhaḥ
translated: For thou, O Maghavan, art strong and wise, thou hast increased thy bounty like a fort.

original: indro rājā jagataścarṣaṇīnāmadhi kṣami viṣurūpaṃ yadasti
analyzed: indraḥ rājā jagataḥ carṣaṇīnām adhi kṣami viṣurūpam yat asti
translated: Indra is king over the people of the world, over all the varied forms that are on earth.

original: tato dadāti dāśuṣe vasūni codad rādha upastutaścidarvāk
analyzed: tatas dadāti dāśuṣe vasūni codat rādhaḥ upastutaḥ cit arvāk
translated: From that he grants wealth to the worshipper, he impels bounty even to the one who is praised below.

original: nū cin na indro maghavā sahūtī dāno vājaṃ ni yamate na ūtī
analyzed: nu cit naḥ indraḥ maghavā sahūtī dānaḥ vājam ni yamate naḥ ūtī
translated: Now may Indra, the bountiful, the much-invoked, grant us strength with his help.

original: anūnā yasya dakṣiṇā pīpāya vāmaṃ nṛbhyo abhivītā sakhibhyaḥ
analyzed: anūnā yasya dakṣiṇā pīpāya vāmam nṛbhyaḥ abhivītā sakhibhyaḥ
translated: Whose unfailing bounty has spread to men, the good to friends who are protected by him.

original: nū indra rāye varivas kṛdhī na ā te mano vavṛtyāma maghāya
analyzed: nu indra rāye varivaḥ kṛdhī naḥ ā te manaḥ vavṛtyāma maghāya
translated: Now, O Indra, make room for us to obtain wealth, may our mind turn to thee for the sake of bounty.

original: gomadaśvāvad rathavad vyanto yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: gomat aśvāvat rathavat vyantaḥ yūyam pāta
translated: With cattle, with horses, with chariots, with wealth, do ye protect us.

original: brahmā ṇa indropa yāhi vidvānarvāñcaste harayaḥ santu yuktāḥ
analyzed: brahmā naḥ indra upa yāhi vidvān arvāñcaḥ te harayaḥ santu yuktāḥ
translated: O Brahman, come to Indra, knowing the way; let thy bay horses be yoked for thee.

original: viśve cid dhi tvā vihavanta martā asmākamicchṛṇuhi viśvaminva
analyzed: viśve cit hi tvā vihavanta martāḥ asmākam id śṛṇuhi viśvaminva
translated: For all mortals call upon thee; listen to all our prayers, O thou who spreadest all things.

original: havaṃ ta indra mahimā vyānaḍ brahma yat pāsi śavasinnṛṣīṇām
analyzed: havam te indra mahimā vyānaṭ brahma yat pāsi śavasin ṛṣīṇām
translated: Thy call, O Indra, hath been extended, the prayer which thou guardest among the powerful Rishis.

original: ā yad vajraṃ dadhiṣe hasta ugra ghoraḥ san kratvā janiṣṭhā aṣāḷaḥ
analyzed: ā yat vajram dadhiṣe haste ugra ghoraḥ san kratvā janiṣṭhāḥ aṣāḍaḥ
translated: When thou takest the thunderbolt in thy hand, O mighty one, terrible, thou art born invincible by wisdom.

original: tava praṇītīndra johuvānān saṃ yan nṝn na rodasī ninetha
analyzed: tava praṇītī indra johuvānān sam yat nṝn na rodasī ninetha
translated: By thy guidance, O Indra, thou leadest the men who call upon thee to the two worlds.

original: mahe kṣatrāya śavase hi jajñe 'tūtujiṃ cit tūtujiraśiśnat
analyzed: mahe kṣatrāya śavase hi jajñe tūtujim cit tūtujiḥ aśiśnat
translated: He was born for the great lordship and power; even the impetuous one has trembled.

original: ebhirna indrāhabhirdaśasya durmitrāso hi kṣitayaḥ pavante
analyzed: ebhiḥ naḥ indra ahabhiḥ daśasya durmitrāsaḥ hi kṣitayaḥ pavante
translated: With these, O Indra, be gracious; for the people are purified by their enemies.

original: prati yaccaṣṭe anṛtamanenā ava dvitā varuṇo māyīnaḥ sāt
analyzed: prati yat caṣṭe anṛtam anenāḥ ava dvitā varuṇaḥ māyīnaḥ sāt
translated: And the deceitful Varuna, who threatens with falsehood, is overcome in two days.

original: vocemedindraṃ maghavānamenaṃ maho rāyo rādhaso yad dadannaḥ
analyzed: vocema id indram maghavānam enam mahaḥ rāyaḥ rādhasaḥ yat dadan naḥ
translated: We have spoken to this Indra, the bountiful one, who gives us great wealth and gifts.

original: yo arcato brahmakṛtimaviṣṭho yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: yaḥ arcataḥ brahmakṛtim aviṣṭhaḥ yūyam pāta
translated: He who most readily accepts the praise and prayer of the worshipper. Do ye, O (gods), protect us.

original: ayaṃ soma indra tubhyaṃ sunva ā tu pra yāhi harivastadokāḥ
analyzed: ayam somaḥ indra tubhyam sunve ā tu pra yāhi harivasta dokāḥ
translated: This Soma, O Indra, is pressed for thee; come hither, O thou whose abode is in the bay steeds, to the libations.

original: pibā tvasya suṣutasya cārordado maghāni maghavanniyānaḥ
analyzed: pibā tvasya suṣutasya cāroḥ dadaḥ maghāni maghavan niyānaḥ
translated: Drink of this well-pressed juice, O thou of great bounty, and give us riches, O thou who art to be invoked.

original: brahman vīra brahmakṛtiṃ juṣāṇo 'rvācīno haribhiryāhi tūyam
analyzed: brahman vīra brahmakṛtim juṣāṇaḥ rvācīnaḥ haribhiḥ yāhi tūyam
translated: O hero, O Brahman, accepting the Brahman's work, come hither quickly with thy tawny steeds.

original: asminnū ṣu savane mādayasvopa brahmāṇi śṛṇava imā naḥ
analyzed: asmin u su savane mādayasva upa brahmāṇi śṛṇavaḥ imā naḥ
translated: Delight thyself in this libation, listen to these prayers of ours,

original: kā te astyaraṃkṛtiḥ sūktaiḥ kadā nūnaṃ te maghavan dāśema
analyzed: kā te asti araṃkṛtiḥ sūktaiḥ kadā nūnam te maghavan dāśema
translated: What fault hast thou found with us? When, O Maghavan, shall we serve thee with hymns?

original: viśvā matīrā tatane tvāyādhā ma indra śṛṇavo havemā
analyzed: viśvāḥ matīḥ ā tatane tvāyā adhā me indra śṛṇavaḥ havā imā
translated: All thoughts have been extended to thee, O Indra, listen to our calls.

original: uto ghā te puruṣyā idāsan yeṣāṃ pūrveṣāmaśṛṇorṛṣīṇām
analyzed: uta u gha te puruṣyāḥ id āsan yeṣām pūrveṣām aśṛṇoḥ ṛṣīṇām
translated: And now these men of thine are to be served, of whom we have heard from the ancient seers.

original: adhāhaṃ tvā maghavañ johavīmi tvaṃ na indrāsi pramatiḥ piteva
analyzed: adha aham tvā maghavam johavīmi tvam naḥ indra asi pramatiḥ pitā iva
translated: Now I call upon thee, O Maghavan, thou art the overseer, O Indra, like a father.

original: vocemedindraṃ / / /
analyzed: vocema id indram
translated: We have spoken to Indra...

original: ā no deva śavasā yāhi śuṣmin bhavā vṛdha indra rāyo asya
analyzed: ā naḥ deva śavasā yāhi śuṣmin bhava vṛdhaḥ indra rāyaḥ asya
translated: Come to us, O God, with might, be thou a helper, O Indra, in this wealth.

original: mahe nṛmṇāya nṛpate suvajra mahi kṣatrāya pauṃsyāya śūra
analyzed: mahe nṛmṇāya nṛpate su vajra mahi kṣatrāya pauṃsyāya śūra
translated: For great manliness, O lord of men, O thou of good thunderbolt, for great lordship, for manly power, O hero.

original: havanta u tvā havyaṃ vivāci tanūṣu śūrāḥ sūryasya sātau
analyzed: havante u tvā havyam vivāci tanūṣu śūrāḥ sūryasya sātau
translated: The heroes call upon thee, O Indra, with their bodies, with their voices, in the winning of the sun.

original: tvaṃ viśveṣu senyo janeṣu tvaṃ vṛtrāṇi randhayā suhantu
analyzed: tvam viśveṣu senyaḥ janeṣu tvam vṛtrāṇi randhaya su hantu
translated: Thou art to be praised among all peoples, thou art he who breaks through the forts, O good slayer.

original: ahā yadindra sudinā vyuchān dadho yat ketumupamaṃ samatsu
analyzed: ahā yat indra su dinā vyuchān dadhaḥ yat ketum upamam samatsu
translated: If, O Indra, thou hast granted us good days, when thou hast set the banner up in battles,

original: nyagniḥ sīdadasuro na hotā huvāno atra subhagāya devān
analyzed: ni agniḥ sīdat asuraḥ na hotā huvānaḥ atra subhagāya devān
translated: The Asura Agni, the priest, is seated, invited, to bring the gods to the prosperous one.

original: vayaṃ te ta indra ye ca deva stavanta śūra dadato maghāni
analyzed: vayam te te indra ye ca deva stavanta śūra dadataḥ maghāni
translated: We are yours, O Indra, and those who praise you, O hero, bestowing boons.

original: yachā sūribhya upamaṃ varūthaṃ svābhuvo jaraṇāmaśnavanta🔽vocemedindraṃ / / /
analyzed: yat sūribhyaḥ upamam varūtham su ābhuvaḥ jaraṇām aśnavanta  vocema id indram
translated: Grant the best protection to the princes, the self-existent ones who enjoy old age.🔽We have spoken to Indra...

original: pra va indrāya mādanaṃ haryaśvāya gāyata
analyzed: pra vaḥ indrāya mādanam haryaśvāya gāyata
translated: Sing forth the gladdening song to Indra, to the one with tawny horses,

original: sakhāyaḥ somapāvne
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ soma pāvne
translated: O friends, to the one who drinks Soma.

original: śaṃsedukthaṃ sudānava uta dyukṣaṃ yathā naraḥ
analyzed: śaṃset uktham sudānavaḥ uta dyukṣam yathā naraḥ
translated: Praise the hymn, O bountiful one, as the men praise the heavenly one,

original: cakṛmā satyarādhase🔽tvaṃ na indra vājayustvaṃ gavyuḥ śatakrato🔽tvaṃ hiraṇyayurvaso
analyzed: cakṛma satya rādhase  tvam naḥ indra vājayuḥ tvam gavyuḥ śatakrato  tvam hiraṇyayuḥ vaso
translated: We have done for the one whose vow is true.🔽You, O Indra, are the one who wins booty, you are the one who wins cattle, O Shatakratu,🔽You are the one who wins gold, O Vasu.

original: vayamindra tvāyavo 'bhi pra ṇonumo vṛṣan
analyzed: vayam indra tvāyavaḥ bhi pra nonumaḥ vṛṣan
translated: We, O Indra, the active ones, praise you, O bull,

original: viddhī tvasya no vaso
analyzed: viddhi tvasya naḥ vaso
translated: Know this, O Vasu, of us.

original: mā no nide ca vaktave 'ryo randhīrarāvṇe
analyzed: mā naḥ nide ca vaktave ryaḥ randhīḥ arāvṇe
translated: Do not deliver us to blame and reproach, O you who delight in the enemy's goods,

original: tve api kraturmama
analyzed: tve api kratuḥ mama
translated: In you also is my resolve.

original: tvaṃ varmāsi saprathaḥ puroyodhaśca vṛtrahan
analyzed: tvam varmā asi saprathaḥ puras yodhaḥ ca vṛtrahan
translated: You are the armor, the wide-spread one, and the vanguard warrior, O Vritra-slayer,

original: tvayā pratibruve yujā
analyzed: tvayā pratibruve yujā
translated: With you I fight the battle.

original: mahānutāsi yasya te 'nu svadhāvarī sahaḥ
analyzed: mahān utā asi yasya te nu svadhāvarī sahaḥ
translated: You are the great one whose strength, flowing by its own nature, is to be reckoned with,

original: mamnāte indrarodasī
analyzed: mamnāte indra rodasī
translated: The two worlds, O Indra, are afraid of you.

original: taṃ tvā marutvatī pari bhuvad vāṇī sayāvarī
analyzed: tam tvā marutvatī pari bhuvat vāṇī sa yāvarī
translated: You, O Indra, were surrounded by the Marut-filled speech, the one with many voices,

original: nakṣamāṇā saha dyubhiḥ
analyzed: nakṣamāṇā saha dyubhiḥ
translated: Seeking you with the heavenly powers.

original: ūrdhvāsastvānvindavo bhuvan dasmamupa dyavi
analyzed: ūrdhvāsaḥ tvā anvindavaḥ bhuvan dasmam upa dyavi
translated: The drops have flowed upwards to thee, O wondrous one, to the sky

original: saṃ te namanta kṛṣṭayaḥ
analyzed: sam te namanta kṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: Your people bow to thee

original: pra vo mahe mahivṛdhe bharadhvaṃ pracetase pra sumatiṃ kṛṇudhvam🔽viśaḥ pūrvīḥ pra carā carṣaṇiprāḥ
analyzed: pra vaḥ mahe mahivṛdhe bharadhvam pracetase pra sumatim kṛṇudhvam  viśaḥ pūrvīḥ pra cara carṣaṇi prāḥ
translated: Bring to the great one who increases greatness, to the wise one, bring your best devotion, make your mind most compliant🔽Lead forth the many people, O leader of men

original: uruvyacase mahine suvṛktimindrāya brahma janayanta viprāḥ
analyzed: uru vyacase mahine suvṛktim indrāya brahma janayanta viprāḥ
translated: For the far-ruling Indra the wise ones have generated a hymn of praise

analyzed: tasya vratāni na minanti dhīrāḥ
translated: The wise ones do not violate his ordinances

translated: The singers have always made Indra, whose anger is unsurpassed, their king for the sake of unity

original: śravacchrutkarṇa īyate vasūnāṃ nū cin no mardhiṣad giraḥ
analyzed: śravat śrutkarṇaḥ īyate vasūnām nu cit naḥ mardhiṣat giraḥ
translated: He is invoked with hearing ears to the treasures. Let not our songs fail us.

original: sadyaścid yaḥ sahasrāṇi śatā dadan nakirditsantamā minat
analyzed: sadyaścit yaḥ sahasrāṇi śatā dadat nakirditsantamā minat
translated: He who gives hundreds and thousands even in a moment. Let not the niggardly one be destroyed.

original: sa vīro apratiṣkuta indreṇa śūśuve nṛbhiḥ🔽yaste gabhīrā savanāni vṛtrahan sunotyā ca dhāvati🔽bhavā varūthaṃ maghavan maghonāṃ yat samajāsi śardhataḥ
analyzed: sa vīraḥ apratiṣkutaḥ indreṇa śūśuve nṛbhiḥ  yaḥ te gabhīrā savanāni vṛtrahan sunotyā ca dhāvati  bhava varūtham maghavan maghonām yat samajāsi śardhataḥ
translated: That hero, invincible, has shone forth with the men by Indra.🔽He who presses for thee the deep libations, O Vrtra-slayer, and runs to the draught.🔽Be thou a protector, O bountiful one, of the bountiful ones, when thou art united with the impetuous ones.

original: vi tvāhatasya vedanaṃ bhajemahyā dūṇāśo bharā gayam
analyzed: vi tvā āhatasya vedanam bhajemahi dūṇāśaḥ bhara gayam
translated: May we enjoy the favour of the unvanquished one. Bring the gift with high hopes.

original: sunotā somapāvne somamindrāya vajriṇe
analyzed: sunota soma pāvne somam indrāya vajriṇe
translated: Press the Soma for the Soma-drinker, for Indra the wielder of the thunderbolt.

original: pacatā paktīravase kṛṇudhvamit pṛṇannit pṛṇate mayaḥ
analyzed: pacata paktīḥ avase kṛṇudhvam id pṛṇan id pṛṇate mayaḥ
translated: Cook the cooked viands for the sake of help. Give, O bountiful one, to the bountiful one.

original: mā sredhata somino dakṣatā mahe kṛṇudhvaṃ rāya ātuje
analyzed: mā sredhata sominaḥ dakṣata mahe kṛṇudhvam rāyaḥ ātuje
translated: Do not be niggardly, O Soma-pressers, in giving. Make great wealth for the sake of help.

original: taraṇirijjayati kṣeti puṣyati na devāsaḥ kavatnave
analyzed: taraṇiḥ id jayati kṣeti puṣyati na devāsaḥ kavatnave
translated: The active one conquers, rests, and prospers. The gods are not for the deceitful one.

original: nakiḥ sudāso rathaṃ paryāsa na rīramat🔽indro yasyāvitā yasya maruto gamat sa gomati vraje
analyzed: nakir sudāsaḥ ratham paryāsa na rīramat  indraḥ yasya avitā yasya marutaḥ gamat sa gomati vraje
translated: The good Sudās will not turn away the chariot. Let him not be remiss.🔽Let him go to the cattle-pen with thee for his helper, O Indra, with the Maruts for his helper.

original: gamad vājaṃ vājayannindra martyo yasya tvamavitā bhuvaḥ
analyzed: gamat vājam vājayan indra martyaḥ yasya tvam avitā bhuvaḥ
translated: Let the mortal man who strives for strength go to the prize, O Indra, if thou art his helper.

original: asmākaṃ bodhyavitā rathānāmasmākaṃ śūra nṛṇām
analyzed: asmākam bodhi avitā rathānām asmākam śūra nṛṇām
translated: Our chariot-wheels are for your enlightenment, O hero among men.

original: udin nyasya ricyate 'ṃśo dhanaṃ na jigyuṣaḥ
analyzed: udit nyasya ricyate ṃśaḥ dhanam na jigyuṣaḥ
translated: The share of one who is rising is taken away, like wealth from one who desires to conquer.

original: ya indroharivān na dabhanti taṃ ripo dakṣaṃ dadhāti somini
analyzed: yaḥ indra ūharivān na dabhanti tam ripaḥ dakṣam dadhāti somini
translated: Him whom the tawny-colored Indra does not deceive, the enemy places his power in him, O Soma-offerer.

original: mantramakharvaṃ sudhitaṃ supeśasaṃ dadhāta yajñiyeṣvā
analyzed: mantram akharvam sudhitam supeśasam dadhāta yajñiya iṣvā
translated: He places the unstaggering, well-arranged, well-formed mantra in the sacrificial rites.

original: pūrvīścana prasitayastaranti taṃ ya indre karmaṇā bhuvat
analyzed: pūrvīḥ cana prasitayaḥ taranti tam yaḥ indre karmaṇā bhuvat
translated: Not even many snares can hold him who has become through his work in Indra.

original: kastamindra tvāvasumā martyo dadharṣati
analyzed: kaḥ tam indra tvāvasumāḥ martyaḥ dadharṣati
translated: What mortal, O Indra, dares to oppose that wealth of yours?

original: śraddhā it temaghavan pārye divi vājī vājaṃ siṣāsati
analyzed: śraddhā id te maghavan pārye divi vājī vājam siṣāsati
translated: Faith, O bountiful one, is at the end of the day, the strong one thirsts for strength.

original: maghonaḥ sma vṛtrahatyeṣu codaya ye dadati priyā vasu
analyzed: maghonaḥ sma vṛtra hatyeṣu codaya ye dadati priyā vasu
translated: Stir up the generous ones in the slaying of Vrtra, those who give dear wealth.

original: tavapraṇītī haryaśva sūribhirviśvā tarema duritā
analyzed: tava praṇītī haryaśva sūribhiḥ viśvā tarema duritā
translated: By your guidance, O you with tawny horses, with the leaders, may we overcome all difficulties.

original: tavedindrāvamaṃ vasu tvaṃ puṣyasi madhyamam🔽satrā viśvasya paramasya rājasi nakiṣ ṭvā goṣu vṛṇvate🔽tvaṃ viśvasya dhanadā asi śruto ya īṃ bhavantyājayaḥ
analyzed: tava id indra avamam vasu tvam puṣyasi madhyamam  satrā viśvasya paramasya rājasi nakir tvā goṣu vṛṇvate  tvam viśvasya dhana dāḥ asi śrutaḥ ye īm bhavanti ājayaḥ
translated: You, O Indra, are the lowest, the middlemost, and the highest wealth. You nourish.🔽You always rule over the highest of all. No one chooses you in the matter of cattle.🔽You are the giver of wealth to all, O famous one, who is to be favored by you.

original: tavāyaṃ viśvaḥ puruhūta pārthivo 'vasyurnāma bhikṣate
analyzed: tava ayam viśvaḥ puruhūta pārthivaḥ vasyuḥ nāma bhikṣate
translated: This entire earthly world, O much-invoked one, begs for your help, desiring your favor.

original: yadindra yāvatastvametāvadahamīśīya
analyzed: yat indra yāvataḥ tvam etāvat aham īśīya
translated: If, O Indra, I were to possess as much as you,

original: stotāramid didhiṣeya radāvaso na pāpatvāya rāsīya
analyzed: stotāram id didhiṣeya radāvaso na pāpatvāya rāsīya
translated: I would serve the one who delights in praise, O you whose wealth is to be enjoyed, not to be despised.

original: śikṣeyamin mahayate divedive rāya ā kuhacidvide
analyzed: śikṣeyam id mahayate dive dive rāyaḥ ā kuhacid vide
translated: I would learn to be exalted day by day, for the sake of wealth, even if it be from a lowly one.

original: nahi tvadanyan maghavan na āpyaṃ vasyo asti pitā cana
analyzed: nahi tvat anyat maghavan naḥ āpyam vasyaḥ asti pitā cana
translated: For, O Maghavan, there is no other who is more worthy of worship than you, not even a father.

original: taraṇirit siṣāsati vājaṃ purandhyā yujā
analyzed: taraṇiḥ id siṣāsati vājam purandhyā yujā
translated: The swift one strives for strength, yoked with the dawn.

original: ā va indrampuruhūtaṃ name girā nemiṃ taṣṭeva sudrvam
analyzed: ā vaḥ indram puruhūtam name girā nemim taṣṭā iva su drvam
translated: I bow to Indra, invoked by many, with a song, like a wheel-maker to a well-wrought wheel.

original: na duṣṭutī martyo vindate vasu na sredhantaṃ rayirnaśat
analyzed: na duṣṭutī martyaḥ vindate vasu na sredhantam rayiḥ naśat
translated: A mortal who sings your praises finds no wealth, nor does he who is stingy obtain riches.

original: suśaktirin maghavan tubhyaṃ māvate deṣṇaṃ yat pārye divi
analyzed: suśaktirit maghavan tubhyam māvate deṣṇam yat pārye divi
translated: O Maghavan, the good protector is for you, the one who has much, the gift that is in the farthest heaven.

original: abhi tvā śūra nonumo 'dugdhā iva dhenavaḥ
analyzed: abhi tvā śūra nonumaḥ dugdhāḥ iva dhenavaḥ
translated: We praise you, O hero, like milch cows that are not milked.

original: īśānamasya jagataḥ svardṛśamīśānamindra tasthuṣaḥ
analyzed: īśānam asya jagataḥ svar dṛśam īśānam indra tasthuṣaḥ
translated: The lord of this world, the seer of heaven, the lord of the firm ones, O Indra,

original: na tvāvānanyo divyo na pārthivo na jāto na janiṣyate
analyzed: na tvāvān anyaḥ divyaḥ na pārthivaḥ na jātaḥ na janiṣyate
translated: No one else, whether divine or earthly, has been born or will be born like you.

original: aśvāyanto maghavannindra vājino gavyantastvā havāmahe
analyzed: aśvāyantaḥ maghavan indra vājinaḥ gavyantaḥ tvā havāmahe
translated: O Maghavan Indra, we call you, those who desire horses and riches.

original: abhī ṣatastadā bharendra jyāyaḥ kanīyasaḥ
analyzed: abhi sataḥ tadā bhara indra jyāyaḥ kanīyasaḥ
translated: You are the one who bestows more than many, O Indra, the greater than the lesser.

original: purūvasurhi maghavan sanādasi bharebhare ca havyaḥ
analyzed: purūvasuḥ hi maghavan sanāt asi bharebhare ca havyaḥ
translated: For you, O Maghavan, have always been the one with many treasures, to be invoked in every battle.

original: parā ṇudasva maghavannamitrān suvedā no vasū kṛdhi
analyzed: parā nudasva maghavan amitrān su vedā naḥ vasū kṛdhi
translated: Drive away our enemies, O Maghavan, make wealth easy to be obtained for us

original: asmākaṃ bodhyavitā mahādhane bhavā vṛdhaḥ sakhīnām
analyzed: asmākam bodhyavitā mahādhane bhavā vṛdhaḥ sakhīnām
translated: Be thou our protector in the great conflict, be thou the increaser of our friends

original: indra kratuṃ na ā bhara pitā putrebhyo yathā
analyzed: indra kratum naḥ ā bhara pitā putrebhyaḥ yathā
translated: O Indra, bring us power as a father to his sons

original: śikṣā ṇoasmin puruhūta yāmani jīvā jyotiraśīmahi
analyzed: śikṣa naḥ asmin puruhūta yāmani jīvāḥ jyotiḥ aśīmahi
translated: Instruct us in this service, O thou who art invoked by many, that we may obtain

original: mā no ajñātā vṛjanā durādhyo māśivāso ava kramuḥ
analyzed: mā naḥ ajñātā vṛjanā durādhyaḥ mā aśivāsaḥ ava kramuḥ
translated: Let not unknown, ill-disposed people, wearing black garments, come nigh us

original: tvayā vayaṃ pravataḥ śaśvatīrapo 'ti śūra tarāmasi🔽śvityañco mā dakṣiṇataskapardā dhiyaṃjinvāso abhi hi pramanduḥ
analyzed: tvayā vayam pravataḥ śaśvatīḥ apaḥ ti śūra tarāmasi  śvityañcaḥ mā dakṣiṇa taskapardāḥ dhiyaṃjinvāsaḥ abhi hi pramanduḥ
translated: By thee, O hero, we will pass over the far-extended waters🔽The white-backed ones, inspiring the thoughts, have delighted me as I was coming

original: uttiṣṭhan voce pari barhiṣo nṝn na me dūrādavitave vasiṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: uttiṣṭhan voce pari barhiṣaḥ nṝn na me dūrāt avitave vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Rising, I call to the men who sit on the sacred grass; not far is it for the Vasisthas to come to me

original: dūrādindramanayannā sutena tiro vaiśantamati pāntamugram
analyzed: dūrāt indram anayat nā sutena tiras vaiśantam ati pāntam ugram
translated: From afar they have brought Indra with the Soma, the mighty one who protects beyond the Vaisins

original: pāśadyumnasya vāyatasya somāt sutādindro 'vṛṇītāvasiṣṭhān
analyzed: pāśa dyumnasya vāyatasya somāt sutāt indraḥ vṛṇīta avasiṣṭhān
translated: From the Soma pressed for Pasadyumna, the son of Vayat, Indra chose the Vasisthas

original: even nu kaṃ sindhumebhistatāreven nu kaṃ bhedamebhirjaghāna
analyzed: eva id nu kam sindhum ebhiḥ tatāra iva id nu kam bhedam ebhiḥ jaghāna
translated: Even now he crossed the Sindhu with these (Vasisthas); even now he conquered the Bheda with these

original: even nu kaṃ dāśarājñe sudāsaṃ prāvadindro brahmaṇā vo vasiṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: eva id nu kam dāśarājñe sudāsam prāvat indraḥ brahmaṇā vaḥ vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Even now he spoke to Sudasa, the lord of the Dasas, Indra with the prayer, O Vasisthas

original: juṣṭī naro brahmaṇā vaḥ pitṝṇāmakṣamavyayaṃ na kilā riṣātha
analyzed: juṣṭī naraḥ brahmaṇā vaḥ pitṝṇām akṣam avyayam na kila riṣātha
translated: The men have been accepted by you through the prayer of the fathers, the imperishable eye, you have not been harmed

original: yacchakvarīṣu bṛhatā raveṇendre śuṣmamadadhātā vasiṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: yat śakvarīṣu bṛhatā raveṇa indre śuṣmam adadhāta vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: In the Sakvari verses, O Vasishthas, you have placed strength in Indra with your loud roar

original: ud dyāmivet tṛṣṇajo nāthitāso 'dīdhayurdāśarājñe vṛtāsaḥ
analyzed: ud dyām ved tṛṣṇajaḥ nāthitāsaḥ dīdhayuḥ dāśarājñe vṛtāsaḥ
translated: Like those afflicted by thirst who look up to the sky, the chosen ones have been inspired for the king of the Dasas

original: vasiṣṭhasya stuvata indro aśroduruṃ tṛtsubhyo akṛṇodu lokam
analyzed: vasiṣṭhasya stuvataḥ indraḥ aśrot urum tṛtsubhyaḥ akṛṇot u lokam
translated: Indra listened to the praise of Vasishtha and made a wide space for the Tritsus

original: daṇḍā ived goajanāsa āsan parichinnā bharatā arbhakāsaḥ
analyzed: daṇḍāḥ iva id go ajanāsaḥ āsan parichinnāḥ bharatāḥ arbhakāsaḥ
translated: They were like sticks, the young Bharatas were surrounded, the cows were like people

original: abhavacca puraetā vasiṣṭha ādit tṛtsūnāṃ viśo aprathanta
analyzed: abhavat ca puraetā vasiṣṭhaḥ ādit tṛtsūnām viśaḥ aprathanta
translated: And Vasishtha became their leader, then the tribes of the Tritsus spread out

original: trayaḥ kṛṇvanti bhuvaneṣu retastisraḥ prajā āryā jyotiragrāḥ
analyzed: trayaḥ kṛṇvanti bhuvaneṣu retaḥ tisraḥ prajāḥ āryāḥ jyotiḥ agrāḥ
translated: They make the seed in the three worlds, the three noble classes with light in front

original: trayo gharmāsa uṣasaṃ sacante sarvānit tānanuvidurvasiṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: trayaḥ gharmāsaḥ uṣasam sacante sarvān id tān anuviduḥ vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Three warmths attend the dawn, all of them the Vasishthas have understood

original: sūryasyeva vakṣatho jyotireṣāṃ samudrasyeva mahimā gabhīraḥ
analyzed: sūryasya iva vakṣathaḥ jyotiḥ eṣām samudrasya iva mahimā gabhīraḥ
translated: The light of these is like the sun, their greatness is deep like the ocean

original: vātasyeva prajavo nānyena stomo vasiṣṭhā anvetave vaḥ
analyzed: vātasya iva prajavaḥ na anyena stomaḥ vasiṣṭhāḥ anvetave vaḥ
translated: Your praise, O Vasishthas, is like the speed of the wind, it cannot be followed by another

original: ta in niṇyaṃ hṛdayasya praketaiḥ sahasravalśamabhi saṃcaranti
analyzed: te id niṇyam hṛdayasya praketaiḥ sahasra valśam abhi saṃcaranti
translated: They move along the thousand-branched seat, the sign of the heart

original: yamena tataṃ paridhiṃ vayanto 'psarasa upa sedurvasiṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: yamena tatam paridhim vayantaḥ psarasaḥ upa seduḥ vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: The Vasishthas, the Apsarases, weaving the enclosing-stick stretched by Yama,

original: vidyuto jyotiḥ pari saṃjihānaṃ mitrāvaruṇā yadapaśyatāṃ tvā
analyzed: vidyutaḥ jyotiḥ pari saṃjihānam mitrāvaruṇā yat apaśyatām tvā
translated: When Mitra and Varuna beheld thee, the light of the lightning flashing around,

original: tat te janmotaikaṃ vasiṣṭhāgastyo yat tvā viśaājabhāra
analyzed: tat te janma uta ekam vasiṣṭha agastyaḥ yat tvā viśa ājabhāra
translated: That is thy one birth, O Vasishtha, which Agastya brought forth from thee with his people.

original: utāsi maitrāvaruṇo vasiṣṭhorvaśyā brahman manaso 'dhi jātaḥ
analyzed: uta asi maitrāvaruṇaḥ vasiṣṭha urvaśyā brahman manasaḥ dhi jātaḥ
translated: And thou art the son of Mitra and Varuna, O Vasishtha, born from the will and mind of the Brahman.

original: drapsaṃ skannaṃ brahmaṇā daivyena viśve devāḥ puṣkare tvādadanta
analyzed: drapsam skannam brahmaṇā daivyena viśve devāḥ puṣkare tvā adadanta
translated: The scattered drop, by the divine Brahman, the All-gods placed in the lotus.

original: sa praketa ubhayasya pravidvān sahasradāna uta vā sadānaḥ
analyzed: sa praketaḥ ubhayasya pravidvān sahasra dānaḥ uta vā sadānaḥ
translated: He, the revealer, knowing both, the giver of a thousand, or he who always gives,

original: yamena tataṃ paridhiṃ vayiṣyannapsarasaḥ pari jajñe vasiṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: yamena tatam paridhim vayiṣyan apsarasaḥ pari jajñe vasiṣṭhaḥ
translated: Weaving the enclosing-stick stretched by Yama, Vasishtha was born surrounded by the Apsarases.

original: satre ha jātāviṣitā namobhiḥ kumbhe retaḥ siṣicatuḥ samānam
analyzed: satre ha jātau iṣitā namobhiḥ kumbhe retaḥ siṣicatuḥ samānam
translated: Born in the sacrifice, sought with salutations, they poured the same seed into the womb.

original: tato ha māna udiyāya madhyāt tato jātam ṛṣimāhurvasiṣṭham🔽ukthabhṛtaṃ sāmabhṛtaṃ bibharti grāvāṇaṃ bibhrat pra vadātyagre
analyzed: tatas ha mānaḥ udiyāya madhyāt tatas jātam ṛṣim āhuḥ vasiṣṭham  uktha bhṛtam sāma bhṛtam bibharti grāvāṇam bibhrat pra vadāti agre
translated: Then the mind arose from the middle, and from that they call the born one the sage Vasishtha.🔽He bears the Ukthabhrits and the Samanbhrits, bearing the stone, he speaks first.

original: upainamādhvaṃ sumanasyamānā ā vo gachāti pratṛdo vasiṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: upa enam ādhvam sumanasyamānāḥ ā vaḥ gacchāti pratṛdaḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ
translated: Come to him with good will, Vasishtha will come to you, the giver of gifts.

original: pra śukraitu devī manīṣā asmat sutaṣṭo ratho na vājī
analyzed: pra śukrā etu devī manīṣā asmat su taṣṭaḥ rathaḥ na vājī
translated: Let the pure thought of the Goddess come to us, like a well-made chariot, like a strong horse.

original: viduḥ pṛthivyā divo janitraṃ śṛṇvantyāpo adha kṣarantīḥ🔽āpaścidasmai pinvanta pṛthvīrvṛtreṣu śūrā maṃsanta ugrāḥ
analyzed: viduḥ pṛthivyāḥ divaḥ janitram śṛṇvanti āpaḥ adha kṣarantīḥ  āpaḥ cit asmai pinvanta pṛthvīḥ vṛtreṣu śūrāḥ maṃsante ugrāḥ
translated: They know the birthplace of heaven and earth, the waters hear as they flow along.🔽Even the waters swell out for him, the broad ones; the brave ones delight in the strong ones among the Vritras.

original: ā dhūrṣvasmai dadhātāśvānindro na vajrī hiraṇyabāhuḥ🔽abhi pra sthātāheva yajñaṃ yāteva patman tmanā hinota
analyzed: ā dhūrṣu asmai dadhāta aśvān indraḥ na vajrī hiraṇya bāhuḥ  abhi pra sthāta ahā iva yajñam yāta iva patman tmanā hinota
translated: Place the horses for him in the yokes, like the thunderer Indra, with arms of gold.🔽Advance to the sacrifice, as if to a path, urge it forward with your own (power).

original: tmanā samatsu hinota yajñaṃ dadhāta ketuṃ janāya vīram
analyzed: tmanā samatsu hinota yajñam dadhāta ketum janāya vīram
translated: Urge it forward with your own (power) in the battles, place the sacrifice, a hero, as a sign for the people.

original: udasya śuṣmād bhānurnārta bibharti bhāraṃ pṛthivī nabhūma
analyzed: udasya śuṣmāt bhānuḥ na ārta bibharti bhāram pṛthivī nabhūma
translated: From his rising the sun bears his light, like the earth its burden.

original: hvayāmi devānayāturagne sādhannṛtena dhiyaṃ dadhāmi
analyzed: hvayāmi devān ayātuḥ agne sādhan ṛtena dhiyam dadhāmi
translated: I invoke the gods with this, O Agni; accomplishing the truth, I set the thought.

original: abhi vo devīṃ dhiyaṃ dadhidhvaṃ pra vo devatrā vācaṃ kṛṇudhvam
analyzed: abhi vaḥ devīm dhiyam dadhidhvam pra vaḥ devatrā vācam kṛṇudhvam
translated: You must conceive the divine thought; you must direct your speech to the gods.

original: ā caṣṭa āsāṃ pātho nadīnāṃ varuṇa ugraḥ sahasracakṣāḥ
analyzed: ā caṣṭe āsām pāthaḥ nadīnām varuṇaḥ ugraḥ sahasra cakṣāḥ
translated: He looks upon the path of these rivers; the terrible Varuna, with a thousand eyes.

original: rājā rāṣṭrānāṃ peśo nadīnāmanuttamasmai kṣatraṃ viśvāyu
analyzed: rājā rāṣṭrānām peśaḥ nadīnām anuttamasmai kṣatram viśvāyu
translated: The king of the peoples, the essence of the rivers, the best for him, the all-supporting realm.

original: aviṣṭo asmān viśvāsu vikṣvadyuṃ kṛṇota śaṃsaṃ ninitsoḥ
analyzed: aviṣṭaḥ asmān viśvāsu vikṣvadyum kṛṇota śaṃsam ninitsoḥ
translated: Unite us with the all-supporting, make us resplendent in all the dwellings, the praise of the envious.

original: vyetu didyud dviṣāmaśevā yuyota viṣvag rapastanūnām
analyzed: vyetu didyut dviṣām aśevā yuyota viṣvak rapaḥ tanūnām
translated: Let the lightning of our foes be dispelled, drive away the disease from our bodies on all sides.

original: avīn no agnirhavyān namobhiḥ preṣṭho asmā adhāyi stomaḥ
analyzed: avīt naḥ agniḥ havyāt namobhiḥ preṣṭhaḥ asmai adhāyi stomaḥ
translated: May Agni, to whom offerings are made with homage, be most dear to us; may praise be offered to him.

original: sajūrdevebhirapāṃ napātaṃ sakhāyaṃ kṛdhvaṃ śivo no astu
analyzed: sajūs devebhiḥ apām napātam sakhāyam kṛdhvam śivaḥ naḥ astu
translated: Be united with the waters' son, make him your friend, may he be auspicious to us.

original: abjāmukthairahiṃ gṛṇīṣe budhne nadīnāṃ rajassu ṣīdan
analyzed: ap jām ukthaiḥ ahim gṛṇīṣe budhne nadīnām rajassu sīdan
translated: I praise the Ahi with hymns, sitting in the waters' depths, in the regions of the rivers.

original: mā no 'hirbudhnyo riṣe dhān mā yajño asya sridhad ṛtāyoḥ
analyzed: mā naḥ hirbudhnyaḥ riṣe dhāt mā yajñaḥ asya sridhat ṛtāyoḥ
translated: Let not the Ahi Budhnya harm us for our sin, let not our sacrifice fail in the two truths.

original: uta na eṣu nṛṣu śravo dhuḥ pra rāye yantu śardhanto aryaḥ
analyzed: uta naḥ eṣu nṛṣu śravaḥ dhuḥ pra rāye yantu śardhantaḥ aryaḥ
translated: And may they bestow fame on these men; may the impetuous nobles go to wealth.

original: tapanti śatruṃ svarṇa bhūmā mahāsenāso amebhireṣām🔽ā yan naḥ patnīrgamantyachā tvaṣṭā supāṇirdadhātuvīrān
analyzed: tapanti śatrum svarṇa bhūmā mahā senāsaḥ amebhiḥ eṣām  ā yat naḥ patnīḥ gamanti achā tvaṣṭā su pāṇiḥ dadhātu vīrān
translated: They scorch the enemy, the greatly powerful ones, with their own armies, in the battles of these (men).🔽When our wives come to us, may Tvastr, the good-handed one, bestow heroes on us.

original: prati na stomaṃ tvaṣṭā juṣeta syādasme aramatirvasūyuḥ🔽tā no rāsan rātiṣāco vasūnyā rodasī varuṇānī śṛṇotu🔽varūtrībhiḥ suśaraṇo no astu tvaṣṭā sudatro vi dadhātu rāyaḥ
analyzed: prati naḥ stomam tvaṣṭā juṣeta syāt asme aramatiḥ vasūyuḥ  tāḥ naḥ rāsan rātiṣācaḥ vasūnyāḥ rodasī varuṇānī śṛṇotu  varūtrībhiḥ su śaraṇaḥ naḥ astu tvaṣṭā su datraḥ vi dadhātu rāyaḥ
translated: May Tvastr accept our praise; may he be gracious to us, seeking wealth.🔽May those bountiful ones grant us wealth; may the daughter of Varuna, the two worlds, listen.🔽May Tvastr, the good-natured one, be our good protector with the Varuni (waters); may Tvastr, the good-natured one, bestow wealth.

original: tan no rāyaḥ parvatāstan na āpastad rātiṣāca oṣadhīruta dyauḥ
analyzed: tat naḥ rāyaḥ parvatāḥ tat naḥ āpaḥ tat rātiṣācaḥ oṣadhīḥ uta dyauḥ
translated: May the mountains, may the waters, may the bountiful plants, and the sky grant us that wealth.

original: vanaspatibhiḥ pṛthivī sajoṣā ubhe rodasī pari pāsato naḥ
analyzed: vanaspatibhiḥ pṛthivī sajoṣāḥ ubhe rodasī pari pāsataḥ naḥ
translated: The trees in unison with the earth, and both the heaven and earth, protect us on every side.

original: anu tadurvī rodasī jihātāmanu dyukṣo varuṇa indrasakhā
analyzed: anu tat urvī rodasī jihātām anu dyukṣaḥ varuṇaḥ indra sakhā
translated: Let the two vast worlds of earth and heaven open to that, and the sky-dwelling friend of Indra, Varuna.

original: anu viśve maruto ye sahāso rāyaḥ syāma dharuṇaṃ dhiyadhyai
analyzed: anu viśve marutaḥ ye sahāsaḥ rāyaḥ syāma dharuṇam dhiyadhyai
translated: And let all the Maruts who are of the same mind as us, and may we be possessed of wealth, the support of our thoughts.

original: tan na indro varuṇo mitro agnirāpa oṣadhīrvanino juṣanta
analyzed: tat naḥ indraḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ āpaḥ oṣadhīḥ vaninaḥ juṣanta
translated: May Indra, Varuna, Mitra, Agni, the waters, plants, and trees accept this.

original: śarman syāma marutāmupasthe yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: śarman syāma marutām upasthe yūyam pāta
translated: May we be in the lap of the Maruts. Do you protect us.

original: śaṃ na indrāgnī bhavatāmavobhiḥ śaṃ na indrāvaruṇā rātahavyā
analyzed: śam naḥ indra agnī bhavatām avobhiḥ śam naḥ indrāvaruṇā rāta havyā
translated: Be auspicious to us, O Indra and Agni, with your help. Be auspicious to us, O Indra and Varuna, who receive offerings.

original: śamindrāsomā suvitāya śaṃ yoḥ śaṃ na indrāpūṣaṇā vājasātau
analyzed: śam indrāsomā suvitāya śam yos śam naḥ indrāpūṣaṇā vājasātau
translated: Be auspicious to us, O Indra and Soma, for prosperity and peace. Be auspicious to us, O Indra and Pusan, in the winning of strength.

original: śaṃ no bhagaḥ śamu naḥ śaṃso astu śaṃ naḥ purandhiḥśamu santu rāyaḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ bhagaḥ śamu naḥ śaṃsaḥ astu śam naḥ purandhiḥ śamu santu rāyaḥ
translated: Be auspicious to us, O Bhaga, and be auspicious to us, O Saman. Be auspicious to us, O Purandhi, and be auspicious to us, O riches.

original: śaṃ naḥ satyasya suyamasya śaṃsaḥśaṃ no aryamā purujāto astu🔽śaṃ no dhātā śamu dhartā no astu śaṃ na urūcī bhavatusvadhābhiḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ satyasya su yamasya śaṃsaḥ śam naḥ aryamā puru jātaḥ astu  śam naḥ dhātā śamu dhartā naḥ astu śam naḥ urūcī bhavatu svadhābhiḥ
translated: Be auspicious to us, the praise of the true and well-governed one. Be auspicious to us, O Aryaman, the much-born one.🔽Be auspicious to us, O Dhatr, and be auspicious to us, O Dhrit. Be auspicious to us, the two vast ones, with their own powers.

original: śaṃ rodasī bṛhatī śaṃ no adriḥ śaṃ nodevānāṃ suhavāni santu
analyzed: śam rodasī bṛhatī śam naḥ adriḥ śam naḥ devānām su havāni santu
translated: Be auspicious to us, the two great worlds, and be auspicious to us, the mountain. Be auspicious to us the well-disposed ones of the gods.

original: śaṃ no agnirjyotiranīko astu śaṃ no mitrāvaruṇāvaśvinā śam
analyzed: śam naḥ agniḥ jyotiḥ anīkaḥ astu śam naḥ mitrāvaruṇau aśvinā śam
translated: May Agni, the light-bringer, be auspicious to us, may Mitra-Varuṇa and the two Aśvins be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ sukṛtāṃ sukṛtāni santu śaṃ na iṣiroabhi vātu vātaḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ su kṛtām sukṛtāni santu śam naḥ vātu vātaḥ
translated: May our good deeds be auspicious to us, may the wind blow auspicious for us.

original: śaṃ no dyāvāpṛthivī pūrvahūtau śamantarikṣaṃ dṛśayeno astu
analyzed: śam naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī pūrva hūtau śam antarikṣam dṛśa yenaḥ astu
translated: May heaven and earth be auspicious to us in the first invocation, may the atmosphere be auspicious to us for the sight.

original: śaṃ na oṣadhīrvanino bhavantu śaṃ no rajasas patirastu jiṣṇuḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ oṣadhīḥ vaninaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ rajasaḥ patiḥ astu jiṣṇuḥ
translated: May the plants and trees be auspicious to us, may the lord of the realm be auspicious and victorious to us.

original: śaṃ na indro vasubhirdevo astu śamādityebhirvaruṇaḥ suśaṃsaḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ indraḥ vasubhiḥ devaḥ astu śam ādityebhiḥ varuṇaḥ su śaṃsaḥ
translated: May the god Indra be auspicious to us with the Vasus, may Varuṇa be well-praised with the Ādityas.

original: śaṃ no rudro rudrebhirjalāṣaḥ śaṃ nastvaṣṭā gnābhiriha śṛṇotu🔽śaṃ naḥ somo bhavatu brahma śaṃ naḥ śaṃ no grāvāṇaḥśamu santu yajñāḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ rudraḥ rudrebhiḥ jalāṣaḥ śam naḥ tvaṣṭā gnābhiḥ iha śṛṇotu  śam naḥ somaḥ bhavatu brahma śam naḥ śam naḥ grāvāṇaḥ śamu santu yajñāḥ
translated: May Rudra be auspicious to us with the Rudras, may Tvaṣṭṛ be auspicious to us here with the wives.🔽May Soma be auspicious to us, may the Brahman be auspicious to us, may the pressing-stones and sacrifices be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ svarūṇāṃ mitayo bhavantu śaṃ naḥ prasvaḥ śaṃ vastu vediḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ svarūṇām mitayaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ prasvaḥ śam vastu vediḥ
translated: May the measures of our chanting be auspicious to us, may the Prastāva be auspicious to us, may the altar be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ sūrya urucakṣā udetu śaṃ naścatasraḥ pradiśo bhavantu
analyzed: śam naḥ sūryaḥ uru cakṣāḥ udetu śam naḥ catasraḥ pradiśaḥ bhavantu
translated: May the far-seeing sun rise auspicious to us, may the four quarters be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ parvatā dhruvayo bhavantu śaṃ naḥ sindhavaḥ śamu santvāpaḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ parvatāḥ dhruvayaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ sindhavaḥ śamu santu āpaḥ
translated: May the firm mountains be auspicious to us, may the rivers and waters be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ no aditirbhavatu vratebhiḥ śaṃ no bhavantu marutaḥ svarkāḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ aditiḥ bhavatu vratebhiḥ śam naḥ bhavantu marutaḥ su arkāḥ
translated: May Aditi be auspicious to us with her vows, may the Maruts, the joyous ones, be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ no viṣṇuḥ śaṃ u pūṣā no astu śaṃ no bhavitraṃ śaṃ vastu vāyuḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ viṣṇuḥ śam u pūṣā naḥ astu śam naḥ bhavitram śam vastu vāyuḥ
translated: May Vishnu be auspicious to us, and may Pusan be auspicious to us, may Bhaga be auspicious to us, and may Vayu be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ no devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇaḥ śaṃ no bhavantūṣaso vibhātīḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇaḥ śam naḥ bhavantu uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ
translated: May the god Savitar, the protector, be auspicious to us, and may the shining dawns be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ parjanyo bhavatu prajābhyaḥ śaṃ naḥkṣetrasya patirastu śambhuḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ parjanyaḥ bhavatu prajābhyaḥ śam naḥ kṣetrasya patiḥ astu śambhuḥ
translated: May Parjanya be auspicious to us for the sake of offspring, and may the auspicious lord of the field be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ no devā viśvadevā bhavantu śaṃ sarasvatī saha dhībhirastu
analyzed: śam naḥ devāḥ viśva devāḥ bhavantu śam sarasvatī saha dhībhiḥ astu
translated: May the gods, all the gods, be auspicious to us, and may Sarasvati be auspicious with the hymns.

original: śamabhiṣācaḥ śamu rātiṣācaḥ śaṃ no divyāḥ pārthivāḥ śaṃ no apyāḥ
analyzed: śam abhiṣācaḥ śam u rātiṣācaḥ śam naḥ divyāḥ pārthivāḥ śam naḥ apyāḥ
translated: May the bestowers of gifts be auspicious, and may the givers of wealth be auspicious, may the heavenly ones be auspicious to us, and may the earthly ones be auspicious to us, and may the watery ones be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ naḥ satyasya patayo bhavantu śaṃ no arvantaḥ śamu santu gāvaḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ satyasya patayaḥ bhavantu śam naḥ arvantaḥ śamu santu gāvaḥ
translated: May the lords of truth be auspicious to us, and may the horses be auspicious to us, and may the cows be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ na ṛbhavaḥ sukṛtaḥ suhastāḥ śaṃ no bhavantu pitaro haveṣu🔽śaṃ no aja ekapād devo astu śaṃ no 'hirbudhnyaḥ śaṃ samudraḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ ṛbhavaḥ su kṛtaḥ su hastāḥ śam naḥ bhavantu pitaraḥ haveṣu  śam naḥ ajaḥ ekapād devaḥ astu śam naḥ hirbudhnyaḥ śam samudraḥ
translated: May the well-made, well-handed Rbhus be auspicious to us, and may the fathers be auspicious to us in the offerings.🔽May the one-footed god Aja be auspicious to us, may Ahi Budhnya be auspicious to us, and may the ocean be auspicious to us.

original: śaṃ no apāṃ napāt perurastu śaṃ naḥ pṛśnirbhavatu devagopā
analyzed: śam naḥ apām napāt peruḥ astu śam naḥ pṛśniḥ bhavatu deva gopā
translated: May the son of the waters, the swift one, be auspicious to us, and may the dappled one, protected by the gods, be auspicious to us.

original: ādityā rudrā vasavo juṣantedaṃ brahma kriyamāṇaṃ navīyaḥ
analyzed: ādityāḥ rudrāḥ vasavaḥ juṣanta idam brahma kriyamāṇam navīyaḥ
translated: May the Adityas, Rudras, and Vasus accept this new prayer being made.

original: śṛṇvantu ni divyāḥ pārthivāso gojātā uta ye yajñiyāsaḥ
analyzed: śṛṇvantu ni divyāḥ pārthivāsaḥ go jātāḥ uta ye yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: May the heavenly ones, the earthly ones, and those born from the cow, and those worthy of sacrifice, listen.

original: ye devānāṃ yajñiyā yajñiyānāṃ manoryajatrā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ
analyzed: ye devānām yajñiyāḥ yajñiyānām manoḥ yajatrāḥ amṛtāḥ ṛta jñāḥ
translated: Those who are of the gods, the worthy ones of the worthy, the holy ones of the mind, the immortal ones who know the truth,

original: te no rāsantāmurugāyamadya yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: te naḥ rāsantām uru gāyam adya yūyam pāta
translated: may they grant us wide space today. You, protect us.

original: pra brahmaitu sadanād ṛtasya vi raśmibhiḥ sasṛje sūryo gāḥ
analyzed: pra brahmā etu sadanāt ṛtasya vi raśmibhiḥ sasṛje sūryaḥ gāḥ
translated: Let the prayer go forth from the seat of truth. The sun has created the cows with his rays.

original: vi sānunā pṛthivī sasra urvī pṛthu pratīkamadhyedhe agniḥ🔽imāṃ vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā suvṛktimiṣaṃ na kṛṇve asurā navīyaḥ🔽ino vāmanyaḥ padavīradabdho janaṃ ca mitro yatati bruvāṇaḥ
analyzed: vi sānunā pṛthivī sasre urvī pṛthu pratīkam adhyedhe agniḥ  imām vām mitrāvaruṇā suvṛk timiṣam na kṛṇve asurāḥ navīyaḥ  inaḥ vāmanyaḥ pada vīra dabdhaḥ janam ca mitraḥ yatati bruvāṇaḥ
translated: The earth has spread out with its broad back. In the middle they have placed the wide-spreading Agni.🔽I make this good hymn for you, O Mitra-Varuṇa, a new food for the immortal ones.🔽The one who is not to be deceived, O Mitra, the one who extends your paths, the one who speaks, strives for the people.

original: ā vātasya dhrajato ranta ityā apīpayanta dhenavo na sūdāḥ
analyzed: ā vātasya dhrajataḥ rante ityāḥ apīpayanta dhenavaḥ na sūdāḥ
translated: The cows have filled him, as it were, the swift-moving Vāyu, like milch cows their pail.
