original: maho divaḥ sadane jāyamāno 'cikradad vṛṣabhaḥ sasminnūdhan
analyzed: mahaḥ divaḥ sadane jāyamānaḥ cikradat vṛṣabhaḥ sasmin ūdhan
translated: The bull has bellowed in his own womb, being born in the great abode of heaven.

original: girā ya etā yunajad dharī ta indra priyā surathā śūra dhāyū
analyzed: girā yaḥ etā yunajat harī te indra priyā su rathā śūra dhāyū
translated: He who has yoked these dear ones of yours, O Indra, the strong-winged swift chariots, O hero,

original: pra yo manyuṃ ririkṣato minātyā sukratumaryamaṇaṃ vavṛtyām
analyzed: pra yaḥ manyum ririkṣataḥ mināti ā sukratum aryamaṇam vavṛtyām
translated: I will turn away the angry one who would destroy the one of good thoughts, the one who would oppress the noble one.

original: yajante asya sakhyaṃ vayaśca namasvinaḥ sva ṛtasya dhāman
analyzed: yajante asya sakhyam vayaḥ ca namasvinaḥ sve ṛtasya dhāman
translated: They worship his friendship and power, the humble ones, in the abode of his own truth.

original: vi pṛkṣo bābadhe nṛbhi stavāna idaṃ namo rudrāya preṣṭham
analyzed: vi pṛkṣaḥ bābadhe nṛbhiḥ stavānaḥ idam namaḥ rudrāya preṣṭham
translated: He has destroyed the food with the men, this homage to Rudra, the most beloved.

original: ā yat sākaṃ yaśaso vāvaśānāḥ sarasvatī saptathī sindhumātā
analyzed: ā yat sākam yaśasaḥ vāvaśānāḥ sarasvatī saptathī sindhu mātā
translated: When the roaring ones, together with glory, the seven-flowing Sarasvatī, the mother of the rivers,

original: yāḥ suṣvayanta sudughāḥ sudhārā abhi svena payasā pīpyānāḥ
analyzed: yāḥ su dughāḥ su dhārāḥ abhi svena payasā pīpyānāḥ
translated: The well-milked ones who are milked well, with good streams, swelling with their own milk,

original: uta tye no maruto mandasānā dhiyaṃ tokaṃ ca vājino 'vantu
analyzed: uta tye naḥ marutaḥ mandasānāḥ dhiyam tokam ca vājinaḥ vantu
translated: And may those very same Maruts, rejoicing, protect our thought and offspring, O mighty ones.

original: mā naḥ pari khyadakṣarā carantyavīvṛdhan yujyaṃ te rayiṃ naḥ
analyzed: mā naḥ pari khyat akṣarā carantī avīvṛdhan yujyam te rayim naḥ
translated: Let not the words that wander around deceive us. We have increased your wealth that is to be yoked.

original: pra vo mahīmaramatiṃ kṛṇudhvaṃ pra pūṣaṇaṃ vidathyaṃ na vīram
analyzed: pra vaḥ mahīmaramatim kṛṇudhvam pra pūṣaṇam vidathyam na vīram
translated: Make your great hymn for you, make Pūṣan the hero who frequents the assembly,

original: bhagaṃ dhiyo 'vitāraṃ no asyāḥ sātau vājaṃ rātiṣācaṃ purandhim
analyzed: bhagam dhiyaḥ vitāram naḥ asyāḥ sātau vājam rātiṣācam purandhim
translated: Bhaga, the leader of our thoughts in this contest, the bountiful one, the winner of booty, the rich one.

original: achāyaṃ vo marutaḥ śloka etvachā viṣṇuṃ niṣiktapāmavobhiḥ🔽uta prajāyai gṛṇate vayo dhuryūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: acha ayam vaḥ marutaḥ ślokaḥ etu achā viṣṇum niṣikta pāmavobhiḥ  uta prajāyai gṛṇate vayaḥ dhuḥ yūyam pāta
translated: Let this hymn of ours come to you, O Maruts, let it come to Viṣṇu with the sprinkled (waters),🔽And for offspring to the singing one, O you who carry strength. Protect us, O you who carry strength.

original: ā vo vāhiṣṭho vahatu stavadhyai ratho vājā ṛbhukṣaṇo amṛktaḥ
analyzed: ā vaḥ vāhiṣṭhaḥ vahatu stavadhyai rathaḥ vājāḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ amṛktaḥ
translated: May your best bearer carry you for praise, the chariot, O mighty ones, unhindered, rich in treasures,

original: abhi tripṛṣṭhaiḥ savaneṣu somairmade suśiprā mahabhiḥ pṛṇadhvam
analyzed: abhi tri pṛṣṭhaiḥ savaneṣu somaiḥ made su śiprāḥ mahabhiḥ pṛṇadhvam
translated: With the three-backed (chariots) at the libations, with the Soma, O you with beautiful eyebrows, with the great (waters), fill yourselves.

original: yūyaṃ ha ratnaṃ maghavatsu dhattha svardṛśa ṛbhukṣaṇo amṛktam
analyzed: yūyam ha ratnam maghavatsu dhattha svar dṛśaḥ ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ amṛktam
translated: You indeed place treasure among the generous ones, O you who carry strength, the unobstructed one, which sees the heaven.

original: saṃ yajñeṣu svadhāvantaḥ pibadhvaṃ vi no rādhāṃsi matibhirdayadhvam
analyzed: sam yajñeṣu svadhāvantaḥ pibadhvam vi naḥ rādhāṃsi matibhiḥ dayadhvam
translated: At sacrifices, ye who are rich in your own power, drink ye; with your thoughts show us favour and bestow gifts on us.

original: uvocitha hi maghavan deṣṇaṃ maho arbhasya vasuno vibhāge
analyzed: uvocitha hi maghavan deṣṇam mahaḥ arbhasya vasunaḥ vibhāge
translated: For thou hast spoken, O bountiful one, of the bestowal of wealth in the distribution of the great and the small.

original: ubhā te pūrṇā vasunā gabhastī na sūnṛtā ni yamate vasavyā
analyzed: ubhā te pūrṇā vasunā gabhastī na sūnṛtā ni yamate vasavyā
translated: Both thy hands are full of wealth; no good will is withheld from thee, O bountiful one.

original: tvamindra svayaśā ṛbhukṣā vājo na sādhurastameṣy ṛkvā
analyzed: tvam indra sva yaśāḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ vājaḥ na sādhuḥ astam eṣi ṛkvā
translated: Thou, O Indra, art self-famous, a consumer of food, a steed to be invoked, a good friend to be approached.

original: vayaṃ nu te dāśvāṃsaḥ syāma brahma kṛṇvanto harivo vasiṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: vayam nu te dāśvāṃsaḥ syāma brahma kṛṇvantaḥ harivas vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: May we be thy worshippers, O thou of tawny steeds, O Vasishṭhas, offering prayer and invoking thee.

original: sanitāsi pravato dāśuṣe cid yābhirviveṣo haryaśva dhībhiḥ🔽vavanmā nu te yujyābhirūtī kadā na indra rāya ā daśasyeḥ
analyzed: sanitāsi pravataḥ dāśuṣe cit yābhiḥ viveṣaḥ haryaśva dhībhiḥ  vavanma nu te yujyā abhirūtī kadā naḥ indra rāyaḥ ā daśasyeḥ
translated: Thou art the fulfiller of the wishes of the liberal worshipper, O thou of tawny steeds, by whom thou hast entered (our hearts).🔽Do thou, O Indra, favour us with thy most helpful aids: when wilt thou show us favour, O Indra, with wealth?

original: vāsayasīva vedhasastvaṃ naḥ kadā na indra vacaso bubodhaḥ🔽astaṃ tātyā dhiyā rayiṃ suvīraṃ pṛkṣo no arvā nyuhīta vājī
analyzed: vāsayasi iva vedhasaḥ tvam naḥ kadā naḥ indra vacasaḥ bubodhaḥ  astam tātyā dhiyā rayim su vīram pṛkṣaḥ naḥ arvā nyuhīta vājī
translated: Thou dwellest, as it were, with the creators, O thou of tawny steeds: when wilt thou, O Indra, understand our words?🔽Let the strong steed, the food, come to us from afar, as if urged on by the thought of the bountiful one, to bestow wealth with good heroes.

original: abhi yaṃ devī nirṛtiścidīśe nakṣanta indraṃ śaradaḥsupṛkṣaḥ
analyzed: abhi yam devī nirṛtiḥ cit īśe nakṣante indram śaradaḥ su pṛkṣaḥ
translated: Whom even the goddess Nirrti obeys, to whom the autumn months come, well-filled, to Indra.

original: upa tribandhurjaradaṣṭimetyasvaveśaṃ yaṃ kṛṇavanta martāḥ
analyzed: upa tribandhuḥ jaradaṣṭim etya sva veśam yam kṛṇavanta martāḥ
translated: The mortal men have made him their own, whom the three-born one has approached, the one with long sight.

original: ā no rādhāṃsi savitaḥ stavadhyā ā rāyo yantu parvatasyarātau🔽sadā no divyaḥ pāyuḥ siṣaktu yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: ā naḥ rādhāṃsi savitar stavadhyai ā rāyaḥ yantu parvatasya rātau  sadā naḥ divyaḥ pāyuḥ siṣaktu yūyam pāta
translated: O Savitar, let your gifts be praised, let our riches come in the gift of Parvata.🔽May the heavenly protector always be with us. You, protect us.

original: udu ṣya devaḥ savitā yayāma hiraṇyayīmamatiṃ yāmaśiśret
analyzed: udu sya devaḥ savitā yayāma hiraṇyayīm amatim yām aśiśret
translated: Savitar, the god, has lifted up the golden thought which he has conceived.

original: nūnaṃ bhago havyo mānuṣebhirvi yo ratnā purūvasurdadhāti
analyzed: nūnam bhagaḥ havyaḥ mānuṣebhiḥ vi yaḥ ratnā purūvasuḥ dadhāti
translated: Now Bhaga, who distributes abundant wealth, is to be invoked by men.

original: udu tiṣṭha savitaḥ śrudhyasya hiraṇyapāṇe prabhṛtāv ṛtasya🔽vyurvīṃ pṛthvīmamatiṃ sṛjāna ā nṛbhyo martabhojanaṃ suvānaḥ
analyzed: udu tiṣṭha savitar śrudhyasya hiraṇya pāṇe prabhṛtau ṛtasya  vi urvīm pṛthvīm amatim sṛjānaḥ ā nṛbhyaḥ marta bhojanam suvānaḥ
translated: Rise up, O Savitar, be ready, O thou with golden hands, at the beginning of the rite.🔽Creating the wide, extended thought, bestowing on men the enjoyment of life.

original: api ṣṭutaḥ savitā devo astu yamā cid viśve vasavo gṛṇanti🔽sa na stomān namasyaścano dhād viśvebhiḥ pātu pāyubhirni sūrīn
analyzed: api stutaḥ savitā devaḥ astu yamā cit viśve vasavaḥ gṛṇanti  sa naḥ stomān namasyaścanaḥ dhāt viśvebhiḥ pātu pāyubhiḥ ni sūrīn
translated: May the praised Savitar, the god, be with us, whom all the Vasus and the Vishvedevas sing.🔽May he, to be worshipped by the hymns, grant us what we desire, and protect the princes with all his protecting powers.

original: abhi yaṃ devyaditirgṛṇāti savaṃ devasya saviturjuṣāṇā
analyzed: abhi yam devī aditiḥ gṛṇāti savam devasya savituḥ juṣāṇā
translated: Whom the divine Aditi praises, accepting the rite of the god Savitar,

original: abhi samrājo varuṇo gṛṇantyabhi mitrāso aryamā sajoṣāḥ
analyzed: abhi samrājaḥ varuṇaḥ gṛṇanti abhi mitrāsaḥ aryamā sajoṣāḥ
translated: The royal Varuna sings, the Mitra-Aryaman in unison.

original: abhi ye mitho vanuṣaḥ sapante rātiṃ divo rātiṣācaḥ pṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: abhi ye mithas vanuṣaḥ sapante rātim divaḥ rātiṣācaḥ pṛthivyāḥ
translated: Whom the mutually contending ones, the givers of gifts from heaven and earth, desire.

original: ahirbudhnya uta naḥ śṛṇotu varūtryekadhenubhirni pātu
analyzed: ahirbudhnyaḥ uta naḥ śṛṇotu varūtrī ekadhenubhiḥ ni pātu
translated: May Ahi Budhnya listen to us, may Varuna protect us with the Ekadhenu (penance).

original: anu tan no jāspatirmaṃsīṣṭa ratnaṃ devasya savituriyānaḥ
analyzed: anu tat naḥ jāspatiḥ maṃsīṣṭa ratnam devasya savituḥ iyānaḥ
translated: May our lord of the house think of that, seeking the treasure of god Savitar.

original: bhagamugro 'vase johavīti bhagamanugro adha yāti ratnam
analyzed: bhagam ugraḥ vase johavīti bhagam anugraḥ adha yāti ratnam
translated: The mighty one calls for Bhaga's help, the one without Bhaga goes for the treasure.

original: śaṃ no bhavantu vājino haveṣu devatātā mitadravaḥ svarkāḥ
analyzed: śam naḥ bhavantu vājinaḥ haveṣu devatātā mitadravaḥ su arkāḥ
translated: May the strong ones be auspicious to us in our invocations, the gods' companions, the well-ordered ones, the noble ones.

original: jambhayanto 'hiṃ vṛkaṃ rakṣāṃsi sanemyasmad yuyavannamīvāḥ
analyzed: jambhayantaḥ him vṛkam rakṣāṃsi sanemi asmat yuyavan amīvāḥ
translated: Crushing the serpent, the wolf, the Raksases, may they drive away evil from us.

original: vājevāje 'vata vājino no dhaneṣu viprā amṛtā ṛtajñāḥ
analyzed: vājevāje vata vājinaḥ naḥ dhaneṣu viprāḥ amṛtāḥ ṛta jñāḥ
translated: In every contest, O strong ones, help us in our battles, O immortal sages who know the truth.

original: asya madhvaḥ pibata mādayadhvaṃ tṛptā yāta pathibhirdevayānaiḥ
analyzed: asya madhvaḥ pibata mādayadhvam tṛptāḥ yāta pathibhiḥ deva yānaiḥ
translated: Drink of this mead and rejoice; satisfied, go on the paths of the gods.

original: ūrdhvo agniḥ sumatiṃ vasvo aśret pratīcī jūrṇirdevatātimeti🔽bhejāte adrī rathyeva panthām ṛtaṃ hotā na iṣito yajāti
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ agniḥ sumatim vasvaḥ aśret pratīcī jūrṇiḥ devatātim eti  bhejāte adrī rathyā iva panthām ṛtam hotā naḥ iṣitaḥ yajāti
translated: Agni has risen high, seeking the favor of wealth; the western fire goes to meet the gods.🔽The two Adhvaryus have joined, like two chariot-riders on the path; the priest of truth is sent to sacrifice.

original: pra vāvṛje suprayā barhireṣāmā viśpatīva bīriṭa iyāte
analyzed: pra vāvṛje su prayāḥ barhiḥ eṣāmā viśpatī iva bīriṭe iyāte
translated: They have spread out their excellent grass; the lords of the people have come, like heroes.

original: viśāmaktoruṣasaḥ pūrvahūtau vāyuḥ pūṣā svastaye niyutvān
analyzed: viśām aktoḥ uṣasaḥ pūrva hūtau vāyuḥ pūṣā svastaye niyutvān
translated: At the dawn's first invocation of the people, Vayu and Pusan with their team are for our welfare.

original: jmayā atra vasavo ranta devā urāvantarikṣe marjayanta śubhrāḥ
analyzed: jma yāḥ atra vasavaḥ ranta devāḥ urau antarikṣe marjayanta śubhrāḥ
translated: Here the earth-born gods have rejoiced, the bright ones are purified in the wide atmosphere.

original: arvāk patha urujrayaḥ kṛṇudhvaṃ śrotā dūtasya jagmuṣo no asya
analyzed: arvāk pathaḥ uru jrayaḥ kṛṇudhvam śrota dūtasya jagmuṣaḥ naḥ asya
translated: Make the path downward, O ye of wide paths; hear this our envoy who has come to you.

original: te hi yajñeṣu yajñiyāsa ūmāḥ sadhasthaṃ viśve abhi santi devāḥ🔽tānadhvara uśato yakṣyagne śruṣṭī bhagaṃ nāsatyā purandhim
analyzed: te hi yajñeṣu yajñiyāsaḥ ūmāḥ sadhastham viśve abhi santi devāḥ  tān adhvare uśataḥ yakṣi agne śruṣṭī bhagam nāsatyā purandhim
translated: For they, the holy ones at sacrifices, all the gods attend the assembly together.🔽To those who long for worship, O Agni, bring Varuṇa, Bhaga, the Nāsatyas, Purandhi.

original: āgne giro diva ā pṛthivyā mitraṃ vaha varuṇamindramagnim
analyzed: ā agne giraḥ divaḥ ā pṛthivyāḥ mitram vaha varuṇam indram agnim
translated: Bring the songs, O Agni, from the sky and earth, bring Mitra, Varuṇa, Indra, Agni,

original: āryamaṇamaditiṃ viṣṇumeṣāṃ sarasvatī maruto mādayantām
analyzed: ā aryamaṇam aditim viṣṇum eṣām sarasvatī marutaḥ mādayantām
translated: Aryaman, Aditi, Viṣṇu, may these Sarasvatī and the Maruts rejoice.

original: rare havyaṃ matibhiryajñiyānāṃ nakṣat kāmaṃ martyānāmasinvan
analyzed: rare havyam matibhiḥ yajñiyānām nakṣat kāmam martyānām asinvan
translated: Let him spread the offering with the thoughts of the holy ones, may he fulfill the desire of mortals, unwearied.

original: dhātā rayimavidasyaṃ sadāsāṃ sakṣīmahi yujyebhirnu devaiḥ
analyzed: dhāta rayim avidasyam sadāsām sakṣīmahi yujyebhiḥ nu devaiḥ
translated: May we obtain wealth, O Dhatr, the unconquered one of all people, with the helpful gods.

original: nū rodasī abhiṣṭute vasiṣṭhairṛtāvāno varuṇo mitro agniḥ
analyzed: nu rodasī abhiṣṭute vasiṣṭhaiḥ ṛtāvānaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ
translated: Now may the two worlds be praised by the best singers, Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni, rich in truth,

original: yachantu candrā upamaṃ no arkaṃ yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: yacchantu candrāḥ upamam naḥ arkam yūyam pāta
translated: May the Chandras grant us a praiseworthy hymn. You, protect us...

original: o śruṣṭirvidathyā sametu prati stomaṃ dadhīmahi turāṇām
analyzed: ā u śruṣṭiḥ vidathyā sametu prati stomam dadhīmahi turāṇām
translated: O Śruṣṭi, may she come to the assembly, let us conceive the praise of the impetuous ones.

original: yadadya devaḥ savitā suvāti syāmāsya ratnino vibhāge
analyzed: yat adya devaḥ savitā suvāti syāma asya ratninaḥ vibhāge
translated: What the god Savitar now impels, may we be in his possession of riches.

original: mitrastan no varuṇo rodasī ca dyubhaktamindro aryamā dadātu
analyzed: mitraḥ tat naḥ varuṇaḥ rodasī ca dyu bhaktam indraḥ aryamā dadātu
translated: May Mitra, Varuṇa, and the two worlds, Indra, and Aryaman grant us that.

original: dideṣṭu devyaditī rekṇo vāyuśca yan niyuvaite bhagaśca
analyzed: dideṣṭu devī aditiḥ rekṇaḥ vāyuḥ ca yat niyuvā ete bhagaḥ ca
translated: May the divine Aditi, the wealth, and Vāyu and Bhaga, when they are yoked, grant it.

original: sedugro astu marutaḥ sa śuṣmī yaṃ martyaṃ pṛṣadaśvā avātha
analyzed: sa idugraḥ astu marutaḥ sa śuṣmī yam martyam pṛṣat aśvāḥ avātha
translated: Be fierce and strong, O Maruts, he whom ye have helped, O ye with spotted horses, that mortal man

original: utemagniḥ sarasvatī junanti na tasya rāyaḥ paryetāsti
analyzed: uta īm agniḥ sarasvatī junanti na tasya rāyaḥ paryetā asti
translated: Even him Agni and Sarasvatî incite: there is no limit to his wealth.

original: ayaṃ hi netā varuṇa ṛtasya mitro rājāno aryamāpo dhuḥ
analyzed: ayam hi netā varuṇaḥ ṛtasya mitraḥ rājānaḥ aryamā apaḥ dhuḥ
translated: For he is the leader, O Varuna, of holy order; Mitra, Aryamaṇ, and the kings have borne him.

original: suhavā devyaditiranarvā te no aṃho ati parṣannariṣṭān
analyzed: su havā devī aditiḥ anarvā te naḥ aṃhaḥ ati parṣan ariṣṭān
translated: The friendly Goddess Aditi, the unassailable, may carry us over his woe to what is free from danger.

original: asya devasya mīḷhuṣo vayā viṣṇoreṣasya prabhṛthe havirbhiḥ
analyzed: asya devasya mīḍhuṣaḥ vayāḥ viṣṇoḥ eṣasya prabhṛthe havirbhiḥ
translated: For this God who is bountiful, the mighty one, the all-surpassing, with oblations at his feast

original: vide hi rudro rudriyaṃ mahitvaṃ yāsiṣṭaṃ vartiraśvināvirāvat
analyzed: vide hi rudraḥ rudriyam mahi tvam yāsiṣṭam vartiḥ aśvinā virāvat
translated: Let Rudra know his own great Rudra-power. Come hither, O ye Aśvins, to the dwelling-place.

original: mātra pūṣannāghṛṇa irasyo varūtrī yad rātiṣācaśca rāsan
analyzed: mā atra pūṣan āghṛṇaḥ irasyaḥ varūtrī yat rātiṣācaḥ ca rāsan
translated: Be not wroth, O Pūṣan, O thou who art free from hate. May the bountiful one and the bountiful ones come to us.

original: mayobhuvo no arvanto ni pāntu vṛṣṭiṃ parijmā vāto dadātu
analyzed: mayobhuvaḥ naḥ arvantaḥ ni pāntu vṛṣṭim parijmā vātaḥ dadātu
translated: May the well-being-giving horses protect us. May the wind that goes round about give rain.

original: nū rodasī / / /
analyzed: nu rodasī
translated: Now may the two world-halves...

original: prātaragniṃ prātarindraṃ havāmahe prātarmitrāvaruṇāprātaraśvinā
analyzed: prātar agnim prātar indram havāmahe prātar mitrāvaruṇā prātar aśvinā
translated: In the morning we call on Agni, in the morning on Indra, in the morning on Mitra-Varuṇa, in the morning on the Aśvins,

original: prātarbhagaṃ pūṣaṇaṃ brahmaṇas patiṃ prātaḥ somamuta rudraṃ huvema
analyzed: prātar bhagam pūṣaṇam brahmaṇaḥ patim prātar somam uta rudram huvema
translated: In the morning on Bhaga, on Pūṣan, on the lord of prayer, in the morning on Soma, and on Rudra we invoke.

original: prātarjitaṃ bhagamugraṃ huvema vayaṃ putramaditeryo vidhartā
analyzed: prātar jitam bhagam ugram huvema vayam putram aditeḥ yaḥ vidhartā
translated: In the morning let us invoke the victorious Bhaga, the mighty one, the son of Aditi, the disposer.

original: ādhraścid yaṃ manyamānasturaścid rājā cid yaṃ bhagaṃ bhakṣītyāha
analyzed: ādhraḥ cit yam manyamānaḥ turaḥ cit rājā cit yam bhagam bhakṣi iti āha
translated: Even the poor one who thinks of you, the rich one, even the king who says, 'I will enjoy you, O Bhaga.'

original: bhaga praṇetarbhaga satyarādho bhagemāṃ dhiyamudavā dadan naḥ
analyzed: bhaga praṇetar bhaga satya rādhaḥ bhaga imām dhiyam udavā dadan naḥ
translated: O Bhaga, leader, Bhaga whose prayers are true, grant us this thought, O Bhaga.

original: bhaga pra ṇo janaya gobhiraśvairbhaga pra nṛbhirnṛvantaḥ syāma
analyzed: bhaga pra naḥ janaya gobhiḥ aśvaiḥ bhaga pra nṛbhiḥ nṛvantaḥ syāma
translated: O Bhaga, generate us with cattle and horses. O Bhaga, may we be prosperous with men.

original: utedānīṃ bhagavantaḥ syāmota prapitva uta madhye ahnām
analyzed: uta idānīm bhagavantaḥ syāma uta prapitve uta madhye ahnām
translated: May we be prosperous now, and in the evening, and in the middle of the day.

original: utoditā maghavan sūryasya vayaṃ devānāṃ sumatau syāma🔽bhaga eva bhagavānastu devāstena vayaṃ bhagavantaḥ syāma
analyzed: uta uditā maghavan sūryasya vayam devānām sumatau syāma  bhagaḥ eva bhagavān astu devāḥ tena vayam bhagavantaḥ syāma
translated: And when the sun has risen, O bountiful one, may we be in the favor of the gods.🔽May Bhaga alone be the prosperous one among the gods. By him may we be prosperous.

original: taṃ tvā bhaga sarva ijjohavīti sa no bhaga puraetā bhaveha
analyzed: tam tvā bhaga sarvaḥ id johavīti sa naḥ bhaga puraetā bhava iha
translated: You, O Bhaga, all invoke. Be you our leader, O Bhaga.

original: samadhvarāyoṣaso namanta dadhikrāveva śucaye padāya
analyzed: sam adhvarāya uṣasaḥ namanta dadhikrāvā iva śucaye padāya
translated: The dawns bow to him for the performance of the sacrifice, like Dadhikrâvan to the pure path.

original: arvācīnaṃ vasuvidaṃ bhagaṃ no rathamivāśvā vājina ā vahantu
analyzed: arvācīnam vasu vidam bhagam naḥ ratham iva aśvāḥ vājinaḥ ā vahantu
translated: Let them bring to us Bhaga, the finder of wealth, as on a chariot, the strong horses.

original: aśvāvatīrgomatīrna uṣāso vīravatīḥ sadamuchantu bhadrāḥ
analyzed: aśvāvatīḥ gomatīḥ naḥ uṣāsaḥ vīravatīḥ sadam ucchantu bhadrāḥ
translated: May the blessed dawns rise for us always, rich in horses, rich in cattle, rich in heroes.

original: ghṛtaṃ duhānā viśvataḥ prapītā yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: ghṛtam duhānāḥ viśvatas prapītāḥ yūyam pāta
translated: Pouring ghee from all sides. You, protect us.

original: pra brahmāṇo aṅgiraso nakṣanta pra krandanurnabhanyasya vetu
analyzed: pra brahmāṇaḥ aṅgirasaḥ nakṣanta pra krandanuḥ nabhanyasya vetu
translated: The Brahmans, the Angirases, have come. Let the roar of the cloud go forth.

original: pra dhenava udapruto navanta yujyātāmadrī adhvarasya peśaḥ
analyzed: pra dhenavaḥ uda prutaḥ navanta yujyātāmadrī adhvarasya peśaḥ
translated: Let the milch-kine lowing to their young ones sing forth, and let the two wings of the sacrifice be yoked.

original: sugaste agne sanavitto adhvā yukṣvā sute harito rohitaśca
analyzed: sugaḥ te agne sanavittaḥ adhvā yukṣva sute haritaḥ rohitaḥ ca
translated: Easy for thee is the path, O Agni, to travel, to win wealth: yoke thy two ruddy steeds and thy red one.

original: ye vā sadmannaruṣā vīravāho huve devānāṃ janimānisattaḥ
analyzed: ye vā sadman aruṣā vīra vāhaḥ huve devānām janimā anisattar
translated: Or, O thou who carriest the ruddy steeds, who sittest in the house, borne by red horses, invited, to the generations of the Gods, call them.

original: samu vo yajñaṃ mahayan namobhiḥ pra hotā mandro ririca upāke
analyzed: samu vaḥ yajñam mahayan namobhiḥ pra hotā mandraḥ ririce upāke
translated: Exalting your sacrifice with adorations, the delightful Priest hath slipped away to the near side.

original: yajasva su purvaṇīka devānā yajñiyāmaramatiṃ vavṛtyāḥ
analyzed: yajasva su purvaṇīka devānā yajñiya amaramatim vavṛtyāḥ
translated: Worship the Gods, O thou of fair rites, turn away the wrath of the immortal ones.

original: yadā vīrasya revato duroṇe syonaśīratithirāciketat
analyzed: yadā vīrasya revataḥ duroṇe syona śīḥ atithiḥ āciketat
translated: When the prosperous guest, O house of the hero, hath been invited, hath been pointed out,

original: suprīto agniḥ sudhito dama ā sa viśe dāti vāryamiyatyai
analyzed: su prītaḥ agniḥ sudhitaḥ dame ā sa viśe dāti vāryam iyatyai
translated: Well-pleased, Agni, well-disposed in the house, give to the people wealth for this (sacrifice).

original: imaṃ no agne adhvaraṃ juṣasva marutsvindre yaśasaṃ kṛdhī naḥ
analyzed: imam naḥ agne adhvaram juṣasva marutsu indre yaśasam kṛdhī naḥ
translated: Accept this sacrifice of ours, O Agni, make it glorious among the Maruts, among Indra.

original: ā naktā barhiḥ sadatāmuṣāsośantā mitrāvaruṇāyajeha
analyzed: ā naktā barhiḥ sadatām uṣāsā uśantā mitrāvaruṇā āyaja iha
translated: Let the night and the dawn sit on the sacred grass: be joyful, O Mitra-Varuṇa, and worship here.

original: evāgniṃ sahasyaṃ vasiṣṭho rāyaskāmo viśvapsnyasya staut🔽iṣaṃ rayiṃ paprathad vājamasme yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: eva agnim sahasyam vasiṣṭhaḥ rāyaskāmaḥ viśvapsnyasya staut  iṣam rayim paprathat vājam asme yūyam pāta
translated: Thus Vasishtha, longing for wealth, hath praised this Agni, the conqueror, the all-impelling.🔽Spread food, wealth, and strength among us. Do ye all protect us.

original: pra vo yajñeṣu devayanto arcan dyāvā namobhiḥ prithivī iṣadhyai
analyzed: pra vaḥ yajñeṣu devayantaḥ arcan dyāvā namobhiḥ prithivī iṣadhyai
translated: The pious, worshipping you in sacrifices, with adorations seek to win food from heaven and earth.

original: yeṣāṃ brahmāṇyasamāni viprā viṣvag viyanti vanino na śākhāḥ🔽pra yajña etu hetvo na saptirud yachadhvaṃ samanaso ghṛtācīḥ
analyzed: yeṣām brahmāṇi asamāni viprāḥ viṣvak viyanti vaninaḥ na śākhāḥ  pra yajñaḥ etu hetvaḥ na saptiḥ ud yacchadhvam samanasaḥ ghṛtācīḥ
translated: Whose Brahmans are unequalled, O priests, which spread in all directions like the branches of trees🔽Let the sacrifice go forth like a chariot, raise up the thoughts, the ghee-filled ones

original: stṛṇīta barhiradhvarāya sādhūrdhvā śocīṃṣi devayūnyasthuḥ
analyzed: stṛṇīta barhiḥ adhvarāya sādhu ūrdhvā śocīṃṣi devayūni asthuḥ
translated: Spread the sacred grass well for the sacrifice, the flames pointing upwards are god-appointed

original: ā putrāso na mātaraṃ vibhṛtrāḥ sānau devāso barhiṣaḥsadantu
analyzed: ā putrāsaḥ na mātaram vibhṛtrāḥ sānau devāsaḥ barhiṣaḥ sadantu
translated: Like sons supporting their mother, may the gods sit on the lap of the sacrificial grass

original: ā viśvācī vidathyāmanaktvagne mā no devatātā mṛdhas kaḥ
analyzed: ā viśvācī vidathyām anaktu agne mā naḥ devatātā mṛdhaḥ kaḥ
translated: Anoint the all-pervading one who goes to the assembly, O Agni, let there be no strife among us, O god

original: te sīṣapanta joṣamā yajatrā ṛtasya dhārāḥ sudughā duhānāḥ
analyzed: te sīṣapanta joṣamāḥ yajatrāḥ ṛtasya dhārāḥ sudughāḥ duhānāḥ
translated: They have flowed to your acceptance, O worthy of sacrifice, the streams of truth, well-milked, are yielding milk

original: jyeṣṭhaṃ vo adya maha ā vasūnāmā gantana samanaso yati ṣṭha
analyzed: jyeṣṭham vaḥ adya mahaḥ ā vasū nāmā gantana samanasaḥ yati ṣṭha
translated: The best of your great riches today, come together with one mind, stand

original: evā no agne vikṣvā daśasya tvayā vayaṃ sahasāvannāskrāḥ
analyzed: eva naḥ agne vikṣva daśasya tvayā vayam sahasāvan āskrāḥ
translated: Thus, O Agni, be gracious to us in all places, through you, O victor, we are to be unconquered

original: rāyā yujā sadhamādo ariṣṭā yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: rāyā yujā sadhamādaḥ ariṣṭāḥ yūyam pāta
translated: With wealth as our companion, with undiminished joy, you, protect us...

original: dadhikrāṃ vaḥ prathamamaśvinoṣasamagniṃ samiddhaṃ bhagamūtaye huve
analyzed: dadhikrām vaḥ prathamam aśvinā uṣasam agnim samiddham bhagam ūtaye huve
translated: I invoke Dadhikrâvan, the first to be invoked of the Ashvins, Agni when kindled, Bhaga for help

original: indraṃ viṣṇuṃ pūṣaṇaṃ brahmaṇas patimādityān dyāvāpṛthivī apaḥ svaḥ
analyzed: indram viṣṇum pūṣaṇam brahmaṇaḥ patim ādityān dyāvāpṛthivī apaḥ svar
translated: Indra, Vishnu, Pûshan, the lord of prayer, the Âdityas, sky and earth, the waters, heaven.

original: dadhikrāmu namasā bodhayanta udīrāṇā yajñamupaprayantaḥ🔽iḷāṃ devīṃ barhiṣi sādayanto 'śvinā viprā suhavāhuvema
analyzed: dadhikrāmu namasā bodhayantaḥ udīrāṇāḥ yajñam upaprayantaḥ  iḷām devīm barhiṣi sādayantaḥ śvinā viprā su havā ahuvema
translated: We will awaken Dadhikrâvan with homage, rising and approaching the sacrifice.🔽Placing the divine Iḷâ on the sacred grass, we will call the two youthful Asvins, swift to hear.

original: dadhikrāvāṇaṃ bubudhāno agnimupa bruva uṣasaṃ sūryaṃ gām
analyzed: dadhikrāvāṇam bubudhānaḥ agnim upa bruve uṣasam sūryam gām
translated: Awakening to Dadhikrâvan, to Agni, I address the dawn, the sun, the cow.

original: bradhnaṃ māṃścatorvaruṇasya babhruṃ te viśvāsmad duritā yāvayantu
analyzed: bradhnam māṃścatoḥ varuṇasya babhrum te viśvā asmat duritā yāvayantu
translated: The ruddy one of Varuna, the bountiful, may they all remove all our evil.

original: dadhikrāvā prathamo vājyarvāgre rathānāṃ bhavati prajānan
analyzed: dadhikrāvā prathamaḥ vājī arvā agre rathānām bhavati prajānan
translated: Dadhikrâvan, the first swift steed, goes in front, knowing, of the chariots.

original: saṃvidāna uṣasā sūryeṇādityebhirvasubhiraṅgirobhiḥ
analyzed: saṃvidānaḥ uṣasā sūryeṇa ādityebhiḥ vasubhiḥ aṅgirobhiḥ
translated: In accord with the dawn, the sun, the Âdityas, the Vasus, and the Aṅgiras.

original: ā no dadhikrāḥ pathyāmanaktv ṛtasya panthāmanvetavā u
analyzed: ā naḥ dadhikrāḥ pathyām anaktu ṛtasya panthām anvetavai u
translated: May Dadhikrâvan anoint the path for us, the path of truth, to follow.

original: śṛṇotu no daivyaṃ śardho agniḥ śṛṇvantu viśve mahiṣāamūrāḥ
analyzed: śṛṇotu naḥ daivyam śardhaḥ agniḥ śṛṇvantu viśve mahiṣa amūrāḥ
translated: May the divine host, Agni, hear us; may all the mighty bulls hear us.

original: ā devo yātu savitā suratno 'ntarikṣaprā vahamāno aśvaiḥ
analyzed: ā devaḥ yātu savitā su ratnaḥ ntarikṣa prāḥ vahamānaḥ aśvaiḥ
translated: May the god Savitar come to us with good treasure, borne on his horses through the atmosphere.

original: haste dadhāno naryā purūṇi niveśayañca prasuvañca bhūma
analyzed: haste dadhānaḥ naryā purūṇi niveśayan ca prasuvan ca bhūma
translated: Holding in his hand many manly things, establishing and producing the earth.

original: udasya bāhū śithirā bṛhantā hiraṇyayā divo antānanaṣṭām
analyzed: udasya bāhū śithirā bṛhantā hiraṇyayā divaḥ anta ananaṣṭām
translated: His arms are raised, firm and vast, golden, reaching to the ends of the sky, not destroyed.

original: nūnaṃ so asya mahimā paniṣṭa sūraścidasmā anu dādapasyām
analyzed: nūnam saḥ asya mahimā paniṣṭa sūraḥ cit asmai anu dāt apasyām
translated: Surely his greatness is to be desired; even the sun has given him the highest place.

original: sa ghā no devaḥ savitā sahāvā sāviṣad vasupatirvasūni
analyzed: sa gha naḥ devaḥ savitā sahāvā sāviṣat vasu patiḥ vasūni
translated: May that God Savitar, the lord of treasures, grant us treasures, as a friend,

original: viśrayamāṇo amatimurūcīṃ martabhojanamadha rāsate naḥ
analyzed: viśrayamāṇaḥ amatim urūcīm marta bhojanam adha rāsate naḥ
translated: As he rests on the far-reaching prayer, may he grant us the food of mortals.

original: imā giraḥ savitāraṃ sujihvaṃ pūrṇagabhastimīḷate supāṇim
analyzed: imāḥ giraḥ savitāram su jihvam pūrṇa gabhastim īḍate su pāṇim
translated: These songs praise Savitar, the well-tongued one, with full rays, the good-handed one,

original: citraṃ vayo bṛhadasme dadhātu yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: citram vayaḥ bṛhat asme dadhātu yūyam pāta
translated: May he grant us wonderful great life. Do you protect us.

original: imā rudrāya sthiradhanvane giraḥ kṣipreṣave devāya svadhāvne
analyzed: imāḥ rudrāya sthiradhanvane giraḥ kṣipreṣave devāya svadhāvne
translated: These songs to Rudra, the firm-bowed one, to the swift-shooting God, the self-dependent one,

original: aṣāḷhāya sahamānāya vedhase tigmāyudhāya bharatā śṛṇotu naḥ
analyzed: aṣāḷhāya sahamānāya vedhase tigma āyudhāya bharatā śṛṇotu naḥ
translated: To the imperishable one, the conqueror, the creator, the sharp-weaponed one, may the Bharatas listen to us.

original: sa hi kṣayeṇa kṣamyasya janmanaḥ sāmrājyena divyasya cetati
analyzed: sa hi kṣayeṇa kṣamyasya janmanaḥ sāmrājyena divyasya cetati
translated: For he knows by the destruction of the perishable creation and by the sovereignty of the divine creation.

original: avannavantīrupa no duraścarānamīvo rudra jāsu no bhava
analyzed: avan avantīḥ upa naḥ duraḥ cara anamīvaḥ rudra jāsu naḥ bhava
translated: O Rudra, be free from disease among our people, and drive away the diseases that go about seeking.

original: yā te didyudavasṛṣṭā divas pari kṣmayā carati pari sāvṛṇaktu naḥ
analyzed: yā te didyut avasṛṣṭā divaḥ pari kṣmayā carati pari sā āvṛṇaktu naḥ
translated: That dart of yours which is sent forth from heaven, which moves about with swiftness, may it surround us.

original: sahasraṃ te svapivāta bheṣajā mā nastokeṣutanayeṣu rīriṣah
analyzed: sahasram te svapivāta bheṣajā mā naḥ tokeṣutanayeṣu rīriṣah
translated: May a thousand of your healing powers be with us. Do not afflict our children or offspring.

original: mā no vadhī rudra mā parā dā mā te bhūma prasitau hīḷitasya
analyzed: mā naḥ vadhīḥ rudra mā parā dāḥ mā te bhūma prasitau hīḍitasya
translated: Do not kill us, O Rudra, do not give us away. Let us not fall into the snare of your anger.

original: ā no bhaja barhiṣi jīvaśaṃse yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: ā naḥ bhaja barhiṣi jīva śaṃse yūyam pāta
translated: Share us on the sacrificial grass, for the good report of the living. Do you protect us.

original: āpo yaṃ vaḥ prathamaṃ devayanta indrapānamūrmimakṛṇvateḷaḥ
analyzed: āpaḥ yam vaḥ prathamam devayantaḥ indra pānam ūrmim akṛṇvata iḷaḥ
translated: The waters which the pious first made for you to be the wave that Indra drinks, the wave that delights

original: taṃ vo vayaṃ śucimaripramadya ghṛtapruṣaṃ madhumantaṃ vanema
analyzed: tam vaḥ vayam śucim aripram adya ghṛta pruṣam madhumantam vanema
translated: That pure and spotless one, sprinkled with ghee, full of sweetness, may we enjoy today

original: tamūrmimāpo madhumattamaṃ vo 'pāṃ napādavatvāśuhemā
analyzed: tam ūrmim āpaḥ madhumattamam vaḥ pām napāt avatu āśu hemā
translated: May that most sweet wave of yours, the foot of the waters, come swiftly to us

original: yasminnindro vasubhirmādayāte tamaśyāma devayanto vo adya
analyzed: yasmin indraḥ vasubhiḥ mādayāte tam aśyāma devayantaḥ vaḥ adya
translated: In which Indra delights with the Vasus, may we obtain that today, you who are pious

original: śatapavitrāḥ svadhayā madantīrdevīrdevānāmapi yanti pāthaḥ
analyzed: śata pavitrāḥ svadhayā madantīḥ devīḥ devānām api yanti pāthaḥ
translated: The one hundred-filtered (waters), rejoicing in their own nature, the divine ones, go to the abode of the gods

original: tā indrasya na minanti vratāni sindhubhyo havyaṃ ghṛtavajjuhota
analyzed: tāḥ indrasya na minanti vratāni sindhubhyaḥ havyam ghṛtavat juhota
translated: They do not violate Indra's laws. Offer oblations to the rivers, full of ghee

original: yāḥ sūryo raśmibhirātatāna yābhya indro aradad gātumūrmim
analyzed: yāḥ sūryaḥ raśmibhiḥ ātatāna yābhyaḥ indraḥ aradat gātum ūrmim
translated: Those which the sun has stretched out with his rays, for which Indra has plowed the path with a wave

original: te sindhavo varivo dhātanā no yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: te sindhavaḥ varivaḥ dhātana naḥ yūyam pāta
translated: May those rivers grant us room. You, protect us...

original: ṛbhukṣaṇo vājā mādayadhvamasme naro maghavānaḥ sutasya
analyzed: ṛbhukṣaṇaḥ vājāḥ mādayadhvam asme naraḥ maghavānaḥ sutasya
translated: O Rbhukṣaṇas, O Vājas, rejoice in our libation, O wealthy men!

original: ā vo 'rvācaḥ kratavo na yātāṃ vibhvo rathaṃ naryaṃ vartayantu
analyzed: ā vaḥ rvācaḥ kratavaḥ na yātām vibhvaḥ ratham naryam vartayantu
translated: May your thoughts come to us from afar, may the all-pervading ones turn the manly chariot.

original: ṛbhurṛbhubhirabhi vaḥ syāma vibhvo vibhubhiḥ śavasā śavāṃsi
analyzed: ṛbhuḥ ṛbhubhiḥ abhi vaḥ syāma vibhvaḥ vibhubhiḥ śavasā śavāṃsi
translated: May we be with the Rbhus, O all-pervading ones, with the powerful ones, with our own strength.

original: vājo asmānavatu vājasātāvindreṇa yujā taruṣemavṛtram
analyzed: vājaḥ asmān avatu vājasātau indreṇa yujā taruṣema vṛtram
translated: May Vāja help us in the winning of booty. With Indra as our ally, may we conquer Vṛtra.

original: te cid dhi pūrvīrabhi santi śāsā viśvānarya uparatāti vanvan
analyzed: te cit hi pūrvīḥ abhi santi śāsā viśvānaryaḥ uparatāti vanvan
translated: For they have conquered many ancient peoples, overcoming all the Aryan tribes.

original: indro vibhvān ṛbhukṣā vājo aryaḥ śatrormithatyā kṛṇavan vi nṛmṇam
analyzed: indraḥ vibhvān ṛbhukṣāḥ vājaḥ aryaḥ śatroḥ mithatyā kṛṇavan vi nṛmṇam
translated: Indra, the powerful, the R̥ibhuksha, the strong, the noble, has made his manliness prevail over the foe's violence.

original: nū devāso varivaḥ kartanā no bhūta no viśve 'vase sajoṣāḥ
analyzed: nu devāsaḥ varivaḥ kartana naḥ bhūta naḥ viśve vase sajoṣāḥ
translated: Now, O ye Gods, make ye room for us, be ye all of one accord to be our helpers.

original: samasme iṣaṃ vasavo dadīran yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: sam asme iṣam vasavaḥ dadīran yūyam pāta
translated: Grant ye us food, O ye Vasus. Do ye all preserve us.

original: samudrajyeṣṭhāḥ salilasya madhyāt punānā yantyaniviśamānāḥ
analyzed: samudra jyeṣṭhāḥ salilasya madhyāt punānāḥ yanti a niviśamānāḥ
translated: The Ocean's children, from the midst of the waters, purifying, move on, not to be restrained.

original: indro yā vajrī vṛṣabho rarāda tā āpo devīrihamāmavantu
analyzed: indraḥ yāḥ vajrī vṛṣabhaḥ rarāda tāḥ āpaḥ devīḥ iham āmavantu
translated: The waters which the thunder-wielding Indra, the Bull, hath gladdened, may those Goddess waters here refresh us.

original: yā āpo divyā uta vā sravanti khanitrimā uta vā yāḥ svayaṃjāḥ
analyzed: yāḥ āpaḥ divyāḥ uta vā sravanti khanitrimāḥ uta vā yāḥ svayaṃjāḥ
translated: The waters which flow down from heaven, or those which spring from digging, or those which come of themselves,

original: samudrārthā yāḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāstā āpo / / /
analyzed: samudra arthāḥ yāḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ tāḥ āpaḥ
translated: The pure, the purifying, which have the sea for their goal, may those waters.

original: yāsāṃ rājā varuṇo yāti madhye satyānṛte avapaśyañ janānām
analyzed: yāsām rājā varuṇaḥ yāti madhye satya anṛte avapaśyam janānām
translated: In the midst of which Varuna, the King, goes, beholding the truth and untruth of men,

original: madhuścutaḥ śucayo yāḥ pāvakāstā āpo / / /
analyzed: madhuścutaḥ śucayaḥ yāḥ pāvakāḥ tāḥ āpaḥ
translated: The waters which flow with honey, the pure, the purifying, may those waters.

original: yāsu rājā varuṇo yāsu somo viśve devā yāsūrjaṃ madanti
analyzed: yāsu rājā varuṇaḥ yāsu somaḥ viśve devāḥ yāsu ūrjam madanti
translated: In which Varuna, the King, in which Soma, in which the All-Gods rejoice,

original: vaiśvānaro yāsvagniḥ praviṣṭastā āpo / / /
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ yāsu agniḥ praviṣṭaḥ tāḥ āpaḥ
translated: In which Vaisvânara Agni hath entered, may those waters.

original: ā māṃ mitrāvaruṇeha rakṣataṃ kulāyayad viśvayan mā na ā gan
analyzed: ā mām mitrāvaruṇā iha rakṣatam kulāyayat viśvayat mā naḥ ā gan
translated: Protect me here, O ye Mitra and Varuna, who have all things in your keeping. Come not to us.

original: ajakāvaṃ durdṛśīkaṃ tiro dadhe mā māṃ padyena rapasā vidat tsaruḥ
analyzed: ajakāvam durdṛśīkam tiras dadhe mā mām padyena rapasā vidat tsaruḥ
translated: The Ajaka-disease, hard to see, I have hidden away. Let not the arrow of consumption find me.

original: yad vijāman paruṣi vandanaṃ bhuvadaṣṭhīvantau pari kulphau ca dehat
analyzed: yat vijāman paruṣi vandanam bhuvat aṣṭhīvantau pari kulphau ca dehat
translated: What harm there is in the joint, in the bone, in the marrow, in the knee-pan, in the ankle,

original: agniṣ ṭacchocannapa bādhatāmito mā māmpadyena / / /
analyzed: agniḥ tat śocan apa bādhatām itas mā māmpadyena
translated: Let Agni, burning it up, drive it away from here. Let not the arrow of consumption find me.

original: yacchalmalau bhavati yan nadīṣu yadoṣadhībhyaḥ pari jāyate viṣam
analyzed: yat śalmalau bhavati yat nadīṣu yat oṣadhībhyaḥ pari jāyate viṣam
translated: What poison there is in the Shlalmali tree, in the rivers, what is produced from the plants,

original: viśve devā niritastat suvantu mā māṃ padyena / / /
analyzed: viśve devāḥ niḥ itas tat suvantu mā mām padyena
translated: Let all the gods drive that away from us. Let not the arrow of consumption find me.

original: yāḥ pravato nivata udvata udanvatīranudakāśca yāḥ
analyzed: yāḥ pravataḥ nivataḥ udvataḥ udanvatīḥ anudakāḥ ca yāḥ
translated: The rivers that flow east, west, north, and south, those that have water, and those that are without water,

original: tā asmabhyaṃ payasā pinvamānāḥ śivā devīraśipadā bhavantu sarvā nadyo aśimidā bhavantu
analyzed: tāḥ asmabhyam payasā pinvamānāḥ śivāḥ devīḥ a śipadāḥ bhavantu sarvāḥ nadyaḥ a śimidāḥ bhavantu
translated: May they, swelling with milk, be gracious goddesses to us, may all the rivers be free from harm to us.

original: ādityānāmavasā nūtanena sakṣīmahi śarmaṇā śantamena🔽anāgāstve adititve turāsa imaṃ yajñaṃ dadhatu śroṣamāṇāḥ
analyzed: ādityānām avasā nūtanena sakṣīmahi śarmaṇā śantamena  anāgāstve aditi tve turāsaḥ imam yajñam dadhatu śroṣamāṇāḥ
translated: By the new favour of the Adityas may we obtain the most delightful protection.🔽May the impetuous ones, in the guardianship of Aditi and in the non-guardianship of Aditi, accept this sacrifice, listening.

original: ādityāso aditirmādayantāṃ mitro aryamā varuṇo rajiṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: ādityāsaḥ aditiḥ mādayantām mitraḥ aryamā varuṇaḥ rajiṣṭhāḥ
translated: May the Adityas and Aditi delight us, Mitra, Aryaman, Varuna, in the most straight path.

original: asmākaṃ santu bhuvanasya gopāḥ pibantu somamavase no adya
analyzed: asmākam santu bhuvanasya gopāḥ pibantu somam avase naḥ adya
translated: May they be the guardians of our world. May they drink Soma today for our help.

original: ādityā viśve marutaśca viśve devāśca viśva ṛbhavaśca viśve
analyzed: ādityāḥ viśve marutaḥ ca viśve devāḥ ca viśve ṛbhavaḥ ca viśve
translated: The Ādityas, all the Maruts, all the Viśve Devas, all the Ṛbhus,

original: indro agniraśvinā tuṣṭuvānā yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: indraḥ agniḥ aśvinā tuṣṭuvānāḥ yūyam pāta
translated: Indra, Agni, the Aśvins, being praised, do you protect us.

original: ādityāso aditayaḥ syāma pūrdevatrā vasavo martyatrā🔽sanema mitrāvaruṇā sananto bhavema dyāvāpṛthivī bhavantaḥ
analyzed: ādityāsaḥ aditayaḥ syāma pūḥ devatrā vasavaḥ martyatrā  sanema mitrāvaruṇā sanantaḥ bhavema dyāvāpṛthivī bhavantaḥ
translated: O Ādityas, may we be with Aditi, in the highest heaven, O Vasus, on earth.🔽May we, desiring, obtain Mitra and Varuṇa. May we be, becoming, with Dyaus and Prithivī.

original: mitrastan no varuṇo māmahanta śarma tokāya tanayāya gopāḥ
analyzed: mitraḥ tat naḥ varuṇaḥ māmahanta śarma tokāya tanayāya gopāḥ
translated: May Mitra and Varuṇa protect us from that, as guardians to the child and offspring.

original: mā vo bhujemānyajātameno mā tat karma vasavo yaccayadhve
analyzed: mā vaḥ bhujema anya jāta menaḥ mā tat karma vasavaḥ yat cayadhve
translated: Let not that sin of yours, O Vasus, which ye remember, be committed.

original: turaṇyavo 'ṅgiraso nakṣanta ratnaṃ devasya savituriyānāḥ
analyzed: turaṇyavaḥ ṅgirasaḥ nakṣanta ratnam devasya savituḥ iyānāḥ
translated: The Angirases, the swift ones, have come, seeking the treasure of god Savitr.

original: pitā ca tan no mahān yajatro viśve devāḥ samanaso juṣanta
analyzed: pitā ca tat naḥ mahān yajatraḥ viśve devāḥ samanasaḥ juṣanta
translated: And that, our great, holy father, the Viśve Devas, of one mind, accept.

original: pra dyāvā yajñaiḥ pṛthivī namobhiḥ sabādha īḷe bṛhatīyajatre
analyzed: pra dyāvā yajñaiḥ pṛthivī namobhiḥ sabādhas īḍe bṛhatī yajatre
translated: I worship the two great ones, Dyaus and Pṛthivī, with sacrifices and salutations.

original: te cid dhi pūrve kavayo gṛṇantaḥ puro mahī dadhire devaputre
analyzed: te cit hi pūrve kavayaḥ gṛṇantaḥ puras mahī dadhire deva putre
translated: For those ancient sages, singing, have placed the two great ones, the sons of gods, in the highest heaven.

original: pra pūrvaje pitarā navyasībhirgīrbhiḥ kṛṇudhvaṃ sadane ṛtasya
analyzed: pra pūrva je pitarā navyasībhiḥ gīrbhiḥ kṛṇudhvam sadane ṛtasya
translated: With new hymns make ready the two ancient parents in the seat of holy order.

original: ā no dyāvāpṛthivī daivyena janena yātaṃ mahi vāṃ varūtham
analyzed: ā naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī daivyena janena yātam mahi vām varūtham
translated: Come, O Dyaus and Prithivī, with the divine people. Great is your protection.

original: uto hi vāṃ ratnadheyāni santi purūṇi dyāvāpṛthivī sudāse
analyzed: uta u hi vām ratna dheyāni santi purūṇi dyāvāpṛthivī sudāse
translated: And indeed, O Heaven and Earth, you have many treasures to bestow upon Puru-Sudâs

original: asme dhattaṃ yadasadaskṛdhoyu yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: asme dhattam yūyam pāta
translated: Bestow upon us what is yours, O ye who are ever ready. Protect us, O ye Gods, from insult.

original: vāstoṣ pate prati jānīhyasmān svāveśo anamīvo bhavā naḥ
analyzed: vāstoḥ pate prati jānīhi asmān su āveśaḥ anamīvaḥ bhava naḥ
translated: O Vâstoshpati, be gracious to us; be a kind master to us, free from disease.

original: yat tvemahe prati tan no juṣasva śaṃ no bhava dvipade śaṃ catuṣpade
analyzed: yat tvā īmahe prati tat naḥ juṣasva śam naḥ bhava dvipade śam catuṣpade
translated: Accept from us what we ask of thee. Be thou a blessing to our men and to our cattle.

original: vāstoṣ pate prataraṇo na edhi gayasphāno gobhiraśvebhirindo
analyzed: vāstoḥ pate prataraṇaḥ naḥ edhi gaya sphānaḥ gobhiḥ aśvebhiḥ indo
translated: O Vâstoshpati, be thou our protector, a gladdener of our house, O Indu, with thy cattle and thy horses.

original: ajarāsaste sakhye syāma piteva putrān prati no juṣasva
analyzed: ajarāsaḥ te sakhye syāma pitā iva putrān prati naḥ juṣasva
translated: May we be free from old age in thy friendship. Accept us as a father his sons.

original: vāstoṣ pate śagmayā saṃsadā te sakṣīmahi raṇvayā gātumatyā🔽pāhi kṣema uta yoge varaṃ no yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: vāstoḥ pate śagmayā saṃsadā te sakṣīmahi raṇvayā gātumatyā  pāhi kṣeme uta yoge varam naḥ yūyam pāta
translated: O Vâstoshpati, with thy auspicious company may we enjoy thy favour, with thy kind and bountiful favour.🔽Protect us when we are in peace, and when we are in trouble. Protect us, O ye Gods, from insult.

original: amīvahā vāstoṣ pate viśvā rūpāṇyāviśan
analyzed: amīva hā vāstoḥ pate viśvā rūpāṇi āviśan
translated: O Vâstoshpati, bringing no disease, thou hast entered into all forms.

original: sakhā suśeva edhi naḥ
analyzed: sakhā su śevaḥ edhi naḥ
translated: Be a kind friend to us.

original: yadarjuna sārameya dataḥ piśaṅga yachase
analyzed: yat arjuna sārameya dataḥ piśaṅga yacchase
translated: O Saramâ's son, O yellow-toothed one, when thou art eager to seize,

original: vīva bhrājanta ṛṣṭaya upa srakveṣu bapsato ni ṣu svapa
analyzed: vi iva bhrājante ṛṣṭayaḥ upa srakveṣu bapsataḥ ni su svapa
translated: Thy teeth, O thou that art eager to seize, shine forth like swords in the mouths of the wolves.

original: stenaṃ rāya sārameya taskaraṃ vā punaḥsara
analyzed: stenam rāya sārameya taskaram vā punaḥsara
translated: O Saramâ's son, thou art the thief, or the robber, who is to be pursued.

original: stotṝnindrasya rāyasi kimasmān duchunāyase ni ṣu svapa
analyzed: stotṝn indrasya rāyasi kim asmān duchunāyase ni su svapa
translated: Thou art the supporter of Indra's praisers. Why dost thou afflict us?

original: tvaṃ sūkarasya dardṛhi tava dardartu sūkaraḥ🔽stotṝnindrasya / / /
analyzed: tvam sūkarasya dardṛhi tava dardartu sūkaraḥ  stotṝn indrasya
translated: Thou shalt crush the boar, let the boar crush thee.🔽Let the boar crush the worshippers of Indra.

original: sastu mātā sastu pitā sastu śvā sastu viśpatiḥ
analyzed: sastu mātā sastu pitā sastu śvā sastu viśpatiḥ
translated: Let the mother be crushed, let the father be crushed, let the dog be crushed, let the lord of the house be crushed.

original: sasantu sarve jñātayaḥ sastvayamabhito janaḥ
analyzed: sasantu sarve jñātayaḥ sastu ayam abhitas janaḥ
translated: Let all the relatives be crushed, let the people around thee be crushed.

original: ya āste yaśca carati yaśca paśyati no janaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ āste yaḥ ca carati yaḥ ca paśyati naḥ janaḥ
translated: He who sits, he who moves about, he who looks upon us, the people,

original: teṣāṃsaṃ hanmo akṣāṇi yathedaṃ harmyaṃ tathā
analyzed: teṣām aṃsam hanmaḥ akṣāṇi yathā idam harmyam tathā
translated: Of them we will crush the eyes, as this house is.

original: sahasraśṛṅgo vṛṣabho yaḥ samudrādudācarat
analyzed: sahasra śṛṅgaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ yaḥ samudrāt udācarat
translated: The thousand-peaked bull who has risen from the ocean,

original: tenā sahasyenā vayaṃ ni janān svāpayāmasi
analyzed: tena sahasyena vayam ni janān svāpayāmasi
translated: With that victorious one we cause the people to fall asleep.

original: proṣṭhaśayā vahyeśayā nārīryāstalpaśīvarīḥ
analyzed: proṣṭhaśayāḥ vahyeśayāḥ nārīryāḥ talpa śīvarīḥ
translated: The women who lie on the eastern bed, the women who lie on the outer bed, the women who lie on the couch,

original: striyo yāḥ puṇyagandhāstāḥ sarvāḥ svāpayāmasi🔽ka īṃ vyaktā naraḥ sanīḷā rudrasya maryā adha svaśvāḥ
analyzed: striyaḥ yāḥ puṇya gandhāḥ tāḥ sarvāḥ svāpayāmasi  ke īm vyaktāḥ naraḥ sanīḍāḥ rudrasya maryāḥ adha su aśvāḥ
translated: All those women who have a fragrant body, we cause them all to fall asleep.🔽Who have revealed the men, the companions, the boundaries of Rudra, the people with good horses,

original: nakirhyeṣāṃ janūṃṣi veda te aṅga vidre mitho janitram
analyzed: nakir hi eṣām janūṃṣi veda te aṅga vidre mithas janitram
translated: For none knoweth their generations. They, verily, have divided among themselves the birthplace.

original: abhi svapūbhirmitho vapanta vātasvanasaḥ śyenā aspṛdhran🔽etāni dhīro niṇyā ciketa pṛśniryadūdho mahī jabhāra
analyzed: abhi svapūbhiḥ mithas vapanta vāta svanasaḥ śyenāḥ aspṛdhran  etāni dhīraḥ niṇyā ciketa pṛśniḥ yat ūdhaḥ mahī jabhāra
translated: They sprinkle each other with their own fat. The hawks, with the sound of the wind, have striven.🔽The wise one hath thought of these, the Pr̥iṣni, what milk the great one hath borne.

original: sā viṭ suvīrā marudbhirastu sanāt sahantī puṣyantī nṛmṇam
analyzed: sā viś su vīrā marudbhiḥ astu sanāt sahantī puṣyantī nṛmṇam
translated: Let that be a good birth with good heroes, with the Maruts, from of old, enduring, nourishing heroism.

original: yāmaṃ yeṣṭhāḥ śubhā śobhiṣṭhāḥ śriyā sammiślā ojobhirugrāḥ🔽ugraṃ va oja sthirā śavāṃsyadhā marudbhirgaṇastuviṣmān
analyzed: yāmam yeṣṭhāḥ śubhā śobhiṣṭhāḥ śriyā sammiślāḥ ojobhiḥ ugrāḥ  ugram vaḥ ojaḥ sthirā śavāṃsi adha marudbhiḥ gaṇaḥ tuviṣmān
translated: Most to be worshipped, most auspicious, most splendid, mingled with glory, strong with powers,🔽Your strength is fierce, your powers are firm, your host is mighty with the Maruts.

original: śubhro vaḥ śuṣmaḥ krudhmī manāṃsi dhunirmuniriva śardhasya dhṛṣṇoḥ
analyzed: śubhraḥ vaḥ śuṣmaḥ krudhmī manāṃsi dhuniḥ muniḥ iva śardhasya dhṛṣṇoḥ
translated: Your impulse is white, your minds are wrathful, you are impetuous like a sage of the Marut host.

original: sanemyasmad yuyota didyuṃ mā vo durmatiriha praṇaṃ naḥ
analyzed: sanemi asmat yuyota didyum mā vaḥ durmatiḥ iha naḥ
translated: Turn away from us your dart, let not your evil thought be bent on us here.

original: priyā vo nāma huve turāṇāmā yat tṛpan maruto vāvaśānāḥ
analyzed: priyā vaḥ nāma huve turāṇām ā yat tṛpat marutaḥ vāvaśānāḥ
translated: I call on you, O swift ones, by your dear names, when, O Maruts, you are satisfied with the lowing cows.

original: svāyudhāsa iṣmiṇaḥ suniṣkā uta svayaṃ tanvaḥ śumbhamānāḥ
analyzed: su āyudhāsaḥ iṣmiṇaḥ su niṣkāḥ uta svayam tanvaḥ śumbhamānāḥ
translated: You who have good weapons, who are impetuous, who have good doors, and who adorn your own bodies,

original: śucī vo havyā marutaḥ śucīnāṃ śuciṃ hinomyadhvaraṃ śucibhyaḥ
analyzed: śucī vaḥ havyā marutaḥ śucīnām śucim hinomi adhvaram śucibhyaḥ
translated: Your oblations are pure, O Maruts, I offer pure sacrifice to you, the pure ones.

original: ṛtena satyam ṛtasāpa āyañchucijanmānaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ
analyzed: ṛtena satyam ṛtasāpaḥ āyan śuci janmānaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ
translated: By truth the truthful have come, born of purity, pure, purifying,

original: aṃseṣvā marutaḥ khādayo vo vakṣassu rukmā upaśiśriyāṇāḥ
analyzed: aṃsa iṣvā marutaḥ kha ādayaḥ vaḥ vakṣassu rukmāḥ upaśiśriyāṇāḥ
translated: O Maruts, your bellies are on your shoulders, your breasts are covered with ornaments.

original: vi vidyuto na vṛṣṭibhī rucānā anu svadhāmāyudhairyachamānāḥ
analyzed: vi vidyutaḥ na vṛṣṭibhiḥ rucānāḥ anu svadhām āyudhaiḥ yacchamānāḥ
translated: Your lightnings flash like rain, you move along your own course with your weapons,

original: pra budhnyā va īrate mahāṃsi pra nāmāni prayajyavastiradhvam
analyzed: pra budhnyā vaḥ īrate mahāṃsi pra nāmāni prayajyavaḥ tiradhvam
translated: You send forth great things from the depths, you spread out your names, O you who are to be worshipped.

original: sahasriyaṃ damyaṃ bhāgametaṃ gṛhamedhīyaṃ maruto juṣadhvam
analyzed: sahasriyam damyam bhāgam etam gṛhamedhīyam marutaḥ juṣadhvam
translated: Accept this share of a thousand, this domestic share, O Maruts, which is for the householder's sacrifice.

original: yadi stutasya maruto adhīthetthā viprasya vājino havīman🔽makṣū rāyaḥ suvīryasya dāta nū cid yamanya ādabhadarāvā
analyzed: yadi stutasya marutaḥ adhītha itthā viprasya vājinaḥ havīman  makṣū rāyaḥ su vīryasya dāta nu cit yamanyaḥ ādabhada rāvā
translated: If, O Maruts, ye approve the praise of him who offers the strong one's oblations,🔽Do not delay to give wealth and good heroism. Let no one else surpass us in strength.

original: atyāso na ye marutaḥ svañco yakṣadṛśo na śubhayanta maryāḥ
analyzed: atyāsaḥ na ye marutaḥ svañcaḥ yakṣa dṛśaḥ na śubhayanta maryāḥ
translated: The Maruts who are swift to act, like those who watch for treasure, adorn their bodies like youths.

original: te harmyeṣṭhāḥ śiśavo na śubhrā vatsāso na prakrīḷinaḥ payodhāḥ
analyzed: te harmyeṣṭhāḥ śiśavaḥ na śubhrāḥ vatsāsaḥ na prakrīḍinaḥ payodhāḥ
translated: They, the most excellent in the house, are bright like young children, like calves that play in the pasture, the givers of milk.

original: daśasyanto no maruto mṛḷantu varivasyanto rodasī sumeke
analyzed: daśasyantaḥ naḥ marutaḥ mṛḍantu varivasyantaḥ rodasī sumeke
translated: May the Maruts, favouring us, be gracious, extending the two well-formed worlds.

original: āre gohā nṛhā vadho vo astu sumnebhirasme vasavo namadhvam
analyzed: āre go hā nṛ hā vadhaḥ vaḥ astu sumnebhiḥ asme vasavaḥ namadhvam
translated: Let the slaying of cattle and men be far from you. O Vasus, be gracious to us with your favours.

original: ā vo hotā johavīti sattaḥ satrācīṃ rātiṃ maruto gṛṇānaḥ
analyzed: ā vaḥ hotā johavīti sattaḥ satrācīm rātim marutaḥ gṛṇānaḥ
translated: Your priest, seated, invokes you, O Maruts, singing for the ever-present gift.

original: ya īvato vṛṣaṇo asti gopāḥ so advayāvī havate va ukthaiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ īvataḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ asti gopāḥ saḥ advayāvī havate vaḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: He who has you, O bulls, as protectors, he, the unconquered, worships you with hymns.

original: ime turaṃ maruto rāmayantīme sahaḥ sahasa ā namanti
analyzed: ime turam marutaḥ rāmayanti ime sahaḥ sahasaḥ ā namanti
translated: These Maruts delight in the swift one, these honour strength with a thousand (gifts).

original: imeśaṃsaṃ vanuṣyato ni pānti guru dveṣo araruṣe dadhanti
analyzed: imeśaṃsam vanuṣyataḥ ni pānti guru dveṣaḥ a raruṣe dadhanti
translated: These protect the one who praises, these place great enmity in the wicked.

original: ime radhraṃ cin maruto junanti bhṛmiṃ cid yathā vasavo juṣanta🔽apa bādhadhvaṃ vṛṣaṇastamāṃsi dhatta viśvaṃ tanaya
analyzed: ime radhram cit marutaḥ junanti bhṛmim cit yathā vasavaḥ juṣanta  apa bādhadhvam vṛṣaṇaḥ tamāṃsi dhatta viśvam tanaya
translated: These Maruts stimulate even the sluggish, these Vasus accept even the slow one.

original: ṃ tokamasme
analyzed: ṃ tokam asme
translated: Drive away the darkness, O bulls, and bestow on us all offspring and progeny.

original: mā vo dātrān maruto nirarāma mā paścād daghma rathyo vibhāge
analyzed: mā vaḥ dātrāt marutaḥ nirarāma mā paścāt daghma rathyaḥ vibhāge
translated: Do not, O Maruts, cast us off, O bounteous ones; may we not be last in the distribution of your chariot-seats.

original: ā na spārhe bhajatanā vasavye yadīṃ sujātaṃ vṛṣaṇo vo asti
analyzed: ā naḥ spārhe bhajatana vasavye yadīm su jātam vṛṣaṇaḥ vaḥ asti
translated: When ye distribute the desirable wealth, in which ye, O ye mighty ones, have a good share,

original: saṃ yad dhananta manyubhirjanāsaḥ śūrā yahvīṣvoṣadhīṣu vikṣu
analyzed: sam yat hananta manyubhiḥ janāsaḥ śūrāḥ yahvīṣu oṣadhīṣu vikṣu
translated: When the people gather wealth with their wrath, the heroes in the young plants and the fields,

original: adha smā no maruto rudriyāsastrātāro bhūta pṛtanāsvaryaḥ
analyzed: adha smā naḥ marutaḥ rudriyāsaḥ trātāraḥ bhūta pṛtanāsvaryaḥ
translated: Then, O Maruts, be ye our protectors, O Rudra's own, in the battles, O ye who are to be worshipped.

original: bhūri cakra marutaḥ pitryāṇyukthāni yā vaḥ śasyante purā cit
analyzed: bhūri cakra marutaḥ pitryāṇi ukthāni yā vaḥ śasyante purā cit
translated: Ye Maruts, have performed many ancestral rites, the hymns which are recited to you even from of old.

original: marudbhirugraḥ pṛtanāsu sāḷhā marudbhirit sanitā vājamarvā
analyzed: marudbhiḥ ugraḥ pṛtanāsu sāḷhā marudbhiḥ id sanitā vāja marvā
translated: With the Maruts, he is fierce in battles, with the Maruts he is victorious in winning booty.

original: asme vīro marutaḥ śuṣmyastu janānāṃ yo asuro vidhartā
analyzed: asme vīraḥ marutaḥ śuṣmyaḥ tu janānām yaḥ asuraḥ vidhartā
translated: Let the hero be strong among us, O Maruts, among the people, he who is the Asura supporter.

original: apo yena sukṣitaye taremādha svamoko abhi vaḥ syāma
analyzed: apaḥ yena su kṣitaye tarema adha sva mokaḥ abhi vaḥ syāma
translated: By which we may cross the waters for good protection, and may come to your own abode.

original: tan na indro varuṇo mitro agnir / / /
analyzed: tat naḥ indraḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ
translated: That may Indra, Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni...

original: madhvo vo nāma mārutaṃ yajatrāḥ pra yajñeṣu śavasā madanti
analyzed: madhvaḥ vaḥ nāma mārutam yajatrāḥ pra yajñeṣu śavasā madanti
translated: The sweet name of you, O Maruts, who are to be worshipped, delights in sacrifices with its power.

original: ye rejayanti rodasī cidurvī pinvantyutsaṃ yadayāsurugrāḥ
analyzed: ye rejayanti rodasī cit urvī pinvanti utsam yat ayāsuḥ ugrāḥ
translated: They who make even the two vast worlds tremble, who swell the spring when they are impetuous.

original: nicetāro hi maruto gṛṇantaṃ praṇetāro yajamānasya manma
analyzed: nicetāraḥ hi marutaḥ gṛṇantam praṇetāraḥ yajamānasya manma
translated: For the Maruts are the leaders, they who praise, the guides of the sacrificer's thought.

original: asmākamadya vidatheṣu barhirā vītaye sadata pipriyāṇāḥ
analyzed: asmākam adya vidatheṣu barhiḥ ā vītaye sadata pipriyāṇāḥ
translated: May they sit on the sacred grass in our assemblies today, being delighted to enjoy the feast.

original: naitāvadanye maruto yatheme bhrājante rukmairāyudhaistanūbhiḥ
analyzed: na etāvat anye marutaḥ yathā ime bhrājante rukmaiḥ āyudhaiḥ tanūbhiḥ
translated: No other Maruts are equal to these, as they shine with their golden weapons and bodies.

original: ā rodasī viśvapiśaḥ piśānāḥ samānamañjyañjate śubhe kam
analyzed: ā rodasī viśva piśaḥ piśānāḥ samānam añji añjate śubhe kam
translated: They have filled both worlds with all their splendor, and they move together in their splendid chariot.

original: ṛdhak sā vo maruto didyudastu yad va āgaḥ puruṣatā karāma
analyzed: ṛdhak sā vaḥ marutaḥ didyut astu yat vaḥ āgaḥ puruṣa tā karāma
translated: O Maruts, let this thunderbolt of yours fall on us, if we have done you wrong as human beings.

original: mā vastasyāmapi bhūmā yajatrā asme vo astu sumatiścaniṣṭhā
analyzed: mā vaḥ tasyām api bhūma yajatrāḥ asme vaḥ astu sumatiḥ caniṣṭhā
translated: Do not let us be destroyed by that, O you who are to be worshipped. May your most excellent favor be with us.

original: kṛte cidatra maruto raṇantānavadyāsaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ
analyzed: kṛte cit atra marutaḥ raṇanta anavadyāsaḥ śucayaḥ pāvakāḥ
translated: Even when offended, O Maruts, you are irresistible, faultless, pure, and purifying.

original: pra ṇo 'vata sumatibhiryajatrāḥ pra vājebhistirata puṣyase naḥ
analyzed: pra naḥ vata sumatibhiḥ yajatrāḥ pra vājebhiḥ tirata puṣyase naḥ
translated: Come to us with your favors, O you who are to be worshipped. Lead us forward with your powers, and prosper us.

original: uta stutāso maruto vyantu viśvebhirnāmabhirnaro havīṃṣi
analyzed: uta stutāsaḥ marutaḥ vyantu viśvebhiḥ nāmabhiḥ naraḥ havīṃṣi
translated: May the Maruts, when praised, accept the offerings with all their names, O men.

original: dadāta no amṛtasya prajāyai jigṛta rāyaḥ sūnṛtā maghāni
analyzed: dadāta naḥ amṛtasya prajāyai jigṛta rāyaḥ sūnṛtāḥ maghāni
translated: Grant us immortality for our offspring. Delight us with wealth, with bounties.

original: ā stutāso maruto viśva ūtī achā sūrīn sarvatātā jigāta
analyzed: ā stutāsaḥ marutaḥ viśve ūtī achā sūrīn sarvatātā jigāta
translated: O Maruts, praised by all, come to the lords with all your names,

original: ye nastmanā śatino vardhayanti yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: ye naḥ tmanā śatinaḥ vardhayanti yūyam pāta
translated: who increase our strength according to our desire. You, protect us...

original: pra sākamukṣe arcatā gaṇāya yo daivyasya dhāmnastuviṣmān
analyzed: pra sākamukṣe arcata gaṇāya yaḥ daivyasya dhāmnaḥ tuviṣmān
translated: Praise the host of the one who hurls together, who is powerful in the abode of the divine.

original: uta kṣodanti rodasī mahitvā nakṣante nākaṃ nirṛteravaṃśāt
analyzed: uta kṣodanti rodasī mahitvā nakṣante nākam nirṛteḥ avaṃśāt
translated: And they rend asunder the two worlds with their greatness, they reach the vault from the house of destruction.

original: janūścid vo marutastveṣyeṇa bhīmāsastuvimanyavo 'yāsaḥ
analyzed: janūḥ cit vaḥ marutaḥ tveṣyeṇa bhīmāsaḥ tuvi manyavaḥ yāsaḥ
translated: Even from the womb, O Maruts, ye terrible ones of impetuous might, ye swift ones,

original: pra ye mahobhirojasota santi viśvo vo yāman bhayate svardṛk
analyzed: pra ye mahobhiḥ ojasā uta santi viśvaḥ vaḥ yāman bhayate svar dṛś
translated: They who are mighty with great powers, all of them tremble at your coming, the seer of heaven.

original: bṛhad vayo maghavadbhyo dadhāta jujoṣannin marutaḥ suṣṭutiṃ naḥ
analyzed: bṛhat vayaḥ maghavadbhyaḥ dadhāta jujoṣan id marutaḥ suṣṭutim naḥ
translated: Grant great glory to the wealthy ones, O Maruts, be pleased with our good praise.

original: gato nādhvā vi tirāti jantuṃ pra ṇa spārhābhirūtibhistireta
analyzed: gataḥ na adhvā vi tirāti jantum pra naḥ spārhābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ tireta
translated: The path goes not too far for the living being, he extends with your desirable aids.

original: yuṣmoto vipro marutaḥ śatasvī yuṣmoto arvā sahuriḥ sahasrī
analyzed: yuṣmotaḥ vipraḥ marutaḥ śatasvī yuṣmotaḥ arvā sahuriḥ sahasrī
translated: Your priest, O Maruts, is worth a hundred, your swift one is worth a thousand.

original: yuṣmotaḥ samrāḷ uta hanti vṛtraṃ pra tad vo astu dhūtayo deṣṇam
analyzed: yuṣmotaḥ samrāj uta hanti vṛtram pra tat vaḥ astu dhūtayaḥ deṣṇam
translated: Your emperor slays Vṛtra, that is your gift, O Dhūtas, which we implore.

original: tānā rudrasya mīḷhuṣo vivāse kuvin naṃsante marutaḥ punarnaḥ
analyzed: tānā rudrasya mīḷhuṣaḥ vivāse kuvid naṃsante marutaḥ punar naḥ
translated: Those of Rudra, the bountiful one, we place in the house, will the Maruts favor us again?

original: yat sasvartā jihīḷire yadāvirava tadena īmahe turāṇām🔽prā sā vāci suṣṭutirmaghonāmidaṃ sūktaṃ maruto juṣanta
analyzed: yat sasvartā jihīḍire yat āvirava tat enaḥ īmahe turāṇām  pra sā vāci suṣṭutiḥ maghonām idam sūktam marutaḥ juṣanta
translated: When they have sung with their own voices, when they have come, then we implore that of the swift ones.🔽That praise of the wealthy ones is well-sung, O Maruts, accept this hymn of ours.

original: ārāccid dveṣo vṛṣaṇo yuyota yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: ārāt cit dveṣaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ yuyota yūyam pāta
translated: Even from afar, O mighty ones, remove our hatred, do ye protect us, O Maruts.

original: yaṃ trāyadhva idamidaṃ devāso yaṃ ca nayatha
analyzed: yam trāyadhve idam idam devāsaḥ yam ca nayatha
translated: Whom ye protect, O gods, whom ye lead forward,

original: tasmā agne varuṇa mitrāryaman marutaḥ śarma yachata
analyzed: tasmai agne varuṇa mitra aryaman marutaḥ śarma yacchata
translated: Therefore, O Agni, O Varuṇa, O Mitra, O Aryaman, O Maruts, grant protection

original: yuṣmākaṃ devā avasāhani priya ījānastarati dviṣaḥ
analyzed: yuṣmākam devāḥ avasā ahani priye ījānaḥ tarati dviṣaḥ
translated: The worshipper, O Gods, in your protection, dear to you, overcomes his foes

original: pra sa kṣayaṃ tirate vi mahīriṣo yo vo varāya dāśati
analyzed: pra sa kṣayam tirate vi mahī riṣaḥ yaḥ vaḥ varāya dāśati
translated: He who offers you gifts overcomes the great expanses of food

original: nahi vaścaramaṃ cana vasiṣṭhaḥ parimaṃsate
analyzed: nahi vaḥ caramam cana vasiṣṭhaḥ parimaṃsate
translated: For Vasishtha does not despise even your lowest gift

original: asmākamadya marutaḥ sute sacā viśve pibata kāminaḥ
analyzed: asmākam adya marutaḥ sute sacā viśve pibata kāminaḥ
translated: O Maruts, today, O you who delight in the draught, drink together with us all the offered (Soma)

original: nahi va ūtiḥ pṛtanāsu mardhati yasmā arādhvaṃ naraḥ
analyzed: nahi vaḥ ūtiḥ pṛtanāsu mardhati yasmai arādhvam naraḥ
translated: For your help in battles does not fail him, O heroes, to whom you show favour

original: abhi va āvart sumatirnavīyasī tūyaṃ yāta pipīṣavaḥ
analyzed: abhi vaḥ āvart sumatiḥ navīyasī tūyam yāta pipīṣavaḥ
translated: Come hither to us, O Maruts, with a newer favour, come to drink, O you who delight in the draught

original: o ṣu ghṛṣvirādhaso yātanāndhāṃsi pītaye
analyzed: ā u su ghṛṣvi rādhasaḥ yātana andhāṃsi pītaye
translated: O you who delight in the sweet, come to the libations to drink

original: imā vo havyā maruto rare hi kaṃ mo ṣvanyatra gantana
analyzed: imā vaḥ havyā marutaḥ rare hi kam mā u su anyatra gantana
translated: These offerings of yours, O Maruts, are ready; go not elsewhere

original: ā ca no barhiḥ sadatāvitā ca na spārhāṇi dātave vasu
analyzed: ā ca naḥ barhiḥ ca naḥ spārhāṇi dātave vasu
translated: Sit on our sacred grass and help us; give us the desirable wealth to be bestowed

original: asredhanto marutaḥ somye madhau svāheha mādayādhvai
analyzed: a sredhantaḥ marutaḥ somye madhau svāhā iha mādayādhvai
translated: O Maruts, rejoicing in the sweet Soma, rejoice here with Svâhâ

original: sasvaścid dhi tanvaḥ śumbhamānā ā haṃsāso nīlapṛṣṭhā apaptan
analyzed: sasvaścit hi tanvaḥ śumbhamānāḥ ā haṃsāsaḥ nīla pṛṣṭhāḥ apaptan
translated: Even the shining bodies, adorning themselves, the swans with blue backs have flown down

original: viśvaṃ śardho abhito mā ni ṣeda naro na raṇvāḥ savane madantaḥ
analyzed: viśvam śardhaḥ abhitas mā ni seda naraḥ na raṇvāḥ savane madantaḥ
translated: Let all the host sit around me, rejoicing like men at the feast

original: yo no maruto abhi durhṛṇāyustiraścittāni vasavo jighāṃsati
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ marutaḥ abhi durhṛṇāyuḥ tiras cittāni vasavaḥ jighāṃsati
translated: O Maruts, whoever against us, O Vasus, would injure our thoughts with evil intent,

original: druhaḥ pāśān prati sa mucīṣṭa tapiṣṭhena hanmanāhantanā tam
analyzed: druhaḥ pāśān prati sa mucīṣṭa tapiṣṭhena hanmanā ahantana tam
translated: May he be loosed from the noose of the deceiver, with your most burning weapon, O you who slay the foe.

original: sāntapanā idaṃ havirmarutastajjujuṣṭana
analyzed: sāntapanāḥ idam haviḥ marutaḥ tat jujuṣṭana
translated: O Maruts, you who are heated, accept this oblation, O you who are to be heated.

original: yuṣmākotīriśādasaḥ
analyzed: yuṣmākā ūtīri śādasaḥ
translated: You who are the lords of great power.

original: gṛhamedhāsa ā gata maruto māpa bhūtana
analyzed: gṛha medhāsaḥ ā gata marutaḥ mā apa bhūtana
translated: Come, O Maruts, to the domestic sacrifice, do not pass by.

original: yuṣmākotī sudānavaḥ
analyzed: yuṣmākā ūtī sudānavaḥ
translated: You who are bountiful.

original: iheha vaḥ svatavasaḥ kavayaḥ sūryatvacaḥ
analyzed: iha iha vaḥ svatavasaḥ kavayaḥ sūrya tvacaḥ
translated: Here, O you who are self-existent, O sages, O you who have the sun as your skin,

original: yajñaṃ maruta āvṛṇe
analyzed: yajñam marutaḥ āvṛṇe
translated: I invite the Maruts to the sacrifice.

original: tryambakaṃ yajāmahe sugandhiṃ puṣṭivardhanam
analyzed: tryambakam yajāmahe sugandhim puṣṭi vardhanam
translated: We worship the three-eyed one, the fragrant one, the increaser of prosperity,

original: urvārukamivabandhanān mṛtyormukṣīya māmṛtāt
analyzed: urvārukam iva bandhanāt mṛtyoḥ mukṣīya mā amṛtāt
translated: Like a cucumber from its stem, may I be freed from death, from immortality.

original: yadadya sūrya bravo 'nāgā udyan mitrāya varuṇāya satyam
analyzed: yat adya sūrya bravaḥ nāgāḥ udyan mitrāya varuṇāya satyam
translated: Whatever we say today, O Sun, as you rise, O sinless one, to Mitra and Varuna,

original: vayaṃ devatrādite syāma tava priyāso aryaman gṛṇantaḥ
analyzed: vayam devatrā adite syāma tava priyāsaḥ aryaman gṛṇantaḥ
translated: May we be with the gods, O Aditi, O Aryaman, singing your praises, O you who are dear to us.

original: eṣa sya mitrāvaruṇā nṛcakṣā ubhe udeti sūryo abhi jman
analyzed: eṣa sya mitrāvaruṇā nṛ cakṣāḥ ubhe udeti sūryaḥ abhi jman
translated: This Sun, O Mitra and Varuna, who looks on men, rises over both worlds,

original: viśvasya sthāturjagataśca gopā ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā capaśyan
analyzed: viśvasya sthātuḥ jagataḥ ca gopāḥ ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā capaśyan
translated: The guardian of all that stands and moves, beholding the upright and the crooked among mortals.

original: ayukta sapta haritaḥ sadhasthād yā īṃ vahanti sūryaṃ ghṛtācīḥ
analyzed: ayukta sapta haritaḥ sadhasthāt yāḥ īm vahanti sūryam ghṛtācīḥ
translated: The seven tawny ones have yoked him from his abode, those who carry the Sun in their mouths, the pure ones.

original: dhāmāni mitrāvaruṇā yuvākuḥ saṃ yo yūtheva janimāni caṣṭe
analyzed: dhāmāni mitrāvaruṇā yuvākuḥ sam yaḥ yūthā iva janimāni caṣṭe
translated: Mitra and Varuna have made their dwellings, he who looks on the generations as on a herd.

original: ud vāṃ pṛkṣāso madhumanto asthurā sūryo aruhacchukramarṇaḥ🔽yasmā ādityā adhvano radanti mitro aryamā varuṇaḥsajoṣāḥ
analyzed: ud vām pṛkṣāsaḥ madhumantaḥ asthuḥ ā sūryaḥ aruhat śukramarṇaḥ  yasmai ādityāḥ adhvanaḥ radanti mitraḥ aryamā varuṇaḥ sajoṣāḥ
translated: Your fat-filled portions have arisen, the bright ocean has mounted up to the sun.🔽From whom the Ādityas, Mitra, Aryaman, and Varuṇa of one mind, make the path straight.

original: ime cetāro anṛtasya bhūrermitro aryamā varuṇo hi santi
analyzed: ime cetāraḥ anṛtasya bhūreḥ mitraḥ aryamā varuṇaḥ hi santi
translated: These are the observers of the wide expanse of truth, for they are Mitra, Aryaman, and Varuṇa.

original: ima ṛtasya vāvṛdhurduroṇe śagmāsaḥ putrā aditeradabdhāḥ
analyzed: ime ṛtasya vāvṛdhuḥ duroṇe śagmāsaḥ putrāḥ aditeḥ adabdhāḥ
translated: These, the invincible sons of Aditi, have grown strong in the abode of truth.

original: ime mitro varuṇo dūḷabhāso 'cetasaṃ ciccitayanti dakṣaiḥ
analyzed: ime mitraḥ varuṇaḥ dūḍabhāsaḥ cetasam cit citayanti dakṣaiḥ
translated: These, Mitra and Varuṇa, with their far-reaching rays, with their powers think upon the thoughtless one.

original: api kratuṃ sucetasaṃ vatantastiraścidaṃhaḥ supathānayanti
analyzed: api kratum su cetasam vatantaḥ tiraścit aṃhaḥ su pathā ānayanti
translated: They direct their well-thought-out purpose even across the darkness, and lead along the good path.

original: ime divo animiṣā pṛthivyāścikitvāṃso acetasaṃ nayanti
analyzed: ime divaḥ animiṣāḥ pṛthivyāḥ cikitvāṃsaḥ acetasam nayanti
translated: These, the watchful ones of heaven and earth, lead the thoughtless one to thought.

original: pravrāje cin nadyo gādhamasti pāraṃ no asya viṣpitasya parṣan
analyzed: pravrāje cit nadyaḥ gādham asti pāram naḥ asya viṣpitasya parṣan
translated: Even in the wandering rivers there is a ford; he will carry us across this wide expanse.

original: yad gopāvadaditiḥ śarma bhadraṃ mitro yachanti varuṇaḥ sudāse
analyzed: yat gopāvat aditiḥ śarma bhadram mitraḥ yacchanti varuṇaḥ sudāse
translated: The good protection which Aditi gives like a cow, which Mitra and Varuṇa grant to Sudās,

original: tasminnā tokaṃ tanayaṃ dadhānā mā karma devaheḷanaṃ turāsaḥ
analyzed: tasmin ā tokam tanayam dadhānāḥ mā karma deva heḍanam turāsaḥ
translated: In that, bearing our offspring and our children, may we not, O strong ones, do the deed that offends the gods.

original: ava vediṃ hotrābhiryajeta ripaḥ kāścid varuṇadhrutaḥ saḥ
analyzed: ava vedim hotrābhiḥ yajeta ripaḥ kāścid varuṇadhrutaḥ saḥ
translated: Even the one who has strayed from the altar may worship with his offerings; he who has offended Varuṇa may cross over some.

original: pari dveṣobhiraryamā vṛṇaktūruṃ sudāse vṛṣaṇā u lokam
analyzed: pari dveṣobhiḥ aryamā vṛṇaktu urum sudāse vṛṣaṇau u lokam
translated: Aryaman, with his enemies, has granted wide space to Sudâs, O ye mighty ones.

original: sasvaścid dhi samṛtistveṣyeṣāmapīcyena sahasā sahante
analyzed: sasvaścit hi samṛtiḥ tveṣī eṣām apīcyena sahasā sahante
translated: For they have power to help, and their protection is terrible. They conquer with their irresistible might.

original: yuṣmad bhiyā vṛṣaṇo rejamānā dakṣasya cin mahinā mṛḷatā naḥ
analyzed: yuṣmat bhiyā vṛṣaṇaḥ rejamānāḥ dakṣasya cit mahinā mṛḍata naḥ
translated: Through fear of you, O mighty ones, trembling, be gracious to us even for the greatness of Daksha.

original: yo brahmaṇe sumatimāyajāte vājasya sātau paramasya rāyaḥ🔽sīkṣanta manyuṃ maghavāno arya uru kṣayāya cakrire sudhātu
analyzed: yaḥ brahmaṇe sumatim āyajāte vājasya sātau paramasya rāyaḥ  sīkṣanta manyum maghavānaḥ aryaḥ uru kṣayāya cakrire su dhātu
translated: He who has brought to the Brahman the favour of the birth of strength, of the highest wealth,🔽The mighty ones, O Varuna, have sent forth their wrath, and have made wide room for the sacrifice.

original: iyaṃ deva purohitiryuvabhyāṃ yajñeṣu mitrāvaruṇāvakāri🔽viśvāni durgā pipṛtaṃ tiro no yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: iyam deva purohitiḥ yuvabhyām yajñeṣu mitrāvaruṇau akāri  viśvāni durgā pipṛtam tiras naḥ yūyam pāta
translated: This, O ye Gods, is your priestly office, O Mitra and Varuna, in sacrifices.🔽Give us all-surpassing protection. Preserve us evermore, ye Gods, with blessings.

original: ud vāṃ cakṣurvaruṇa supratīkaṃ devayoreti sūryastatanvān
analyzed: ud vām cakṣuḥ varuṇa su pratīkam devayoḥ eti sūryaḥ tatanvān
translated: Your eye, O Varuna, O Mitra, fair to behold, goes forth, O ye Gods, the Sun, extending.

original: abhi yo viśvā bhuvanāni caṣṭe sa manyuṃ martyeṣvā ciketa
analyzed: abhi yaḥ viśvā bhuvanāni caṣṭe sa manyum martyeṣvā ciketa
translated: He who looks on all existing things, he has considered wrath among mortal men.

original: pra vāṃ sa mitrāvaruṇāv ṛtāvā vipro manmāni dīrghaśrudiyarti🔽yasya brahmāṇi sukratū avātha ā yat kratvā na śaradaḥ pṛṇaithe
analyzed: pra vām sa mitrāvaruṇau ṛtāvā vipraḥ manmāni dīrgha śrut iyarti  yasya brahmāṇi su kratū avātha ā yat kratvā na śaradaḥ pṛṇaithe
translated: That sage, O Mitra and Varuna, of far-reaching thought, sends forth his hymns to you, the righteous.🔽Whose prayers, O ye of good vows, ye have accepted, whom ye have filled with food by your wisdom, O ye bountiful ones,

original: prorormitrāvaruṇā pṛthivyāḥ pra diva ṛṣvād bṛhataḥ sudānū
analyzed: pra uroḥ mitrāvaruṇā pṛthivyāḥ pra divaḥ ṛṣvāt bṛhataḥ sudānū
translated: From the earth, O Mitra and Varuna, from the lofty, wide heaven,

original: spaśo dadhāthe oṣadhīṣu vikṣv ṛdhag yato animiṣaṃrakṣamāṇā
analyzed: spaśaḥ dadhāthe oṣadhīṣu vikṣu ṛdhak yataḥ animiṣam rakṣamāṇā
translated: You two have placed power in all the plants, watching over it with unclosed eyes.

original: śaṃsā mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma śuṣmo rodasī badbadhe mahitvā
analyzed: śaṃsā mitrasya varuṇasya dhāma śuṣmaḥ rodasī badbadhe mahitvā
translated: Declare the abode of Mitra and Varuna. With might the impulse has filled the two world-halves.

original: ayan māsā ayajvanāmavīrāḥ pra yajñamanmā vṛjanaṃ tirāte
analyzed: ayan māsāḥ ayajvanām avīrāḥ pra yajña manmā vṛjanam tirāte
translated: The months without sacrifice, without heroes, have come. The sacrifice, the company, the food have been destroyed.

original: amūrā viśvā vṛṣaṇāvimā vāṃ na yāsu citraṃ dadṛśena yakṣam
analyzed: amūrā viśvā vṛṣaṇau imāḥ vām na yāsu citram dadṛśena yakṣam
translated: All these, O mighty ones, are yours, in which we have seen nothing wonderful to be worshipped.

original: druhaḥ sacante anṛtā janānāṃ na vāṃ niṇyānyacite abhūvan
analyzed: druhaḥ sacante anṛtāḥ janānām na vām niṇyāni a cite abhūvan
translated: The falsehoods of men, the injuries, follow them. Your judgments have not been made without cause.

original: samu vāṃ yajñaṃ mahayaṃ namobhirhuve vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā sabādhaḥ
analyzed: samu vām yajñam mahayam namobhiḥ huve vām mitrāvaruṇā sabādhas
translated: With great homage I invoke your sacrifice, O Mitra-Varuna, with all my heart.

original: pra vāṃ manmāny ṛcase navāni kṛtāni brahma jujuṣannimāni
analyzed: pra vām manmāni ṛcase navāni kṛtāni brahma jujuṣan imāni
translated: I offer these new hymns to you, O Mitra-Varuna, who delight in the praise.

original: iyaṃ deva purohitir / / /
analyzed: iyam deva purohitiḥ
translated: This is the divine worship...

original: ut sūryo bṛhadarcīṃṣyaśret puru viśvā janima mānuṣāṇām
analyzed: ud sūryaḥ bṛhat arcīṃṣi aśret puru viśvā janima mānuṣāṇām
translated: The sun has risen with great flames, pervading all the generations of men.

original: samo divā dadṛśe rocamānaḥ kratvā kṛtaḥ sukṛtaḥkartṛbhirbhūt
analyzed: samaḥ divā dadṛśe rocamānaḥ kratvā kṛtaḥ su kṛtaḥ kartṛbhiḥ bhūt
translated: He is seen in the sky, shining equally by day. By his will he has been made well-made by the makers.

original: sa sūrya prati puro na ud gā ebhiḥ stomebhiretaśebhirevaiḥ
analyzed: sa sūrya prati puras naḥ ud gāḥ ebhiḥ stomebhiḥ etaśebhiḥ evaiḥ
translated: O sun, rise up with these swift and strong hymns in front of us.

original: pra no mitrāya varuṇāya voco 'nāgaso aryamṇe agnaye ca
analyzed: pra naḥ mitrāya varuṇāya vocaḥ nāgasaḥ aryamṇe agnaye ca
translated: Speak to Mitra, Varuna, and the sinless Aryaman and Agni for us.

original: vi naḥ sahasraṃ śurudho radantv ṛtāvāno varuṇo mitro agniḥ
analyzed: vi naḥ sahasram śurudhaḥ radantu ṛtāvānaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ
translated: May the truthful ones, Mitra, Varuṇa, and Agni, grant us a thousand desires to be fulfilled.

original: yachantu candrā upamaṃ no arkamā naḥ kāmaṃ pūpurantustavānāḥ
analyzed: yacchantu candrāḥ upamam naḥ arkam ā naḥ kāmam
translated: May the radiant ones grant us praise worthy of comparison. May the powerful ones fulfill our wish.

original: dyāvābhūmī adite trāsīthāṃ no ye vāṃ jajñuḥ sujanimāna ṛṣve
analyzed: dyāvābhūmī adite trāsīthām naḥ ye vām jajñuḥ su janimānaḥ ṛṣve
translated: O Dyaus and Prithivī, O Aditi, protect us, you who have generated the lofty ones well.

original: mā heḷe bhūma varuṇasya vāyormā mitrasya priyatamasya nṛṇām
analyzed: mā heḍe bhūma varuṇasya vāyoḥ mā mitrasya priyatamasya nṛṇām
translated: Do not be angry with us, O Varuṇa and Vāyu, nor with Mitra, the most beloved of men.

original: pra bāhavā sisṛtaṃ jīvase na ā no gavyūtimukṣataṃ ghṛtena
analyzed: pra bāhū sisṛtam jīvase naḥ ā naḥ gavyūtim ukṣatam ghṛtena
translated: Stretch forth your arms to us for our life. Besprinkle our pasture with ghee.

original: ā no jane śravayataṃ yuvānā śrutaṃ me mitrāvaruṇā havemā
analyzed: ā naḥ jane śravayatam yuvānā śrutam me mitrāvaruṇā havā imā
translated: Make us famous among men, O young ones. Listen to my call, O Mitra and Varuṇa.

original: nū mitro varuṇo aryamā nastmane tokāya varivo dadhantu
analyzed: nu mitraḥ varuṇaḥ aryamā nastmane tokāya varivaḥ dadhantu
translated: May Mitra, Varuṇa, and Aryaman grant us room for ourselves and our offspring.

original: sugā no viśvā supathāni santu yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: sugā naḥ viśvā su pathāni santu yūyam pāta
translated: May all our paths be easy for us. You, protect us...

original: ud veti subhago viśvacakṣāḥ sādhāraṇaḥ sūryo mānuṣāṇām
analyzed: ud veti subhagaḥ viśva cakṣāḥ sādhāraṇaḥ sūryaḥ mānuṣāṇām
translated: The fortunate one, seeing all, rises, the common sun of men.

original: cakṣurmitrasya varuṇasya devaścarmeva yaḥ samavivyak tamāṃsi
analyzed: cakṣuḥ mitrasya varuṇasya devaḥ carma iva yaḥ samavivyak tamāṃsi
translated: The eye of Mitra, Varuṇa, and the god, who with his light has dispelled the darkness, as with a shield.

original: ud veti prasavītā janānāṃ mahān keturarṇavaḥ sūryasya
analyzed: ud veti prasavītā janānām mahān ketuḥ arṇavaḥ sūryasya
