translated: The great banner of the ocean, the sun, rises, the impeller of the people.

original: samānaṃ cakraṃ paryāvivṛtsan yadetaśo vahati dhūrṣu yuktaḥ
analyzed: samānam cakram paryāvivṛtsan yat etaśaḥ vahati dhūrṣu yuktaḥ
translated: Turning the same wheel, when the swift one is yoked in the traces, he draws.

original: vibhrājamāna uṣasāmupasthād rebhairudetyanumadyamānaḥ
analyzed: vibhrājamānaḥ uṣasām upasthāt rebhaiḥ udeti anumadyamānaḥ
translated: Shining, he hath risen to the place of the Dawns, being welcomed by the Rvbhus as he cometh.

original: eṣa me devaḥ savitā cachanda yaḥ samānaṃ na praminātidhāma
analyzed: eṣa me devaḥ savitā cachanda yaḥ samānam na pramināti dhāma
translated: This God Savitar hath taken pleasure in my hymn, who faileth not to measure out the common place.

original: divo rukma urucakṣā udeti dūrearthastaraṇirbhrājamānaḥ
analyzed: divaḥ rukmaḥ uru cakṣāḥ udeti dūrearthaḥ taraṇiḥ bhrājamānaḥ
translated: The light of heaven, far-seeing, riseth up, the swift, shining one, whose course is far away.

original: nūnaṃ janāḥ sūryeṇa prasūtā ayannarthāni kṛṇavannapāṃsi
analyzed: nūnam janāḥ sūryeṇa prasūtāḥ ayan arthāni kṛṇavan napāṃsi
translated: Now, verily, the people have been quickened by the Sun: they will perform their tasks and works.

original: yatrā cakruramṛtā gātumasmai śyeno na dīyannanveti pāthaḥ
analyzed: yatra cakruḥ amṛtāḥ gātum asmai śyenaḥ na dīyan anveti pāthaḥ
translated: Where they have made a way for him who is immortal, he cometh on his way like a hawk let loose.

original: prati vāṃ sūra udite vidhema namobhirmitrāvaruṇota havyaiḥ
analyzed: prati vām sūre udite vidhema namobhiḥ mitrāvaruṇā uta havyaiḥ
translated: When the Sun hath risen, we will worship you, O Mitra-Varuṇa, with homage and oblations.

original: nū mitro varuṇo aryamā / / /
analyzed: nu mitraḥ varuṇaḥ aryamā
translated: Now may Mitra, Varuṇa, and Aryaman,

original: divi kṣayantā rajasaḥ pṛthivyāṃ pra vāṃ ghṛtasya nirṇijodadīran
analyzed: divi kṣayantā rajasaḥ pṛthivyām pra vām ghṛtasya nirṇijā udadīran
translated: dwelling in heaven, in the region of the sky, spread out for you the cleansing of the ghee.

original: havyaṃ no mitro aryamā sujāto rājā sukṣatro varuṇo juṣanta
analyzed: havyam naḥ mitraḥ aryamā su jātaḥ rājā su kṣatraḥ varuṇaḥ juṣanta
translated: May Mitra, Aryaman, the well-born one, and King Varuṇa accept our offering.

original: ā rājānā maha ṛtasya gopā sindhupatī kṣatriyā yātamarvāk🔽iḷāṃ no mitrāvaruṇota vṛṣṭimava diva invataṃ jīradānū
analyzed: ā rājānā mahaḥ ṛtasya gopā sindhu patī kṣatriyā yātam arvāk  iḍām naḥ mitrāvaruṇā uta vṛṣṭim ava divaḥ invatam jīra dānū
translated: Come hither, O ye Kings, guardians of great holy order, Lords of the rivers, on your own paths.🔽Send us rain, O Mitra-Varuṇa, from the sky, and cause the streams to flow, O ye givers of increase.

original: mitrastan no varuṇo devo aryaḥ pra sādhiṣṭhebhiḥ pathibhirnayantu
analyzed: mitraḥ tat naḥ varuṇaḥ devaḥ aryaḥ pra sādhiṣṭhebhiḥ pathibhiḥ nayantu
translated: May the God Aryaman, Mitra, and Varuṇa lead us on by the most spacious paths.

original: bravad yathā na ādariḥ sudāsa iṣā madema saha devagopāḥ
analyzed: bravat yathā naḥ ādariḥ sudāse iṣā madema saha deva gopāḥ
translated: So that the generous one may not despise us, may we rejoice in food, protected by the gods.

original: yo vāṃ gartaṃ manasā takṣadetamūrdhvāṃ dhītiṃ kṛṇavad dhārayacca
analyzed: yaḥ vām gartam manasā takṣat etam ūrdhvām dhītim kṛṇavat dhārayat ca
translated: He who fashions this pit of yours with his mind, may he make our thought lofty and support it.

original: ukṣethāṃ mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtena tā rājānāsukṣitīstarpayethām
analyzed: ukṣethām mitrāvaruṇā ghṛtena tāḥ rājānāḥ asu kṣitīḥ tarpayethām
translated: You two, Mitra and Varuna, should be sprinkled with ghee, you two kings should satisfy the people.

original: eṣa stomo varuṇa mitra tubhyaṃ somaḥ śukro na vāyave 'yāmi
analyzed: eṣa stomaḥ varuṇa mitra tubhyam somaḥ śukraḥ na vāyave yāmi
translated: This praise is for you, O Mitra and Varuna, I offer pure Soma to Vayu.

original: aviṣṭaṃ dhiyo jigṛtaṃ puramdhīryūyaṃ pāta
analyzed: aviṣṭam dhiyaḥ jigṛtam puram dhīḥ yūyam pāta
translated: Inspire our thoughts and our wisdom, protect us.

original: prati vāṃ sūra udite sūktairmitraṃ huve varuṇaṃ pūtadakṣam
analyzed: prati vām sūre udite sūktaiḥ mitram huve varuṇam pūta dakṣam
translated: To you two, O Surya, at sunrise, I call Mitra and Varuna with hymns, the pure-minded.

original: yayorasuryamakṣitaṃ jyeṣṭhaṃ viśvasya yāmannācitā jigatnu
analyzed: yayoḥ asuryam akṣitam jyeṣṭham viśvasya yāman ācitā jigatnu
translated: Whose divine power is imperishable, the highest in all their ways, the most active.

original: tā hi devānāmasurā tāvaryā tā naḥ kṣitīḥ karatamūrjayantīḥ
analyzed: tā hi devānām asurā tāvaryā tā naḥ kṣitīḥ karatam ūrjayantīḥ
translated: For they are the gods' most excellent power. May they make our lands prosperous for us.

original: aśyāma mitrāvaruṇā vayaṃ vāṃ dyāvā ca yatra pīpayannahā ca🔽tā bhūripāśāvanṛtasya setū duratyetū ripave martyāya
analyzed: aśyāma mitrāvaruṇā vayam vām dyāvā ca yatra pīpayan ahā ca  tāḥ bhūri pāśau anṛtasya setū duratyetū ripave martyāya
translated: May we, O Mitra and Varuna, enjoy your favor, where heaven and earth have been made full of water.🔽You two with many snares, the dikes of falsehood, hard to pass over for the mortal foe.

original: ṛtasya mitrāvaruṇā pathā vāmapo na nāvā duritā tarema
analyzed: ṛtasya mitrāvaruṇā pathā vām apaḥ na nāvā duritā tarema
translated: By the path of truth, O Mitra and Varuna, may we cross over difficulties like waters in a boat.

original: ā no mitrāvaruṇā havyajuṣṭiṃ ghṛtairgavyūtimukṣatamiḷābhiḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ mitrāvaruṇāḥ havya juṣṭim ghṛtaiḥ gavyūtim ukṣatam iḷābhiḥ
translated: O Mitra and Varuna, anoint us with ghee and milk for the sake of our oblations and offerings.

original: prati vāmatra varamā janāya pṛṇītamudno divyasya cāroḥ🔽eṣa stomo varuṇa mitra / / /
analyzed: prati vām atra varamā janāya pṛṇītam udnaḥ divyasya cāroḥ  eṣa stomaḥ varuṇa mitra
translated: Grant to the people here a boon, a wide expanse of the heavenly course.🔽This praise, O Varuṇa and Mitra,

original: pra mitrayorvaruṇayoḥ stomo na etu śūṣyaḥ
analyzed: pra mitrayoḥ varuṇayoḥ stomaḥ naḥ etu śūṣyaḥ
translated: Let the praise of Mitra and Varuṇa go forth, to be accepted,

original: namasvān tuvijātayoḥ
analyzed: namasvān tuvi jātayoḥ
translated: Humble, to the mighty ones.

original: yā dhārayanta devāḥ sudakṣā dakṣapitarā
analyzed: yā dhārayanta devāḥ su dakṣā dakṣa pitarā
translated: Those who, as gods, uphold the well-fashioned, the skillful, the parents of skill,

original: asuryāya pramahasā
analyzed: asuryāya pramahasā
translated: To the Asura, with great might.

original: tā na stipā tanūpā varuṇa jaritṝṇām
analyzed: tā naḥ stipā tanū pā varuṇa jaritṝṇām
translated: They, O Varuṇa, the guardians of the house, the guardians of the body, of those who sing praises,

original: mitra sādhayataṃ dhiyaḥ
analyzed: mitra sādhayatam dhiyaḥ
translated: O Mitra, accomplish the thoughts.

original: yadadya sūra udite 'nāgā mitro aryamā
analyzed: yat adya sūre udite nāgāḥ mitraḥ aryamā
translated: What today, when the sun has risen, Mitra, Aryaman,

original: suvāti savitābhagaḥ
analyzed: suvāti savitā abhagaḥ
translated: Savitar, Bhaga, blow away evil.

original: suprāvīrastu sa kṣayaḥ pra nu yāman sudānavaḥ
analyzed: su prāvīraḥ tu sa kṣayaḥ pra nu yāman sudānavaḥ
translated: May that abode be rich in heroes. Now, in the journey, the bountiful ones,

original: ye no aṃho 'tipiprati
analyzed: ye naḥ aṃhaḥ tipiprati
translated: Who carry us over the distress.

original: uta svarājo aditiradabdhasya vratasya ye
analyzed: uta sva rājaḥ aditiḥ adabdhasya vratasya ye
translated: And the self-ruling ones of Aditi, of the inviolable vow,

original: maho rājāna īśate
analyzed: mahaḥ rājānaḥ īśate
translated: The great kings rule.

original: prati vāṃ sūra udite mitraṃ gṛṇīṣe varuṇam
analyzed: prati vām sūre udite mitram gṛṇīṣe varuṇam
translated: To you, when the sun has risen, I sing Mitra, Varuṇa,

original: aryamaṇaṃriśādasam
analyzed: aryamaṇam riśādasam
translated: Aryaman, the destroyer of enemies.

original: rāyā hiraṇyayā matiriyamavṛkāya śavase
analyzed: rāyā hiraṇyayā matiḥ iyam avṛkāya śavase
translated: This thought of wealth, of gold, to the one without wolves, to the one of mighty power,

original: iyaṃ viprāmedhasātaye
analyzed: iyam viprā medha sātaye
translated: This to the one who is to be praised by the wise.

original: te syāma deva varuṇa te mitra sūribhiḥ saha
analyzed: te syāma deva varuṇa te mitra sūribhiḥ saha
translated: May we be with you, O god Varuṇa, with you, O Mitra, with the princes,

original: iṣaṃ svaśca dhīmahi
analyzed: iṣam svar ca dhīmahi
translated: To gain food and our own thoughts.

original: bahavaḥ sūracakṣaso 'gnijihvā ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
analyzed: bahavaḥ sūra cakṣasaḥ gni jihvāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ
translated: Many are the ones with the sun as their eye, with Agni as their tongue, who increase truth,

original: trīṇi ye yemurvidathāni dhītibhirviśvāni paribhūtibhiḥ
analyzed: trīṇi ye yemuḥ vidathāni dhītibhiḥ viśvāni paribhūtibhiḥ
translated: Those three who have established the three worlds with their thoughts, with all-surpassing powers,

original: vi ye dadhuḥ śaradaṃ māsamādaharyajñamaktuṃ cād ṛcam
analyzed: vi ye dadhuḥ śaradam māsam āt aharyajñam aktum ca āt ṛcam
translated: Who have established the year, the month, the day, the sacrifice, the hymn, and the Ṛc,

original: anāpyaṃ varuṇo mitro aryamā kṣatraṃ rājāna āśata
analyzed: an āpyam varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā kṣatram rājānaḥ āśata
translated: Varuṇa, Mitra, and Aryaman have attained the lordship of kings, the unattainable.

original: tad vo adya manāmahe sūktaiḥ sūra udite
analyzed: tat vaḥ adya manāmahe sūktaiḥ sūre udite
translated: We think of that today with hymns, O Sūrya, when you have risen,

original: yadohate varuṇo mitro aryamā yūyam ṛtasya rathyaḥ
analyzed: yadā ūhate varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā yūyam ṛtasya rathyaḥ
translated: When you, O Varuṇa, Mitra, and Aryaman, are the charioteers of truth.

original: ṛtāvāna ṛtajātā ṛtāvṛdho ghorāso anṛtadviṣaḥ
analyzed: ṛtāvānaḥ ṛta jātāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ ghorāsaḥ anṛta dviṣaḥ
translated: Righteous, born of truth, increasing truth, terrible, hating falsehood,

original: teṣāṃvaḥ sumne suchardiṣṭame naraḥ syāma ye ca sūrayaḥ
analyzed: teṣām vaḥ sumne su chardiṣṭame naraḥ syāma ye ca sūrayaḥ
translated: In whose favor, O men, may we be, and those who are princes, most prosperous in good guidance.

original: udu tyad darśataṃ vapurdiva eti pratihvare
analyzed: udu tyad darśatam vapuḥ divaḥ eti pratihvare
translated: That beautiful form of yours rises up in the sky at dawn,

original: yadīmāśurvahati deva etaśo viśvasmai cakṣase aram
analyzed: yadi imā āśuḥ vahati devaḥ etaśaḥ viśvasmai cakṣase aram
translated: When that swift one, the god Etaṣa, carries it for all to see.

original: śīrṣṇaḥśīrṣṇo jagatastasthuṣas patiṃ samayā viśvamā rajaḥ
analyzed: śīrṣṇaḥ śīrṣṇaḥ jagataḥ tasthuṣaḥ patim samayā viśvamā rajaḥ
translated: The lord of the head, of the moving and unmoving world, in due order, of all the regions,

original: sapta svasāraḥ suvitāya sūryaṃ vahanti harito rathe
analyzed: sapta svasāraḥ suvitāya sūryam vahanti haritaḥ rathe
translated: Seven sisters carry the sun in a golden chariot for prosperity.

original: taccakṣurdevahitaṃ śukramuccarat
analyzed: tat cakṣuḥ deva hitam śukram uccarat
translated: That pure, divine eye rises up,

original: paśyema śaradaḥ śataṃ jīvema śaradaḥ śatam
analyzed: paśyema śaradaḥ śatam jīvema śaradaḥ śatam
translated: May we see a hundred autumns, may we live a hundred autumns.

original: kāvyebhiradābhyā yātaṃ varuṇa dyumat
analyzed: kāvyebhiḥ adābhyā yātam varuṇa dyumat
translated: Come with your invincible thoughts, O Varuṇa, shining,

original: mitraśca somapītaye
analyzed: mitraḥ ca soma pītaye
translated: And Mitra, for the drinking of Soma.

original: divo dhāmabhirvaruṇa mitraścā yātamadruhā
analyzed: divaḥ dhāmabhiḥ varuṇa mitraścā yātam adruhā
translated: Come, O Varuna and Mitra, with the lights of heaven, ye who do no wrong,

original: pibataṃ somamātujī
analyzed: pibatam soma mātujī
translated: Drink the Soma with delight.

original: ā yātaṃ mitrāvaruṇā juṣāṇāvāhutiṃ narā
analyzed: ā yātam mitrāvaruṇā juṣāṇau āhutim narā
translated: Come, O Mitra and Varuna, accept the offering, O men,

original: pātaṃ somam ṛtāvṛdhā
analyzed: pātam somam ṛtāvṛdhā
translated: Drink the Soma, ye who increase the truth.

original: prati vāṃ rathaṃ nṛpatī jaradhyai haviṣmatā manasā yajñiyena
analyzed: prati vām ratham nṛpatī jaradhyai haviṣmatā manasā yajñiyena
translated: I honour your chariot, O lords of men, with a mind full of oblations, worthy of sacrifice,

original: yo vāṃ dūto na dhiṣṇyāvajīgarachā sūnurna pitarā vivakmi
analyzed: yaḥ vām dūtaḥ na dhiṣṇya avajīgarathā sūnuḥ na pitarā vivakmi
translated: I praise you, as a son his parents, as a messenger who does not fail in his duty.

original: aśocyagniḥ samidhāno asme upo adṛśran tamasaścidantāḥ
analyzed: aśoci agniḥ samidhānaḥ asme upa u adṛśran tamasaḥ cit antāḥ
translated: The unsoiled Agni, kindled for us, shines forth, even through the darkness.

original: aceti keturuṣasaḥ purastācchriye divo duhiturjāyamānaḥ
analyzed: aceti ketuḥ uṣasaḥ purastāt śriye divaḥ duhituḥ jāyamānaḥ
translated: The light of the dawns moves in front, being born for the glory of heaven's daughter.

original: abhi vāṃ nūnamaśvinā suhotā stomaiḥ siṣakti nāsatyā vivakvān
analyzed: abhi vām nūnam aśvinā su hotā stomaiḥ siṣakti nāsatyāḥ vivakvān
translated: The good priest, the inspirer, Nāsatyas, now anoints you with praises, O Aśvins.

original: pūrvībhiryātaṃ pathyābhirarvāk svarvidā vasumatā rathena🔽avorvāṃ nūnamaśvinā yuvākurhuve yad vāṃ sute mādhvīvasūyuḥ🔽ā vāṃ vahantu sthavirāso aśvāḥ pibātho asmesuṣutā madhūni
analyzed: pūrvībhiḥ yātam pathyābhiḥ arvāk svarvidā vasumatā rathena  ava urvām nūnam aśvinā yuvākuḥ huve yat vām sute mādhvīvasūyuḥ  ā vām vahantu sthavirāsaḥ aśvāḥ pibāthaḥ asmesuṣutā madhūni
translated: Come on the ancient paths, with the one who finds the light, with a chariot rich in goods.🔽I call you, O Aśvins, to my aid, as one who longs for sweet riches at the pressing of the Soma.🔽Let your ancient horses bring you. Drink the well-pressed sweet juices for us.

original: prācīmu devāśvinā dhiyaṃ me 'mṛdhrāṃ sātaye kṛtaṃ vasūyum
analyzed: prācīm u devā aśvinā dhiyam me mṛdhrām sātaye kṛtam vasūyum
translated: O Aśvins, make my thought go forward, unerring, to gain wealth, O ye who find the light.

original: viśvā aviṣṭaṃ vāja ā purandhīstā naḥ śaktaṃ śacīpatī śacībhiḥ
analyzed: viśvāḥ aviṣṭam vāje ā purandhīḥ tāḥ naḥ śaktam śacīpatī śacībhiḥ
translated: All-conquering, with food, with foresight, have ye come. Do ye, mighty, with your might, give us strength.

original: aviṣṭaṃ dhīṣvaśvinā na āsu prajāvad reto ahrayaṃ no astu
analyzed: aviṣṭam dhīṣu aśvinā naḥ āsu prajāvat retaḥ ahrayam naḥ astu
translated: Have ye come to these our songs, O ye Asvins. Let our seed be undecaying and rich in offspring.

original: ā vāṃ toke tanaye tūtujānāḥ suratnāso devavītiṃgamema
analyzed: ā vām toke tanaye tūtujānāḥ su ratnāsaḥ deva vītiṃgamema
translated: Impelled by our children and offspring, may we, possessing good treasures, go to the banquet of the gods.

original: eṣa sya vāṃ pūrvagatveva sakhye nidhirhito mādhvī rāto asme
analyzed: eṣa sya vām pūrva gatvā iva sakhye nidhiḥ hitaḥ mādhvī rātaḥ asme
translated: This treasure, O ye two, is laid up for you in the first place, as friends, in our house, O ye lovers of sweetness.

original: aheḷatā manasā yātamarvāgaśnantā havyaṃ mānuṣīṣu vikṣu
analyzed: a heḍatā manasā yātam arvāk aśnantā havyam mānuṣīṣu vikṣu
translated: Come hither with a mind free from anger. Eating the offering in the houses of men.

original: ekasmin yoge bhuraṇā samāne pari vāṃ sapta sravato ratho gāt
analyzed: ekasmin yoge bhuraṇā samāne pari vām sapta sravataḥ rathaḥ gāt
translated: In the same union, O ye mighty ones, let your chariot go to the seven flowing (rivers).

original: na vāyanti subhvo devayuktā ye vāṃ dhūrṣu taraṇayovahanti🔽asaścatā maghavadbhyo hi bhūtaṃ ye rāyā maghadeyaṃ junanti
analyzed: na vāyanti su bhvaḥ deva yuktāḥ ye vām dhūrṣu taraṇayaḥ vahanti  asaścatā maghavadbhyaḥ hi bhūtam ye rāyā magha deyam junanti
translated: The strong (horses), yoked by the gods, do not carry you, which carry those who are to be conveyed on your poles.🔽For the generous ones let it be lasting, which stir up wealth, O ye bountiful ones, to give gifts.

original: pra ye bandhuṃ sūnṛtābhistirante gavyā pṛñcanto aśvyā maghāni
analyzed: pra ye bandhum sūnṛtābhiḥ tirante gavyā pṛñcantaḥ aśvyā maghāni
translated: Those who, bestowing good things, fill up their kinsman with fair speeches, (thinking) 'We will win great riches through our own strength.'

original: nū me havamā śṛṇutaṃ yuvānā yāsiṣṭaṃ vartiraśvināvirāvat
analyzed: nu me havam ā śṛṇutam yuvānā yāsiṣṭam vartiḥ aśvinā virāvat
translated: Now, O young ones, listen to my call. Come, O ye Aśvins, to the place of assembly, to Virāṭ.

original: dhattaṃ ratnāni jarataṃ ca sūrīn yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: dhattam ratnāni jaratam ca sūrīn yūyam pāta
translated: Give treasures, and make old the princes. Do ye protect...

original: ā śubhrā yātamaśvinā svaśvā giro dasrā jujuṣāṇā yuvākoḥ
analyzed: ā śubhrā yātam aśvinā su aśvā giraḥ dasrā jujuṣāṇā yuvākoḥ
translated: O ye Aśvins, come hither, O ye fair ones, on your own good horses, accepting the songs of the young man, O ye Wonder-Workers.

original: havyāni ca pratibhṛtā vītaṃ naḥ
analyzed: havyāni ca pratibhṛtā vītam naḥ
translated: And the oblations are ready for you. Come to us

original: pra vāmandhāṃsi madyānyasthuraraṃ gantaṃ haviṣo vītaye me
analyzed: pra vām andhāṃsi madyāni asthuḥ aram gantam haviṣaḥ vītaye me
translated: Your gladdening juices have been pressed. Come to me to enjoy the oblation.

original: tiro aryo havanāni śrutaṃ naḥ
analyzed: tiras aryaḥ havanāni śrutam naḥ
translated: Pass by the oblations of our enemies, O ye who hear us.

original: pra vāṃ ratho manojavā iyarti tiro rajāṃsyaśvinā śatotiḥ
analyzed: pra vām rathaḥ manaḥ javāḥ iyarti tiras rajāṃsi aśvinā śata ūtiḥ
translated: Your chariot, O ye Aṣvins, which moves with the speed of thought, passes through the regions, a hundred-powered one.

original: asmabhyaṃ sūryāvasū iyānaḥ
analyzed: asmabhyam sūryāvasū iyānaḥ
translated: Come to us, O ye Sūryas, as a guest.

original: ayaṃ ha yad vāṃ devayā u adrirūrdhvo vivakti somasud yuvabhyām
analyzed: ayam ha yat vām deva yāḥ u adriḥ ūrdhvaḥ vivakti soma sut yuvabhyām
translated: This very stone, O ye Gods, which is set up, which is pressed out for you, the lofty one, speaks to you.

original: ā valgū vipro vavṛtīta havyaiḥ
analyzed: ā valgū vipraḥ havyaiḥ
translated: The sage has turned to you, O bounteous ones, with offerings.

original: citraṃ ha yad vāṃ bhojanaṃ nvasti nyatraye mahiṣvantaṃ yuyotam
analyzed: citram ha yat vām bhojanam nu asti nyatraye mahiṣvantam yuyotam
translated: Wonderful is the food which ye have, O ye who are to be invoked by the sacrificer. Drive away from us the enemy who hath great wealth.

original: yo vāmomānaṃ dadhate priyaḥ san
analyzed: yaḥ vāmomānam dadhate priyaḥ san
translated: He who, being dear, hath set himself against you,

original: uta tyad vāṃ jurate aśvinā bhūccyavānāya pratītyaṃ havirde
analyzed: uta tyad vām jurate aśvinā bhūt cyavānāya pratītyam haviḥ de
translated: And that, O ye Aṣvins, which is your gift to the one who is cast away, be a return-gift for the oblation.

original: adhi yad varpa itaūti dhatthaḥ
analyzed: adhi yat varpaḥ itaūti dhatthaḥ
translated: When ye bestow upon him the form which is here,

original: uta tyaṃ bhujyumaśvinā sakhāyo madhye jahurdurevāsaḥ samudre
analyzed: uta tyam bhujyum aśvinā sakhāyaḥ madhye jahuḥ durevāsaḥ samudre
translated: And that, O ye Aṣvins, which is your friend Bhujyu, the Dāsas in the midst of the ocean have cast away.

original: nirīṃ parṣadarāvā yo yuvākuḥ
analyzed: niḥ īm parṣadarāvā yaḥ yuvākuḥ
translated: The one who hath brought you the swift one, the young one,

original: vṛkāya cijjasamānāya śaktamuta śrutaṃ śayave hūyamānā
analyzed: vṛkāya cit jasamānāya śaktam uta śrutam śayave hūyamānā
translated: To the wolf who is eager for strength, to Śayu who is invoked, ye have given the strong one, O ye who are famous.

original: yāvaghnyāmapinvatamapo na staryaṃ cicchaktyaśvināśacībhiḥ
analyzed: yau aghnyām apinvatam apaḥ naḥ staryam cit śakti aśvinā aśacībhiḥ
translated: Ye have filled the cow who was to be slain, as a mother to her calf, with milk, O ye Aṣvins, with your powers.

original: eṣa sya kārurjarate sūktairagre budhāna uṣasāṃ sumanmā🔽iṣā taṃ vardhadaghnyā payobhiryūyaṃ pāta / / /🔽ā vāṃ ratho rodasī badbadhāno hiraṇyayo vṛṣabhiryātvaśvaiḥ
analyzed: eṣa sya kāruḥ jarate sūktaiḥ agre budhānaḥ uṣasām su manmā  iṣā tam vardhat aghnyā payobhiḥ yūyam pāta  ā vām rathaḥ rodasī badbadhānaḥ hiraṇyayaḥ vṛṣabhiḥ yātu aśvaiḥ
translated: This is his creator, he delights with hymns, the most thoughtful one at the dawns, the one with the best mind🔽He, with food, grows with the milk of the milch cow. You, protect us.🔽Your chariot, yoked to the two worlds, moves on golden horses, bulls

original: ghṛtavartaniḥ pavibhī rucāna iṣāṃ voḷhā nṛpatirvājinīvān
analyzed: ghṛta vartaniḥ pavibhiḥ rucānaḥ iṣām voḷhā nṛpatiḥ vājinīvān
translated: Shining with its own power, with ghee as its path, the lord of men, rich in food, rich in horses

original: sa paprathāno abhi pañca bhūmā trivandhuro manasā yātu yuktaḥ
analyzed: sa paprathānaḥ abhi pañca bhūmā tri vandhuraḥ manasā yātu yuktaḥ
translated: It, spreading out, with a three-wheeled chariot, yoked, moves on its mind

original: viśo yena gachatho devayantīḥ kutrā cid yāmamaśvinā dadhānā🔽svaśvā yaśasā yātamarvāg dasrā nidhiṃ madhumantaṃ pibāthaḥ
analyzed: viśaḥ yena gacchathaḥ devayantīḥ kutra cit yāmam aśvinā dadhānā  su aśvā yaśasā yātam arvāk dasrā nidhim madhumantam pibāthaḥ
translated: To the people who honor the gods, by which (you) go, O Aśvins, placing (your) journey everywhere🔽On swift horses, come hither with glory. Drink the honey-rich treasure

original: vi vāṃ ratho vadhvā yādamāno 'ntān divo bādhate vartanibhyām🔽yuvoḥ śriyaṃ pari yoṣāvṛṇīta sūro duhitā paritakmyāyām
analyzed: vi vām rathaḥ vadhvā yādamānaḥ ntān divaḥ bādhate vartanibhyām  yuvoḥ śriyam pari yoṣā vṛṇīta sūraḥ duhitā paritakmyāyām
translated: Your chariot, moving like a bride, extends the ends of the sky with its paths🔽The daughter of the sun chose your glory as a wife in the twilight

original: yad devayantamavathaḥ śacībhiḥ pari ghraṃsamomanā vāṃ vayo gāt
analyzed: yat devayantam avathaḥ śacībhiḥ pari ghraṃsam omanā vām vayaḥ gāt
translated: When you help the one who honors the gods with your powers, the flock of birds, O you two, has come around

original: yo ha sya vāṃ rathirā vasta usrā ratho yujānaḥ pariyātivartiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ ha sya vām rathirā usrā rathaḥ yujānaḥ pariyāti vartiḥ
translated: The chariot, which is your swift messenger, your chariot, yoked, moves around as a wheel

original: tena naḥ śaṃ yoruṣaso vyuṣṭau nyaśvinā vahataṃ yajñe asmin
analyzed: tena naḥ śam yā uruṣasaḥ vyuṣṭau ni aśvinā vahatam yajñe asmin
translated: By that, O Aśvins, bring us to the dawn, to the rising of the dawn, to this sacrifice.

original: narā gaureva vidyutaṃ tṛṣāṇāsmākamadya savanopa yātam
analyzed: narā gaurā iva vidyutam tṛṣāṇā asmākam adya savanā upa yātam
translated: Men, like cows, longing for lightning, come to our libation today

original: purutrā hi vāṃ matibhirhavante mā vāmanye ni yaman devayantaḥ
analyzed: purutrā hi vām matibhiḥ havante mā vāmanye ni yaman devayantaḥ
translated: For you are called by many thoughts, do not delay, you who honor the gods

original: yuvaṃ bhujyumavaviddhaṃ samudra udūhathurarṇaso asridhānaiḥ
analyzed: yuvam bhujyum avaviddham samudre udūhathuḥ arṇasaḥ a sridhānaiḥ
translated: You lifted up Bhujyu, pierced, from the ocean, with your wounds-bearing (boats),

original: patatribhiraśramairavyathibhirdaṃsanābhiraśvinā pārayantā
analyzed: patatribhiḥ aśramaiḥ avyathibhiḥ daṃsanābhiḥ aśvinā pārayantā
translated: With your flying, tireless, unwearied teeth, O Asvins, saving (him)

original: nū me havamā śṛṇutaṃ yuvānā / / /🔽ā viśvavārāśvinā gataṃ naḥ pra tat sthānamavāci vāṃ pṛthivyām
analyzed: nu me havamā śṛṇutam yuvānā  ā viśva vārā aśvinā gatam naḥ pra tat sthānam avāci vām pṛthivyām
translated: Listen to my call, you young ones,🔽Come to us, O you who give all desired things, O Asvins, that place of yours on earth is proclaimed

original: aśvo na vājī śunapṛṣṭho asthādā yat sedathurdhruvase na yonim
analyzed: aśvaḥ na vājī śuna pṛṣṭhaḥ asthāt ā yat sedathuḥ dhruvase na yonim
translated: The strong horse with a good back stands, when you two sit down in your firm seat

original: siṣakti sā vāṃ sumatiścaniṣṭhātāpi gharmo manuṣo duroṇe
analyzed: siṣakti sā vām sumatiḥ caniṣṭhā atāpi gharmaḥ manuṣaḥ duroṇe
translated: That is your best favor to us, the heated milk in the house of a man

original: yo vāṃ samudrān saritaḥ pipartyetagvā cin na suyujā yujānaḥ🔽yāni sthānānyaśvinā dadhāthe divo yahvīṣvoṣadhīṣu vikṣu🔽ni parvatasya mūrdhani sadanteṣaṃ janāya dāśuṣevahantā
analyzed: yaḥ vām samudrān saritaḥ piparti etagvā cit na su yujā yujānaḥ  yāni sthānāni aśvinā dadhāthe divaḥ yahvīṣu oṣadhīṣu vikṣu  ni parvatasya mūrdhani sadantā iṣam janāya dāśuṣe iva hantā
translated: He who nourishes you, O Asvins, the oceans, the rivers, even though yoked with a lame one🔽The places, O Asvins, that you have, on the peak of the mountain, in the swift plants of heaven🔽Sitting there, bring food to the people who offer,

original: caniṣṭaṃ devā oṣadhīṣvapsu yad yogyā aśnavaithe ṛṣīṇām
analyzed: caniṣṭam devau oṣadhīṣu apsu yat yogyā aśnavaithe ṛṣīṇām
translated: The gods have settled in the plants and waters, when you find the suitable ones of the seers

original: purūṇi ratnā dadhatau nyasme anu pūrvāṇi cakhyathuryugāni
analyzed: purūṇi ratnā dadhatau nyasme anu pūrvāṇi cakhyathuḥ yugāni
translated: Bearing many treasures to us, you have passed through many former ages.

original: śuśruvāṃsā cidaśvinā purūṇyabhi brahmāṇi cakṣāthe ṛṣīṇām
analyzed: śuśruvāṃsā cit aśvinā purūṇi abhi brahmāṇi cakṣāthe ṛṣīṇām
translated: O Aśvins, you have seen many prayers of the Rṣis, even those who are renowned.

original: prati pra yātaṃ varamā janāyāsme vāmastu sumatiścaniṣṭhā
analyzed: prati pra yātam varamā janāya asme vām astu sumatiḥ caniṣṭhā
translated: Return to the people, to the choice, may your most excellent favor be with us.

original: yo vāṃ yajño nāsatyā haviṣmān kṛtabrahmā samaryo bhavāti
analyzed: yaḥ vām yajñaḥ nāsatyāḥ haviṣmān kṛta brahmā samaryaḥ bhavāti
translated: O Nāsatyas, the sacrifice to you, accompanied by oblations, will be made ready in the assembly.

original: upa pra yātaṃ varamā vasiṣṭhamimā brahmāṇy ṛcyante yuvabhyām
analyzed: upa pra yātam varamā vasiṣṭham imā brahmāṇi ṛcyante yuvabhyām
translated: Come to the choice, to Vasiṣṭha, these prayers are being recited to you two.

original: iyaṃ manīṣā iyamaśvinā gīrimāṃ suvṛktiṃ vṛṣaṇā juṣethām
analyzed: iyam manīṣā iyam aśvinā gīḥ imām suvṛktim vṛṣaṇā juṣethām
translated: This is the thought, O Aśvins, this is the song, accept this good praise, O you two powerful ones.

original: imā brahmāṇi yuvayūnyagman yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: imā brahmāṇi yuvayūni agman yūyam pāta
translated: These prayers have come to you two, young ones. You two, protect us.

original: apa svasuruṣaso nag jihīte riṇakti kṛṣṇīraruṣāya panthām
analyzed: apa svasuḥ uṣasaḥ nak jihīte riṇakti kṛṣṇīḥ aruṣāya panthām
translated: The dawn spreads out like a young woman, she opens the black paths for the red one.

original: aśvāmaghā gomaghā vāṃ huvema divā naktaṃ śarumasmad yuyotam
analyzed: aśvāmaghāḥ go maghāḥ vām huvema divā naktam śarum asmat yuyotam
translated: We call upon you, O you who are rich in horses and cows, by day and by night, drive away the dart from us.

original: upāyātaṃ dāśuṣe martyāya rathena vāmamaśvinā vahantā
analyzed: upāyātam dāśuṣe martyāya rathena vāmam aśvinā vahantā
translated: Come to the mortal who offers, O Aśvins, bringing the good by your chariot.

original: yuyutamasmadanirāmamīvāṃ divā naktaṃ mādhvī trāsithāṃ naḥ
analyzed: yuyutam asmad anirām amīvām divā naktam mādhvī trāsithām naḥ
translated: You have driven away the dart from us, by day and by night, O you who are dear to Soma, you have protected us.

original: ā vāṃ rathamavamasyāṃ vyuṣṭau sumnāyavo vṛṣaṇo vartayantu
analyzed: ā vām ratham avamasyām vyuṣṭau sumnāyavaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ vartayantu
translated: May the strong ones, longing for bliss, turn your chariot to us at this dawn.

original: syūmagabhastim ṛtayugbhiraśvairāśvinā vasumantaṃ vahethām
analyzed: syūma gabhastim ṛta yugbhiḥ aśvaiḥ āśvinā vasumantam vahethām
translated: With your yoke-fellows, your horses, O Asvins, bring hither Sûryâ's son, the Lord of light,

original: yo vāṃ ratho nṛpatī asti voḷhā trivandhuro vasumānusrayāmā
analyzed: yaḥ vām rathaḥ nṛpatī asti voḍhā tri vandhuraḥ vasumān usra yāmā
translated: Who is your chariot, O ye Kings, that moves with ease, with triple seat, and brings all blessings.

original: ā na enā nāsatyopa yātamabhi yad vāṃ viśvapsnyo jigāti🔽yuvaṃ cyavānaṃ jaraso 'mumuktaṃ ni pedava ūhathurāśumaśvam
analyzed: ā naḥ enā nāsatyā upa yātam abhi yat vām viśvapsnyaḥ jigāti  yuvam cyavānam jarasaḥ mumuktam ni pedavaḥ ūhathuḥ āśum aśvam
translated: Come hither unto us, O Nâsatyas, to the place where all-sustaining earth is spread.🔽Ye set free Chyavâna from his age and decrepitude, and gave him back his vigorous youth.

original: niraṃhasastamasa spartamatriṃ ni jāhuṣaṃ śithire dhātamantaḥ
analyzed: niraṃhasaḥ tamasaḥ spartam atrim ni jāhuṣam śithire dhātam antar
translated: Ye gave Atri, who had lost his sight, his eyes, and Jâhushi, who was in the pit, ye raised.

original: iyaṃ manīṣā iyamaśvinā gīr / / /
analyzed: iyam manīṣā iyam aśvinā gīḥ
translated: This is the thought, O Asvins, this the song which I,

original: ā gomatā nāsatyā rathenāśvāvatā puruścandreṇa yātam
analyzed: ā gomatā nāsatyā rathena aśvāvatā puru ścandreṇa yātam
translated: Come, O Nâsatyas, on your car that is laden with kine, with horses, and with many blessings.

original: abhi vāṃ viśvā niyutaḥ sacante spārhayā śriyā tanvā śubhānā
analyzed: abhi vām viśvāḥ niyutaḥ sacante spārhayā śriyā tanvā śubhānā
translated: All your teams of horses follow you, O ye whose forms are beautiful, for the sake of glory.

original: ā no devebhirupa yātamarvāk sajoṣasā nāsatyā rathena
analyzed: ā naḥ devebhiḥ upa yātam arvāk sajoṣasā nāsatyā rathena
translated: Come hither unto us, O ye Gods, on your car, O Nâsatyas, in harmony with us.

original: yuvorhi naḥ sakhyā pitryāṇi samāno bandhuruta tasya vittam🔽udu stomāso aśvinorabudhrañ jāmi brahmāṇyuṣasaśca devīḥ
analyzed: yuvoḥ hi naḥ sakhyā pitryāṇi samānaḥ bandhuḥ uta tasya vittam  udu stomāsaḥ aśvinoḥ abudhram jāmi brahmāṇi uṣasaḥ ca devīḥ
translated: For our fathers' friendship with you is ancient, and the bond of that is still unbroken.🔽The songs of praise have sounded forth to the Asvins, and the sister-deities, the Dawns.

original: āvivāsan rodasī dhiṣṇyeme achā vipro nāsatyā vivakti
analyzed: āvivāsan rodasī dhiṣṇyā ime achā vipraḥ nāsatyā vivakti
translated: The two world-halves have shone forth in their dwelling-place: the sage invokes the Nâsatyas.🔽The songs of praise have sounded forth to the Asvins, and the sister-deities, the Dawns.

original: vi ceduchantyaśvinā uṣāsaḥ pra vāṃ brahmāṇi kāravo bharante
analyzed: vi ced ucchanti aśvinau uṣāsaḥ pra vām brahmāṇi kāravaḥ bharante
translated: And the dawns, O Asvins, are shining forth; the bards bring forth your prayers.

original: ūrdhvaṃ bhānuṃ savitā devo aśred bṛhadagnayaḥ samidhā jarante
analyzed: ūrdhvam bhānum savitā devaḥ aśret bṛhat agnayaḥ samidhā jarante
translated: Savitar, the god, has raised his light on high; the great fires are kindled with fuel.

original: ā paścātān nāsatyā purastādāśvinā yātamadharādudaktāt
analyzed: ā paścātāt nāsatyā purastāt āśvinā yātam adharāt udaktāt
translated: Come, O Nāsatyas, from the west, from the east, O Asvins, come from below, from above.

original: ā viśvataḥ pāñcajanyena rāyā yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: ā viśvatas pāñcajanyena rāyā yūyam pāta
translated: From all sides with the wealth of the five peoples. Do you protect us...

original: atāriṣma tamasas pāramasya prati stomaṃ devayanto dadhānāḥ
analyzed: atāriṣma tamasaḥ pāramasya prati stomam devayantaḥ dadhānāḥ
translated: We have crossed over to the farther shore of this darkness, offering praise to the gods.

original: purudaṃsā purutamā purājāmartyā havate aśvinā gīḥ
analyzed: purudaṃsā purutamā purājā amartyā havate aśvinā gīḥ
translated: The most bountiful, the most ancient, the most youthful, the immortal one, calls upon the Asvins with his song.

original: nyu priyo manuṣaḥ sādi hotā nāsatyā yo yajate vandate ca
analyzed: niḥ priyaḥ manuṣaḥ sādi hotā nāsatyā yaḥ yajate vandate ca
translated: The dear guest of men has become the priest, O Nāsatyas, he who sacrifices and worships.

original: aśnītaṃ madhvo aśvinā upāka ā vāṃ voce vidatheṣu prayasvān
analyzed: aśnītam madhvaḥ aśvinau upāke ā vām voce vidatheṣu prayasvān
translated: Eat the honey, O Asvins, near at hand; I, the bountiful one, call you to the assemblies.

original: ahema yajñaṃ pathāmurāṇā imāṃ suvṛktiṃ vṛṣaṇā juṣethām
analyzed: ahema yajñam pathā amurāṇāḥ imām suvṛktim vṛṣaṇā juṣethām
translated: We have brought the sacrifice, coming by the path; accept this good hymn, O mighty ones.

original: śruṣṭīveva preṣito vāmabodhi prati stomairjaramāṇo vasiṣṭhaḥ🔽upa tyā vahnī gamato viśaṃ no rakṣohaṇā sambhṛtā vīḷupāṇī
analyzed: śruṣṭīvā iva preṣitaḥ vāma bodhi prati stomaiḥ jaramāṇaḥ vasiṣṭhaḥ  upa tyā vahnī gamataḥ viśam naḥ rakṣaḥ haṇā sambhṛtā vīḍu pāṇī
translated: Like one who is heard, sent forth, you are to be awakened; Vasishtha, growing old, with praises.🔽Come to our people with your two carrying (chariots), O you who are gathered for the slaying of the Rakshas, O you who have terrible hands.

original: samandhāṃsyagmata matsarāṇi mā no mardhiṣṭamā gataṃ śivena
analyzed: sam andhāṃsi agmata matsarāṇi mā naḥ mardhiṣṭama ā gatam śivena
translated: You have come to the intoxicating libations; do not injure us, come to us with what is good.

original: ā paścātān nāsatyā purastād / / /🔽imā u vāṃ diviṣṭaya usrā havante aśvinā
analyzed: ā paścātāt nāsatyā purastāt  imāḥ u vām diviṣṭayaḥ usrā havante aśvinā
translated: From the west, O Nāsatyas, from the east...🔽These two, O Aśvins, the heavenly drops, are calling you.

original: ayaṃ vāmahve 'vase śacīvasū viśaṃviśaṃ hi gachathaḥ
analyzed: ayam vām mahve vase śacī vasū viśam viśam hi gachathaḥ
translated: I call you for help, O you who possess power, for you go to every clan.

original: yuvaṃ citraṃ dadathurbhojanaṃ narā codethāṃ sūnṛtāvate🔽arvāg rathaṃ samanasā ni yachataṃ pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu
analyzed: yuvam citram dadathuḥ bhojanam narā codethām sūnṛtāvate  arvāk ratham samanasā ni yacchatam pibatam somyam madhu
translated: You two grant wonderful nourishment, O heroes, be ready for the one who delights in truth.🔽Direct your chariot together with a willing mind, drink the Soma-mixed honey.

original: ā yātamupa bhūṣataṃ madhvaḥ pibatamaśvinā
analyzed: ā yātam upa bhūṣatam madhvaḥ pibatam aśvinā
translated: Come, approach, drink the sweet drink, O Aśvins.

original: dugdhaṃ payovṛṣaṇā jenyāvasū mā no mardhiṣṭamā gatam
analyzed: dugdham payaḥ vṛṣaṇā jenyāvasū mā naḥ mardhiṣṭamā gatam
translated: Milk the two mighty, worthy of offerings, do not injure us, come.

original: aśvāso ye vāmupa dāśuṣo gṛhaṃ yuvāṃ dīyanti bibhrataḥ
analyzed: aśvāsaḥ ye vām upa dāśuṣaḥ gṛham yuvām dīyanti bibhrataḥ
translated: The horses which you give to the worshipper's house, carrying you,

original: makṣūyubhirnarā hayebhiraśvinā devā yātamasmayū
analyzed: makṣūyubhiḥ narā hayebhiḥ aśvinā devā yātamasmayū
translated: O Aśvins, with swift horses, O heroes, come to us, O gods.

original: adhā ha yanto aśvinā pṛkṣaḥ sacanta sūrayaḥ🔽tā yaṃsato maghavadbhyo dhruvaṃ yaśaśchardirasmabhyaṃ nāsatyā
analyzed: adhā ha yantaḥ aśvinā pṛkṣaḥ sacanta sūrayaḥ  tā yaṃsataḥ maghavadbhyaḥ dhruvam yaśaḥ chardiḥ asmabhyam nāsatyā
translated: Then, O Aśvins, the princes follow the gifts which you bestow.🔽Grant to the generous ones firm fame, a wide pasture to us, O Nāsatyas.

original: pra ye yayuravṛkāso rathā iva nṛpātāro janānām
analyzed: pra ye yayuḥ avṛkāsaḥ rathāḥ iva nṛ pātāraḥ janānām
translated: Those who have gone forth, like chariots, without enmity, the protectors of the people,

original: uta svena śavasā śūśuvurnara uta kṣiyanti sukṣitim
analyzed: uta svena śavasā śūśuvuḥ naraḥ uta kṣiyanti su kṣitim
translated: And the men have shone forth with their own strength, and they enjoy good fortune.

original: vyuṣā āvo divijā ṛtenāviṣkṛṇvānā mahimānamāgāt
analyzed: vyuṣāḥ āvaḥ divijāḥ ṛtena āviṣkṛṇvānā mahimānam āgāt
translated: The dawn, born in the sky, has come with truth, revealing its greatness.

original: apa druhastama āvarajuṣṭamaṅgirastamā pathyā ajīgaḥ
analyzed: apa druhastamaḥ ā vara juṣṭam aṅgirastamā pathyāḥ ajīgaḥ
translated: Thou hast attained the path most frequented by the Aṅgiras, most delightful, most free from enmity

original: mahe no adya suvitāya bodhyuṣo mahe saubhagāya pra yandhi
analyzed: mahe naḥ adya suvitāya bodhi uṣaḥ mahe saubhagāya pra yandhi
translated: Be thou this day, O Uṣas, for our great welfare, for great good fortune, speed forward

original: citraṃ rayiṃ yaśasaṃ dhehyasme devi marteṣu mānuṣi śravasyum
analyzed: citram rayim yaśasam dhehi asme devi marteṣu mānuṣi śravasyum
translated: Bestow upon us, O Goddess among mortals, wondrous wealth, glorious, to be desired by men

original: ete tye bhānavo darśatāyāścitrā uṣaso amṛtāsa āguḥ
analyzed: ete tye bhānavaḥ darśatāyāḥ citrāḥ uṣasaḥ amṛtāsaḥ āguḥ
translated: These wondrous immortal lights of the dawn have come, to be seen

original: janayanto daivyāni vratānyāpṛṇanto antarikṣā vyasthuḥ
analyzed: janayantaḥ daivyāni vratāni āpṛṇantaḥ antarikṣā vyasthuḥ
translated: Begetting the divine ordinances, filling the regions, they have taken their places

original: eṣā syā yujānā parākāt pañca kṣitīḥ pari sadyo jigāti
analyzed: eṣā syā yujānā parākāt pañca kṣitīḥ pari sadyas jigāti
translated: This one, yoked, goes forth from afar, in a moment she traverses the five regions

original: abhipaśyantī vayunā janānāṃ divo duhitā bhuvanasyapatnī🔽vājinīvatī sūryasya yoṣā citrāmaghā rāya īśe vasūnām🔽ṛṣiṣṭutā jarayantī maghonyuṣā uchati vahnibhirgṛṇānā
analyzed: abhipaśyantī vayunā janānām divaḥ duhitā bhuvanasya patnī  vājinīvatī sūryasya yoṣā citrāmaghā rāyaḥ īśe vasūnām  ṛṣiṣṭutā jarayantī maghonī uṣāḥ uchati vahnibhiḥ gṛṇānā
translated: Looking on the doings of men, the daughter of the sky, the consort of the world🔽The wife of Surya, rich in wealth, of wondrous bounty, she rules over riches and treasures🔽The dawn, praised by the seers, bringing prosperity to the wealthy, rises, singing with the priests

original: prati dyutānāmaruṣāso aśvāścitrā adṛśrannuṣasaṃ vahantaḥ
analyzed: prati dyutānām aruṣāsaḥ aśvāḥ citrāḥ adṛśran uṣasam vahantaḥ
translated: The ruddy horses of the lights, bearing the dawn, are seen, carrying her in variegated (chariots)

original: yāti śubhrā viśvapiśā rathena dadhāti ratnaṃvidhate janāya
analyzed: yāti śubhrā viśva piśā rathena dadhāti ratnam vidhate janāya
translated: The bright one goes with her chariot to all people, she bestows treasure on the man who offers sacrifice

original: satyā satyebhirmahatī mahadbhirdevī devebhiryajatā yajatraiḥ
analyzed: satyā satyebhiḥ mahatī mahadbhiḥ devī devebhiḥ yajatā yajatraiḥ
translated: The true one, the great one, with the true great ones, the goddess with the gods who offer sacrifice, the worthy one with the worthy ones

original: rujad dṛḷhāni dadadusriyāṇāṃ prati gāva uṣasaṃ vāvaśanta🔽nū no gomad vīravad dhehi ratnamuṣo aśvāvad purubhojo asme
analyzed: rujat dṛḷhāni dadat usriyāṇām prati gāvaḥ uṣasam vāvaśanta  nu naḥ gomat vīravat dhehi ratna muṣaḥ aśvāvat puru bhojaḥ asme
translated: He breaks the firm ones, bestowing on the cows, the cows low to the dawn🔽Come to us with wealth in cattle and heroes, O Dawn, with horses and abundant food for us

original: mā no barhiḥ puruṣatā nide karyūyaṃ pāta / / /🔽udu jyotiramṛtaṃ viśvajanyaṃ viśvānaraḥ savitā devo aśret
analyzed: mā naḥ barhiḥ puruṣa tā nide karyūyam pāta  udu jyotiḥ amṛtam viśvajanyam viśvānaraḥ savitā devaḥ aśret
translated: Do not make our sacred grass a place for human reproach. Do you, O Dawn, protect us with your protection.🔽The immortal light, which all men must have, which all men must have, Savitar, the god, hath raised on high.

original: kratvā devānāmajaniṣṭa cakṣurāvirakarbhuvanaṃviśvamuṣāḥ
analyzed: kratvā devānām ajaniṣṭa cakṣuḥ āvirakaḥ bhuvanam viśva muṣāḥ
translated: By his own power he hath been born as the eye of the gods. Dawn hath disclosed the whole world of life.

original: pra me panthā devayānā adṛśrannamardhanto vasubhiriṣkṛtāsaḥ
analyzed: pra me panthāḥ deva yānāḥ adṛśran amardhantaḥ vasubhiḥ iṣkṛtāsaḥ
translated: The paths which men must travel have appeared to me, the paths which men must travel, made ready with the Vasus.

original: abhūdu keturuṣasaḥ purastāt pratīcyāgādadhi harmyebhyaḥ
analyzed: abhūt u ketuḥ uṣasaḥ purastāt pratīcyā agāt adhi harmyebhyaḥ
translated: The light of the dawn hath appeared before us, it hath come from the west to the houses.

original: tānīdahāni bahulānyāsan yā prācīnamuditā sūryasya
analyzed: tāni id ahāni bahulāni āsan yā prācīna muditā sūryasya
translated: These many days have passed, which were before the sun rose,

original: yataḥ pari jāra ivācarantyuṣo dadṛkṣe na punaryatīva
analyzed: yatas pari jāre iva ācarantī uṣaḥ dadṛkṣe na punar yatī iva
translated: From which the dawn moves like a lover, as if it would not return.

original: ta id devānāṃ sadhamāda āsannṛtāvānaḥ kavayaḥ pūrvyāsaḥ
analyzed: te id devānām sadhamādaḥ āsan ṛtāvānaḥ kavayaḥ pūrvyāsaḥ
translated: They are indeed the most delightful assemblies of the gods, the truthful sages of old.

original: gūḷhaṃ jyotiḥ pitaro anvavindan satyamantrā ajanayannuṣāsam
analyzed: gūḍham jyotiḥ pitaraḥ anvavindan satya mantrāḥ ajanayan uṣāsam
translated: The fathers have found the hidden light, the truthful ones have generated the dawn.

original: samāna ūrve adhi saṃgatāsaḥ saṃ jānate na yatante mithaste
analyzed: samāne ūrve adhi saṃgatāsaḥ sam jānate na yatante mithas te
translated: They are united on the same wide place, they agree, they do not strive against each other.

original: te devānāṃ na minanti vratānyamardhanto vasubhiryādamānāḥ
analyzed: te devānām na minanti vratāni amardhantaḥ vasubhiḥ yādamānāḥ
translated: They do not violate the ordinances of the gods, being immortal and seeking wealth with the Vasus.

original: prati tvā stomairīḷate vasiṣṭhā uṣarbudhaḥ subhage tuṣṭuvāṃsaḥ
analyzed: prati tvā stomaiḥ īḍate vasiṣṭhāḥ uṣarbudhaḥ subhage tuṣṭuvāṃsaḥ
translated: The best of the Vasishthas praise you with their hymns, O dawn, O you who are good to all.

original: gavāṃ netrī vājapatnī na uchoṣaḥ sujāte prathamā jarasva
analyzed: gavām netrī vāja patnī naḥ ucha uṣaḥ sujāte prathamā jarasva
translated: O you who lead the cows, O you who lead the wealth, O dawn, O you who are well-born, shine forth first.

original: eṣā netrī rādhasaḥ sūnṛtānāmuṣā uchantī ribhyate vasiṣṭhaiḥ
analyzed: eṣā netrī rādhasaḥ sūnṛtānām uṣāḥ uchantī ribhyate vasiṣṭhaiḥ
translated: She who leads the streams of bounty, of pleasant songs, dawn, rising, is adorned by the Vasishthas.

original: dīrghaśrutaṃ rayimasme dadhānā yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: dīrgha śrutam rayim asme dadhānāḥ yūyam pāta
translated: Granting us wealth renowned afar, O dawn, do you and these gods preserve us evermore with blessings.

original: upo ruruce yuvatirna yoṣā viśvaṃ jīvaṃ prasuvantī carāyai
analyzed: upa u ruruce yuvatiḥ na yoṣā viśvam jīvam prasuvantī carāyai
translated: She hath shone forth like a young woman, a maiden, bringing forth all living things for motion.

original: abhūdagniḥ samidhe mānuṣāṇāmakarjyotirbādhamānā tamāṃsi
analyzed: abhūt agniḥ samidhe mānuṣāṇām akaḥ jyotiḥ bādhamānā tamāṃsi
translated: Agni hath become the kindler of men, driving away the darkness with his light.

original: viśvaṃ pratīcī saprathā udasthād ruśad vāso bibhratīśukramaśvait
analyzed: viśvam pratīcī saprathāḥ udasthāt ruśat vāsaḥ bibhratī śukram aśvait
translated: She hath risen up, all-pervading, spreading herself, wearing a garment of red, shining with white.

original: hiraṇyavarṇā sudṛśīkasandṛg gavāṃ mātānetryahnāmaroci
analyzed: hiraṇya varṇā su dṛśīka sandṛś gavām mātā netrī ahnām aroci
translated: Of golden hue, of beautiful appearance, the mother of the cows, the dawn hath shone forth.

original: devānāṃ cakṣuḥ subhagā vahantī śvetaṃ nayantī sudṛśīkamaśvam
analyzed: devānām cakṣuḥ subhagā vahantī śvetam nayantī su dṛśīkam aśvam
translated: Bearing the auspicious eye of the gods, leading the white horse of beautiful appearance,

original: uṣā adarśi raśmibhirvyaktā citrāmaghā viśvamanu prabhūtā
analyzed: uṣāḥ adarśi raśmibhiḥ vyaktā citrāmaghā viśvam anu prabhūtā
translated: Dawn hath appeared with her rays, the wondrous one, the all-pervading, the most bountiful.

original: antivāmā dūre amitramuchorvīṃ gavyūtimabhayaṃ kṛdhī naḥ
analyzed: antivāmā dūre amitra mucha urvīm gavyūtim abhayam kṛdhī naḥ
translated: Make for us wide pasture, free from foes, O dawn, who art ever kind, from far away.

original: yāvaya dveṣa ā bharā vasūni codaya rādho gṛṇate maghoni
analyzed: yāvaya dveṣaḥ ā bhara vasūni codaya rādhaḥ gṛṇate maghoni
translated: Drive away hatred, bring us riches, and stimulate bounty, O you who are rich in gifts, for the singer

original: asme śreṣṭhebhirbhānubhirvi bhāhyuṣo devi pratirantī na āyuḥ
analyzed: asme śreṣṭhebhiḥ bhānubhiḥ vi bhāhi uṣaḥ devi pratirantī naḥ āyuḥ
translated: Shine upon us, O Dawn, O Goddess, extending our life with your most excellent rays

original: iṣaṃ ca no dadhatī viśvavāre gomadaśvāvad rathavacca rādhaḥ🔽yāṃ tvā divo duhitarvardhayantyuṣaḥ sujāte matibhirvasiṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: iṣam ca naḥ dadhatī viśva vāre gomat aśvāvat rathavat ca rādhaḥ  yām tvā divaḥ duhitar vardhayanti uṣaḥ sujāte matibhiḥ vasiṣṭhāḥ
translated: Bestowing upon us food, O you who are rich in all goods, with cattle, horses, and chariots, as your bounty🔽O you who are the daughter of the sky, whom the Vasishthas, O Dawn, O you who are nobly born, exalt with their thoughts

original: sāsmāsu dhā rayim ṛṣvaṃ bṛhantaṃ yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: sā asmāsu dhāḥ rayim ṛṣvam bṛhantam yūyam pāta
translated: Bestow upon us that lofty and great wealth. Do you all protect us...

original: prati ketavaḥ prathamā adṛśrannūrdhvā asyā añjayo vi śrayante
analyzed: prati ketavaḥ prathamāḥ adṛśran ūrdhvāḥ asyāḥ añjayaḥ vi śrayante
translated: The first rays have been seen, the upward-streaming bright ones are extended

original: uṣo arvācā bṛhatā rathena jyotiṣmatā vāmamasmabhyaṃ vakṣi🔽prati ṣīmagnirjarate samiddhaḥ prati viprāso matibhirgṛṇantaḥ
analyzed: uṣaḥ arvācā bṛhatā rathena jyotiṣmatā vāmam asmabhyam vakṣi  prati sīm agniḥ jarate samiddhaḥ prati viprāsaḥ matibhiḥ gṛṇantaḥ
translated: O Dawn, with your lofty chariot, which is full of light, bring us what is good🔽Agni, when kindled, shines forth, the sages praise him with their thoughts

original: uṣā yāti jyotiṣā bādhamānā viśvā tamāṃsi duritāpa devī
analyzed: uṣāḥ yāti jyotiṣā bādhamānā viśvā tamāṃsi duritā apa devī
translated: Dawn moves along with her light, dispelling all the darkness and evil, the Goddess

original: etā u tyāḥ pratyadṛśran purastājjyotiryachantīruṣasovibhātīḥ
analyzed: etāḥ u tyāḥ pratyadṛśran purastāt jyotiḥ yachantīḥ uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ
translated: These very dawns have been seen in the east, stretching out their shining lights

original: ajījanan sūryaṃ yajñamagnimapācīnaṃ tamo agādajuṣṭam
analyzed: ajījanan sūryam yajñam agnim apācīnam tamaḥ agāt ajuṣṭam
translated: They have generated the sun, the sacrifice, and Agni. The unwelcome darkness has departed

original: aceti divo duhitā maghonī viśve paśyantyuṣasaṃ vibhātīm
analyzed: aceti divaḥ duhitā maghonī viśve paśyanti uṣasam vibhātīm
translated: The bountiful daughter of the sky moves along, all behold the shining Dawn

original: āsthād rathaṃ svadhayā yujyamānamā yamaśvāsaḥ suyujo vahanti🔽prati tvādya sumanaso budhantāsmākāso maghavāno vayaṃ ca
analyzed: āsthāt ratham svadhayā yujyamānamā ā yama śvāsaḥ su yujaḥ vahanti  prati tvā adya sumanasaḥ budhanta asmākāsaḥ maghavānaḥ vayam ca
translated: The chariot which is yoked by its own impulse, which the well-yoked horses draw, has come to him🔽Today let the well-disposed ones rejoice in you, we and our wealthy ones

original: tilvilāyadhvamuṣaso vibhātīryūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: tilvilāyadhvam uṣasaḥ vibhātīḥ yūyam pāta
translated: Shine forth, O shining dawns! You, protect us...

original: vyuṣā āvaḥ pathyā janānāṃ pañca kṣitīrmānuṣīrbodhayantī🔽susandṛgbhirukṣabhirbhānumaśred vi sūryo rodasī cakṣasāvaḥ
analyzed: vyuṣāḥ āvaḥ pathyāḥ janānām pañca kṣitīḥ mānuṣīḥ bodhayantī  su sandṛgbhiḥ ukṣabhiḥ bhānum aśret vi sūryaḥ rodasī cakṣasā avaḥ
translated: Dawn has brought forth the paths of men, awakening the five human abodes🔽With well-formed bulls, with light, the sun has shone forth, seeing the two world-halves

original: vyañjate divo anteṣvaktūn viśo na yuktā uṣaso yatante
analyzed: vyañjate divaḥ anteṣu aktūn viśaḥ na yuktāḥ uṣasaḥ yatante
translated: It shows the signs on the edges of the sky, the people, like yoked teams, strive for the dawns

original: saṃ te gāvastama ā vartayanti jyotiryachanti saviteva bāhū🔽abhūduṣā indratamā maghonyajījanat suvitāya śravāṃsi
analyzed: sam te gāvaḥ tamaḥ ā vartayanti jyotiḥ yacchanti savitā iva bāhū  abhūt uṣāḥ indratamā maghonī ajījanat suvitāya śravāṃsi
translated: Your cows turn to this darkness, they stretch forth light like Savitar his arms🔽Dawn has become most like Indra in bounty, it has produced good fortune and fame

original: vi divo devī duhitā dadhātyaṅgirastamā sukṛte vasūni🔽tāvaduṣo rādho asmabhyaṃ rāsva yāvat stotṛbhyo arado gṛṇānā
analyzed: vi divaḥ devī duhitā dadhāti aṅgirastamā su kṛte vasūni  tāvat uṣaḥ rādhaḥ asmabhyam rāsva yāvat stotṛbhyaḥ aradaḥ gṛṇānā
translated: The divine daughter of the sky bestows wealth, most like Angiras, on the well-doer🔽O Dawn, give us that much wealth as you have promised to the praisers who sing your praises

original: yāṃ tvā jajñurvṛṣabhasyā raveṇa vi dṛḷhasya duro adreraurṇoḥ
analyzed: yām tvā jajñuḥ vṛṣabhasya raveṇa vi dṛḷhasya duraḥ adreḥ aurṇoḥ
translated: Which you knew by the roar of the bull, the opening of the firm, the cleft of the snowy mountain

original: devaṃdevaṃ rādhase codayantyasmadryak sūnṛtā īrayantī
analyzed: devam devam rādhase codayantī asmadryak sūnṛtāḥ īrayantī
translated: They urge the god to give, the god to the gift, sending good will in our direction

original: vyuchantī naḥ sanaye dhiyo dhā yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: vyuchantī naḥ sanaye dhiyaḥ dhāḥ yūyam pāta
translated: Shining for us to create thoughts, you who bestow... You who protect...

original: prati stomebhiruṣasaṃ vasiṣṭhā gīrbhirviprāsaḥ prathamā abudhran
analyzed: prati stomebhiḥ uṣasam vasiṣṭhāḥ gīrbhiḥ viprāsaḥ prathamāḥ abudhran
translated: The Vasishthas have awakened Ushas with their praises and songs, the seers with their hymns.

original: vivartayantīṃ rajasī samante āviṣkṛṇvatīṃ bhuvanāni viśvā🔽eṣā syā navyamāyurdadhānā gūḍhvī tamo jyotiṣoṣāabodhi
analyzed: vivartayantīm rajasī samante āviṣkṛṇvatīm bhuvanāni viśvā  eṣā syā navyam āyuḥ dadhānā gūḍhvī tamaḥ jyotiṣā uṣā abodhi
translated: Turning the two ends of the realm around, revealing all the worlds,🔽This one, bearing new life, has risen from the hidden darkness to the light.

original: agra eti yuvatirahrayāṇā prācikitat sūryaṃ yajñamagnim
analyzed: agre eti yuvatiḥ ahrayāṇā prācikitat sūryam yajñam agnim
translated: The young woman goes forth, thundering, she has discerned the sun, the sacrifice, the fire.

original: aśvāvatīrgomatīrna uṣāso / / /
analyzed: aśvāvatīḥ gomatīḥ naḥ uṣāsaḥ
translated: The dawns rich in horses and cows...

original: pratyu adarśyāyatyuchantī duhitā divaḥ🔽apo mahi vyayati cakṣase tamo jyotiṣ kṛṇoti sūnarī🔽udusriyāḥ sṛjate sūryaḥ sacānudyan nakṣatramarcivat
analyzed: prati u adarśyā āyatī uchantī duhitā divaḥ  apa u mahi vyayati cakṣase tamaḥ jyotiḥ kṛṇoti sūnarī  udusriyāḥ sṛjate sūryaḥ sacā an udyan nakṣatram arcivat
translated: She who shines, the daughter of the sky, has appeared,🔽She spreads out the great waters, she makes light out of darkness, the good one.🔽The sun sends forth the bright stars as it rises.

original: taveduṣo vyuṣi sūryasya ca saṃ bhaktena gamemahi🔽prati tvā duhitardiva uṣo jīrā abhutsmahi🔽yā vahasi puruspārhaṃ vananvati ratnaṃ na dāśuṣe mayaḥ
analyzed: tava īduṣaḥ vyuṣi sūryasya ca sam bhaktena gamemahi  prati tvā duhitar divaḥ uṣaḥ jīrāḥ abhutsmahi  yā vahasi puruspārham vananvati ratnam na dāśuṣe mayaḥ
translated: We will go with our share to you, O dawn, and to the light of the sun.🔽We have extolled you, O daughter of the sky, O dawn, who hastens to the sacrifice,🔽You who bring much-desired treasure to the worshipper, O auspicious one.

original: uchantī yā kṛṇoṣi maṃhanā mahi prakhyai devi svardṛśe
analyzed: uchantī yā kṛṇoṣi maṃhanā mahi devi svar dṛśe
translated: O dawn, as you shine forth with your bounty, you make great light visible, O goddess, you who behold the light.

original: tasyāste ratnabhāja īmahe vayaṃ syāma māturna sūnavaḥ🔽taccitraṃ rādha ā bharoṣo yad dīrghaśruttamam🔽yat tedivo duhitarmartabhojanaṃ tad rāsva bhunajāmahai
analyzed: tasyāḥ te ratna bhājaḥ īmahe vayam syāma mātuḥ na sūnavaḥ  tat citram rādhaḥ ā bhara uṣaḥ yat dīrghaśruttamam  yat tedivaḥ duhitar marta bhojanam tat rāsva bhunajāmahai
translated: We seek to share in those treasures of thine, may we be the sons of our mother🔽That wondrous gift of thine, O Dawn, which is most renowned, bring thou to us🔽That which is the mortal food, O daughter of the sky, that may we enjoy

original: śravaḥ sūribhyo amṛtaṃ vasutvanaṃ vājānasmabhyaṃ gomataḥ
analyzed: śravaḥ sūribhyaḥ amṛtam vasutvanam vājān asmabhyam gomataḥ
translated: Give fame to the princes, immortality, and the bestowal of wealth, and strength to us with our cattle

original: codayitrī maghonaḥ sūnṛtāvatyuṣā uchadapa sridhaḥ
analyzed: codayitrī maghonaḥ sūnṛtāvatī uṣāḥ uchat apa sridhaḥ
translated: The impeller of the bountiful, rich in kindness, Dawn hath risen, dispelling the darkness

original: indrāvaruṇā yuvamadhvarāya no viśe janāya mahi śarma yachatam
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā yuvam adhvarāya naḥ viśe janāya mahi śarma yacchatam
translated: O Indra and Varuna, grant great protection to our people and our clan for the sacrifice

original: dīrghaprayajyumati yo vanuṣyati vayaṃ jayema pṛtanāsu dūḍhyaḥ
analyzed: dīrghaprayajyumati yaḥ vanuṣyati vayam jayema pṛtanāsu dūḍhyaḥ
translated: He who will strive in the long-lasting sacrifice, may we conquer the wicked in battles

original: samrāḷ anyaḥ svarāḷ anya ucyate vāṃ mahāntāvindrāvaruṇā mahāvasū
analyzed: samrāj anyaḥ svarāj anyaḥ ucyate vām mahāntau indrāvaruṇā mahā vasū
translated: One of you is called the sovereign, the other the self-ruler, O ye great Indra and Varuna, great possessors

original: viśve devāsaḥ parame vyomani saṃ vāmojovṛṣaṇā saṃ balaṃ dadhuḥ
analyzed: viśve devāsaḥ parame vyomani sam vām ojaḥ vṛṣaṇā sam balam
translated: All the gods in the highest heaven have bestowed upon you strength, O ye mighty ones, and power

original: anvapāṃ khānyatṛntamojasā sūryamairayataṃ divi prabhu🔽m
analyzed: anu apām khāni atṛntam ojasā sūryam airayatam divi prabhu  m
translated: Ye have with might followed the excavations of the waters, ye have set the sun in the sky, O ye lords

original: indrāvaruṇā made asya māyino 'pinvatamapitaḥ pinvataṃ dhiyaḥ
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā made asya māyinaḥ pinvatam apitaḥ pinvatam dhiyaḥ
translated: O Indra and Varuna, in the intoxication of this one who delights in magic, ye have caused the father to swell, cause our thoughts to swell

original: yuvāmid yutsu pṛtanāsu vahnayo yuvāṃ kṣemasya prasave mitajñavaḥ
analyzed: yuvām id yutsu pṛtanāsu vahnayaḥ yuvām kṣemasya prasave mitajñavaḥ
translated: Ye are the charioteers in battles, O ye two, ye are the guardians of peace, ye who know the measure

original: īśānā vasva ubhayasya kārava indrāvaruṇā suhavā havāmahe
analyzed: īśānā vasvaḥ ubhayasya kāravaḥ indrāvaruṇā su havā havāmahe
translated: We call on the lords of wealth, the makers of both, Indra and Varuna, the swift to listen.

original: indrāvaruṇā yadimāni cakrathurviśvā jātāni bhuvanasyamajmanā
analyzed: indrāvaruṇāḥ yat imāni cakrathuḥ viśvā jātāni bhuvanasya majmanā
translated: If, Indra and Varuna, ye have made these all things born, by the might of the world,

original: kṣemeṇa mitro varuṇaṃ duvasyati marudbhirugraḥ śubhamanya īyate
analyzed: kṣemeṇa mitraḥ varuṇam duvasyati marudbhiḥ ugraḥ śubham anyaḥ īyate
translated: Mitra attends on Varuna with welfare; the fierce one goes to the fair with the Maruts.

original: mahe śulkāya varuṇasya nu tviṣa ojo mimāte dhruvamasya yat svam
analyzed: mahe śulkāya varuṇasya nu tviṣe ojaḥ mimāte dhruvam asya yat svam
translated: For the great bride-price of Varuna, verily, ye two mete out his strength, his own that is firm.

original: ajāmimanyaḥ śnathayantamātirad dabhrebhiranyaḥ pra vṛṇoti bhūyasaḥ
analyzed: ajāmim anyaḥ śnathayantam ātirat dabhrebhiḥ anyaḥ pra vṛṇoti bhūyasaḥ
translated: One hath surpassed the unmoving with the swift; another with the many chooseth the stronger.

original: na tamaṃho na duritāni martyamindrāvaruṇā na tapaḥ kutaścana
analyzed: na tam aṃhaḥ na duritāni martyam indrāvaruṇā na tapaḥ kutaścana
translated: Neither grief nor misfortunes, O Indra and Varuna, nor heat from any side, afflict the mortal

original: yasya devā gachatho vītho adhvaraṃ na taṃ martasya naśate parihvṛtiḥ
analyzed: yasya devā gachathaḥ vīthaḥ adhvaram na tam martasya naśate parihvṛtiḥ
translated: Whom, O ye Gods, ye visit in the way of sacrifice: no danger of destruction overtakes the man.

original: arvāṃ narā daivyenāvasā gataṃ śṛṇutaṃ havaṃ yadi me jujoṣathaḥ
analyzed: arvām narā daivyena avasā gatam śṛṇutam havam yadi me jujoṣathaḥ
translated: Come hither, O ye men, with the divine help: listen if ye will to my invocation.

original: yuvorhi sakhyamuta vā yadāpyaṃ mārḍīkamindrāvaruṇā ni yachatam
analyzed: yuvoḥ hi sakhyam uta vā yat āpyam mārḍīkam indrāvaruṇā ni yacchatam
translated: For your friendship, O Indra and Varuna, is a sure protection, and your favour.

original: asmākamindrāvaruṇā bharebhare puroyodhā bhavataṃ kṛṣṭyojasā
analyzed: asmākam indrāvaruṇā bharebhare puras yodhā bhavatam kṛṣṭi ojasā
translated: Be ye, O Indra and Varuna, our foremost champions in every conflict, with the strength of the field,

original: yad vāṃ havanta ubhaye adha spṛdhi narastokasya tanayasya sātiṣu
analyzed: yat vām havante ubhaye adha spṛdhi nara stokasya tanayasya sātiṣu
translated: When men call on you both in the strife for children and offspring.

original: asme indro varuṇo mitro aryamā dyumnaṃ yachantu mahi śarmasaprathaḥ
analyzed: asme indraḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ aryamā dyumnam yacchantu mahi śarma saprathaḥ
translated: May Indra, Varuna, Mitra, Aryaman bestow on us great glory and far-extending protection.

original: avadhraṃ jyotiraditerṛtāvṛdho devasya ślokaṃ saviturmanāmahe
analyzed: avadhram jyotiḥ aditeḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ devasya ślokam savituḥ manāmahe
translated: The light of the unclouded heaven, the law-upholder, the praise of the god Savitar, we meditate.

original: yuvāṃ narā paśyamānāsa āpyaṃ prācā gavyantaḥ pṛthuparśavo yayuḥ
analyzed: yuvām narā paśyamānāsaḥ āpyam prācā gavyantaḥ pṛthu parśavaḥ yayuḥ
translated: You two, O men, beholding the attainable, have gone forward, longing for the cow, with wide-stepping strides.

original: dāsā ca vṛtrā hatamāryāṇi ca sudāsamindrāvaruṇāvasāvatam
analyzed: dāsā ca vṛtrā hatam āryāṇi ca sudāsam indrāvaruṇā avasā avatam
translated: And the Dâsas and the Vr̥itras have been slain, and the Âryas' tasks. Indra and Varuna have helped Sudâs.

original: yatrā naraḥ samayante kṛtadhvajo yasminnājā bhavati kiṃcana priyam🔽yatrā bhayante bhuvanā svardṛśastatrā na indrāvaruṇādhi vocatam
analyzed: yatrā naraḥ kṛta dhvajaḥ yasmin ājā bhavati kiṃcana priyam  yatra bhayante bhuvanā svar dṛśaḥ tatra naḥ indrāvaruṇā adhi vocatam
translated: Where men, with standards set up, assemble, where there is any dear contest at all,🔽Where the worlds tremble, beholding the light of heaven, there, O Indra and Varuna, do ye speak for us.

original: saṃ bhūmyā antā dhvasirā adṛkṣatendrāvaruṇā divi ghoṣaāruhat
analyzed: sam bhūmyāḥ antāḥ dhvasirāḥ adṛkṣata indrāvaruṇā divi ghoṣaḥ āruhat
translated: The ends of the earth are seen to tremble, O Indra and Varuna. The cry hath arisen in heaven.

original: asthurjanānāmupa māmarātayo 'rvāgavasā havanaśrutā gatam
analyzed: asthuḥ janānām upa mām arātayaḥ rvāc avasā havana śrutā gatam
translated: The mortal enemies of the people have come to me. Come hither, O ye who hear the invocation, to the gift.

original: indrāvaruṇā vadhanābhiraprati bhedaṃ vanvantā pra sudāsamāvatam
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā vadhanābhiḥ aprati bhedam vanvantā pra sudāsam āvatam
translated: O Indra and Varuna, with irresistible weapons, winning the victory, have ye helped Sudâs.

original: brahmāṇyeṣāṃ śṛṇutaṃ havīmani satyā tṛtsūnāmabhavat purohitiḥ
analyzed: brahmāṇi eṣām śṛṇutam havīmani satyā tṛtsūnām abhavat purohitiḥ
translated: Hear ye his prayers, at his invocation. True hath been the Tṛtsu's hope of help.

original: indrāvaruṇāvabhyā tapanti māghānyaryo vanuṣāmarātayaḥ
analyzed: indrāvaruṇau abhyā tapanti mā aghāni aryaḥ vanuṣām arātayaḥ
translated: O Indra and Varuna, the mortal enemies of the Aryas, the malignant, afflict me.

original: yuvaṃ hi vasva ubhayasya rājatho 'dha smā no 'vataṃ pārye divi
analyzed: yuvam hi vasvaḥ ubhayasya rājathaḥ dha smā naḥ vatam pārye divi
translated: For you two rule over all wealth, so help us to the prize in the contest.

original: yuvāṃ havanta ubhayāsa ājiṣvindraṃ ca vasvo varuṇaṃ casātaye
analyzed: yuvām havante ubhayāsaḥ ājiṣu indram ca vasvaḥ varuṇam casātaye
translated: In the contests they call on you both, on Indra and Varuṇa for help.

original: yatra rājabhirdaśabhirnibādhitaṃ pra sudāsamāvataṃ tṛtsubhiḥ saha
analyzed: yatra rājabhiḥ daśabhiḥ nibādhitam pra sudāsam āvatam tṛtsubhiḥ saha
translated: Where you helped Sudās, who was oppressed by ten kings, together with the Tṛtsu people.

original: daśa rājānaḥ samitā ayajyavaḥ sudāsamindrāvaruṇā na yuyudhuḥ
analyzed: daśa rājānaḥ samitāḥ ayajyavaḥ sudāsam indrāvaruṇā na yuyudhuḥ
translated: Ten kings, united, who did not offer sacrifices, fought against Sudās, O Indra and Varuṇa.

original: satyā nṛṇāmadmasadāmupastutirdevā eṣāmabhavan devahūtiṣu
analyzed: satyā nṛṇām admasadām upastutiḥ devāḥ eṣām abhavan deva hūtiṣu
translated: The true praise of men who sit in the assembly, the gods were on their side in their invocations.

original: dāśarājñe pariyattāya viśvataḥ sudāsa indrāvaruṇāvaśikṣatam
analyzed: dāśarājñe pariyattāya viśvatas sudāse indrāvaruṇau aśikṣatam
translated: To Sudās, the lord of ten peoples, you two, O Indra and Varuṇa, have granted (protection) from all sides.

original: śvityañco yatra namasā kapardino dhiyā dhīvanto asapanta tṛtsavaḥ
analyzed: śvityañcaḥ yatra namasā kapardinaḥ dhiyā dhīvantaḥ asapanta tṛtsavaḥ
translated: Where the white-robed, curly-haired Tṛtsu people, wise in their wisdom, have pressed with reverence,

original: vṛtrāṇyanyaḥ samitheṣu jighnate vratānyanyo abhi rakṣate sadā
analyzed: vṛtrāṇi anyaḥ samitheṣu jighnate vratāni anyaḥ abhi rakṣate sadā
translated: One of them slays the Vr̥itras in the battles, the other always guards the ordinances.

original: havāmahe vāṃ vṛṣaṇā suvṛktibhirasme indrāvaruṇaā śarma yachatam
analyzed: havāmahe vām vṛṣaṇā suvṛktibhiḥ asme indrāvaruṇaā śarma yacchatam
translated: We invoke you two, O mighty ones, with good hymns. Grant us protection, O Indra and Varuṇa.

original: asme indro varuṇo mitro / / /
analyzed: asme indraḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ
translated: May Indra, Varuṇa, Mitra...

original: ā vāṃ rājānāvadhvare vavṛtyāṃ havyebhirindrāvaruṇā namobhiḥ
analyzed: ā vām rājānau adhvare vavṛtyām havyebhiḥ indrāvaruṇāḥ namobhiḥ
translated: I would turn to you two, O kings, at the sacrifice, with offerings, O Indra and Varuṇa, with salutations.

original: pra vāṃ ghṛtācī bāhvordadhānā pari tmanā viṣurūpā jigāti🔽yuvo rāṣṭraṃ bṛhadinvati dyauryau setṛbhirarajjubhiḥ sinīthaḥ
analyzed: pra vām ghṛtācī bāhvoḥ dadhānā pari tmanā viṣurūpā jigāti  yuvoḥ rāṣṭram bṛhadinvati dyauḥ yau setṛbhiḥ a rajjubhiḥ sinīthaḥ
translated: Bearing you, O you of the two hands, the oblation, she goes forth in various forms, according to her own nature.🔽Your kingdom, O you two, O Indra and Varuna, is vast, like the sky. You two, O you who are to be praised, have made it with your bonds and ropes.

original: pari no heḷo varuṇasya vṛjyā uruṃ na indraḥ kṛṇavadu lokam
analyzed: pari naḥ heḍaḥ varuṇasya vṛjyāḥ urum naḥ indraḥ kṛṇavatu lokam
translated: May we be freed from Varuṇa's noose. May Indra make a wide space for us.

original: kṛtaṃ no yajñaṃ vidatheṣu cāruṃ kṛtaṃ brahmāṇi sūriṣupraśastā🔽upo rayirdevajūto na etu pra ṇaḥ spārhābhirūtibhistiretam
analyzed: kṛtam naḥ yajñam vidatheṣu cārum kṛtam brahmāṇi sūriṣu praśastā  upa u rayiḥ deva jūtaḥ naḥ etu pra naḥ spārhābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ tiretam
translated: Make our sacrifice beautiful in the assemblies. Make our prayers excellent among the nobles.🔽May wealth, urged on by the gods, come to us. May it extend to us with its desirable aids.

original: asme indrāvaruṇā viśvavāraṃ rayiṃ dhattaṃ vasumantaṃ purukṣum
analyzed: asme indrāvaruṇāḥ viśva vāram rayim dhattam vasumantam purukṣum
translated: O Indra and Varuna, grant us wealth that is all-giving, rich in goods and grains.

original: pra ya ādityo anṛtā minātyamitā śūro dayate vasūni
analyzed: pra yaḥ ādityaḥ anṛtā mināti amitā śūraḥ dayate vasūni
translated: The sun, the hero, the unlimited one, passes over the untruth and bestows treasures.

original: iyamindraṃ varuṇamaṣṭa me gīḥ prāvat toke tanaye tūtujānā
analyzed: iyam indram varuṇam aṣṭa me gīḥ prāvat toke tanaye tūtujānā
translated: This my hymn has gone to Indra and Varuṇa, eager to help in the birth of offspring.

original: suratnāso devavītiṃ gamema yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: su ratnāsaḥ deva vītim gamema yūyam pāta
translated: May we go to the abode of the gods, rich in treasures. You, O gods, protect us.

original: punīṣe vāmarakṣasaṃ manīṣāṃ somamindrāya varuṇāya juhvat
analyzed: punīṣe vāmarakṣasam manīṣām somam indrāya varuṇāya juhvat
translated: I purify the thought that guards the good, offering Soma to Indra and Varuṇa.

original: ghṛtapratīkāmuṣasaṃ na devīṃ tā no yāmannuruṣyatāmabhīke
analyzed: ghṛta pratīkām uṣasam na devīm tāḥ naḥ yāman uruṣyatām abhīke
translated: Like the dawn, the goddess whose face is turned towards the ghee, may they protect us from the front in the battle.

original: spardhante vā u devahūye atra yeṣu dhvajeṣu didyavaḥ patanti
analyzed: spardhante vai u deva hūye atra yeṣu dhvajeṣu didyavaḥ patanti
translated: They who invoke the gods here contend in the contests, in which the arrows fall on the banners.

original: yuvaṃ tānindrāvaruṇāvamitrān hataṃ parācaḥ śarvā viṣūcaḥ
analyzed: yuvam tān indrāvaruṇau amitrān hatam parācaḥ śarvā viṣūcaḥ
translated: You, O Indra and Varuna, have slain those enemies, the evil spirits, the wide-spreading ones.

original: āpaścid dhi svayaśasaḥ sadassu devīrindraṃ varuṇaṃ devatā dhuḥ
analyzed: āpaḥ cit hi sva yaśasaḥ sadassu devīḥ indram varuṇam devatāḥ dhuḥ
translated: For the divine ones, the self-shining ones, have chosen Indra and Varuna as their deities in the assemblies.

original: kṛṣṭīranyo dhārayati praviktā vṛtrāṇyanyo apratīni hanti🔽sa sukraturṛtacidastu hotā ya āditya śavasā vāṃ namasvān
analyzed: kṛṣṭīḥ anyaḥ dhārayati praviktāḥ vṛtrāṇi anyaḥ apratīni hanti  sa sukratuḥ ṛta cit astu hotā yaḥ āditya śavasā vām namasvān
translated: One of them supports the well-divided fields, the other slays the unresisted foes.🔽May he be the priest, O Aditya, who, with his might, bows to you with homage,

original: āvavartadavase vāṃ haviṣmānasadit sa suvitāya prayasvān
analyzed: āvavartat avase vām haviṣmān asadit sa suvitāya prayasvān
translated: Who turns to you for help, bringing oblations, seated, ready for good fortune.

original: iyamindraṃ varuṇamaṣṭa me gīḥ / / /
analyzed: iyam indram varuṇam aṣṭa me gīḥ
translated: This my eighth hymn extols Indra and Varuna.

original: dhīrā tvasya mahinā janūṃṣi vi yastastambha rodasī cidurvī
analyzed: dhīrā tvasya mahinā janūṃṣi vi yastastambha rodasī cit urvī
translated: The wise one, by his greatness, distinguishes the generations, he who has firmly established even the vast heaven and earth.

original: pra nākam ṛṣvaṃ nunude bṛhantaṃ dvitā nakṣatrampaprathacca bhūma
analyzed: pra nākam ṛṣvam nunude bṛhantam dvitā nakṣatram paprathat ca bhūma
translated: He has extended the lofty vault, the starry heaven, twice.

original: uta svayā tanvā saṃ vade tat kadā nvantarvaruṇe bhuvāni
analyzed: uta svayā tanvā sam vade tat kadā nu antarvaruṇe bhuvāni
translated: And may I speak with him with my own body. When will I be in your presence, O Varuna?

original: kiṃ me havyamahṛṇāno juṣeta kadā mṛḷīkaṃ sumanā abhi khyam🔽pṛche tadeno varuṇa didṛkṣūpo emi cikituṣo vipṛcham
analyzed: kim me havyam a hṛṇānaḥ juṣeta kadā mṛḷīkam sumanāḥ abhi khyam  pṛcche tat enaḥ varuṇa didṛkṣu upa u emi cikituṣaḥ vipṛcham
translated: What oblation will he accept from me without anger? When will he speak kindly to me?🔽I ask you this, O Varuna, desiring to see you. I come to you, the wise one, to ask.

original: samānamin me kavayaścidāhurayaṃ ha tubhyaṃ varuṇo hṛṇīte
analyzed: samānam id me kavayaḥ cit āhuḥ ayam ha tubhyam varuṇaḥ hṛṇīte
translated: The wise ones all say the same thing to me: This Varuna is angry with you.

original: kimāga āsa varuṇa jyeṣṭhaṃ yat stotāraṃ jighāṃsasi sakhāyam
analyzed: kim āgaḥ āsa varuṇa jyeṣṭham yat stotāram jighāṃsasi sakhāyam
translated: What is the highest debt, O Varuna, that thou seekest to slay thy praiser and friend?

original: pra tan me voco dūḷabha svadhāvo 'va tvānenā namasā tura iyām🔽ava drugdhāni pitryā sṛjā no 'va yā vayaṃ cakṛmā tanūbhiḥ
analyzed: pra tat me vocaḥ dūḍabha svadhāvas va tvā anena namasā turaḥ iyām  ava drugdhāni pitryā sṛja naḥ va yā vayam cakṛma tanūbhiḥ
translated: Speak that to me, O bountiful one; with this homage I will quickly come to thee.🔽Free us from the enmity of our fathers, free us from what we have done with our bodies.

original: ava rājan paśutṛpaṃ na tāyuṃ sṛjā vatsaṃ na dāmno vasiṣṭham
analyzed: ava rājan paśutṛpam na tāyum sṛja vatsam na dāmnaḥ vasiṣṭham
translated: Free, O king, the greedy one who delights in cattle, free the most excellent one as if from a rope.

original: na sa svo dakṣo varuṇa dhrutiḥ sā surā manyurvibhīdakoacittiḥ
analyzed: na sa svaḥ dakṣaḥ varuṇa dhrutiḥ sā surā manyuḥ vibhīdakā acittiḥ
translated: That, O Varuna, is not thy firm and own power, the intoxicating drink, the wrathful and destructive thought.

original: asti jyāyān kanīyasa upāre svapnaścanedanṛtasya prayotā
analyzed: asti jyāyān kanīyasaḥ upa āre svapnaḥ cana id anṛtasya prayotā
translated: There is a greater one than the lesser in the flood; even sleep is the instigator of untruth.

original: araṃ dāso na mīḷhuṣe karāṇyahaṃ devāya bhūrṇaye 'nāgāḥ
analyzed: aram dāsaḥ na mīḍhuṣe karāṇi aham devāya bhūrṇaye nāgāḥ
translated: I will make my hands serviceable to the god, the eager one, as a slave to a greedy man, free from sin.

original: acetayadacito devo aryo gṛtsaṃ rāye kavitaro junāti
analyzed: acetayat acitaḥ devaḥ aryaḥ gṛtsam rāye kavitaraḥ junāti
translated: The wise god, the holy one, has made the Gritsamadas think of the unseen wealth.

original: ayaṃ su tubhyaṃ varuṇa svadhāvo hṛdi stoma upaśritaścidastu
analyzed: ayam su tubhyam varuṇa svadhāvas hṛdi stomaḥ upaśritaḥ cit astu
translated: This praise, O Varuna of true law, may be in thy heart, and may be near thee.

original: śaṃ naḥ kṣeme śamu yoge no astu yūyaṃ pāta / / /🔽radat patho varuṇaḥ sūryāya prārṇāṃsi samudriyā nadīnām
analyzed: śam naḥ kṣeme śamu yoge naḥ astu yūyam pāta  radat pathaḥ varuṇaḥ sūryāya pra arṇāṃsi samudriyā nadīnām
translated: Be auspicious to us in peace, be auspicious to us in union. Do ye protect us, O ye gods, from above, from below, from behind, from in front.🔽Varuna has opened the paths for the sun, the ocean-like waters of the rivers.

original: sargo na sṛṣṭo arvatīrṛtāyañcakāra mahīravanīrahabhyaḥ
analyzed: sargaḥ na sṛṣṭaḥ arvatīḥ ṛtāyan cakāra mahī ravanī rahabhyaḥ
translated: He has made the great and wide expanses of the earth to be born, to be created, for the righteous ones.

original: ātmā te vāto raja ā navīnot paśurna bhūrṇiryavase sasavān
analyzed: ātmā te vātaḥ rajaḥ ā navīnot paśuḥ na bhūrṇiḥ yavase sasavān
translated: Your own self, O Vata, has been born in the dust, like a swift animal in the pasture, strong.

original: antarmahī bṛhatī rodasīme viśvā te dhāma varuṇa priyāṇi
analyzed: antar mahī bṛhatī rodasī ime viśvā te dhāma varuṇa priyāṇi
translated: The great and wide worlds are within, O Varuṇa, all your dear abodes.

original: pari spaśo varuṇasya smadiṣṭā ubhe paśyanti rodasī sumeke
analyzed: pari spaśaḥ varuṇasya smadiṣṭāḥ ubhe paśyanti rodasī sumeke
translated: The spies of Varuṇa are well-known, both the well-formed worlds look on.

original: ṛtāvānaḥ kavayo yajñadhīrāḥ pracetaso ya iṣayanta manma
analyzed: ṛtāvānaḥ kavayaḥ yajña dhīrāḥ pracetasaḥ ye iṣayanta manma
translated: The wise, the sacrificial priests, the thoughtful, the far-seeing, who send forth my thought,

original: uvāca me varuṇo medhirāya triḥ sapta nāmāghnyā bibharti
analyzed: uvāca me varuṇaḥ medhirāya tris sapta nāma aghnyā bibharti
translated: Varuṇa has told me to the wise one, he bears the three times seven inviolable names.

original: vidvān padasya guhyā na vocad yugāya vipra uparāya śikṣan
analyzed: vidvān padasya guhyā na vocat yugāya vipraḥ uparāya śikṣan
translated: The wise one, knowing the secret of the foot, did not tell it, teaching it to the young seer for a yoke.

original: tisro dyāvo nihitā antarasmin tisro bhūmīruparāḥ ṣaḍvidhānāḥ
analyzed: tisraḥ dyāvaḥ nihitāḥ antarasmin tisraḥ bhūmīḥ uparāḥ ṣaṣ vidhānāḥ
translated: Three heavens are placed within this one, three earths are the lower ones, six in number.

original: gṛtso rājā varuṇaścakra etaṃ divi preṅkhaṃhiraṇyayaṃ śubhe kam
analyzed: gṛtsaḥ rājā varuṇaḥ cakre etam divi preṅkham hiraṇyayam śubhe kam
translated: King Gritsa and Varuṇa have made this one, the golden one that moves in the sky, the beautiful one.

original: ava sindhuṃ varuṇo dyauriva sthād drapso na śveto mṛgastuviṣmān
analyzed: ava sindhum varuṇaḥ dyauḥ iva sthāt drapsaḥ na śvetaḥ mṛgaḥ tuviṣmān
translated: Varuṇa stands over the river like the sky, the swift white deer is powerful.

original: gambhīraśaṃso rajaso vimānaḥ supārakṣatraḥ sato asya rājā
analyzed: gambhīra śaṃsaḥ rajasaḥ vimānaḥ su pāra kṣatraḥ sataḥ asya rājā
translated: The one with deep praise, the measurer of space, the king of this existence has excellent protection.

original: yo mṛḷayāti cakruṣe cidāgo vayaṃ syāma varuṇe anāgāḥ
analyzed: yaḥ mṛḍayāti cakruṣe cit āgaḥ vayam syāma varuṇe anāgāḥ
translated: He who would transgress even the one who comes with gifts, may we be free from sin in Varuṇa.

original: anu vratānyaditerṛdhanto yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: anu vratāni aditeḥ ṛdhantaḥ yūyam pāta
translated: Following the ordinances of Aditi, may you protect us.

original: pra śundhyuvaṃ varuṇāya preṣṭhāṃ matiṃ vasiṣṭha mīḷhuṣe bharasva
analyzed: pra śundhyuvam varuṇāya preṣṭhām matim vasiṣṭha mīḍhuṣe bharasva
translated: O Vasistha, bring to the most excellent Varuna the most delightful thought,

original: ya īmarvāñcaṃ karate yajatraṃ sahasrāmaghaṃ vṛṣaṇaṃ bṛhantam
analyzed: yaḥ īm arvāñcam karate yajatram sahasrāmagham vṛṣaṇam bṛhantam
translated: He who makes him, the worthy of sacrifice, to come hither, the mighty, the bountiful, the great,

original: adhā nvasya sandṛśaṃ jaganvānagneranīkaṃ varuṇasya maṃsi
analyzed: adhā nu asya sandṛśam jaganvān agneḥ anīkam varuṇasya maṃsi
translated: Now, having gone to his appearance, I will think of the face of Agni and Varuna.

original: svaryadaśmannadhipā u andho 'bhi mā vapurdṛśaye ninīyāt
analyzed: svaryat aśman adhipāḥ u andhaḥ bhi mā vapuḥ dṛśaye ninīyāt
translated: May the lord of the stone, the lord of the water, lead my form to be seen.

original: ā yad ruhāva varuṇaśca nāvaṃ pra yat samudramīrayāvamadhyam
analyzed: ā yat ruhāva varuṇaḥ ca nāvam pra yat samudram īrayāvamadhyam
translated: When we two, Varuna and I, shall ascend the boat, when we shall drive it to the middle of the ocean,

original: adhi yadapāṃ snubhiścarāva pra preṅkha īṅkhayāvahai śubhe kam
analyzed: adhi yat apām snubhiḥ carāva pra preṅkhe īṅkhayāvahai śubhe kam
translated: When we shall go upon the waters with the floating things, we shall move to and fro for some good fortune.

original: vasiṣṭhaṃ ha varuṇo nāvyādhād ṛṣiṃ cakāra svapā mahobhiḥ
analyzed: vasiṣṭham ha varuṇaḥ na avyā adhāt ṛṣim cakāra su apāḥ mahobhiḥ
translated: Varuna cured Vasistha, the seer, he made him his own with great powers.

original: stotāraṃ vipraḥ sudinatve ahnāṃ yān nu dyāvastatanan yāduṣāsaḥ
analyzed: stotāram vipraḥ sudina tve ahnām yāt nu dyāvaḥ tatanan yāduṣāsaḥ
translated: The sage, the praiser, at the bright time of the days, those who have spread out the heavens, the doers of good deeds,

original: kva tyāni nau sakhyā babhūvuḥ sacāvahe yadavṛkaṃ purā cit🔽bṛhantaṃ mānaṃ varuṇa svadhāvaḥ sahasradvāraṃ jagamā gṛhaṃ te
analyzed: kva tyāni nau sakhyā babhūvuḥ sacāvahe yadavṛkam purā cit  bṛhantam mānam varuṇa svadhāvas sahasra dvāram jagama gṛham te
translated: Where are those friendships of ours that we had, when we were together even before the wolf?🔽The great measure, O Varuna, self-moving, the house with a thousand doors, I have entered.

original: ya āpirnityo varuṇa priyaḥ san tvāmāgāṃsi kṛṇavat sakhā te
analyzed: yaḥ āpiḥ nityaḥ varuṇa priyaḥ san tvām āgāṃsi kṛṇavat sakhā te
translated: You who are a friend to me, O Varuna, though dear, have made me do these things for you.

original: mā ta enasvanto yakṣin bhujema yandhi ṣmā vipra stuvate varūtham
analyzed: mā te enasvantaḥ yakṣin bhujema yandhi sma vipra stuvate varūtham
translated: O Yakṣiṇī, let us not suffer harm from you. Grant us protection, O powerful one, to the praising sage.

original: dhruvāsu tvāsu kṣitiṣu kṣiyanto vyasmat pāśaṃ varuṇomumocat
analyzed: dhruvāsu tvā āsu kṣitiṣu kṣiyantaḥ vi asmat pāśam varuṇaḥ umumocat
translated: In these firm abodes, dwelling, Varuṇa has loosed the bond from us.

original: avo vanvānā aditerupasthād yūyaṃ pāta
analyzed: avaḥ vanvānāḥ aditeḥ upasthāt yūyam pāta
translated: Seeking your favour from Aditi's presence, do ye protect us.

original: mo ṣu varuṇa mṛnmayaṃ gṛhaṃ rājannahaṃ gamam
analyzed: mā u su varuṇa mṛd mayam gṛham rājan aham gamam
translated: O Varuṇa, O king, I go not to your house of clay.

original: mṛḷā sukṣatra mṛḷaya
analyzed: mṛḷa su kṣatra mṛḍaya
translated: Be gracious, O good lord, be gracious.

original: yademi prasphuranniva dṛtirna dhmāto adrivaḥ
analyzed: yat emi prasphuran iva dṛtiḥ na dhmātaḥ adrivas
