translated: When I go forth, trembling as it were, like a bellows blown up, O you who have thunder for your weapon,

original: mṛḷā s / m /
analyzed: mṛḍa s m
translated: Be gracious, O good lord.🔽We have come to lowliness, O you of great wisdom, to a place hard to reach, O you who are pure.

original: kratvaḥ samaha dīnatā pratīpaṃ jagamā śuce🔽mṛḷā s / m /
analyzed: kratvaḥ samaha dīna tā pratīpam jagama śuce  mṛḍa s m
translated: Be gracious, O good lord.

original: apāṃ madhye tasthivāṃsaṃ tṛṣṇāvidajjaritāram
analyzed: apām madhye tasthivāṃsam tṛṣṇā vidat jaritāram
translated: Him who stands in the midst of the waters, who is tormented by thirst, who is a singer,

original: mṛḷā s / m /
analyzed: mṛḍa s m
translated: Be gracious, O good lord.

original: yat kiṃ cedaṃ varuṇa daivye jane 'bhidrohaṃ manuṣyāścarāmasi
analyzed: yat kim ca idam varuṇa daivye jane bhidroham manuṣyāḥ carāmasi
translated: Whatever sin we commit against the divine people, O Varuṇa, whatever among men,

original: acittī yat tava dharmā yuyopima mā nastasmādenaso deva rīriṣaḥ🔽pra vīrayā śucayo dadrire vāmadhvaryubhirmadhumantaḥ sutāsaḥ🔽vaha vāyo niyuto yāhyachā pibā sutasyāndhaso madāya
analyzed: acittī yat tava dharmā yuyopima mā naḥ tasmāt enasaḥ deva rīriṣaḥ  pra vīrayā śucayaḥ dadrire vām adhvaryubhiḥ madhumantaḥ sutāsaḥ  vaha vāyo niyutaḥ yāhi achā pibā sutasya andhasaḥ madāya
translated: If we disregard your laws, do not afflict us, O god, with that sin.🔽The pure ones have flowed forth with hero strength, the Soma-pressings rich in sweetness, with the Adhvaryus.🔽Bring thy teams, O Vayu, come hither, drink of the juice of the Soma for thy delight.

original: īśānāya prahutiṃ yasta ānaṭ chuciṃ somaṃ śucipāstubhyaṃ vāyo
analyzed: īśānāya prahutim yaḥ te ānaṭ śucim somam śuci pāstubhyam vāyo
translated: He who has brought the offering to the lord, the pure Soma, may the pure one be for thee, O Vayu.

original: kṛṇoṣi taṃ martyeṣu praśastaṃ jātojāto jāyate vājyasya
analyzed: kṛṇoṣi tam martyeṣu praśastam jātaḥ jātaḥ jāyate vājyasya
translated: You make him most praised among mortals, born again and again, the strong one is born for strength

original: rāye nu yaṃ jajñatū rodasīme rāye devī dhiṣaṇā dhāti devam🔽adha vāyuṃ niyutaḥ saścata svā uta śvetaṃ vasudhitiṃ nireke🔽uchannuṣasaḥ sudinā ariprā uru jyotirvividurdīdhyānāḥ
analyzed: rāye nu yam jajñatuḥ rodasī ime rāye devī dhiṣaṇā dhāti devam  adha vāyum niyutaḥ saścata svāḥ uta śvetam vasu dhitim nireke  uchan uṣasaḥ su dināḥ ariprāḥ uru jyotiḥ vividuḥ dīdhyānāḥ
translated: For wealth, for whom the two worlds were born, for wealth the divine Dhisana nourishes the god🔽Then the teams hasten to Vayu, and the white Vasudhiti in the forefront🔽The dawnings with good days, free from guile, have found the wide light, shining

original: gavyaṃ cidūrvamuśijo vi vavrusteṣāmanu pradivaḥ sasrurāpaḥ
analyzed: gavyam cit ūrvam uśijaḥ vi vavruḥ teṣām anu pradivaḥ sasruḥ āpaḥ
translated: The eager ones have opened even the closed stall of the cow; after them the days have flowed

original: te satyena manasā dīdhyānāḥ svena yuktāsaḥ kratunā vahanti🔽indravāyū vīravāhaṃ rathaṃ vāmīśānayorabhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante🔽īśānāso ye dadhate svarṇo gobhiraśvebhirvasubhirhiraṇyaiḥ🔽indravāyū sūrayo viśvamāyurarvadbhirvīraiḥ pṛtanāsu sahyuḥ
analyzed: te satyena manasā dīdhyānāḥ svena yuktāsaḥ kratunā vahanti  indra vāyū vīra vāham ratham vāmi īśānayoḥ abhi pṛkṣaḥ sacante  īśānāsaḥ ye dadhate svarṇaḥ gobhiḥ aśvebhiḥ vasubhiḥ hiraṇyaiḥ  indra vāyū sūrayaḥ viśva māyuḥ arvadbhiḥ vīraiḥ pṛtanāsu sahyuḥ
translated: They, thinking with a true mind, carry on with their own union, with their own rite

analyzed: arvantaḥ na śravasaḥ bhikṣamāṇāḥ indra vāyū suṣṭutibhiḥ vasiṣṭhāḥ 🔽vājayantaḥ su avase huvema yūyam pāta 🔽kuvidaṅga namasā ye vṛdhāsaḥ purā devāḥ anavadyāsaḥ āsan

original: te vāyave manave bādhitāyāvāsayannuṣasaṃ sūryeṇa
analyzed: te vāyave manave bādhitāya avāsayan uṣasam sūryeṇa
translated: They, for Vayu, for the afflicted Manu, have set the dawn free with the sun.

original: uśantā dūtā na dabhāya gopā māsaśca pāthaḥ śaradaśca pūrvīḥ
analyzed: uśantā dūtā na dabhāya gopā māsaḥ ca pāthaḥ śaradaḥ ca pūrvīḥ
translated: The loving messengers, the guardians against deception, the month and the many autumns,

original: indravāyū suṣṭutirvāmiyānā mārḍīkamīṭṭe suvitaṃ ca navyam
analyzed: indra vāyū suṣṭutiḥ vāmiyānā mārḍīkam īṭṭe suvitam ca navyam
translated: O Indra and Vayu, the praise that seeks your favor, grant us mercy and new prosperity.

original: pīvoannān rayivṛdhaḥ sumedhāḥ śvetaḥ siṣakti niyutāmabhiśrīḥ
analyzed: pīvaḥ annān rayivṛdhaḥ sumedhāḥ śvetaḥ siṣakti niyutām abhiśrīḥ
translated: The white one, rich in food, increasing wealth, wise, flows to the assembled company.

original: te vāyave samanaso vi tasthurviśven naraḥ svapatyāni cakruḥ
analyzed: te vāyave samanasaḥ vi tasthuḥ viśvāḥ id naraḥ su apatyāni cakruḥ
translated: They, with the same thought, have gone forth to Vayu, all the men have done their own tasks.

original: yāvat tarastanvo yāvadojo yāvan naraścakṣasā dīdhyānāḥ
analyzed: yāvat taraḥ tanvaḥ yāvat ojaḥ yāvat naraḥ cakṣasā dīdhyānāḥ
translated: As far as the bodies, as far as the strength, as far as the men are seen with the eye,

original: śuciṃ somaṃ śucipā pātamasme indravāyū sadatambarhiredam
analyzed: śucim somam śuci pā pātam asme indra vāyū sadatam barhirā idam
translated: Drink the pure Soma, O you who drink the pure, for us, O Indra and Vayu, sit on this sacred grass.

original: niyuvānā niyuta spārhavīrā indravOi Pū idaṃ hi vāṃ prabhṛtaṃ madhvo agramadha prīṇānā vimumuktamasme
analyzed: niyuvānā niyutaḥ spārha vīrāḥ indravoi idam hi vām prabhṛtam madhvaḥ agram adha prīṇānā vimumuktam asme
translated: You two, O Indra and Vayu, with your teams, with your desirable heroes, come to this, for this is your share of the sweet drink, the first, delighting us, set free.

original: yā vāṃ śataṃ niyuto yāḥ sahasramindravāyū viśvavārāḥ sacante
analyzed: yāḥ vām śatam niyutaḥ yāḥ sahasram indra vāyū viśva vārāḥ sacante
translated: Your hundred teams, O Indra and Vayu, your thousand, which are helpful to all, follow you.

original: ābhiryātaṃ suvidatrābhirarvāk pātaṃ narāpratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ
analyzed: ābhiḥ yātam suvidatrābhiḥ arvāk pātam narā a pratibhṛtasya madhvaḥ
translated: Come with those helpful ones, O heroes, drink of the offered sweet drink.

original: arvanto na śravaso / / /
analyzed: arvantaḥ na śravasaḥ
translated: Like horses for the glory...

original: ā vāyo bhūṣa śucipā upa naḥ sahasraṃ te niyuto viśvavāra
analyzed: ā vāyo bhūṣa śuci pāḥ upa naḥ sahasram te niyutaḥ viśva vāra
translated: Come, O Vâyu, to us, O thou who lovest the pure, with thy thousand teams, O thou who givest all

original: upo te andho madyamayāmi yasya deva dadhiṣe pūrvapeyam
analyzed: upa u te andhaḥ madyam ayāmi yasya deva dadhiṣe pūrvapeyam
translated: I bring thee the gladdening juice, whereof thou, O God, hast the first draught appointed thee

original: pra sotā jīro adhvareṣvasthāt somamindrāya vāyave pibadhyai🔽pra yad vāṃ madhvo agriyaṃ bharantyadhvaryavo devayantaḥ śacībhiḥ
analyzed: pra sotā jīraḥ adhvareṣu asthāt somam indrāya vāyave pibadhyai  pra yat vām madhvaḥ agriyam bharanti adhvaryavaḥ devayantaḥ śacībhiḥ
translated: The presser hath taken his place, the presser at sacrifices, to drink the Soma for Indra and Vâyu🔽When the Adhvaryus, serving the gods with might, bring you the sweetest of sweet things to drink

original: pra yābhiryāsi dāśvāṃsamachā niyudbhirvāyaviṣṭayeduroṇe
analyzed: pra yābhiḥ yāsi dāśvāṃsam achā niyudbhiḥ vāyaviṣṭayet uroṇe
translated: With what teams dost thou come to the worshipper, O Vâyu, to the house for the banquet?

original: ni no rayiṃ subhojasaṃ yuvasva ni vīraṃ gavyamaśvyaṃ ca rādhaḥ
analyzed: ni naḥ rayim su bhojasam yuvasva ni vīram gavyam aśvyam ca rādhaḥ
translated: Bestow on us wealth that is good to enjoy, bestow on us the gift of heroic strength in horses and in cattle

original: ye vāyava indramādanāsa ādevāso nitośanāso aryaḥ
analyzed: ye vāyavaḥ indra mādanāsaḥ ādevāsaḥ nitośanāsaḥ aryaḥ
translated: Those, O Vâyu, who are thy friends, who delight in Indra, who are not niggardly, who are not hostile

original: ghnanto vṛtrāṇi sūribhiḥ ṣyāma sāsahvāṃso yudhā nṛbhiramitrān
analyzed: ghnantaḥ vṛtrāṇi sūribhiḥ syāma sāsahvāṃsaḥ yudhā nṛbhiḥ amitrān
translated: May we, with princes, slay the Vr̥itras, with men who conquer, slay the enemies in fight

original: ā no niyudbhiḥ śatinībhiradhvaraṃ sahasriṇībhirupa yāhi yajñam
analyzed: ā naḥ niyudbhiḥ śatinībhiḥ adhvaram sahasriṇībhiḥ upa yāhi yajñam
translated: With thy teams by hundreds, by thousands, come to our sacrifice and worship

original: vāyo asmin savane mādayasva yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: vāyo asmin savane mādayasva yūyam pāta
translated: O Vâyu, rejoice thee in this libation. Do ye, etc.

original: śuciṃ nu stomaṃ navajātamadyendrāgnī vṛtrahaṇā juṣethām
analyzed: śucim nu stomam nava jātam adya indra agnī vṛtra haṇā juṣethām
translated: Accept, O Indra and Agni, Vritra-slayers, this pure hymn of praise, this newly-born hymn this day

original: ubhā hi vāṃ suhavā johavīmi tā vājaṃ sadya uśatedheṣṭhā
analyzed: ubhā hi vām su havā johavīmi tā vājam sadyas uśatā idheṣṭhā
translated: For I invoke you both, O ye who are to be invoked, most willing to bestow strength, most prompt to give

original: tā sānasī śavasānā hi bhūtaṃ sākaṃvṛdhā śavasā śūśuvāṃsā🔽kṣayantau rāyo yavasasya bhūreḥ pṛṅktaṃ vājasya sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ
analyzed: tā sānasī śavasānā hi bhūtam sākaṃvṛdhā śavasā śūśuvāṃsā  kṣayantau rāyaḥ yavasasya bhūreḥ pṛṅktam vājasya sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ
translated: For they are the two mighty ones who have become so by strength, mutually increasing, shining in strength.🔽May they two, sharing the wide pasture of wealth, fill us with abundant strength, with old and vigorous strength.

original: upo ha yad vidathaṃ vājino gurdhībhirviprāḥ pramatimichamānāḥ
analyzed: upa u ha yat vidatham vājinaḥ gurdhībhiḥ viprāḥ pramatim ichamānāḥ
translated: When the strong ones approach the assembly, the priests, seeking favour with their hymns,

original: arvanto na kāṣṭhāṃ nakṣamāṇā indrāgnī johuvato naraste
analyzed: arvantaḥ na kāṣṭhām nakṣamāṇāḥ indra agnī johuvataḥ naraḥ te
translated: The men who call on you, O Indra and Agni, like horses striving for the goal,

original: gīrbhirvipraḥ pramatimichamāna īṭṭe rayiṃ yaśasaṃ pūrvabhājam
analyzed: gīrbhiḥ vipraḥ pramatim icchamānaḥ īṭṭe rayim yaśasam pūrvabhājam
translated: The priest, seeking favour with his songs, wins wealth, glorious, to be enjoyed first.

original: indrāgnī vṛtrahaṇā suvajrā pra no navyebhistirataṃ deṣṇaiḥ
analyzed: indra agnī vṛtra haṇā su vajrā pra naḥ navyebhiḥ tiratam deṣṇaiḥ
translated: O Indra and Agni, slayers of Vrtra, with your good deeds, grant us new gifts.

original: saṃ yan mahī mithatī spardhamāne tanūrucā śūrasātā yataite
analyzed: sam yat mahī mithatī spardhamāne tanūrucā śūrasātā yataite
translated: When the two great ones, contending, strive in heroic deeds, with the speed of their bodies,

original: adevayuṃ vidathe devayubhiḥ satrā hataṃ somasutā janena
analyzed: adevayum vidathe devayubhiḥ satrā hatam soma sutā janena
translated: The godless one in the assembly with the godly, is ever slain by the people, by those who offer Soma.

original: imāmu ṣu somasutimupa na endrāgnī saumanasāya yātam
analyzed: imām u su soma sutim upa naḥ ā indra agnī saumanasāya yātam
translated: Come now to this Soma-pressing, O Indra and Agni, for the sake of good will.

original: nū cid dhi parimamnāthe asmānā vāṃ śaśvadbhirvavṛtīya vājaiḥ
analyzed: nu cit hi parimamnāthe asmānā vām śaśvadbhiḥ vavṛtīya vājaiḥ
translated: For you two surely have pity on us. May I be able to serve you with ever-new powers.

original: so agna enā namasā samiddho 'chā mitraṃ varuṇamindraṃ voceḥ
analyzed: saḥ agne enā namasā samiddhaḥ cha mitram varuṇam indram voceḥ
translated: O Agni, kindled with this homage, call to us Mitra, Varuna, and Indra.

original: yat sīmāgaścakṛmā tat su mṛḷa tadaryamāditiḥśiśrathantu
analyzed: yat sīmā agaścakṛma tat su mṛḷa tat aryamā aditiḥ śiśrathantu
translated: Whatever boundary we have transgressed, be gracious to us in that. May Aditi and Aryaman forgive us.

original: etā agna āśuṣāṇāsa iṣṭīryuvoḥ sacābhyaśyāma vājān
analyzed: etāḥ agne āśuṣāṇāsaḥ iṣṭīḥ yuvoḥ sacā abhyaśyāma vājān
translated: O Agni, may we, with you as our ally, win these swift sacrifices and gain strength.

original: mendro no viṣṇurmarutaḥ pari khyan yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: mā indraḥ naḥ viṣṇuḥ marutaḥ pari khyan yūyam pāta
translated: May Indra, Vishnu, and the Maruts protect us. You, protect us.

original: iyaṃ vāmasya manmana indrāgnī pūrvyastutiḥ
analyzed: iyam vām asya manmanaḥ indra agnī pūrvya stutiḥ
translated: This is the ancient praise of you two, O Indra and Agni, the most desirable.

original: abhrād vṛṣṭirivājani
analyzed: abhrāt vṛṣṭiḥ iva ajani
translated: Like rain from the cloud, it has come forth.

original: śṛṇutaṃ jariturhavamindrāgnī vanataṃ giraḥ
analyzed: śṛṇutam jarituḥ havam indra agnī vanatam giraḥ
translated: Listen to the call of the worshipper, O Indra and Agni, accept these songs.

original: īśānāpipyataṃ dhiyaḥ
analyzed: īśānā apipyatam dhiyaḥ
translated: O lords, make our thoughts prosper.

original: mā pāpatvāya no narendrāgnī mābhiśastaye
analyzed: mā pāpa tvāya naḥ nara indra agnī mā abhiśastaye
translated: Do not lead us to sin, O Indra and Agni, do not to condemnation.

original: mā no rīradhataṃ nide
analyzed: mā naḥ rīradhatam nide
translated: Do not place us in distress.

original: indre agnā namo bṛhat suvṛktimerayāmahe
analyzed: indre agnā namaḥ bṛhat suvṛktim erayāmahe
translated: To Indra and Agni we offer a great hymn of praise,

original: dhiyā dhenā avasyavaḥ
analyzed: dhiyā dhenāḥ avasyavaḥ
translated: with thought, with songs, with prayers.

original: tā hi śaśvanta īḷata itthā viprāsa ūtaye
analyzed: tā hi śaśvantaḥ īḍate itthā viprāsaḥ ūtaye
translated: For they are always invoked thus by the sages for help,

original: sabādho vājasātaye
analyzed: sabādhaḥ vājasātaye
translated: to overcome and to win strength.

original: tā vāṃ gīrbhirvipanyavaḥ prayasvanto havāmahe
analyzed: tā vām gīrbhiḥ vipanyavaḥ prayasvantaḥ havāmahe
translated: We, the most generous, call you with our songs, O you who turn to the people,

original: medhasātā saniṣyavaḥ
analyzed: medha sātā saniṣyavaḥ
translated: striving for gain through our thoughts.

original: indrāgnī avasā gatamasmabhyaṃ carṣaṇīsahā
analyzed: indra agnī avasā gatam asmabhyam carṣaṇī sahā
translated: O Indra and Agni, come to us with help, you who conquer the people.

original: mā no duḥśaṃsa īśata
analyzed: mā naḥ duḥśaṃsaḥ īśata
translated: Let no evil-wisher rule over us.

original: mā kasya no araruṣo dhūrtiḥ praṇaṃ martyasya
analyzed: mā kasya naḥ a raruṣaḥ dhūrtiḥ praṇam martyasya
translated: Let not the wicked blow of mortal man prevail against us.

original: indrāgnīśarma yachatam
analyzed: indra agnīśarma yacchatam
translated: O Indra and Agni, grant us protection.

original: gomad dhiraṇyavad vasu yad vāmaśvāvadīmahe
analyzed: gomat hiraṇyavat vasu yat vām aśva avadīmahe
translated: We ask for wealth in cattle, in gold, in horses, O ye two,

original: indrāgnītad vanemahi🔽yat soma ā sute nara indrāgnī ajohavuḥ
analyzed: indra agnītat vanemahi  yat some ā sute naraḥ indra agnī ajohavuḥ
translated: We desire to obtain from you, O Indra and Agni, that wealth which is possessed of cows, gold, and horses.🔽O Indra and Agni, we desire to obtain that.

original: saptīvantā saparyavaḥ
analyzed: saptīvantā saparyavaḥ
translated: When the men have pressed the Soma, O Indra and Agni, and have called you with the seven-horsed (chariot), with the attendants,

original: ukthebhirvṛtrahantamā yā mandānā cidā girā
analyzed: ukthebhiḥ vṛtra hantamā yā mandānā cidā girā
translated: with the lauds, you who are best at slaying Vrtra, even though they are slow,

original: āṅgūṣairāvivāsataḥ
analyzed: āṅgūṣaiḥ āvivāsataḥ
translated: you who are to be invoked with the hymns of praise.

original: tāvid duḥśaṃsaṃ martyaṃ durvidvāṃsaṃ rakṣasvinam
analyzed: tau id duḥśaṃsam martyam durvidvāṃsam rakṣasvinam
translated: You two, O Indra and Agni, destroy the evil-speaking mortal, the one who knows not, the Raksas,

original: ābhogaṃ hanmanā hatamudadhiṃ hanmanā hatam
analyzed: ābhogam hanmanā hatam udadhim hanmanā hatam
translated: the one who is bent on destruction, the one who is bent on slaying, the ocean, the one who is bent on slaying.

original: pra kṣodasā dhāyasā sasra eṣā sarasvatī dharuṇamāyasī pūḥ
analyzed: pra kṣodasā dhāyasā sasre eṣā sarasvatī dharuṇam āyasī pūḥ
translated: This Sarasvati, the receptacle of iron, has flowed forth with the flood and the oblation.

original: prabābadhānā rathyeva yāti viśvā apo mahinā sindhuranyāḥ
analyzed: prabābadhānā rathyā iva yāti viśvāḥ apaḥ mahinā sindhuḥ anyāḥ
translated: She goes forth, like a chariot, to the farthest waters, the river with her might surpasses all others.

original: ekācetat sarasvatī nadīnāṃ śuciryatī giribhya ā samudrāt
analyzed: ekā acetat sarasvatī nadīnām śuciḥ yatī giribhyaḥ ā samudrāt
translated: This Sarasvati is the one river of the rivers, pure, flowing from the mountains to the ocean.

original: rāyaścetantī bhuvanasya bhūrerghṛtaṃ payo duduhe nāhuṣāya
analyzed: rāyaḥ cetantī bhuvanasya bhūreḥ ghṛtam payaḥ duduhe nāhuṣāya
translated: She, thinking of wealth, of the wide world's prosperity, has milked out ghee as milk for the son of Nahusha.

original: sa vāvṛdhe naryo yoṣaṇāsu vṛṣā śiśurvṛṣabho yajñiyāsu
analyzed: sa vāvṛdhe naryaḥ yoṣaṇāsu vṛṣā śiśuḥ vṛṣabhaḥ yajñiyāsu
translated: He, the man, has grown among the women, the bull, the young bull, among the worthy of sacrifice.

original: sa vājinaṃ maghavadbhyo dadhāti vi sātaye tanvaṃ māmṛjīta
analyzed: sa vājinam maghavadbhyaḥ dadhāti vi sātaye tanvam māmṛjīta
translated: He bestows the strong one on the wealthy, he has made his body ready for the victory.

original: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī juṣāṇopa śravat subhagā yajṇe asmin
analyzed: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī juṣāṇā upa śravat subhagā yajṇe asmin
translated: And may Sarasvati, being pleased with us, listen to this our sacrifice, which is rich in blessings.

original: mitajñubhirnamasyairiyānā rāyā yujā ciduttarā sakhibhyaḥ
analyzed: mitajñubhiḥ namasyaiḥ iyānā rāyā yujā cit uttarā sakhibhyaḥ
translated: Approaching with measured knees, with adorations, with wealth, even with what is higher than friends

original: imā juhvānā yuṣmadā namobhiḥ prati stomaṃ sarasvati juṣasva
analyzed: imā juhvānā yuṣmadā namobhiḥ prati stomam sarasvati juṣasva
translated: These, O Sarasvati, with this ladle, with your salutations, accept the praise

original: tava śarman priyatame dadhānā upa stheyāma śaraṇaṃ na vṛkṣam
analyzed: tava śarman priyatame dadhānāḥ upa stheyāma śaraṇam na vṛkṣam
translated: Placing ourselves in your most beloved protection, as in a tree's shelter, we would stand

original: ayamu te sarasvati vasiṣṭho dvārāv ṛtasya subhage vyāvaḥ
analyzed: ayam u te sarasvati vasiṣṭhaḥ dvārau ṛtasya subhage vyāvaḥ
translated: This Vasishtha, O Sarasvati, opens for you the doors of truth, O blissful one

original: vardha śubhre stuvate rāsi vājān yūyaṃ pāta / / /
analyzed: vardha śubhre stuvate rāsi vājān yūyam pāta
translated: Increase, O bright one, grant strength to the praiser. Do you all protect us...

original: bṛhadu gāyiṣe vaco 'suryā nadīnām
analyzed: bṛhatu gāyiṣe vacaḥ suryā nadīnām
translated: I will sing a lofty song to the divine waters of the rivers

original: sarasvatīmin mahayāsuvṛktibhiḥ stomairvasiṣṭha rodasī
analyzed: sarasvatīm id mahaya asuvṛktibhiḥ stomaiḥ vasiṣṭha rodasī
translated: With excellent hymns I praise Sarasvati and the two worlds, O Vasishtha

original: ubhe yat te mahinā śubhre andhasī adhikṣiyanti pūravaḥ
analyzed: ubhe yat te mahinā śubhre andhasī adhikṣiyanti pūravaḥ
translated: When, O bright one, the two mighty ones, the two worlds, exceed you in greatness

original: sā no bodhyavitrī marutsakhā coda rādho maghonām
analyzed: sā naḥ bodhi avitrī marut sakhā coda rādhaḥ maghonām
translated: Be you our wise protector, O friend of the Maruts, impel the bounty of the wealthy ones

original: bhadramid bhadrā kṛṇavat sarasvatyakavārī cetati vājinīvatī
analyzed: bhadram id bhadrā kṛṇavat sarasvatī akavārī cetati vājinīvatī
translated: May the auspicious Sarasvati grant what is auspicious. The bountiful one watches over the one who offers.

original: gṛṇānā jamadagnivat stuvānā ca vasiṣṭhavat
analyzed: gṛṇānā jamadagni vat stuvānā ca vasiṣṭha vat
translated: Praised like Jamadagni, and extolled like Vasishtha

original: janīyanto nvagravaḥ putrīyantaḥ sudānavaḥ
analyzed: janīyantaḥ nu agravaḥ putrīyantaḥ sudānavaḥ
translated: The bountiful ones, like brothers, like sons

original: sarasvantaṃ havāmahe
analyzed: sarasvantam havāmahe
translated: We invoke Sarasvant

original: ye te sarasva ūrmayo madhumanto ghṛtaścutaḥ
analyzed: ye te sarasvas ūrmayaḥ madhumantaḥ ghṛtaścutaḥ
translated: Those sweet waves of yours, O Sarasvati, which flow with ghee

original: tebhirno 'vitā bhava
analyzed: tebhiḥ naḥ vitā bhava
translated: Be our protector with those (helpers).

original: pīpivāṃsaṃ sarasvata stanaṃ yo viśvadarṣataḥ
analyzed: pīpivāṃsam sarasvataḥ stanam yaḥ viśva darṣataḥ
translated: O Sarasvatî, we would drink the full breast of him who flows to all,

original: bhakṣīmahi prajāmiṣam
analyzed: bhakṣīmahi prajā āmiṣam
translated: To enjoy the food of offspring.

original: yajñe divo nṛṣadane pṛthivyā naro yatra devayavo madanti
analyzed: yajñe divaḥ nṛṣadane pṛthivyāḥ naraḥ yatra devayavaḥ madanti
translated: In the sacrifice of heaven, in the seat of men on earth, where men rejoice in the feast of the gods,

original: indrāya yatra savanāni sunve gaman madāya prathamaṃ vayaś ca
analyzed: indrāya yatra savanāni sunve gamat madāya prathamam vayaḥ ca
translated: Where they press the libations for Indra, to the first vigour and to the rapture (I go).

original: ā daivyā vṛṇīmahe 'vāṃsi bṛhaspatir no maha ā sakhāyaḥ
analyzed: ā daivyā vṛṇīmahe vāṃsi bṛhaspatiḥ naḥ mahaḥ ā sakhāyaḥ
translated: We choose the heavenly favours, the gracious ones, Br̥ihaspati, our great friend,

original: yathā bhavema mīḷhuṣe anāgā yo no dātā parāvataḥ piteva
analyzed: yathā bhavema mīḍhuṣe anāgāḥ yaḥ naḥ dātā parāvataḥ pitā iva
translated: That we may be free from sin for the liberal giver, who is to us from afar as a father.

original: tam u jyeṣṭhaṃ namasā havirbhiḥ suśevam brahmaṇas patiṃ gṛṇīṣe
analyzed: tam u jyeṣṭham namasā havirbhiḥ su śevam brahmaṇaḥ patim gṛṇīṣe
translated: To him, the most gracious, the eldest, I sing with reverence and offerings, Br̥ihaspati, the lord of prayer,

original: indraṃ śloko mahi daivyaḥ siṣaktu yo brahmaṇo devakṛtasya rājā
analyzed: indram ślokaḥ mahi daivyaḥ siṣaktu yaḥ brahmaṇaḥ deva kṛtasya rājā
translated: Let the great divine glory rest on Indra, who is king of the divine Brahman.

original: sa ā no yoniṃ sadatu preṣṭho bṛhaspatir viśvavāro yo asti
analyzed: saḥ ā naḥ yonim sadatu preṣṭhaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ viśva vāraḥ yaḥ asti
translated: May he, the most excellent, the all-possessing Br̥ihaspati, sit in our own birthplace.

original: kāmo rāyaḥ suvīryasya taṃ dāt parṣan no ati saścato ariṣṭān🔽tam ā no arkam amṛtāya juṣṭam ime dhāsur amṛtāsaḥ purājāḥ
analyzed: kāmaḥ rāyaḥ su vīryasya tam dāt parṣat naḥ ati saścataḥ ariṣṭān  tam ā naḥ arkam amṛtāya juṣṭam ime dhāsuḥ amṛtāsaḥ purājāḥ
translated: May he grant us the desire of wealth and good heroism. May he lead us across (our foes) without fail and without injury.🔽That hymn, dear to immortality, may these immortal ones, the ancient ones, the supporters,

original: śucikrandaṃ yajatam pastyṛnām bṛhaspatim anarvāṇaṃ huvema
analyzed: śuci krandam yajatam pastyṛnām bṛhaspatim anarvāṇam huvema
translated: The pure-roaring, the worshipful, the lords of the house, may we invoke Br̥ihaspati, the irresistible one.

original: taṃ śagmāso aruṣāso aśvā bṛhaspatiṃ sahavāho vahanti
analyzed: tam śagmāsaḥ aruṣāsaḥ aśvāḥ bṛhaspatim sahavāhaḥ vahanti
translated: His horses, the ruddy ones, the auspicious ones, carry Br̥ihaspati, the all-conquering one,

original: sahaś cid yasya nīlavat sadhasthaṃ nabho na rūpam aruṣaṃ vasānāḥ
analyzed: sahaḥ cit yasya nīlavat sadhastham nabhaḥ na rūpam aruṣam vasānāḥ
translated: Whose abode is like the blue sky, and they, clothed in the red form of the sky,

original: sa hi śuciḥ śatapatraḥ sa śundhyur hiraṇyavāśīr iṣiraḥ svarṣāḥ
analyzed: sa hi śuciḥ śata patraḥ sa śundhyuḥ hiraṇya vāśīḥ iṣiraḥ svarṣāḥ
translated: For he is pure, with a hundred leaves, he is the bright one, the golden-haired, the swift one, the self-luminous one,

original: bṛhaspatiḥ sa svāveśa ṛṣvaḥ purū sakhibhya āsutiṃ kariṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: bṛhaspatiḥ sa su āveśaḥ ṛṣvaḥ purū sakhibhyaḥ āsutim kariṣṭhaḥ
translated: Br̥ihaspati, he is the self-moving, the lofty one, the best bestower of much to his friends,

original: devī devasya rodasī janitrī bṛhaspatiṃ vāvṛdhatur mahitvā
analyzed: devī devasya rodasī janitrī bṛhaspatim vāvṛdhatuḥ mahitvā
translated: The two divine worlds, the mother and the father, have increased Br̥ihaspati with their greatness,

original: dakṣāyyāya dakṣatā sakhāyaḥ karad brahmaṇe sutarā sugādhā
analyzed: dakṣāyyāya dakṣatā sakhāyaḥ karat brahmaṇe sutarā su gādhā
translated: The friends, for the sake of skill, have made the prayer easy to utter, the thought easy to understand,

original: iyaṃ vām brahmaṇas pate suvṛktir brahmendrāya vajriṇe akāri
analyzed: iyam vām brahmaṇaḥ pate suvṛktiḥ brahma indrāya vajriṇe akāri
translated: This is your good hymn, O Lord of prayer, the Brahman has been made for Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: aviṣṭaṃ dhiyo jigṛtam puraṃdhīr jajastam aryo vanuṣām arātīḥ
analyzed: aviṣṭam dhiyaḥ jigṛtam puraṃdhīḥ jajastam aryaḥ vanuṣām arātīḥ
translated: Accept the thoughts, quicken the wise ones, destroy the evil designs of the enemies,

original: bṛhaspate yuvam indraś ca vasvo divyasyeśāthe uta pārthivasya
analyzed: bṛhaspate yuvam indraḥ ca vasvaḥ divyasya īśāthe uta pārthivasya
translated: O Br̥ihaspati, you two, and Indra, are the lords of wealth, of the heavenly and of the earthly,

original: dhattaṃ rayiṃ stuvate kīraye cid yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
analyzed: dhattam rayim stuvate kīraye cit yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Bestow wealth even on the poor praiser. You, protect us always with your blessings.

original: adhvaryavo 'ruṇaṃ dugdham aṃśuṃ juhotana vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ ruṇam dugdham aṃśum juhotana vṛṣabhāya kṣitīnām
translated: O Adhvaryus, offer the red-milked milk into the vessel for the bull of the earth.

original: gaurād vedīyāṃ avapānam indro viśvāhed yāti sutasomam ichan
analyzed: gaurāt vedīyān avapānam indraḥ viśvāhā id yāti suta somam ichan
translated: From the fair one, O Indra, thou hast drunk the most excellent drink, thou goest to every one who presses Soma, seeking him.

original: yad dadhiṣe pradivi cārv annaṃ divedive pītim id asya vakṣi
analyzed: yat dadhiṣe pradivi cāru annam dive dive pītim id asya vakṣi
translated: What dainty food thou hast laid by in the sky, tell us of its drinking day by day.

original: uta hṛdota manasā juṣāṇa uśann indra prasthitān pāhi somān
analyzed: uta hṛdā uta manasā juṣāṇaḥ uśan indra prasthitān pāhi somān
translated: And, O Indra, rejoicing in heart and mind, loving, protect the Somas that are set forth.

original: jajñānaḥ somaṃ sahase papātha pra te mātā mahimānam uvāca
analyzed: jajñānaḥ somam sahase papātha pra te mātā mahimānam uvāca
translated: Thou hast drunk the Soma, O thou who art born for might, thy mother hath told thee of thy greatness.

original: endra paprāthorv antarikṣaṃ yudhā devebhyo varivaś cakartha
analyzed: ā indra paprātha uru antarikṣam yudhā devebhyaḥ varivaḥ cakartha
translated: O Indra, thou hast filled the wide atmosphere, by fighting thou hast made room for the gods.

original: yad yodhayā mahato manyamānān sākṣāma tān bāhubhiḥ śāśadānān
analyzed: yat yodhayā mahataḥ manyamānān sākṣāma tān bāhubhiḥ śāśadānān
translated: When thou hast fought with the mighty ones who think themselves great, thou hast crushed them with thy arms, the boastful ones.

original: yad vā nṛbhir vṛta indrābhiyudhyās taṃ tvayājiṃ sauśravasaṃ jayema
analyzed: yat vā nṛbhiḥ vṛtaḥ indra abhiyudhyāḥ tam tvayā ājim sauśravasam jayema
translated: Or when, O Indra, we are encompassed by men, may we win that battle, that glorious victory through thee.

original: prendrasya vocam prathamā kṛtāni pra nūtanā maghavā yā cakāra
analyzed: pra indrasya vocam prathamā kṛtāni pra nūtanā maghavā yā cakāra
translated: I will proclaim the first deeds of Indra, and the new ones which the bountiful one has done.

original: yaded adevīr asahiṣṭa māyā athābhavat kevalaḥ somo asya
analyzed: yadā id adevīḥ asahiṣṭa māyāḥ atha abhavat kevalaḥ somaḥ asya
translated: When the godless could not endure his magic power, then Soma became his only one.

original: tavedaṃ viśvam abhitaḥ paśavyaṃ yat paśyasi cakṣasā sūryasya
analyzed: tava idam viśvam abhitas paśavyam yat paśyasi cakṣasā sūryasya
translated: This all around thee, O Indra, is to be won by cattle, which thou seest with the eye of the sun.

original: gavām asi gopatir eka indra bhakṣīmahi te prayatasya vasvaḥ
analyzed: gavām asi go patiḥ ekaḥ indra bhakṣīmahi te prayatasya vasvaḥ
translated: Thou art the lord of cattle, O Indra, alone. May we enjoy thy bestowed wealth.

original: bṛhaspate yuvam indraś ca vasvo divyasyeśāthe uta pārthivasya
analyzed: bṛhaspate yuvam indraḥ ca vasvaḥ divyasya īśāthe uta pārthivasya
translated: O Brihaspati, you and Indra are the lords of wealth, of the heavenly and of the earthly.

original: dhattaṃ rayiṃ stuvate kīraye cid yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
analyzed: dhattam rayim stuvate kīraye cit yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: Grant wealth even to the poor who praises you. Do you, O Maruts, protect us always with your blessings.

original: paro mātrayā tanvṛ vṛdhāna na te mahitvam anv aśnuvanti
analyzed: paras mātrayā tanvṛ vṛdhāna na te mahitvam anu aśnuvanti
translated: You have grown beyond measure, O Vishnu, they do not attain the limit of your greatness.

original: ubhe te vidma rajasī pṛthivyā viṣṇo deva tvam paramasya vitse🔽na te viṣṇo jāyamāno na jāto deva mahimnaḥ param antam āpa
analyzed: ubhe te vidma rajasī pṛthivyāḥ viṣṇo deva tvam paramasya vitse  na te viṣṇo jāyamānaḥ na jātaḥ deva mahimnaḥ param antam āpa
translated: We know both your realms, O Vishnu, O god, you know the highest of the earth.🔽Neither the unborn nor the born one, O god, attains the highest limit of your greatness.

original: ud astabhnā nākam ṛṣvam bṛhantaṃ dādhartha prācīṃ kakubham pṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: ud astabhnāḥ nākam ṛṣvam bṛhantam dādhartha prācīm kakubham pṛthivyāḥ
translated: You have upheld the lofty, vast vault, you have set up the eastern quarter of the earth.

original: irāvatī dhenumatī hi bhūtaṃ sūyavasinī manuṣe daśasyā
analyzed: irāvatī dhenumatī hi bhūtam sūyavasinī manuṣe daśasyā
translated: Be it full of food, full of cows, and easy of access for men to win favor.

original: vy astabhnā rodasī viṣṇav ete dādhartha pṛthivīm abhito mayūkhaiḥ
analyzed: vi astabhnāḥ rodasī viṣṇo ete dādhartha pṛthivīm abhitas mayūkhaiḥ
translated: You have stretched out these two worlds, O Vishnu, you have set up the earth on all sides with your rays.

original: uruṃ yajñāya cakrathur ulokaṃ janayantā sūryam uṣāsam agnim
analyzed: urum yajñāya cakrathuḥ ulokam janayantā sūryam uṣāsam agnim
translated: You have made the sacrifice wide and spacious, producing the sun, the dawn, and Agni.

original: dāsasya cid vṛṣaśiprasya māyā jaghnathur narā pṛtanājyeṣu
analyzed: dāsasya cit vṛṣaśiprasya māyāḥ jaghnathuḥ narā pṛtanājyeṣu
translated: You have slain the magic of the Dāsa, O heroes, of the one with the bull's forehead, in the battles for the prize.

original: indrāviṣṇū dṛṃhitāḥ śambarasya nava puro navatiṃ ca śnathiṣṭam
analyzed: indrāviṣṇū dṛṃhitāḥ śambarasya nava puraḥ navatim ca śnathiṣṭam
translated: O Indra and Vishnu, crush the nine forts and ninety of Śambara.

original: śataṃ varcinaḥ sahasraṃ ca sākaṃ hatho apraty asurasya vīrān
analyzed: śatam varcinaḥ sahasram ca sākam hathaḥ aprati asurasya vīrān
translated: A hundred Varcinas and a thousand of the Asura's sons together in the grasp,

original: iyam manīṣā bṛhatī bṛhantorukramā tavasā vardhayantī🔽rare vāṃ stomaṃ vidatheṣu viṣṇo pinvatam iṣo vṛjaneṣv indra
analyzed: iyam manīṣā bṛhatī bṛhantā uru kramā tavasā vardhayantī  rare vām stomam vidatheṣu viṣṇo pinvatam iṣaḥ vṛjaneṣu indra
translated: This great thought of yours, O mighty one, with wide strides, increasing through your power,🔽I spread out your praise in the assemblies, O Vishnu, and make your food abundant in the contests, O Indra.

original: vaṣaṭ te viṣṇav āsa ā kṛṇomi tan me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam
analyzed: vaṣaṭ te viṣṇo āsaḥ ā kṛṇomi tat me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam
translated: I offer you the Vashat, O Vishnu, accept my offering, O Sipivishta.

original: vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayo giro me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
analyzed: vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayaḥ giraḥ me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May my songs, well-praised, strengthen you. You, protect us always with your blessings.

original: nū marto dayate saniṣyan yo viṣṇava urugāyāya dāśat
analyzed: nu martaḥ dayate saniṣyan yaḥ viṣṇave urugāyāya dāśat
translated: Now let the mortal man who wishes to prosper give to Vishnu, the far-striding one,

original: pra yaḥ satrācā manasā yajāta etāvantaṃ naryam āvivāsāt
analyzed: pra yaḥ satrācā manasā yajāte etāvantam naryam āvivāsāt
translated: Who, by his eternal mind, has created this much of manhood, and more, to be desired.

original: tvaṃ viṣṇo sumatiṃ viśvajanyām aprayutām evayāvo matiṃ dāḥ
analyzed: tvam viṣṇo sumatim viśvajanyām aprayutām evayāvaḥ matim dāḥ
translated: O Vishnu, give the all-people's favor, the unwearied thought, the thought that goes its way.

original: parco yathā naḥ suvitasya bhūrer aśvāvataḥ puruścandrasya rāyaḥ
analyzed: parcaḥ yathā naḥ suvitasya bhūreḥ aśvāvataḥ puru ścandrasya rāyaḥ
translated: As a reward for our good life, for our abundant wealth in horses and men, for our glorious wealth.

original: trir devaḥ pṛthivīm eṣa etāṃ vi cakrame śatarcasam mahitvā
analyzed: tris devaḥ pṛthivīm eṣaḥ etām vi cakrame śatarcasam mahitvā
translated: This god has thrice measured this earth of a hundred ridges with his greatness.

original: pra viṣṇur astu tavasas tavīyān tveṣaṃ hy asya sthavirasya nāma
analyzed: pra viṣṇuḥ astu tavasaḥ tavīyān tveṣam hi asya sthavirasya nāma
translated: May Vishnu be stronger than the strong, for his name is terrible, of the ancient one.

original: vi cakrame pṛthivīm eṣa etāṃ kṣetrāya viṣṇur manuṣe daśasyan
analyzed: vi cakrame pṛthivīm eṣaḥ etām kṣetrāya viṣṇuḥ manuṣe daśasyan
translated: He has measured out this earth, Viṣṇu, for the sake of men, bestowing it as a field.

original: dhruvāso asya kīrayo janāsa urukṣitiṃ sujanimā cakāra
analyzed: dhruvāsaḥ asya kīrayaḥ janāsaḥ uru kṣitim su janimā cakāra
translated: His firm foundations are the people, he has made the wide earth easy to travel.

original: pra tat te adya śipiviṣṭa nāmāryaḥ śaṃsāmi vayunāni vidvān
analyzed: pra tat te adya śipiviṣṭa nāma aryaḥ śaṃsāmi vayunāni vidvān
translated: I, a noble man, knowing your deeds, will proclaim to you today, O Śipiviṣṭa, that name.

original: taṃ tvā gṛṇāmi tavasam atavyān kṣayantam asya rajasaḥ parāke
analyzed: tam tvā gṛṇāmi tavasam a tavyān kṣayantam asya rajasaḥ parāke
translated: I praise you, the mighty one, the one without might, dwelling far away in this realm.

original: kim it te viṣṇo paricakṣyam bhūt pra yad vavakṣe śipiviṣṭo asmi
analyzed: kim id te viṣṇo paricakṣyam bhūt pra yat vavakṣe śipiviṣṭaḥ asmi
translated: What is there to be said about you, O Viṣṇu, when I, Śipiviṣṭa, have expanded?

original: mā varpo asmad apa gūha etad yad anyarūpaḥ samithe babhūtha
analyzed: mā varpaḥ asmat apa gūha etat yat anya rūpaḥ samithe babhūtha
translated: Do not hide from us this deception, that you have appeared in a different form in the assembly.

original: vaṣaṭ te viṣṇav āsa ā kṛṇomi tan me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam
analyzed: vaṣaṭ te viṣṇo āsaḥ ā kṛṇomi tat me juṣasva śipiviṣṭa havyam
translated: I offer you this oblation, O Viṣṇu, accept it, O Śipiviṣṭa, my offering.

original: vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayo giro me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
analyzed: vardhantu tvā suṣṭutayaḥ giraḥ me yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May my songs, well-praised, make you grow. You, protect us always with your blessings.

original: tisro vācaḥ pra vada jyotiragrā yā etad duhre madhudogham ūdhaḥ
analyzed: tisraḥ vācaḥ pra vada jyotiḥ agrāḥ yāḥ etat duhre madhu dogham ūdhaḥ
translated: Speak forth three voices, with light in front, which milk this udder yielding honey.

original: sa vatsaṃ kṛṇvan garbham oṣadhīnāṃ sadyo jāto vṛṣabho roravīti
analyzed: sa vatsam kṛṇvan garbham oṣadhīnām sadyas jātaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ roravīti
translated: Making the calf, the embryo of the plants, the newly born bull roars.

original: yo vardhana oṣadhīnāṃ yo apāṃ yo viśvasya jagato deva īśe
analyzed: yaḥ vardhanaḥ oṣadhīnām yaḥ apām yaḥ viśvasya jagataḥ devaḥ īśe
translated: He who is the increaser of the plants, he who is of the waters, he who rules as god over the whole world,

original: sa tridhātu śaraṇaṃ śarma yaṃsat trivartu jyotiḥ svabhiṣṭy asme
analyzed: sa tri dhātu śaraṇam śarma yaṃsat trivartu jyotiḥ su abhiṣṭi asme
translated: He who grants refuge and protection to the three worlds, the light that moves in three ways, may he be our own protector.

original: starīr u tvad bhavati sūta u tvad yathāvaśaṃ tanvaṃ cakra eṣaḥ
analyzed: starīḥ u tvat bhavati sūte u tvat yathāvaśam tanvam cakre eṣaḥ
translated: Your son is born from you, O father, as you will it, he has fashioned his body as he wishes.

original: pituḥ payaḥ prati gṛbhṇāti mātā tena pitā vardhate tena putraḥ
analyzed: pituḥ payaḥ prati gṛbhṇāti mātā tena pitā vardhate tena putraḥ
translated: The mother receives the milk of the father, by that the father grows, by that the son.

original: yasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthus tisro dyāvas tredhā sasrur āpaḥ
analyzed: yasmin viśvāni bhuvanāni tasthuḥ tisraḥ dyāvaḥ tredhā sasruḥ āpaḥ
translated: In whom all the worlds stand, the three heavens have flowed in three ways, the waters.

original: trayaḥ kośāsa upasecanāso madhva ścotanty abhito virapśam
analyzed: trayaḥ kośāsaḥ upasecanāsaḥ madhvaḥ ścotanti abhitas virapśam
translated: The three reservoirs, the sprinklers, the honey-dripping, surround the one with the hump.

original: idaṃ vacaḥ parjanyāya svarāje hṛdo astv antaraṃ taj jujoṣat
analyzed: idam vacaḥ parjanyāya sva rāje hṛdaḥ astu antaram tat jujoṣat
translated: Let this speech be in the heart for Parjanya, the self-ruling one, may he approve of it.

original: mayobhuvo vṛṣṭayaḥ santv asme supippalā oṣadhīr devagopāḥ
analyzed: mayobhuvaḥ vṛṣṭayaḥ santu asme su pippalāḥ oṣadhīḥ deva gopāḥ
translated: May the rain-showers be refreshing for us, the plants well-filled, protected by the gods.

original: sa retodhā vṛṣabhaḥ śaśvatīnāṃ tasminn ātmā jagatas tasthuṣaś ca
analyzed: sa retaḥ dhāḥ vṛṣabhaḥ śaśvatīnām tasmin ātmā jagataḥ tasthuṣaḥ ca
translated: He is the seed-sower, the bull of the eternal ones, in him is the soul of the moving and unmoving world.

original: tan ma ṛtam pātu śataśāradāya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
analyzed: tat me ṛtam pātu śata śāradāya yūyam pāta svastibhiḥ sadā naḥ
translated: May that truth protect me for a hundred autumns. Do you all protect us always with your blessings.

original: parjanyāya pra gāyata divas putrāya mīḷhuṣe
analyzed: parjanyāya pra gāyata divas putrāya mīḍhuṣe
translated: Sing forth to Parjanya, to the son of heaven, to the rain-shower.

original: sa no yavasamichatu
analyzed: sa naḥ yavasam ichatu
translated: May he desire our barley.

original: yo garbhamoṣadhīnāṃ gavāṃ kṛṇotyarvatām
analyzed: yaḥ garbham oṣadhīnām gavām kṛṇoti arvatām
translated: He who causes the embryo of the plants, of the cows, of the horses,

original: parjanyaḥpuruṣīṇām
analyzed: parjanyaḥ puruṣīṇām
translated: Parjanya, of human beings.

original: tasmā idāsye havirjuhotā madhumattamam
analyzed: tasmai idā āsye haviḥ juhota madhumattamam
translated: To him let the sacrificer offer the sweetest oblation in his mouth.

original: iḷāṃ naḥ saṃyataṃ karat
analyzed: iḷām naḥ saṃyatam karat
translated: May he make our food well-governed.

original: saṃvatsaraṃ śaśayānā brāhmaṇā vratacāriṇaḥ
analyzed: saṃvatsaram śaśayānāḥ brāhmaṇāḥ vrata cāriṇaḥ
translated: The Brahmins, observing vows, have been longing for a year.

original: vācaṃ parjanyajinvitāṃ pra maṇḍūkā avādiṣuḥ
analyzed: vācam parjanya jinvitām pra maṇḍūkāḥ avādiṣuḥ
translated: The frogs have uttered their speech, inspired by Parjanya.

original: divyā āpo abhi yadenamāyan dṛtiṃ na śuṣkaṃ sarasī śayānam
analyzed: divyāḥ āpaḥ abhi yat enam āyan dṛtim na śuṣkam sarasī śayānam
translated: When the heavenly waters came to him, like a dry skin lying in the lake,

original: gavāmaha na māyurvatsinīnāṃ maṇdūkānāṃ vagnuratrā sameti
analyzed: gavām aha na māyuḥ vatsinīnām maṇdūkānām vagnuḥ atrā sameti
translated: The voice of the young calves of the cows meets the frog here in the water.

original: yadīmenānuśato abhyavarṣīt tṛṣyāvataḥ prāvṛṣyāgatāyām
analyzed: yadi imena anuśataḥ abhyavarṣīt tṛṣyāvataḥ prāvṛṣi āgatāyām
translated: When he rained upon them in succession, in the coming of the satisfying rain,

original: akhkhalīkṛtyā pitaraṃ na putro anyo anyamupa vadantameti
analyzed: akhkhalīkṛtya pitaram na putraḥ anyaḥ anyam upa vadantam eti
translated: The son does not go to the father for help, like one who has been deceived, each one goes to his own.

original: anyo anyamanu gṛbhṇātyenorapāṃ prasarge yadamandiṣātām
analyzed: anyaḥ anyam anu gṛbhṇāti enoḥ apām prasarge yat amandiṣātām
translated: One holds on to another, when they were delighted at the spreading of the waters.

original: maṇḍūko yadabhivṛṣṭaḥ kaniṣkan pṛṣniḥ sampṛṅkte haritena vācam
analyzed: maṇḍūkaḥ yat abhivṛṣṭaḥ pṛṣniḥ sampṛṅkte haritena vācam
translated: When the frog is rained upon, the speckled one joins his voice with the green one.

original: yadeṣāmanyo anyasya vācaṃ śāktasyeva vadati śikṣamāṇaḥ
analyzed: yat eṣām anyaḥ anyasya vācam śāktasya iva vadati śikṣamāṇaḥ
translated: When one of them speaks the speech of another, as if learning to speak,

original: sarvaṃ tadeṣāṃ samṛdheva parva yat suvāco vadathanādhyapsu
analyzed: sarvam tat eṣām samṛdhā iva parva yat su vācaḥ vadathana adhi apsu
translated: All that of them is like a festival, when you speak good words in the water.

original: gomāyureko ajamāyurekaḥ pṛśnireko harita eka eṣām
analyzed: go māyuḥ ekaḥ aja māyuḥ ekaḥ pṛśniḥ ekaḥ haritaḥ ekaḥ eṣām
translated: One is the jackal, one the goat, one the speckled one, one the green one of them.

original: samānaṃ nāma bibhrato virūpāḥ purutrā vācaṃ pipiśurvadantaḥ
analyzed: samānam nāma bibhrataḥ virūpāḥ purutrā vācam pipiśuḥ vadantaḥ
translated: Bearing the same name, yet diverse, they, in many ways, have sharpened their speech, speaking.

original: brāhmaṇāso atirātre na some saro na pūrṇamabhito vadantaḥ
analyzed: brāhmaṇāsaḥ atirātre na some saraḥ na pūrṇam abhitas vadantaḥ
translated: The Brāhmaṇas, at the Atiratra, not at the Soma, speak around like a full lake.

original: saṃvatsarasya tadahaḥ pari ṣṭha yan maṇḍūkāḥ prāvṛṣīṇaṃ babhūva
analyzed: saṃvatsarasya tat ahar pari stha yat maṇḍūkāḥ prāvṛṣīṇam babhūva
translated: That day of the year which was the time of the frogs in the rainy season,

original: brāhmaṇāsaḥ somino vācamakrata brahma kṛṇvantaḥ parivatsarīṇam
analyzed: brāhmaṇāsaḥ sominaḥ vācam akrata brahma kṛṇvantaḥ parivatsarīṇam
translated: The Brāhmaṇas, the Soma-offerers, have uttered their speech, making the prayer for the year.

original: adhvaryavo gharmiṇaḥ siṣvidānā āvirbhavanti guhyā na ke cit
analyzed: adhvaryavaḥ gharmiṇaḥ siṣvidānāḥ āvirbhavanti guhyāḥ na ke cit
translated: The Adhvaryus, the Gharma-drinkers, are perspiring; none of them are revealed, being hidden.

original: devahitiṃ jugupurdvādaśasya ṛtuṃ naro na pra minantyete🔽saṃvatsare prāvṛṣyāgatāyāṃ taptā gharmā aśnuvate visargam
analyzed: deva hitim jugupuḥ dvādaśasya ṛtum naraḥ na pra minanti ete  saṃvatsare prāvṛṣi āgatāyām taptāḥ gharmāḥ aśnuvate visargam
translated: They have guarded the invocation of the gods of the twelfth month; these men do not neglect the season.🔽When the rainy season has come in the year, the heated Gharma-offerings attain their release.

original: gomāyuradādajamāyuradāt pṛśniradād dharito no vasūni
analyzed: go māyuḥ adāt aja māyuḥ adāt pṛśniḥ adāt haritaḥ naḥ vasūni
translated: The jackal has given, the goat has given, the spotted deer has given our wealth, the brown ones.

original: gavāṃ maṇḍūkā dadataḥ śatāni sahasrasāve pra tiranta āyuḥ
analyzed: gavām maṇḍūkāḥ dadataḥ śatāni sahasrasāve pra tirante āyuḥ
translated: The frogs of the cows give hundreds, they extend life in the thousand-winning (sacrifice).

original: indrāsomā tapataṃ rakṣa ubjataṃ nyarpayataṃ vṛṣaṇā tamovṛdhaḥ
analyzed: indrāsomā tapatam rakṣaḥ ubjatam nyarpayatam vṛṣaṇā tamaḥ vṛdhaḥ
translated: O Indra and Soma, burn the Rakṣases, crush them, O mighty ones, increase the darkness.

original: parā sṛṇītamacito nyoṣataṃ hataṃ nudethāṃ ni śiśītamatriṇaḥ
analyzed: parā sṛṇītam acitaḥ nyoṣatam hatam nudethām ni śiśītam atriṇaḥ
translated: Drive away the wicked ones, slay and chase away the evil spirits, sharpen the arrows here.

original: indrāsomā samaghaśaṃsamabhyaghaṃ tapuryayastu caruragnivāniva🔽brahmadviṣe kravyāde ghoracakṣase dveṣo dhattamanavāyaṃ kimīdine
analyzed: indrāsomā samagha śaṃsam abhyagham tapuḥ yayaḥ tu caruḥ agnivān iva  brahma dviṣe kravya ade ghora cakṣase dveṣaḥ dhattam anavāyam kimīdine
translated: O Indra and Soma, the sinner who is more sinful than the sinner, who moves about like a firebrand,🔽Give him enmity, O Indra and Soma, to the one who hates the Brahman, the one who devours raw flesh, the one with a terrible eye, to the Kīmidin who is to be abhorred.

original: indrāsomā duṣkṛto vavre antaranārambhaṇe tamasi pra vidhyatam
analyzed: indrāsomā duṣkṛtaḥ vavre antar an ārambhaṇe tamasi pra vidhyatam
translated: O Indra and Soma, drive the evildoer into the womb, into the darkness that is not to be grasped.

original: yathā nātaḥ punarekaścanodayat tad vāmastu sahase manyumacchavaḥ
analyzed: yathā na atas punar ekaḥ cana udayat tat vām astu sahase manyumat śavaḥ
translated: So that he may not rise up again even once, may that be your will, O mighty ones, with your wrathful power.

original: indrāsomā vartayataṃ divo vadhaṃ saṃ pṛthivyā aghaśaṃsāya tarhaṇam
analyzed: indrāsomā vartayatam divaḥ vadham sam pṛthivyāḥ agha śaṃsāya tarhaṇam
translated: O Indra and Soma, hurl down from heaven the weapon, from the earth the threshing-rod for the evildoer.

original: ut takṣataṃ svaryaṃ parvatebhyo yena rakṣo vāvṛdhānaṃ nijūrvathaḥ🔽indrāsomā vartayataṃ divas paryagnitaptebhiryuvamaśmahanmabhiḥ
analyzed: ud takṣatam svaryam parvatebhyaḥ yena rakṣaḥ vāvṛdhānam nijūrvathaḥ  indrāsomā vartayatam divaḥ paryagni taptebhiḥ yuvam aśma hanmabhiḥ
translated: Sharpen the weapon from the mountains, wherewith ye drive away the waxen Rākṣasa.🔽O Indra and Soma, roll down from heaven with your thunderbolt-like stones heated by fire,

original: tapurvadhebhirajarebhiratriṇo ni parśāne vidhyataṃ yantu nisvaram
analyzed: tapuḥ vadhebhiḥ ajarebhiḥ atriṇaḥ ni parśāne vidhyatam yantu nisvaram
translated: With your burning weapons, O ageless ones, O devourers, pierce their sides, let them go to destruction.

original: indrāsomā pari vāṃ bhūtu viśvata iyaṃ matiḥ kakṣyāśvevavājinā
analyzed: indrāsomā pari vām bhūtu viśvatas iyam matiḥ kakṣyā aśveva vājinā
translated: O Indra and Soma, may this thought of mine go round you on every side, like a girth round a strong horse,

original: yāṃ vāṃ hotrāṃ parihinomi medhayemā brahmāṇi nṛpatīva jinvatam
analyzed: yām vām hotrām parihinomi medhayā imā brahmāṇi nṛpatī iva jinvatam
translated: The priestly office which I offer to you for the sacrifice. Animate these prayers, as kings animate their people.

original: prati smarethāṃ tujayadbhirevairhataṃ druho rakṣaso bhaṅgurāvataḥ
analyzed: prati smarethām tujayadbhiḥ evaiḥ hatam druhaḥ rakṣasaḥ bhaṅgurāvataḥ
translated: Remember with the victorious ones the slain foe, the Rākṣasa who breaks and trembles, O Indra and Soma.

original: indrāsomā duṣkṛte mā sugaṃ bhūd yo naḥ kadācidabhidāsati druhā
analyzed: indrāsomāḥ duṣkṛte mā sugam bhūt yaḥ naḥ kadācid abhidāsati druhā
translated: O Indra and Soma, let there be no easy path for the evil-doer who at any time injures us with hostility.

original: yo mā pākena manasā carantamabhicaṣṭe anṛtebhirvacobhiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ mā pākena manasā carantam abhicaṣṭe anṛtebhiḥ vacobhiḥ
translated: He who with deceitful mind reviles me who am walking, with untrue words,

original: āpa iva kāśinā saṃgṛbhītā asannastvāsata indra vaktā
analyzed: āpaḥ iva kāśinā saṃgṛbhītāḥ asannaḥ tu asataḥ indra vaktā
translated: Like water held in a vessel, let him be bound, let him be bound, O Indra, O speaker.

original: ye pākaśaṃsaṃ viharanta evairye vā bhadraṃ dūṣayanti svadhābhiḥ
analyzed: ye pāka śaṃsam viharante evaiḥ ye vā bhadram dūṣayanti svadhābhiḥ
translated: Those who, with evil, destroy the praise of the cooked, or who with their own natures defile the good,

original: ahaye vā tān pradadātu soma ā vā dadhātu nirṛterupasthe
analyzed: ahaye vā tān pradadātu somaḥ ā vā dadhātu nirṛteḥ upasthe
translated: To the snake, O Soma, let them be given, or let them be placed in the lap of Nirṛti.

original: yo no rasaṃ dipsati pitvo agne yo aśvānāṃ yo gavāṃ yastanūnām
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ rasam dipsati pitvaḥ agne yaḥ aśvānām yaḥ gavām yaḥ tanūnām
translated: He who, O Agni, injures our sap, whether he be a guest or a kinsman, he who (injures) our horses, our cows, or our bodies,

original: ripu stena steyakṛd dabhrametu ni ṣa hīyatāntanvā tanā ca
analyzed: ripuḥ stenaḥ steya kṛt dabhrametu ni sa hīyatā antanvā tanā ca
translated: Let the enemy, the thief, the stealer, go to destruction. Let him be deprived of his body and his offspring.

original: paraḥ so astu tanvā tanā ca tisraḥ pṛthivīradho astu viśvāḥ
analyzed: paras saḥ astu tanvā tanā ca tisraḥ pṛthivīradhaḥ astu viśvāḥ
translated: Let him be far away from his body and his offspring. Let him be under all the three earths.

original: prati śuṣyatu yaśo asya devā yo no divā dipsati yaśca naktam
analyzed: prati śuṣyatu yaśaḥ asya devāḥ yaḥ naḥ divā dipsati yaḥ ca naktam
translated: Let his glory dry up, O gods, who injures us by day or who (injures us) by night.

original: suvijñānaṃ cikituṣe janāya saccāsacca vacasī paspṛdhāte
analyzed: su vijñānam cikituṣe janāya sat ca asat ca vacasī paspṛdhāte
translated: Easy to know is the truth and the untruth for the inquiring man who strives with words.

original: tayoryat satyaṃ yatarad ṛjīyastadit somo 'vati hantyāsat
analyzed: tayoḥ yat satyam yatarad ṛjīyaḥ tat id somaḥ vati hanti asat
translated: Of the two, whatever is true, whatever is more certain, that may Soma protect, and may he slay the evil one.

original: nā vā u somo vṛjinaṃ hinoti na kṣatriyaṃ mithuyā dhārayantam
analyzed: na vai u somaḥ vṛjinam hinoti na kṣatriyam mithuyā dhārayantam
translated: Soma does not lead the wicked astray, nor the Kshatriya who upholds the truth.

original: hanti rakṣo hantyāsad vadantamubhāvindrasya prasitau śayāte
analyzed: hanti rakṣaḥ hanti asat vadantam ubhau indrasya prasitau śayāte
translated: He slays the Rakshas, he slays the evil-speaking one. Both lie in Indra's snare.

original: yadi vāhamanṛtadeva āsa moghaṃ vā devānapyūhe agne
analyzed: yadi vā aham anṛta devaḥ āsa mogham vā devān api ūhe agne
translated: If I have been one who worships false gods, or have offered to the gods in vain, O Agni,

original: kimasmabhyaṃ jātavedo hṛṇīṣe droghavācaste nirṛthaṃ sacantām
analyzed: kim asmabhyam jātavedaḥ hṛṇīṣe drogha vācaḥ te nirṛtham sacantām
translated: Why are you angry with us, O all-knower? Let the deceitful words of yours be accompanied by misfortune.

original: adyā murīya yadi yātudhāno asmi yadi vāyustatapa pūruṣasya
analyzed: adya murīya yadi yātudhānaḥ asmi yadi vā āyuḥ tatapa pūruṣasya
translated: If today I am a Yātudhāna, or if I have tormented a man in vain,

original: adhā sa vīrairdaśabhirvi yūyā yo mā moghaṃ yātudhānetyāha
analyzed: adha sa vīraiḥ daśabhiḥ vi yūyāḥ yaḥ mā mogham yātudhāna iti āha
translated: Then may he be destroyed with his ten sons who says to me in vain, 'You are a Yātudhāna.'

original: yo māyātuṃ yātudhānetyāha yo vā rakṣāḥ śucirasmītyāha
analyzed: yaḥ mā a yātum yātudhāna iti āha yaḥ vā rakṣāḥ śuciḥ asmi iti āha
translated: He who says to me, 'You are a Yātudhāna,' or who says, 'I am pure, O Rakshas,'

original: indrastaṃ hantu mahatā vadhena viśvasya jantoradhamas padīṣṭa
analyzed: indraḥ tam hantu mahatā vadhena viśvasya jantoḥ adhamaḥ padīṣṭa
translated: May Indra slay him with a great weapon. May he be the lowest of all creatures.

original: pra yā jigāti khargaleva naktamapa druhā tanvaṃ gūhamānā
analyzed: pra yā jigāti khargalā iva naktam apa druhā tanvam gūhamānā
translated: She who goes forth like a she-wolf at night, concealing her body from the foe,

original: vavrānanantānava sā padīṣṭa grāvāṇo ghnantu rakṣasa upabdaiḥ
analyzed: vavrān anantān ava sā padīṣṭa grāvāṇaḥ ghnantu rakṣasaḥ upabdaiḥ
translated: May she be destroyed, her hopes frustrated. Let the pressing-stones slay the Rakshas with their sounds.

original: vi tiṣṭhadhvaṃ maruto vikṣvichata gṛbhāyata rakṣasaḥ saṃ pinaṣṭana
analyzed: vi tiṣṭhadhvam marutaḥ vikṣvichata gṛbhāyata rakṣasaḥ sam pinaṣṭana
translated: Stand forth, O Maruts, spread yourselves in all directions, seize the Raksases and crush them down.

original: vayo ye bhūtvī patayanti naktabhirye vā ripo dadhire deve adhvare
analyzed: vayaḥ ye bhūtvī patayanti naktabhiḥ ye vā ripaḥ dadhire deve adhvare
translated: Those who, becoming birds, fly about in the night, or who have made themselves enemies in the worship of the gods,

original: pra vartaya divo aśmānamindra somaśitaṃ maghavan saṃ śiśādhi
analyzed: pra vartaya divaḥ aśmānam indra soma śitam maghavan sam śiśādhi
translated: Turn the stone of heaven, O Indra, sharpen the bolt, O Maghavan, whetted by the Soma.

original: prāktādapāktādadharādudaktādabhi jahi rakṣasaḥparvatena
analyzed: prāktāt apāktāt adharāt udaktāt abhi jahi rakṣasaḥ parvatena
translated: From the east, from the west, from the south, from the north, smite away the Raksases with the mountain.

original: eta u tye patayanti śvayātava indraṃ dipsanti dipsavo 'dābhyam
analyzed: ete u tye patayanti śvayātavaḥ indram dipsanti dipsavaḥ dābhyam
translated: These, indeed, are flying about, the spiteful ones, the spiteful ones who wish to injure the unassailable Indra.

original: śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyo vadhaṃ nūnaṃ sṛjadaśaniṃ yātumadbhyaḥ
analyzed: śiśīte śakraḥ piśunebhyaḥ vadham nūnam sṛjat aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ
translated: Shakra sharpens the weapon for the spiteful ones, now let him send forth the dart against the evil spirits.

original: indro yātūnāmabhavat parāśaro havirmathīnāmabhyāvivāsatām
analyzed: indraḥ yātūnām abhavat parāśaraḥ havirmathīnām abhyāvivāsatām
translated: Indra has become the overcomer of the Yātudhānas, of those who offer oblations and seek to injure.

original: abhīdu śakraḥ paraśuryathā vanaṃ pātreva bhindan sata eti rakṣasaḥ
analyzed: abhīdu śakraḥ paraśuḥ yathā vanam pātrā iva bhindan satas eti rakṣasaḥ
translated: Shakra goes forth, cleaving the Raksases, as with an axe he cleaves a tree, as with a vessel.

original: ulūkayātuṃ śuśulūkayātuṃ jahi śvayātumuta kokayātum
analyzed: ulūka yātum śuśulūka yātum jahi śva yātum uta koka yātum
translated: Destroy the owl-Yātudhāna, the owl-Yātudhāna, the dog-Yātudhāna, and the crow-Yātudhāna.

original: suparṇayātumuta gṛdhrayātuṃ dṛṣadeva pra mṛṇa rakṣa indra
analyzed: suparṇa yātum uta gṛdhra yātum dṛṣadā iva pra mṛṇa rakṣaḥ indra
translated: Destroy the bird-Yātudhāna, the vulture-Yātudhāna, crush the Raksases as with a stone, O Indra.

original: mā no rakṣo abhi naḍ yātumāvatāmapochatu mithunā yā kimīdinā
analyzed: mā naḥ rakṣaḥ abhi naṭ yātumāvatām apochatu mithunā yā kimīdinā
translated: Let not the Raksas, the Nāḍa, the Yātudhāna, the pair of Kimīdins, overcome us.

original: pṛthivī naḥ pārthivāt pātvaṃhaso 'ntarikṣaṃ divyāt pātvasmān
analyzed: pṛthivī naḥ pārthivāt pātu aṃhasaḥ ntarikṣam divyāt pātu asmān
translated: May the earth protect us from earthly danger, may the atmosphere protect us from heavenly danger.

original: indra jahi pumāṃsaṃ yātudhānamuta striyaṃ māyayā śāśadānām
analyzed: indra jahi pumāṃsam yātudhānam uta striyam māyayā śāśadānām
translated: O Indra, slay the male demon and the female demon who deceive with magic.

original: vigrīvāso mūradevā ṛdantu mā te dṛśaṃ sūryamuccarantam
analyzed: vigrīvāsaḥ mūradevāḥ ṛdantu mā te dṛśam sūryam uccarantam
translated: May the neckless, godless demons perish. May not the sun rise upon thee.

original: prati cakṣva vi cakṣvendraśca soma jāgṛtam
analyzed: prati cakṣva vi cakṣva indraḥ ca soma jāgṛtam
translated: Look straight on, look around, O Indra and Soma, be watchful.

original: rakṣobhyo vadhamasyatamaśaniṃ yātumadbhyaḥ
analyzed: rakṣobhyaḥ vadham asyatam aśanim yātumadbhyaḥ
translated: Throw the bolt against the demons, the weapon against the mischief-makers.
